First and foremost- we mainly use Macs/Apple but a few of our family members game frequently (which is definitely not something Apple's are known for being any good at) and my husband is an Android/Windows developer, so we have several Windows machines around, including one he built specifically for gaming last year. So while I'm an Apple expert of sorts, Windows boxes are still a bit foreign to me.

Not sure what happened but everything is great but my touch pad bottom right corner is sticking up, I just had this laptop for a week, I’m thinking sending it back for a replacement. Anyone has this problem. Thanks
Laptop was quite expensive (2049USD) but I don't regret it. I bought an older alienware on clearance for 1400 and just thought I wasn't getting engine bang for the buck.

I liked it except for the fact that it was not 1440 resolution. I play games at 4k with Dolby Vision at times. Dropping down to 1080 with Dolby Vision I just couldn't do. Especially since I thought I was getting 1440 which is basically 2k. I could have dealt with that. Everything else was great. Unfortunately, I had to return it for that reason.

Perfect gaming laptop, it runs all games perfectly. However, there is an issue in the touchpad some times it stuck and doesn’t work at all, you gonna use mouse for a short time and then it will works just fine.

I've thrown alot at it in terms of games: Cyberpunk, Red Dead Redemption 2, Halo Infinite, Metro Exodus, The witcher 3, Monster hunter world... and alot more, everything on ultra settings with ray tracing in the games that alow it, and its smooth as butter ALL of the time. Great heat control, my unit never goes above 75 degrees in high loads (I do have a thermaltake massive cooling pad, and use my laptop in a very cold environment). Haven't seen one game so far that this computer can't run smoothly. 10/10 Machine.

It's an awesome gaming laptop.I chose the lowest one RTX 3060 yet it plays Elden Ring on max setting without even straining one bit.Only down side is the weight but then again it's manageable.It doesn't have a camera  but that doesn't bother me.All in all this is an awesome machine which can handle any Demanding game that exist for a reasonable price.Go for it. 👍

This is an OP laptop, excellent for gaming almost any new game, playing fps games is really smooth with that 300hz screen, when working at top speed fans there are not as loud as I expected and you can easily control every aspect of performance, the mux switch is an excellent addition, the only con is that doesn't come with a camera but overall its a must have laptop if you are looking for better performance, with that 12gen Intel chip things fly!

Can easily play any game on ultra settings you throw at it and it really isn’t that loud when you’re playing. Only thing is that it eats up battery but since most people are going to use this laptop to game, it’s only customary to keep it plugged in. Although it does have that portability option. For 2k, I’d say if you’re looking to buy this machine go for it. The build quality, aesthetics, and performance are astounding. 11/10

First, I'll just tell you that, yes, this computer is incredibly awesome.  Then I'm going to nitpick it as much as I can just to give you an honest perspective and hopefully some details you haven't already figured out.

I really am enjoying this laptop so far. The high power limited 3070ti plays all the games I enjoy at 100-140 fps and the screen looks quite good. The speakers are the best I've heard on a gaming laptop so far (although i wish they could be a bit louder.) I upgraded mine from 16 gigs of ram to 32 and the process was pretty close to simple- since there are two ribbon cables connecting to the LED light bar you should be careful of.

This laptop is amazing. I've had it for only a week since writing this, but I am not disappointed. Getting 16gb of ram for well optimized games should suffice, but it would be better to aim for 32/64gb. I ended up upgrading to 32gb and am very happy.

They are purposefully misleading customers this is a production model that is advertised as having 300hz screen with 1440p and 16 gb of ddr5 ram but it's really 1080p 300hz the system is supposed to be 1440p display at 300 hz and 32gb of ddr5...DO NOT BUY THIS UNLESS ITS PRICE IS REDUCED BY $300 ATLEAST....THIS IS FALSE ADVERTISING TO GIVE A 1080P PAL 300HZ DISPLAY WHILE CALING IT 1440P 300HZ, "JUST BAD BUISNESS"...
Worked great at first, then it stopped working suddenly after a month of use. Since it’s been a month, I can’t return the laptop so now I’m stuck with a useless non-working computer.

I needed a laptop to plug into my worksation (in which I also game at ultra wide 1440p)  and after comparing laptops for weeks I found that this one has the best performace to price relation (I bought it for $2,049~).

Less than 6 months of buying the laptop the trackpad stopped working, after sending the laptop for repair the display started showing white spots so sending it again for service. As the return window has closed I cannot return/replace the laptop so ended up being forced to buy a warranty extension as I wanted to ensure that I do not want to pay for a new laptop's repairs out of pocket. I would not recommend buying this laptop.
I bought this pc this week and it unnecessary gets really hot and the screen has glitching issues. For an expensive laptop as this, there is a serious lack of quality control by Asus.

This is a really good laptop. Every game that I have thrown at it runs smoothly. It handles other tasks, outside of gaming, really well. The touchpad has its issues. There is a delay in the movement of the cursor and at times the touchpad just stops working. Both are frustrating especially in situations where I don't have my mouse. I'd expect issues like this to not happen on a $2000 computer. Other than the touchpad this computer is solid.

I gave it a 4 out 5 rating because of price and battery life while gaming. If you plan on gaming, which it's a gaming laptop, I would strongly suggest to leave it plugged in. Battery life is shorted than I expected.
Good laptops are hard to get a hold of, and this one was no different. Found it here and jumped on it for my son who is going into the ECE program and needed this level of performance.

Excelente computadora, instale todos los programas que utilizo para arquitectura y los manejo muy bien, el único inconveniente es que se calienta bastante por lo que los ventiladores trabajan a su máxima potencia.

I got the ASUS gaming laptop for my young son who likes playing various games like Roblox, Fortnite, and Mine craft, etc. I figured it also would be useful for him to have as a backup for working on school projects and other research since he could take it with him wherever he goes.

Summary: My current desktop is an older Dell XPS 8920 from 2017, which has a i7-7700 processor.  It's still decently fast running Windows 10 Home.  I haven't had a dedicated gaming machine before, so I am very sure that this i9-12900 with the GeForce RTX 3070 Ti card is going to be insanely fast!  The last laptop we bought was a 13-inch MacBook back in August 2020.

Buying a PC is such a daunting task if you’re like me… Desktop or laptop? Business or pleasure? Accessories? Upgrades? With so many options, I was so happy and lucky to find this beauty!! The price was right and the specs were right where I needed them for a casual gamer coming from console. It being upgradable (RAM, SSD, etc.) only sweetens the deal. Buy buy buy! ASUS even offers an extra warranty extension for submitting reviews like this one!

This is a great entry level gaming laptop.  I've tried a few others and this one (being the cheapest as well) I was most impressed with.  Albeit the RAM (which you can add more), it's perfect for what I need it for.  I play mostly MMO's and this thing handles them with ease.  I don't notice it getting super hot, I do hear the fans go from time to time but NOTHING like other laptops I've tried.

So far I love this computer. I love how there are different profiles built in based on what the user needs at that moment (silent, balanced, and turbo). Has handled every game I've thrown at it so far better than my Xbox One. Honestly. Wish I'd ordered this beast sooner.

I play Minecraft and I can get 200 fps at a minimum I can get 400 fps sometimes and you can run shaders at 40 fps with minimum lag I also play valorant on it and it is great overall it is a great gaming starter laptop for the price I love it it is amazing

I bought this computer in hopes that I could use it for schoolwork with the occasional light gaming. After owning this computer for over 3 months I can safely say that it is perhaps the absolute worst laptop I have ever used. Despite upgrading the total ram to 24GB, installing a 1TB SSD and updating everything, it still frequently crashes and freezes multiple times a day. There are also issues with the GPU not being able to render images properly and instead showing everything as two red and blue imagies shifted out of alignement, making it nearly impossible to use.

No cuenta con camara web, lector de huellas o de SD. Pero es bastante buena para la mayoria de cosas que uno quisiera hacer con una computadora portátil. Windows 10 inicia muy rapido, renderiza bien los videos y tambien sirve genial para edicion de imagen. Puedo jugar call of duty ww2 en graficos altos. Y la bateria dura unas 6 horas con un uso basico. En fin me encanto, y creo que tiene un muy buen equilibrio entre precio/calidad.
Bought this laptop because I thought it would be able to run games well, but less than a year in and it constantly blue screens, freezes, and intermittently won’t connect to the internet.

It is a good Laptop, the only problem is the auto brightness. It is almost impossible to disable it, and it is so annoying because you pass from see nothing to get blind. Not sense, you can check asus foros, all people complain about it.

I've always bough Asus laptops for my family in the past due to minimal bloatware and a focus on quality. The machine I got this time has made me question that. While the internal components are good individually, the unit I received regularly bluescreened, even after all windows updates. The screen occasionally went black, like the connection inside wasn't good. Lastly, upon further research, I found the laptop was built with soldered RAM, preventing future upgrades. By far the worst Asus product I've ever purchased.

So far I’m super impressed by the speed of this computer it is amazing quality for the price you’re getting it at. Overall a great bye easy to set up any good work or leisure computer. The screen is nice.

I've been mostly gaming on the Xbox Series X since getting my hands on one last year and left my gaming desktop to collect dust. That beast draws a lot of power and it started to feel burdensome to boot it up occasionally just for personal needs and very light gaming for short bursts of time. So I decided on getting a budget friendly laptop (this one) that I can keep off to the side while my Xbox takes over my main monitor.

The laptop it’s self is amazing, it runs smooth, good response time, quality is super clean. HOWEVER there is one major issue, FREEZING , the screen freezes after 2 weeks or so. I did some research and apparently it is common for most Asus laptops to freeze over time. This is a waste of you money I would recommend a Msi gaming laptop I have a cousin who has had one for over a year and I just switched and it’s way better.
Low FPS in all games even when running the bloatware software on gaming mode. Super loud fans, screens and size are good but extremely bad bottle necking with the terrible cpu and 4 gigs of VRAM.
Me encanta lo silencioso y rápido de este equipo. Sugiero que cuando lo compren pidan una RAM de 8 GB adicional y un sólido de un Tera para complementarlo. Por lo demás... TODO BIEN.

I wish it had a built in  web cam for his online classes but this has been a great laptop for my son in college. I have an asus f17 tuf and love it so this laptop was an easy choice. Come on Asus! A military grade built gaming laptop for an adrenaline filled 19 year old that wants to climb 400 feet in the air to work on windmills and likes to game? Good job Asus. Really good job. 5 stars+

Please I highly advice! Dont buy this laptop it is the worst built laptop that there is out there, yes the specs will get your attention and you might get tempeted but just dont. Put your money somewhere else

The pc has only 3 months and then it only stopped working, I was reading a document and then it only went off and now it is not able to power on again. I am from Costa Rica and now I have to send the pc to an authorized support service and pay more than 80$ just to check the device. So, I believe I will have to spend at least 300$ on that. Thanks, ASUS.

The quality of this laptop was great given the price. I would definitely recommend anyone new to the computer gaming scene to get this laptop as a starter. The graphics quality is amazing, it runs so many games, and best of all it's a fair price. I've only had mine for a short time but I know this purchase will be one of my most valued for a while to come.
This was a gift for my 17 yr old grandson who specifically asked for this laptop. He says he loves it. Also, as a user of a 17" ASUS ROG laptop I have found their products to be excellent.

Before purchasing. I read the other reviews and thought "why not give it a try" I'm sure glad I did. It's a great laptop at a great price. Just be aware of a few things if you do end up getting this one, see below...

On paper it has all I need - 144Hz screen, slim build for travel and 3050Ti graphics. I've been using it after I received it in a nice package. It's been satisfying for my gaming needs - 2K, RD2 etc. But I will only buy it is on sale. For the list price, I will buy a one with more powerful graphics card.

It may not be the best computer in the world but it can be upgraded to be much better than it is. I just wanted a reliable and up to date laptop. This has far exceeded my expectations even only a day after receiving.  Will update in one month

On spec, this computer has all - 144Hz screen, RTX 3050 Ti, slim build and all other parameters that are critical to the gamers. It has great build quality, excellent screen and response and light enough to carry for travel. I gave 4 starts instead of 5 because I think it's worth buying when it is onsale. If at list price, at least I think it should have RTX 3060 or 3070.

This is a quote from the manual. I can understand if there are chemicals inside the device but if I have to wash my hands every time I even "handle" it, it is probably not safe. I returned it and wish this warning would have been included in its description as I would not have purchased it. This whole process caused a great inconvenience.

Laptop was missing RAM when opened to try and figure out why it would not turn on. had to purchase ram and still did not turn on and boot contacted asus to be ignored on the phone kind of upsetting for an item that cost a lot of money. I dont know if i should get another one or just search else where for a different laptop. Was hoping to have this to cheer me up but has only made my mood worse

El equipo llegó dañado, empezó a reiniciarse después de presentar en múltiples ocasiones el temido error de la pantalla azul, después la pantalla se quedaba en negro y no daba imagen hasta el después de varias veces de apagarlo y reiniciarlo respondía pero se pegaba donde el fallo que se ve en la imagen o iniciaba Windows para tiempo después volver a pegarse. No pude probar el equipo ya que nunca funcionó desde que lo recibí.

I dislike this product, because after two normal uses it stopped working. I thought I did something wrong and followed up with tech support. The device did not want to display anything. So, I decided to return the device. Bad experience buying a laptop via Amazon.

I'm a Truck Driver that does long hauls so used for watching movies / TV show some gaming hadn't start yet on gaming,, received mid August 2021. Woke up December 08 2021 the screen doesn't work anymore!! WTF for over $1000 and is supposed to handle extreme temperatures, my cab doesn't get below 32° f very disappointed, attempting to troubleshoot but computer doesn't display  built-in screen as option?!?!

While the price was enticing, the performance of this laptop was very deceiving. By the time I had realized how poor the performance was - it was too late to make a return. Build quality and esthetics are very nice - just a poor performer where it counts most unfortunately.  The hardware undermines the design and esthetics. I do not recommend.

I used the computer for a while and after a couple of months notest that some of the programs were not running adequately i started to check the specs of the laptop and compare it with a specialist and the graphic card wasn't included im very angry with this buy dont trust this seller
EDIT: 4 Months after purchase the screen has died completely and now I have to send it asus for them to repair under warranty with an estimated time of 6 months. Stay away from this line of products

The display on this computer stopped working after 4 months.  I have asked for warranty but ASUS wants to repair the product instead of replacing.  I have a huge issue with this.  I did not buy the product just to have it opened and repaired before the warranty period is even over.  Now, if it even gets repaired, I will have a substandard product that I purchased at full price.  I will not buy this cheap crap again.  Sorry ASUS you lost another one.

There is nothing "TUF" about this piece of garbage.  Six months in and several of the keys have fallen off and can't be reattached.  Why can't a single company make something of decent quality anymore?
Upon opening the box, in which I always take video, the computer, once turned on had no screen action whatsoever. Completely black. I would highly recommend purchasing a different laptop.

If you want to get a good laptop for gaming do not buy this one. The 3050 ti gpu is pathetically poor GPU because of the 4gb VRAM. Because of this fact you will have incredibly reduced frames than you would have with an actually decent gpu. You want at minimum 6gb vram for good gaming. You wont get good gaming with this laptop.

I've had this laptop for a little over a year now and it has been absolutely terrible.  The laptop has done nothing but crash since the day I got it and should not at all be considered a "gaming" laptop. Broken keys within days of first use, horrible overheating issues, headphone jack doest work, BSOD issues. Will never purchase anything from Asus again.
I have used 4 laptops before this and this is the worst of all. Keeps restarting every hour. Can’t event open web browsers properly and gets stuck all the time.

I ordered the laptop happy from all the reviews till it came the box was wayy smaller than expect but still I opened the box little to my surprise it was a bottle of perfume in it instead of my laptop
Well when I first started up this computer is gave me a blue screen of death.  Reinstalled Windows same issue.  Not a good impression for Asus Laptops. Returned ASAP. I suggest avoiding this laptop.

Had it for almost a month. Works like a dream. Two issue that I have are the fan noise, it can get very loud at times and the ports, sometimes the HDMI port and the audio jack ports act up but nothing too bad.

Excelente relación precio y características, el monitor de recurso interno es excelente para evaluar el desempeño con las aplicaciones. Lo único que no me gustó es que solo tiene un slot para la memoria ram.

Look elsewhere. This laptop had all sorts of video issues. I use it for Adobe Premier and it crashes constantly. Drivers are up to date, computer is clean. I would not suggest this at all. I can't even image the gaming on it. :(

Al principio no sabia que esperar, tenia miedo que fuera a llegar dañada o con un problema de software, pero al contrario, la laptop llego en perfectas condiciones y funciona super bien sin ningun problema, ya la probe con varios juegos y los corre fluidos sin problemas, una muy buena compra

Laptop runs amazing, fast, responsive. Only thing that is a but of a downer is how hit the laptop gets after a short period of gaming. I'm not talking max settings. I'm taking about medium settings. Other than that this is a great laptop

I work in video games, so before buying a new laptop, I spent a lot of time researching my options. I'm very glad I ultimately went with this one. It's sleek, fast, and a lot quieter than my old MSI. Both working and gaming has been a pleasure thus far.

I bought this laptop because the price was good and the specs seemed decent. After I set it up and tried to game on it many games such as Fortnite and COD Warzone they stuttered badly. The CPU was pegged at 100% and almost all the ram was being used. I ended up returning it in favor of something with a better CPU.

No matter what I do, I can’t get display to look good. It’s really bland, no vibrancy, and the backlighting is very dim. I have to crank up the gamma/brightness in every game just to see what’s going on. Everything else is fine otherwise.
This thing is great, runs like a champ, I can multibox 3 Diablo 3 games with ease, plays biomutant great, from startup to playing in 5-10seconds, no complaints on my part.

Completely useless after a year of owning this computer. I used it for editing less than 30min videos, streaming football and LOL. It glitches out and does not recognize my plugged in accessories, I’ve verified it’s not the accessories with another computer and they work perfectly. Highly recommend if you only want a good computer for about a year.
This is the first time I buy a gaming laptop, and I must say it exceeded my expectations. Everything I tried runs smoothly. Great price range from my point of view.

Laptop looks nice and everything works fine, but I’m getting 50-100 fps on LOW settings on Valorant. I just bought this laptop a few days ago and it’s already like this. I already went on YouTube to tweak the settings to improve my in game fps but nothing’s working. Already tried setting it to High Performance, playing around with NVIDIA’s settings and it’s still the same. I got better fps on my old laptop that has inferior specs… Did I just get a bad laptop?

The screen had yellow tone , even i had calibration it, still very yellow. if you using for gaming, that is no problem. if you using for photo or video editing, strongly recommend connect other monitor. ( FYI, as my checking, that screen is 69% SRGB)

Will download games that you have to pay for but messes with your phone and all the apps on your phone and there is not even a Built-in camera is very slow Mentioning gaming battery life and no camera quality

Loving it so far! My other laptop is another ASUS but an AMD Radeon. This i7 + RTX3050ti is a BEAST compared to that thing. Alien Isolation PCVR on the Quest 2 looks IMMACULATE. And while she runs hot, not nearly as hot as my AMD laptop.

I'm sorely disappointed in my new laptop. While using Google Chrome and Spotify, my laptop blue screened due to overheating...three days after arrival. I will be returning this product in the next few days. Sad because I've enjoyed everything else about this computer. Blue screens a less than a month into new usage is unacceptable.

Es una computadora que se siente muy bien en la parte del teclado y se ve muy bien la pantalla, pero se queda marcado tus huellas en todas partes donde tocas este aparato (punto malo) a la tercer vez q la use comenzó apagar cada 15 segundos la pura pantalla x 3 ocasiónes y enseguida se apagó definitivamente y solo quedó prendido el teclado, así que piensen en adquirir está máquina.

Bought this laptop as a lower level gaming PC. It arrived on time and in good condition, started as it should have. I had some problems playing any games at first as the drivers were not up to date, but when that was finished, it became possible to load them without crashing.

The first thing I did was double the amount of RAM in this machine. After that, everything stopped stuttering and I could play pretty much whatever I wanted (mind you, I'm generally considered an "old school" gamer and get around to AAA titles 5-10 years after release if at all). The laptop just runs and that's good enough for me.

El producto tardó 2 días en presentar el primer pantallazo azul, luego solo fueron errores tras errores. En total recibí como 5 pantallazos azules y cada que la encendía me decía que debía escanear y reparar el disco de almacenamiento… Ya hice el retorno y estoy esperando la devolución del dinero y en teoría por lo que hablé con servicio al cliente debería recibir la devolución del envío ya que viene con malos funcionamientos de fábrica (Desde Colombia fueron al rededor de 160USD). En mi opinión deberían optar por otra opción o contar con suerte al comprar ésta laptop.

It’s a great computer for the price point. Easily upgradeable ram and hard drive. The ram upgrade is a necessity for this type of computer. It’s not going to play the latest AAA games great. If your just looking to play Fallout 4, 3 and NV on Ultra this is the computer for you.

Bought a Used Like New one and everything looked brand new, but the device was already signed into and encrypted. Battery life was also only going up to 95 even when plugged. Had to return. So be aware of that for anyone buying used.
My laptop works pretty good. I had a couple of technical issues (eg NVidia video card disappearing) and tech support was absolutely unhelpful (after spending a very long time with them).
The Dash F15 is a very good machine with a top-notch 144hz IPS panel display and excellent built quality for the price, but it has one bad and one good+bad point to consider.

*Extremely durable and sturdy feel to it. Keyboard feels amazing, and display looks absolutely terrible. (Display looks as if the brightness setting was capped at 85%, a common and, at this point, memeable recurring issue with TUF displays )

So far, the computer's flawless when it comes to work-related tasks. Although the battery doesn't last as long as advertised (which I'd expected), 8 hours is still pretty good when compared to other gaming laptops.

So far after three months of use this laptop has been great, I have no issue at all so far. The performance from this small package is just great for work, video editing, photo editing and gaming. Video editing 4k video tends to get slow but it still gets the job done.
This laptop is awsome, but the 8gb of ram just makes your GPU to bottleneck, if you want to get full just upgrade it with single-channel 16gb ram. Everything should go smoothly.

Is a good laptop and is awesome for the price also many details should have take in consideration for people that the laptop for programing and use the keyboard in spanish and si that the keyboard don't have a <>  key.

The biggest thing was top clamshell part of the screen was pure metal, making the laptop resilient and durable. The screen picture and resolution was delightful, from the moment I turned it on to the many weeks after. It was capable with running Monster Hunter World pretty much on the higher quality without much problems. I just hooked up an XboxOne Controller and went to town. (I'm a PS5 Player Myself) overall very happy with My purchase. I would buy another in a heartbeat.

Overall this computer is a good entry level gaming laptop, especially for under $1000. The GPU is strong enough to play pretty much every game at 1080p/60 on high or ultra settings. Do make some notes though:

the screen is beautiful though got no camera great for gaming though i got it for architecture and it crushes absolutely the cad softwares though still struggles with lumion i think due to graphics memory but has a fast intel chip especially for the price

Just a few things that I don't like, but I am okay with it. First off, this laptop is that the initial 8 gigs of ram are soldered onto the motherboard. But with that, you still have a empty ram socket that you can use to upgrade your memory size. The 2nd issue is that this laptop only supports NVME SSD drives. I tried to install a M.2 2880 ssd drive and the computer didn't even recognize it at all.

Overall good laptop! I use it for gaming only and it runs everything I want smoothly. I upgraded with another 8gb stick of ram and a 1tb nvme. Battery life could be better but it's not that big of a deal to me.

The battery life is the biggest thing that isn't the best on the laptop. When the laptop is plugged in you'll get max performance out of it. If it's not plugged in when it's on the last bit of the battery it's very slow. *TAKE INTO CONSIDERATION* It's running a lot at once and a really powerful laptop. When the laptop is being used just make sure to plug it in that's all.

Llego en buenas condiciones me sorprendió esperaba que fuera menos potente con respecto a los juegos corre el jedi fallen order en gráficos altos generalmente bien y es un juego reciente la batería como cualquier computadora gamer no dura mucho cuando estas jugando a lo mucho 1 hora 40 min o 2 hrs esta muy bien contruida se siente resistente y me gusta mucho su pantalla con marcos muy delgados y el teclado también está bien y es muy comodo en general es muy buena computadora para empezar si es que no eres muy exigente

Bastante bueno para su precio aquí en Chile, ya que lo eh llegado a ver hasta a 1.3m en paginas nacionales, eh visto bastantes personas aquí en las reseñas de Amazon  quejándose de que no es buen calidad precio, pero consideremos que aquí en Latinoamérica estos pc son poco accesibles, realmente lo recomiendo, alcanzo altos FPS y temperaturas bastante normales hasta ahora, eso si agregar casi obligatorio 8GB de RAM más, también recalco el pésimo servicio de DHL en mi país, pero esto es algo fuera del producto y Amazon así que realmente vale la pena este producto.
The screen is kinda dim out of the box. There is some customization options in the pre-installed software that helps with this. But even on vivid or fps modes. It's still kinda dim.

The computer is perfect for a small gaming setup. The problem I had was that you need 16GB of ram to run fortnite smoothly on max graphics, apex sometimes will stutter, and even small games like roblox will have your fps a little less than their max potential. And GTA will stutter badly after like 10 minutes of running the game. But after i upgraded the ram to 16GB it ran perfectly.

For the price I bought it for at a discount, it’s a great PC to have for gaming & everyday use. The battery does drain fast but. When you are gaming it is a great a experience. It’s great for gaming on the go.

Por el precio es lo mejor, cuando puse gta v al maximo va super fluido a la perfeccion. Los ventiladores trabajan al maximo por lo cual hacen ruido. Va muy muy bien para trabajos normales y uno que otro juego que tengo.

Casing looks cool but is a plastic assembly. RTX3050TI is runs most games Smoothly. Is an ok laptop for a moderate gamer on a low budget. I don't play much so I'm happy with my purchase. I would have preferred to save a little more and get one with a better GPU.
I've had the laptop for approx. a month, and there hasn't been one negative so far.  Its super fast already with 8g ram.  I was planning on upgrading to 16 ram, but I don't think i need to...

This company is very responsive immediately. They were of great help when I had a question and product was shipped same day and delivered by next two days when delivery date was way later. They made it happen. The laptop is amazing, highly recommend this company and products!
The only downfall is, it doesn't have a camera. Other than that, everything has been working really smoothly, it loads supper fast and I'm overall pretty happy with this purchase.

Great computer that runs really smooth. I had an issue with my previous laptop running so slow even when I first bought it. Now that I have this one, it’s so satisfying to have a computer that finally works the way it should. I’m not playing crazy high quality video games but Dota 2 runs perfect, I’m pretty sure it can handle most games. Over all satisfied
Everything is fine with almost games, but I play forza 5 with my 8GB RAM not enough with this game, also there's main problem with this laptop the battery is bad with the games
I might update this at a later date if I find something to be good or bad, and please note I am not a professional reviewer, I'm just basing this on how it fits my needs.

I shopped a long time for a laptop that met some bizarre requirements for for FHD frame rates even though I do not game. But my last 3 Asus purchases (desktop, tablet, 17" laptop) have been quality products and this seems to be no exception.
I gotta say, this PC's specs had me going. I was all excited and ready to game and work using this thing. Saw YT reviews and unboxing and was ready for it. Expected 70-90 fps with Warzone.
I maxed out the ram out of the box, so its right at 40 gigs. This device is used for editing 4k drone video, writing estimates,  pretty much real time.

I like the laptop performance, Good for gaming, business and entertainment. Love the Audio Quality and I wish the laptop come with at least microphone. Camera not present in the laptop is fine. But microphone is necessary for Audio conversation

Great laptop. I added a 32 to bump the memory up to 40 GB and a 2 TB ssd card for game storage. It handles Alyx in VR with no problem ( plugged in of course) and the classics with ease.  Very easy to work on. The case is very sturdy . All around good laptop for gaming or video editing.
Love that it not to heavy and it as nice look to it. I wish that the ram was not solder on. That way I can add 2 16g ram stick
The laptop is pretty good but it heats up fast, the battery isn’t as long as I thought it would be and there isn’t a web cam. All in all though it’s been good so far
Had this laptop about a month now, works as intended no issues, performs well for the light gaming i wanted to do when i feel the urge for pc play.

I got this laptop for $700 on prime day. It’s a great laptop for gaming. I would strongly recommend to upgrade the ram by adding another 8gb for a total of 16. I went from getting 40-60fps in Destiny 2 to 60-80fps after the upgrade.

I've only had this laptop for a few weeks now, but it seems very good for the price. The screen resolution is good, the boot up time is low, and the battery life is much better than my previous laptop. They keyboard area really shows where your hands leave behind oils, which would be my only very minor gripe with it.

I've only had it a day but so far this machine is flawless. Very easy set up even if your not very computer literate. I've had the best performance/longevity with Asus computers throughout my lifetime more than other brands so I do not doubt its performance. I record music and this can definitely handle most of what I need. I do plan upgrading ram just for better plug in performance.
Se recomienda hacer upgrade al hardware ya que su rendimiento aumenta al máximo. El contra que tiene es sólo un slot para memoria RAM (tiene 8 GB de RAM interna)

La computadora es buenísima, no da problemas pero se calentó tanto que casi senti que me quema las piernas. Tendrian que comprarla con un abanico para laptops para que no les explote. También cuando conectas el cargador se pone negra un segundo, lo cual es raro aunque no le hace nada malo .

My Wifi just stopped working one day saying there was an issue with my max address when I went to the asus troubleshoot center and I haven’t even paid it off yet (had it less than 4 months) It was a good laptop until I couldn’t use the internet at over 4.0kbps send my receiving seems fine but I can’t log onto anything it takes forever to load anything and if I can’t use Wi-Fi then I can hardly use this laptop since a majority of the things I do require internet
I love this laptop, the only thing thar i dont like its the screen, its a little dim for my taste and the color profiles are weird, but the refresh rate compensate it.

Out of the box it was wasn’t working well. After a day I was able to set it up and got it running but it ran slow and the screen froze multiple times. The next day when I was turning it on it said that auto repair had failed and the drive had to be wiped clean. I got it when it was on sale and I like the model but now I’m going to have to pay more money for the same product. I love having a 1000 dollar paper weight.

The game was great in terms of running games, it can run games such as GTA and Fortnite with decent graphics. If you are more into games such as Roblox or Genshin Impact it runs them great. Overall the gaming is great, however, the battery is very bad when using it on the go. The best way to get the battery to last is, as is most devices, turning the graphics, screen brightness, and fan speed down. Overall good, could be slightly better.

The system performs quite well and easily handles any game I have tried to play on it.  The battery performance during gaming isn't great, but 144hz refresh rate and power consumption of the video card during gaming does whittle the battery performance down fairly quickly.  However when used for school and maxed out for battery performance, to include restricting to a 60hz refresh rate, the system easily lasts and entire day at school for my son without needing to be plugged in to recharge.

Small but powerful, the screen is easy on the eyes till you get into gaming. After playing with the intel graphics command and playing the games again, and changing the colors, contrast, saturations, I was able to get some nice colors with brightness nothing perfect mind it. These are the settings for me, but nothing is the same.
The Laptop is very good and performs good at every level while gaming, But literally two weeks of purchasing the fans started making noise, I know that It makes noise because of the demand etc...

I really enjoyed my purchase of this laptop, everything works well but the battery life isn't very good unless you use it for the bare minimum on the lowest power settings available. For 999 plus tax it was an excellent purchase but now that the price went up I'd probably look for other options on that price range. Very satisfied nonetheless

Decent computer, I had the i7-12650H with GTX 3060 model. Computer overheats so much even just idling. It got to the point where any sort of heavy load made it inoperable. I had to buy a separate cooling pad just to use the laptop so now I have to carry that thing along as well. Also only have has 500 GB of storage which filled up after 4 games but it’s to be expected (upgradable though).

The laptop is pretty laptop. For the specs you pay for you get a good deal and it is a pretty good slick desgin. I want to put it out there I just got it. But from using it it's pretty nice. If you got the money do it and like to play games I guess I will edit it once I play a game. The game I will be playing is rust.

Great PC for work and play. I use it as my main travel PC for videos and music production as we as games when I have some free time. I purchased it because you get a 12th gen i7 plus ddr5 memory, a built-in graphics card, and thunderbolt 4. I am very happy with my purchase. Oh, yea I almost forgot ASUS is giving me a 90-warranty extension just for telling about my purchase! Wow! Another reason to buy.

The laptop is really well-built, fast and simple perfect for work, study and gaming, the only thing to have in mind if that you are heavily gaming it can get hot, so I would recommend a cooling base/stand, but this is a great laptop for the price !

This laptop really exceeded my expectations. I am receiving a warranty extension from ASUS for giving my feedback however I genuinely recommend this product for anyone who is looking to do gaming and be mobile at the same time. It is very light for its purpose, specs and quality.

This thing is a gaming beast. Able to run most games on ultra. It does get hot around the upper keyboard but that was my only complaint. Battery is good unless using it for heavy tasks or gaming. So your self a favor though and upgrade the ssd to at least 1 terabyte. Super easy to install as this comes with a second SSD slot.

Great midrange laptop that is above average and powerful for gaming to work. Gave a 4 stars as think some improvement on the camera/mic and sound could be a improved a bit. Overall it is a very versatile laptop and so far happy with it.

Other laptops with same specs cost more.  Although this is a little heavier than those, the lower price is a great tradeoff.  Charges incredibly fast, but do wish it came with a USB C charging cable instead of a barrel plug since it has thunderbolt 4 port.

Had it for less than a day, started windows update and after a second restart it never got to Windows again. Reinstalled bios, tried to reinstall windows, nothing worked. Maybe I got a bad one, but it was definitely frustrating.
I’ll keep it simple, i love the design, the specs are really good especially for this budget (i got it for 999$ on sale) and overall it is a great gaming laptop. Love it.

Laptop looks great and is super fast. Only issue is while playing a game it would over heat really bad. Top of the computer would get to hot to touch. I even purchased a cooling fan for it and still would get the same way. Would’ve kept the laptop if this issue didn’t come about.

The laptop uses a powerful cpu in tandem with a upper midrange gpu to provide good performance overall, with decent battery life and the ability to charge it using USB Type C portable charging. There are some strange problems with my specific unit, but they haven't interferred while gaming or doing work, so I would recommend this laptop if it goes for around $1100, as it then has excellent value.

After updating all the systems software on the computer and using it for a few weeks it still runs as expected and very well at gaming, typing, and student task. I would highly recommend this item to others because the value to performance factor is great on this laptop.

When unplugged, the screen bugs out and flashes all different colors every minute or two. Tried reinstalling graphics drivers and even wiping the OS from scratch. Seems to be an issue with one of the ASUS built in software tools that controls the 2 video devices in the laptop. To top it off, Amazon is making me pay for return shipping. Suffice it to say, I probably won’t be buying electronics from Asus or Amazon anymore. If you wanna game on the go, try a Steam deck.

System arrived next day.  Opened it up turned it on and after a few hours of standard updating the system was ready for use.  Sound system was surprisingly good.  Very speedy boot up.  Keyboard light kept flashing until after the standard upgrades were applied.  Recommend gladly.

Bought the 2022 model with 16 gigs. Play mostly league and older games to be honest, but I absolutely love the thing. It looks great- sleek but not obnoxiously gamer design. Web cam is pretty bad, but better then nothing- which is what most other gaming laptops in this price range will offer. Word of advice, avoid having the armory crate open while gaming, and make sure to let BIOS update to current before making a final judgement. I had performance issues prior to sorting out those two issues, but now it runs perfectly.

Soy de Ecuador y al inicio estaba un poco dudoso de importar la laptop a mi país o no, al final lo hice con miedo por los malos comentarios que tenían estas laptos en sus versiones pasadas y por lo dificultoso que sería para mi tramitar una garantía. Pero sin duda esta portátil tiene un buen desempeño:

CPU temps were hitting 97C when gaming out of the box.  With throttle stop and changing power settings to 99% cpu max and turbo disabled gets it down to about 82C which I think is still too hot.  Cannot undervolt as they have it locked so you cannot.  Will change my review if I can get the temperature down more but for now beware.

This is definitely the best purchase I have ever made as far as computers. I spent a lot of time reading up on laptops because I wanted to make sure my son had just what he wanted and with this, he definitely does. He can do all of his schoolwork but most importantly to him, it is excellent for gaming. It is fast and the graphics are really good. He loves it.

It’s been about 6 years since I last built a PC rig and decided it was time to upgrade, I bought the 2021 version and realized it only had 4 cores, returned it to buy this 10 core beast! I am very pleased with its performance 2022 model is a significant upgrade!!

When I started thinking about buying a light and powerful affordable laptop, the only option was the 2021 TUF Dash, but it had a 4-core bottleneck CPU. Later, the 2022 version was released. This model has a good 10-core i7-12650H CPU (6 P-cores + 4 E-cores) and 105W RTX 3060 GPU (80+25 Dynamic boost), so I bought it as soon as I got the chance.

The keyboard is defective. Every time I press "P" key it gets stuck. The battery status sometimes drops suddenly (e.g. from 100% to 80% in just a second). I requested a return days ago, but the UPS is not coming to collect it, and the only return option they provide is UPS pickup, which sucks.

2022 May production date! i7 12650 is a killer, but it gets hot very easy when playing game. The watcher program needs to set or it will be over heat. Wish they put in a 1TB instead of 512GB. Otherwise, it works prefect. Great money for its value!

Aunque en los primeros días me tiro un reinicio raro, luego no tuve ningun problema a la hora de usarla, corre bien en juegos como Valorant, Spiderman, así tambien en programas de Arquitectura como D5 Render, Lumion, Autocad, sin ningún problema si tuviera que ponerle un pero es el almacenamiento pero eso se soluciona usando el slot de ampliación, tambien destacar que ninguna ram esta soldada, es decir ambos son reemplazables sin tener que prescindir del dual channel de ram

Amazing laptop for gaming and work. It’s fast and responsive and the new Windows 11 is amazing for productivity. The new interface is much easier and cleaner to work with. The camera is not amazing but for work it’s decent that it gets the job done. The price to performance per buck makes this laptop a  steal to buy. This is a solid recommendation for anyone and to young people such as college students.

Got it for 1000$( discounted price) and its gotta be the best I have spent , absolute bang for buck. Works perfectly, great performance. Just use a cooling pad while gaming and you’ll be fine with the temps.
Killer laptop Asus built it to last brilliant.Asus you keep on making the best.2022  12th Gen Intel I7  RTX3060  Mux switch  Thunderbolt 4.Pricing unreal. Was worth the wait thanks Asus
This is the best laptop within this budget. Super smooth, fast and low noise. Asus is also giving warranty extension of 90 days for giving feedback of the laptop. That’s great!

I am satisfied qith this purchase. This computer is powerfull and run all aplications very fast. The quality of materials is excelente it seems to be a durable laptop. The only I would like to be better is about the camera. The video calls looks noisy, but it is ok

Es una excelente computadora la tengo ya casi un mes y la utilizo con programas de diseño y no me a dado problema cumplió mis expectativas, los ventiladores en el estado turbo y cuando trabaja al 100 si suenan fuerte pero nada que pueda incomodar, me sorprendió lo ligera que es, tal vez el inconveniente que le veo es la batería dura poco, pero en fin calidad precio es de lo mejor que se puede encontrar

La potencia que tiene a la hora de jugar y trabajar ya sea como productor o diseñador gráfico. solo veo un único punto que no me agradó mucho que son las temperaturas a la hora de jugar juegos muy exigentes

This is for the 2022 model which has some serious upgrades on specs from the earlier model.  First, you are dealing with a 10 core chip, and not the underpowered 4 core i7, so that is substantial. This was always a weak link in the prior version.  You are also dealing with 16gb ddr 5 (not 4) ram, so that is both more and faster but note that upgrading ddr5 ram will be more expensive than upgrading a ddr4 machine so you may have to wait for ram prices to fall a bit before upgrading.

En primer lugar me sentí estafado ya que a los pocos días que compre esta laptop a $1,299.00 se puso en oferta a $1,069.00 o sea pagué $230.00 más los impuestos que esa cantidad representan. Ahora con el tema de la pantalla cuando está el fondo negro se ven unos destellos por toda la zona del marco que se ven horribles, da la impresión de una pantalla de mala calidad. Por todo lo demás la laptop es muy potente y estéticamente agradable…

Seems like a great laptop so far. I want to note that is only comes with 1 SO-DIMM slot, the other is soldered. I am purchasing a 32 gb stick to try and at least upgrade it to 40 gb. Although overall first impressions are great. I had no idea that ASUS had a 1 year complimentary accidental damage protection.

Gran velocidad de encendido, carga, ejecución de aplicaciones. Último hardware en procesador, memoria, video, disco. Teclado impecable, marcos diminutos, ligera de peso, amplio touchpad, teclado numérico incorporado con mínimos marcos en la base para tener el máximo espacio posible completamente aprovechado.

Over all oowww awesome power laptop for this price. this is my stock trading laptop 16gb/512gb ssd very fast!!! lightweight and thin, for me the down side is flat keyboard not use to it yet and wish the battery last longer.

I’m not a huge gamer, but I love playing the sims 4 and a few other easy games on my time off. The only thing that I noticed having this laptop is that the battery runs out very quickly when I’m just doing regular stuff like browsing through, I always have to have it plugged in so I can have a good time playing. Other than that, I’m happy with what I got. Runs the games smoothly & everything else works just fine. I’m just not going to use it when I have no where to plug it, I guess.
I am a teacher and bought this to put some education software on and use for personal use. The lighted keyboard is awesome and I am totally happy with my purchase so far.

Obviously a 1650 won't be able to run the newest games at maximum settings but it's still a very good laptop.  I was able to play GTA V for a few hours without any issues.  I'll be testing it more extensively next time I go on vacation but for now it's 5 stars.  EDIT: I have now taken it on 2 vacations and played quite a few games on it, this laptop is still 5 stars for the price.  You can play pretty much anything on it for extended periods of time.
It’s a good laptop to use on the go especially for gaming just for small games nothing to big or new but it can most games good and the quality of the screen is great worth the 600
Nothing bad to say I've played like 4 to 5 games on this and it's a good deal plays newest stuff on good fps I'm really happy and impressed w this laptop so far
I like it, Only issue is due to low ram amount it may crash during overload. Also MAKE SURE TO UPDATE EVERYTHING! It may be obvious but if you don't it will constantly crash and freeze

Relative had asked me to find a suitable laptop for them since theyre returning to school, initially I was looking for a Lenovo like my own but for some reason those dissappeared a month prior. Anywho the other Lenovos were not to my favor with price to specs so I looked into ASUS as the next best thing, low and behold ASUS TUF gaming laptop!

--Note, after 3 weeks of owning i decided to return this. I stand by my review, i feel the laptop is good for casual gaming, but i ended up wanting to PC game full time, and this wasn't going to cut the mustard.

Bought this PC for my 18 year old daughter as a beginner gaming laptop and the laptop handles World's of Warcraft, Sims, Seven Days to Die and many other large games flawlessly! Now we did upgrade the amount of R.A.M from 8Gb to 32Gb. But it's a great laptop.

Es un buen equipo y cumple para su función perfectamente, mi equipo presento un pequeño problema con su batería ya que dura menos de 1h estando en ahorro de energía y sin funciones activas y uso de redes sociales y videos.

I bought this laptop for work and when it came in, the volume buttons didnt work, the brightness buttons didnt work, i couldnt acess the settings panel through the windows tab. I couldnt even change the rbg lights on the keyboard which are are supposed to be able to with a REAL one. It's a waste of your time to get one of these. They deleted my old review because they said it went against community guidelines but it didnt at all.

A sus computer... that's for sure. Unit will no longer boot. Screen stays black, fan turns on, backlit keypad cycles through rgbs. Contacted ASUS, sending the unit back to be wiped and os reinstalled to secure my data. Return window expired on Amazon but they are allowing me to return the product. Never had a computer completely fail so quickly, so disappointed.

I purchased this laptop for school and within a week of purchase the laptop is not charging. Attempted to reach out to customer support and they were limited in the support they could offer. As someone who is being inconvenienced with this faulty laptop they could have at least offered some sort of support or incentive to remain with the brand they didn't and I would be returning forthwith

This laptop is such an upgrade ...my absolute favorite is the multiple -colored backlit keys that scroll ever so gently while I'm working...pretty jewel tones add a super -rich touch...the keys are so great to see and access...the laptop has a good solid weight to it...the sound is really great...the HD quality is there for sure.

This laptop runs Warcraft shadow lands on high performance setting it’s a great little gaming machine runs smooth. Easily upgraded with 2nd drive and second memory stick.Back opens easily for access. I’m impressed with it.
It works great!  I do not use it for gaming.  The laptop came with 8GB of RAM.  I immediately added another 8GB.  I highly recommend it, unless you are a serious gamer needing a better graphis card.

Received this and immediately went to town getting all my stuff installed and together.  First thing I noticed was that the fan is pretty aggressive.  Built in software can help with that a bit by tuning it for what you're doing.  Still audible, but just fine in my opinion.  Everything runs pretty smooth, until you get to some more intense games.  I think the 8GB of RAM is just a little on the low side and I suspect adding some more will do wonders.

Keep in mind I am not a true, hardcore gamer, I do not compete nor take games too seriously. This is a very good computer. Upgradable for memory and speed. Monitor has brilliant colors.  Setup went fast and easy.
Worth every penny! If I had to come up with 1 con it would be that the USB slots are pretty tight and sometimes difficult to use. Looks really sleek and performs great.
I bought this to upgrade my son from his previous laptop, which was a Mac. Absolutely worth the money, great investment. He loves to play online games and is having no issues running them.

I purchased this laptop to replaced my old ASUS laptop,I needed something faster and runs smoother however I do have to add more ram because it does slows down and sometimes freeze. I wasn’t intended to use it for gaming I just wanted it for normal internet browsing,and also using it when I’m live streaming for twitch that’s about it. It’s a beautiful laptop I definitely like it very convenient for me.

My hubby is the big PC gamer, I am a consol peasant. However, there are certain games we have been itching to play together and they are either not cross platform within game or just PC only. When we saw this deal I thought "well my old laptop is laggy AF and has no memory and was never meant for gaming" so we decided to get this in place of a full blown PC set up (which we didn't have space for even if I wanted it).

I'm not a fan of Windows at all, however I decided to leave it as dual boot with Linux. As is usually the case with laptops, battery life is much better in Windows than it is in Linux. That is an inherent issue with Linux and not a detriment to the laptop itself.

I love it, its pretty good! Was able to play ROBLOX in high quality level and it made the experience so much better since this laptop has a very fast speed quality.  I'm also very satisfied with the battery life. However sometimes when I open a browser, it sometimes take a little while but at least faster then my old laptop I've had and saved a lot of my time. That's all I have to say and ty ^w^
Works great after updating the wifi driver. Before the update it would keep dropping connection. Wish it had 16g ram but not a big deal. Otherwise great laptop so far.

I recently purchased this laptop on a lightning deal off of Amazon. I have to say, it was well worth the money! In my short time owning this laptop, I've put it through multiple gaming tests, workload tests, and just day-to-day usage. As such, I will write a pros/cons list to demonstrate the strengths and weaknesses of this laptop so you can decide for yourself if it's a worthwhile purchase.

I play RuneScape on this computer, and thought about running WoW on it, but I doubt it has enough space for a game that big. Very well built laptop and runs smoothly so far, battery dies pretty quick. Overall great computer for the price, can’t beat ASUS!

I got it to play games. Unfortunately, I can't play games. Skip this and save yourself heart break and frustration. You can do far better. Just because the price " seems reasonable " is not a good excuse to get it. Save up to get better. It just won't stop crashing no matter what I do.
We received this laptop and after 2 days the WiFi stopped working, I returned it and only got back 80% of what we paid for it. Very disappointed! Be aware of these models.
It's what I expected, great screen and fast enough! Sound could be somewhat better, but it is a laptop! Will add a hard drive and memory latter. Would buy again!

Pros: La computadora es buena, su pantalla es excelente con buen brillo, la velocidad es acorde y lo que se espera por lo adquirido, el teclado es suave, teclado iluminado con opción de apagar, la calidad y materiales se ven buenos o duraderos, agrada la facilidad ara actualizar o mejorar la laptop.

El equipo llegó excelente pero cuando se probó las bocinas tienen daño cuando llega una notificación se escuchan con estática o un ruido extraño como si la bocina estuviera reventada, prácticamente no quisieron hacerme el reemplazo y solo debía enviarla

Very poor to make people have to upgrade this because of the cheapness of the company. Why even ship this with single channel 8GB RAM only, and call this a gaming PC? Throw another 8GB stick in for your customers at the cost of what? $20 for you? Very disappointed in ASUS to be honest. The overall memory is lacking as well. Screen is nice, 3050 is meh, it depends what you want to play - but please for "gaming" 16GB should be minimum now with windows 11, and adding another stick will not bankrupt the company.

Just a couple days prior I had gotten a Lenovo product with similar specs a little but cheaper. However the quality difference between an Asus laptop and Lenovo is easy to tell at first glance. The Asus is built with much better quality materials, centered TouchPad, etc. Also Asus is completely functional when it arrives (not broken, looking at you Lenovo!). Thanks again for quality and speed Asus!

i got this on prime day for about $300 delivered and had a good feel for what i was buying, a bit disappointed with overall performance and battery. first thing i did was upgrade ram with an 8GB stick for better performance then i tuned windows 11 for better performance with fewer visuals, turned battery charge stopping point to 80% for longer battery life.  also i installed avast AV as i heard windows defender was causing performance issues - probably fixed by now

I love the size. It's exactly what I needed for my small business and personal needs. The fingerprint scanner is awesome and so convenient. My only complaint is that I didn't realize it didn't have a built in webcam. It makes it difficult for zoom or anything like that, but I'm managing. I have not tried adding my own webcam extension at this time.
Es un buen computador por el precio, pero entiendo que si 4GB es poco para Windows 11 deberían dejarlo saber o vender laptops solo desde 8GB en ram, aunque sean un poco más costosas.

This thing has windows-s loaded so you cannot load anything not microsoft approved. This completely kills the benefits of using a Windows system. If I wanted a system that policed everything, I would have purchased an ipad and I already have an ipad.
This laptop is top notch! It's no power house but it doesnt need to be (for me). Size and battery life for this laptop are my most important options and this device doesn't disappoint.

This extremely small and beautiful Laptop is extremely fast and very much worth the price. Thank you to Amazon and the Seller for this sale to South Africa and for all the other Asus Laptops and Asus Routers.

Initial reaction - expect a $300 laptop to do $300 laptop things. It's not powerful. It can run kind of slow simply because the specs of the hardware aren't great. Wouldn't recommend this for your main computer, and you shouldn't expect to run any modern games on it.

This is a decent, basic little laptop. Perfect for student use and other typically daily tasks. Not for hard-core gaming or photo editing stuff like that. For basic surfing, web use, streaming,  it is a good choice. Easy to get set up and straight into use, so you don't need to be a computer whiz to use this - which makes it good for younger kids as well as individuals who are not so computer savvy. Overall, not bad. Don't expect a work horse and you'll be happy with it, I think. It is basic, yet efficient.

This is all you need for basic web surfing, work or school. I like how quickly you can access it with the touch of the fingerprint sensor. The keys seems small while typing but good enough to use and enjoy. The backlit keyboard can easily be adjusted with a few brightness levels to choose from. It's compact, feels light and slim. It runs smooth! I wouldn't try any gaming on this one in particular, but it's a great laptop overall for general use.

Got this laptop to take to school so I wouldn't have to take my Asus z g14. I was looking for something that wouldn't break the bank and something that is reasonable in price-to-spec ratio. For $300 this is no doubt the best laptop you could buy.

This ASUS VivoBook 14 F415 Laptop works perfectly for what I got it for! I wanted something inexpensive but still usable for my 10 year old, I mean if I wanted to keep him off my $3,000 XPS then he needed something of his own. Basically I got this for him to practice typing, of course doing other things like playing Minecraft…lol.
In terms of functionality it works very well and is capable my only qualm is the screen which changes color at every shift and feels fake so just beware if you are doing visual work

I purchased this laptop during recent Amazon prime day and have been very satisfied up to this point especially for the price and savings. It has more than met my expectations from easy setup all the way to battery life. The fingerprint security feature is definitely a plus. Almost sure my awesome purchase satisfaction will continue through usage.

It's overall good, but battery life is kinda short compared to other laptops at similar (or a bit more expensive) price. Also the cpu is fine for regular works but I can't recommend it for playing games or some other graphical works. Audio quality is also not so good (but it doesn't really matter cause I use headphones). The biggest problem in my opinion is the heating. The laptop heats up fast.

This is the most unresponsive, slowest computer I have ever seen. It BARELY functions out of the box. It can’t keep up with typing in an email address, it cannot stream any service tried (Netflix, Hulu, Disney+). The delay is infuriated and this was a total and complete waste of money. DO NOT BUY.

I have to admit, I was pleasantly surprised with this purchase but since it was replacing a nine year old pentium laptop with the same memory and drive size that ran pretty well (when it powered on) I figured why not. I wasn’t disappointed. The I3 is quick. I’ve been using it for midi projects and it’s worked out better than I had hoped. I may still add more memory down the line but I really see no rush to do so.

Love that it is not small! Needed a bigger laptop and this was perfect!!! Well was excited and did the Asus 90 day warranty as well, to be shot down cause the laptop won’t come on at all! Called technical support to troubleshoot, and laptop is dead! Awaiting replacement. I pray this second one will not let me down. I will get the Asus 90 day warranty on that as well.

I bought this on Prime Day for $270. This laptop comes with 4 GB RAM soldered on board. It is very easy and inexpensive ($35) to add an 8 GB RAM module. With 12 GB of RAM this laptop runs noticeably faster and smoother.

Overall for the price it is a good computer. I bought it for my year travel. It is light and compact, perfect for travel. I mostly bought this computer for the light up keys. I tend to be on my computer a lot when it is dark, so I need the keys to have a back light. Unfortunately, although it is sold saying there is back light keys, there is not. I am very disappointed in my purchase to due the false advertisement.
THIS COMPUTER IS TERRIBLE. THE MOUSE WILL GO OUT EVERY SO OFTEN I EVEN TRIED TO RESET AND STILL COULD NOT GET THE MOUSE THE WORK.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME BUYING THIS PIECE OF CRAP .

There is no back-lit keyboard. The manual says to use F7 to change the brightness of the keyboard but there is no function on the F7 key. Disappointing as this was the main reason I picked this one over others.

Compact design easy to tote. Starts up fast and performs well. I use Microsoft 360 to do excel and word documents. Has wifi and Bluetooth so I can hot spot anywhere. The keyboard is not back-lit as described.

I liked the style and the concept of the number/ mouse pad but it's glitchy. It's extremely slow when loading regardless of great reception. It's also not such a good idea for outdoor day use because the screens always seems dimmed even on high.

I bought this specifically to turn into a retro DOS emulation laptop.  It's nice and small and doesn't take up much room yet, for the price, the build quality is surprisingly good.  I actually like the feel of the keyboard better than my 2020 M1 Macbook Air.

Ya había comprado este computador antes porque lo necesitaba de tamaño pequeño y todo salió bien me enviaron uno de 11 pulgadas como lo especifica el anuncio, luego lo compre nuevamente para alguien mas y me llego un computador de 14 pulgadas. Me enviaron un computador mas grande y lo había comprado precisamente porque lo necesitaba pequeño.
I purchased this for lite school work. However, windows sucks on this little guy. By installing pop os (a Linux distro) it is beyond perfect! Upgraded the HDD to a 1tb and we're all good!

The screen is sharp and good looking,  Solid and fast with a big battery.  Makes for a great travel computer at a exceptional good price.  Installed a 500gb SSD drive... you must initialize and format it before you can use it but it works well and along with the additional SD micro card of 256gb I have plenty of storage.
It’s a little small but great for the money ...still trying to get the 1 free year 365 set up which makes it worth it for school and work other than that it’s awesome

This laptop is perfect for basic use (i.e. web browsing, streaming, office work, social media, etc.).  Battery life seems to last for a while, charges fast, and has decent wi-fi connection.  Good for family use and/or individual.  Would not recommend for gaming :-).

This is a great little laptop. I was skeptical at first when ordering it but it did have a lot of good reviews so I took a chance on it and am glad I did.  It serves my computer needs, is lightweight and small enough not to take up a lot of space on my desk but has good screen quality.
It’s a little small but great for the money ...still trying to get the 1 free year 365 set up which makes it worth it for school and work other than that it’s awesome

Una de las cosas que más me interesa de un laptop es el backlit porque es en la noche cuando ocupo este computador para ciertas cosas personales. Por eso la compré... Pues no viene con BACKLIT aunque lo dice en la descripción.
It was a gift for my aunt whom is a cancer survivor and I got her the deal lol but thank you amazon couldn't of done it without you best prices bravo 👏👏

Really surprised, performance is better than expected. I'm only using it for personal use; emails, shopping, accounting and such. It's quick to start and light weight and I like the key- board. Great purchase for the money.
Don't buy this item!! Just stop working on my today out of nowhere. It sits on my mini desk, so no I have never dropped it. Big waste of money so upset with this item and seller.

If you need or want a laptop this one's is good for that. Very inexpensive but very good with the internet, gaming, general writing is good as well. It's thin and light weight. We did purchase this laptop for basic gaming. We are able to use it for playing World of Warcraft. No lag in animations, good upload time. Only down side is we had to purchase a wireless mouse and wireless keyboard. Just easier to get around everything. Definitely recommend!!

Don't like dragging around a full size laptop? Then this might be the laptop for you. Great affordable means to browse your bills at a whim and to be ready to smash that pay button on any bill of your choice faster than they can say "where's my money". Be sensible, be mobile, be a great bill payer!
Great little bargain. Just dont use for a lot of things it cant handle it. Just using for online classes, its great and what a deal. Very happy with purchase.
The wifi range is terrible. The number keypad really slows you down because it comes on so easy. Drives me crazy. Had to by a mouse to stay away from touchpad. Runs slow when multiple tabs are up.

I have just used it to get my emails, pay my bills, and to print my labels for my online sales. I also have utilized the 1 year free Personal Microsoft Office to draft letters. It was 1/3 of the cost of my older Dell laptop and is quicker, user friendly and so easy to use. If you are looking for a lightweight, small, basic laptop, this is the one for you!

Got this as a birthday gift for my mom (who is not tech savvy). She likes to check her email, watch Youtube videos, and go on Pinterest. This does that and it's easy for her to travel with and navigate. She's had no issues with it.

I love the small light weight of this computer. But had I known that the quality of the carmera was poor. I would have not purchased it. When I am doing zoom calls or blogs it very grainy and not very clear. It will work for now. I wish I would have research this a bit more. Also another down fall was the number pad and mouse control. I found it difficult the rapidly type and not hit the on button for the 10 key pad. Outside of those couple of factors it is a fair computer.

Hey, for a $250 dollar laptop cant beat it. Besides microsoft wanting to control every aspect of my laptop experience its a great laptop. Never used an ASUS brand computer before but i do now moving forward. Great product. Fast delivery.
I bought this in April 2 months later the screen turned black on me I barley used it I tried everything this was a waist of money and I’m very disappointed it’s no way I should have problems now
It’s a fast computer with not much memory. I hook it up to HDMI and use it for playing in areas of the internet which are not financial. I use a Chromebook for my financial things.

Small, light weight, QUIET. Does all that I need it to do and then some. The number pad is a nifty little addition and is actually quite helpful. Pleased with my purchase and would certainly recommend to anyone who needs a laptop for the off occasion, but I do not believe it would hold up to the wear and tear of a heavy-use computer. But for $199, you get more than what you’re paying for.

I bought it seeing high review but utter disappointed. In 45 days it stopped working. The power button wouldnt work. I tried troubleshooting but no use. I lost a chunk of data. No cheap laptop anymore.

I only leave reviews if I’m very pissed or very happy w the product- I’m glad it’s the latter. I love this computer. Light, small but not too small for me at all- I can still get my work done know problem and the speed is just fine.  I love how light it is.  I have had bad computer luck so I had low expectations... so I was surprised. Yayyyyy!

Good little machine however the processor speed is actually 1.1ghz flubbed out when trying to take a exam that required 1.8ghz minimum  I don't know what up to2.8ghz means but it failed to handle a1.8 test

I'm a die hard Mac user but needed to have a Windows 10 computer.  I got this little computer and put a 128 GB memory card in and I'm super happy with the performance.  I didn't want to comment until I was used to the product and I actually had given it a change.  I like using it.  It's an easy set up.  I'm taking advantage of the 1 year of Microsoft 365.  Thanks ASUS for a good product for a reasonable amount of money

I've had this laptop for a few months now and so far it has been great. It's fast enough, lightweight so I can take it anywhere, and easy to use. The only cons i can think of is the calculator location. I turn it off, but it's really sensitive and will turn back on while I'm scrolling and the side of my hand brushes it. It's definitely easier to turn on than to turn off.

You get what you pay for, that's why I am giving 4 stars. I needed a reasonable laptop asap that's why I bought it especially for free office 365. Really not a fan of that number pad thingy, I found that totally useless. But for the price, it's a good laptop for everyday works.

Screen quality is low for graphics, and fine for text and basic web browsing. Web cam is poor, but better than nothing. No touch screen, but keyboard is good and all day battery. Great for a light use carry around for sub $200.

Excellent for what it is.  You're getting a extremely portable usuable computer for under $200 that can serve movies up at 1080 p when HDMI out is connected. You get snappy enough web browsing and the light version of windows doesn't seem to be the resource hog it might be on full systems. Great if you need a cheap ultra portable laptop for basic computing. Far cheaper than an iPad and arguabley more useful.

Spent 2 hours getting this laptop set up. It was slow to load. Next day signed on and tried to get on the internet. Screen went blank. Tried ctrl-alt-delete- nothing. Shut down and restarted. Nothing. Total junk. Will replace with a name brand.

Screen was good but touch screen sucked...the lol mouse would disappear from screen and just pop up anywhere and wouldnt click on items the 1st click(it takes multiple clicks to get to where I'm trying to go).

Decent for the price. Got this for my 7yo sister, perfect for her school work and some youtube. Don't expect much from this thing, If you just need a social media scrolling machine, school or lonely binge watching, then go for it.

Ordered it for my friend. At first when I saw this laptop, I was skeptical about it usage and being prompt. But I still remember I started using it for testing purpose and was not able take my hand off of it for more than couple of hours. It's well equipped for all basic needs. On top of everything the 365 preinstalltaion for 1 year is like awesome. It's a deal in given price.

I needed a quick and cheap laptop for travel.  This machine deliver on both points.  I wouldn't want to work on it for long periods, but for checking emails in a hotel it worked fine.  This is almost the equivalent of a burner phone.  Use it for a while and toss it when you're done.
False advertising in reference to the backlit keyboard. It does NOT have that. Speakers are not loud at all so if you dont have headphones or a quiet space, it can be inconvenient.
My 13 ye old bought this with his allowance for playing some game called TF2. It works, but he has to constantly delete crap to make space. Other than the lack of storage space he says it works fine.

It was smaller than I expected, but that's on me.  I was used to 15" and 4" smaller makes a difference.  battery life is good.  Beware the touchpad disable button in the row at the top of the keyboard.  I inadvertently turned it off and thought the touchpad had broken.  Also, I accidentally touch the turnon button on the touchpad that activates its numbers.  All in all a good purchase.
the pad has a button to click so that I can use it as a number pad, but the number pad just didn't work, so that just made the whole thing not worth it.  If that didn't work, what else won't work?

This laptop is going to be the perfect travel companion. It's lightweight, compact, and surprisingly fast. I wasn't expecting too much, but I am quite surprised at how smoothly, and quickly everything loads, and runs. I would recommend this laptop to friends, and family. I'm really enjoying it, and can't wait to watch Netflix movies I've downloaded on my next flight at 39 thousand feet!

I like it just fine, but I NEED HELP! I pressed some sort of KILL button and can’t get it back on!  I’m a writer who has to write everything from an iPhone12 mini now!  Please PLEASE!!  I can’t even print off the instruction manual now and can’t see the screen on my phone well enough to search for the 494 answers to 494 other questions.  IF SOMEONE HELPS ME, I WILL CHANGE MY REVIEW.

It's great for travel - light and fits easily in pocket of carry-on luggage. I use an external hard drive to eliminate the need to transfer data every time I get a new laptop so storage capacity is a non- issue.

I'm very glad for having bought this laptop. It's just what we needed for our 10-year old boy to use in his online schooling. It's screen size is the perfect size for him, and the camera works just fine even with low light. We're about to buy a second one for our 12-year old girl, for home schooling also.

You decide what apps to install. I just use a total of four apps and it always irritated me that until now every computer I've owned has come with apps I had no use for and couldn't remove. This time I can pick and choose.

This laptop is fairly good for the money. I have tried to use the touch screen  but it is not really useful for what I bought the laptop for. I am not a gamer so I have not used it for that purpose. I use this for Design Space which is  a web program used for Cricut  and Canvasworkspace for Brother Scan & Cut (both of which  run only on Apple and windows but not on Chroebook

I bought this laptop just to do college work on, as soon as i set it up i downloaded chrome and the laptop is struggling to close 1 tab.
