I expect more from asus but i guess nothing is as good as it used to be. Kind of disappointed because im sure ill have to buy another one within the next year. Save your money and buy an HP or mac.

It works decent for running emulators, not what would be considered a gaming quality computer. I am happy with it, especially for the price. If you want gaming or high quality, you have to pay way more money. In my opinion, it's a good little laptop than can do what you want to do.

Love, Love, Love the size and weight of this laptop. Easy to take with me. Screen quality good and keyboard easy to use. I'm not sure I like the ability to switch to the numbers keypad as I sometimes do it accidentally and don't use numbers often, but overall great product and would advise anyone to purchase it.

So it’s a great starter laptop, good battery life, decent storage, all around pretty decent. What my problem with it is it has a problem where it lags out then “shuts off” per say and the only fix is to hard reset it. Other than that pretty great all around

This is a great little laptop. Web browsing, streaming are very nice. Great touch pad response. Keyboard types well. Fairly quick loading. Make sure to buy a micro SD drive for extra space for sure though. Main drive doesn’t have enough space with Windows 10 constant updates of course which is around 30+ gb usually. I love this purchase however. I needed something like this

I recently did my purchase and I'm in love! It's very compact and complete, I used only for my homework so I don't ask so much. I love the fact I can control my phone by this and hopefully has a long life.

One of the reasons I purchased the ASUS Vivobook Go 12 L210 was because of the advertised backlit keyboard. As I was setting up my new computer yesterday, I was having a temendous amount of difficulty turning on the backit keyboard. I spent hours researching and trying to troubleshoot only to discover that this computer doesn't have a backlit keyboard! I am beyond furious and frustrated that this advertising includes lies; what a waste of time! What else is a lie? Buyer beware!
Works great no issues not using in s mode  it’s great for what it is no complaints  we will see how it lasts  one of the best products I have bought from Amazon

The sound on this was not loud enough so decided to return it.I don't want to have to use earbuds to listen/watch videos.....When i went to set it back to default settings it wouldn't do it.....Dideled with it for 1/2 hr and finally said  f it!.
The XML file was not stored for this computer. I can only get to the internet in a place that does not require a password. Gave the computer low scores because of the hassle.
This tablet has been a god send. We take it with us when we travel so we can do our banking and pay bills. It is not a touch screen. The only down side.
I am very happy with my purchase. Got the computer laptop for my sister's birthday. She had no idea that I ordered it. I have to order a lot online and Amazon is awesome. Thank you so much.

Nice little laptop and very nice keyboard. The seperate number pad in the touch pad isnt great, but works. Normally the number pad is off. I'm not a big computer guy, but this laptop is nice and the speed seems to be very fast (Celeron processor using windows 10). The screen is right on the edge of being too small for me, but it hooked up easily to my 40" Samsung LED tv and using mostly mouse functions (wireless mouse) i set the laptop aside and actually do not use it at all.

I went to the ASUS rep and they would not listen.  They continued to tell me to do things as if I were on the web or the computer was up and running.  IT NEVER WAS!  Also, the packing was horrible.  One piece of brown paper that did not even hold box.  Shabby packing and maybe that is why problem
I bought this to hook up to my TV so I would watch my kids sporting events that were being streamed on-line.  It is fine for that.  Not sure about anything else, because that is all I use it for

I bought this comp knowing it was a bargain price at 200.00. However I read all the reviews and thought ok, I'll enjoy it for maybe a few yrs. This comp is the worst I've ever owned and I'm 65. It's buttons stick, serious lag to the point it's unusable. I don't do much on it except brouse and emails, so it's not the load on it.. I had to buy a new one and I'll never, ever, get anything from Asus again. Very disappointed. It should not have gone downhill so fast and in so many ways. Disgrace!

This is an AMAZING computer. I got it this year. It is very sturdy, durable, and very reliable. The disk space is amazing and it came with windows 10.  Asus computers are the absolute best. I love them and would choose them over Dell or other name brand computers. The battery life is phenomenal as well. I definitely recommend this product.
Thinner than my old ASUS so very portable. I bought this strictly for using my CRICUT printer. Clarity of the screen is great and for its purpose I am glad I didn’t purchase a touchscreen machine.

This is a decent, but limited, laptop. 64GB is just enough to run Windows OS and Microsoft Office. Remember, also, this is EMMC memory and not a true SSD. I got a 256GB SD and formatted it to NSFT so I could put my OneDrive on it. If you want to install anything other than Windows and MSOffice, I recommend looking for programs you and install on the non-system drive. That limits your choices.

I did not purchase this as my primary laptop. I bought it to chuck into a suitcase for travel, or use to look something up while watching TV. It boots fast, very lightweight, seems sturdy, fast enough. I also exited S mode and did all the updates. The webcam is unusable.

I struggled so hard to figure out this laptop. Granted, it is my first, but I have had desktops before, and they were much easier to navigate. Unless you're already a pro-teckie, it will frustrate you.

This is a great little laptop. I needed something for simple things like the web and a couple games like the hidden object adventure games. It surpassed my expectations and I'm actually going to order another one for my daughter just for the heck of it.

So far so good with the computer. Why I left 3 stars in total was because of how I found it. It was shipped to a friend's and they left it by the road up against the mail box. My friend never knew it was here. Other than that the computer looks good and runs nice no complaints yet about that.

I highly recommend this Laptop For Students in College, I mainly use this laptop for Editing Videos for YouTube, and It's one of the best (In my opinion) starting out Laptops, it came With Microsoft Office, and The Ram allowed me to Download Vegas Pro 18.

I needed a laptop for 4 things: Microsoft Office, email, internet and streaming. This is a great laptop if you need the basics. I can watch a movie, answer emails and use Office. It's got a great battery life too!

Does NOT Have A Backlit Keyboard Like It Said It Did.. Very Disappointed Because I love Asus An Own Couple Gaming Ones An Had Gotten This One To Use For Work Since I Work At Night An Seen It Says An Shows in The Pictures It Has A Backlit Keyboard. Which I Got Excited.. Untill It Came Today An NOPE.. Guess Not Taking This One To Work Tonight..

Bought it for when I moved because I didn't have a laptop. Then I bought a tiny USB 256gb drive and run Linux without messing with the Windows partition. Winows sucks. After the move I use as my desk video player using external speaker.

The on/off bottom of the touch pad is located on its upper right corner which becomes very frustrating if you are right handed, you will touch it often inadvertently, shifting to calculator mode while you continue unaware. If you are left handed, it will be out of your way most of the time, but not completely.

This product was BETTER than advertised AND arrived 3 days early!! Its awesome and does all the things I need for backend music production on my DAW. This laptop works seamlessly with all of my gear and made installation quick, effortless and pain-free! I'd highly recommend this product and look forward to buying from the seller again!
My son got one for his birthday and loves it and if had the money I would buy my self one ! Love how easy and very nice it is.

I have always found Celeron processors to be the most reliable workhorses, and since I wanted this computer to function as a reliable little workhorse for the type of work that doesn't require 5 cores and 50gb ram, it was actually a selling point for me. The Celeron is as expected - medium speed, zero hiccups or hangups, mild exclusion from some of your fancier computing ambitions (compatibility).

Bought this for my son. HE ABSOLUTELY loves it.  He uses it for online video game playing and for school. He is not a hard care online player (thank goodness) so this LAPTOP works great for him and his use.  I am glad I was able to buy this for him and have it work well after all the reviews I have been reading. thank you public.

Remove the false advertisement price of $88. Pathetic false advertisement at it's best, while searching for cheap online. Wow only $88 for this piece of tech, CLICK, reveal $249 price tag. Low, very low of who ever decided that play.
La laptop venía sellada, sin embargo, el teclado venía con detalles levantadas las teclas, por lo tanto, no es aceptable ya que es posible que se levanten todas las teclas.

the change from windows 10 S mode is a concern. battery life is good. i don't need to bring the charger outside. the screen can flip to 180 degrees but no further. overall good for daily use (generally).

For surfing the web, checking emails, streaming music services, this is perfect!  Nice construction, lightweight and compact, and beautiful design.  I especially LOVE the inclusion of the USB-C port, which I will use to connect to a portable external monitor.  For every day tasks around the house, this fits my purposes perfectly.

We ordered this laptop for my nephew for school. There were specifications for the processor that were necessary. When we received it, the specs for this machine were not as advertised. Now, we have a laptop that he can't use and we need to get a new one. I am very disappointed with this purchase.

The version of Windows installed on here prevents you from installing most software programs (e.g. Mozilla, Adobe Acrobat, etc.). So it's limited mostly to internet browsing. I bought this purely for only paying bills to maintain security when logging into bank accounts, credit card accounts, etc. This is perfect for that.
Was looking for an inexpensive Windows computer and this fit the bill.  Great price, all the features I was looking for in a "just used just sometimes" computer. Portable. Solid feel.

No Touch screen featured for this lap top. Not able to do  zoom call(sound cuts off). Still a great mini laptop.  It's really small. portable. Ok for simple games. Battery life is awesome. great for documentation and surfing the web. Great view. on the screen.  I am not a techy person, so I can't offer more reason why I am pleased. Save everything to the cloud.

flash memory not as good as SSD, Windows S allows only apps from microsoft store, it's not really a "computer" more like a tablet with a keyboard that runs Windows...you can upgrade to Windows Pro for $50 though and that's great considering its $100 to upgrade from Windows Home to Pro...get this for someone who doesn't know a lot about computers and just wants to get online
The chromebook is very nice. I like how I was able to sync my phone and all my apps to the chromebook. It's easy to set up and use. Very slim and lightweight.

I purchased this laptop because my previous laptop had a broken screen, and I did not want to pay much for a laptop I really only use for light internet browsing and coding. I also would never consider running Windows on a machine that is this limited.

I bought this for my upcoming trip to visit my daughter.  It was very easy to set up and I had no problem taking it out of  Windows 10S and installing the regular Windows 10 on it.  What I like about this little laptop is that it is very light, it worked fast on my Wi-Fi at home and the screen quality is decent.  I did buy a SD micro card to increase my storage capacity in case I want to save anything.  I highly recommend this laptop and I am very pleased with the performance thus far.
Me encanta, es ligera, compacta y rapida en modo S. Buen rendimiento de la bateria el teclado es comodo y trackpad sensible. Lo que no me gusta es que le teclado no es retroiluminado

This laptop is great! Its small, convenient, and reliable. The only problem I have with it is it was said to have a backlit keyboard and it does not. This was one of the features I chose this laptop for. I can make it work for now but is a let down it was marketed as something it is not.

If you like using Microsoft Edge, this computer will be great for you. I prefer Google Chrome and when I downloaded it, the computer slowed down to a crawl. I have the comparable model to this one that is 6 years old and it's still snappy and responsive with Google Chrome, so this computer is not going to work for me.

I couldn’t believe the condition of my laptop, considering it was refurbished. I was able to add Microsoft office without any latency and the screen is beautiful. I also love that it’s light weight and very durable. I’m glad I made the decision to purchase this.

It’s not a touch screen computer so I’m not sure why it has that as a ranking option. I do not play games so I don’t know if it’s good for that. But, I use it for school and for the price I really couldn’t ask for more

One of the main reasons I got this laptop was because I saw it said it had a backlit keyboard. Was a very important feature for me when I have work at night. Only to get it, and the keyboard is normal. On top of that, I already have to position the charger a certain way for it to charge ... it’s also a lot smaller than I anticipated, but I can get past that.

The laptop is very small, just wider than the keyboard, which makes typing with fat fingers pretty difficult, and also to find the [back] key! When having volume up, I get an annoying alarm sound until I lower volume. I using the box it came in as a table while sitting in chair, so it should not be overheating. Should have plenty of ventilation.

I don’t play any video games or use programs that require a high amount of processing. I surf the Internet, check my emails, do some work and banking etc. online. The size of this laptop means that I am more likely to take it with me versus a larger machine. I still travel with a tablet and do use that as well but there are just some things that a laptop is much better at doing.

I needed a cheap pc for my new job and this fits the bill. I’m a Mac person so I really didn’t want to pay a lot for this. For a pc, it’s fine. However, the finger pad has a number board that constantly turns on when you are typing. If I could figure out a way to turn it off completely, I would. But it doesn’t look like you can. Overall, it’s cheap, it runs, it serves my purpose.
Works great no issues not using in s mode  it’s great for what it is no complaints  we will see how it lasts  one of the best products I have bought from Amazon

The sound on this was not loud enough so decided to return it.I don't want to have to use earbuds to listen/watch videos.....When i went to set it back to default settings it wouldn't do it.....Dideled with it for 1/2 hr and finally said  f it!.

This was a great buy, set up was easy.  It states has backlit keyboard, I don’t see that feature.  Plan to ad some SD memory.  Lite weight and slim.  Great purchase.  I use it for email and surfing the net

I bought this laptop to my 11 year old daughter for her school works. It seems to be the perfect size for her. She loves the touchpad’s calculator option because she needs it for her math. I bought a 256 gb sd card to extend the memory since it has a card reader it’s very convenient to use. We received 1 year ADP which is relaxing to know. After 2 months of usage we’re really happy with this purchase.

Everything functions as expected. I needed this for work, school and business and as far as I can tell this will get the job done. This is a smaller computer so keep that in mind. The keys are also kind of clunky, and it can be just a bit laggy. “S” mode was simple to turn off so I was able to download other programs and apps. I’m satisfied. There’s nothing more to expect from a brand new $200 computer.

I've been using this laptop(n4020 11.6") for a week and it's pretty good for its' price. Well product's quality is better than I expected, I used more than 15 laptops and I must admit that it feels good tbh. BTW, it doesn't have keyboard light. On the pictures it says that the pc has keyboard lights but it just doesn't. After the installation the pc has 26 gb free space.

Bought for mainly my daughter and her school work. I use it for bills and to print out weekly reward charts. Perfect use for this. It is speedy and a good size for younger kids elementary school age to use for virtual learning. I have not had her or myself play any games on it as of yet although will update the review when we do.

Originally for the $6 I paid for it I thought it was going to be great it worked for about 2 months and I keep it perfect condition and then one day I'm in the middle of my Netflix and it just powered off never came back on and then after that every time it came back on screen would go black and I couldn't use it it was shut off but the power light would still be on but the laptop would not be active
I wouldn’t recommend this laptop unless you want a laptop that lasts less than a week. I have had laptops before and they lasted me for years, not this one. So buyer beware

El precio del equipo estaba en USD200 y no aplicaba impuestos ni aranceles, pero al incrementar el precio a USD230 implica que si uno es comprador en Colombia se le incrementa a USD300. Dan descuentos por compras al por mayor?
First it works fantastic. And it is fast due to SSD. Also while the specs don't say anything about it, there is a slot for upgrade. I put WD 500 GB in it and worked like a charm. Very impressed.

The description plainly says the keyboard is backlit, which played a major role in my purchase decision. If that's important to you, pay attention to the reviews saying there's no backlight on the keyboard. The listing is wrong!
USPS delivered this today. Big box with a fairly big box (and padding) in it with a small and light laptop in that. I had it unpacked and charging in no time.

I am getting used to this small size, I have always had a 14 or 15 laptop.  When I use the touchpad for 2 finger scrolling, the screen sometimes slips.  Also, it is not loud enough for me even with the settings all the way up.  I must admit, I am 70 and my hearing is not what it used to be even with hearing aids!

I'm the type of person who looks at the overall rating and only reads the negative reviews. I don't know what anyone can say negatively about this laptop. It's off the hook amazing for the price. Very light. Portable. Fun to use. Amazing.

1. Out of the box, the screen was glitchy--display blinks every 20 seconds or so, and occasionally, when it comes back into view, the whole display is offset by about 150px from the left edge of the screen.
MICROSOFT JUNK. Good luck getting out of S mode. Touchpad died after a few days. USB port for the mouse works when it wants to...not often. NWO crap. Do Not Purchase.
This laptop just completely stopped working. Ive had it less than 2 weeks. I used it twice and the third time i tried to use it it wouldnt come on anymore.

Bought one because my old laptops are aging and slowing down. For the little bit I use it for, mostly weather/space browsing and making some video's this has been a nice small laptop. No regrets from this purchase!
Cute, easily portable, but it doesn't like it if you try and use Google Chrome, which is my preferred search engine. But besides that, its functional, which is was I was looking for.

This VivoBook L210MA is an AWESOME Laptop. I didn’t want to lug around my expensive Apple M1 Macbook to and from work, so I needed something that was a bit smaller, 11.6”, lightweight and well-priced, this was it.

I really enjoy this laptop. it's just what I was looking for and the price was perfect. My question is, I have a few much-needed programs that I use and need, This IOS is in Windows S mode. if I delete the S mode and go to regular windows, would I be causing any problems to this laptop or would it be completely safe? Would I be able to install windows 11? this is a nice investment to carry afew business apps away from my desktop and the like weight is great.
This was a replacement for my decade-old Acer notebook that was still running Windows 7, and so far I've been quite pleased--I would actually rate it closer to 4.5 stars overall.

I had a chrome book and needed another laptop so I went with this one. My biggest must was I wanted one that could keep multiple tabs open without it being slow or freezing up. That’s why I loved a chrome book but this one has surprised me. I can keep multiple tabs open and it does just fine. Overall great laptop!

I have always loved this brand and for the bargain I got it for I couldn’t be more pleased with my purchase. It’s perfect for what I need it for, easily transportable, long lasting battery, quick processor, and it’s cute.

This is a basic laptop for basic tasks. At that, it's very competent, even excellent. So long as you are not expecting miracles, it gets the job done. Seems well-constructed. Very light. Small, but usable keyboard. Watch out for ads that say it has a backlit keyboard - it doesn't. That's apparently an option that is not included in the model Amazon is selling, even though the ads mention it.

As I'm sure most have experienced with low powered devices, Windows does not behave well. But these units fly on Linux. I have one unit with Win-11 dual boot on it for whenever I need to experiment with that OS. All others are Linux based. I installed this 500GB M.2 SSD (B086BGWNY8) into its open slot, to expand it's storage capacity. If it only had the ability to expand ram. Otherwise awesome!
I was tired of lugging my gaming laptop to work, so I got this laptop. Its awesome! I mainly use it for PowerPoint presentations, but I watch streaming services as well. Good bang for the buck!

I don’t not work from home or school from home. But needed a laptop, it does the job, no complaints as far as browsing the net or using Microsoft software. If u need a simple laptop that’s not too techy this would be the one

I bought this computer to do digital modes for ham radio. So far it is working great! It was very quick and easy to turn off S mode to be able to download the ham radio programs. Great computer at a great price!
Returned. It couldn’t even load its own settings within 3 minutes. I only needed it to write in Google Docs and it couldn’t handle more than 1 tab open at a time.

For what it is, it works perfectly. I use it primarily for internet searches, email, and the occasional streaming service. It's not a powerhouse and by no means does it have alot of internal storage. But if you want a reliable laptop for basic functions, I definitely recommend it.

We bought this computer for our son to play games like Roblox or Fortenite on, but it has been lagging and taking forever to load. We thought this would be an improvement from his father's 8 year old second hand laptop that he has been using. But, it seems to be even worse. We are really disappointed.

I am giving this tablet two stars as it is inexpensive (under $200) and lightweight, other than that I would give it one star.  I should have read the description more carefully as it is not a touchscreen model.  Get your fingers to work on the touchpad if hard enough but the way this was designed if you aren't very careful you are constantly turning on the numbering feature.  It is a serious stupid design.  You have all the number above the alpha keys. Grab a calculator if you need it.  I waited too long on return it.
This does not hold a charge AT ALL!! I will plug it in and get it fully charged, then if I don't use it the next day, it will go down to no charge at all.

This laptop is AMAZING I was very happy with it. It can run games like Roblox with ease and even Minecraft at low settings. I also tryed playing counter strike source and it ran very very smooth. Also this laptop is great for unity game development or game dev in general and runs very fast

Absolutely love it. Ordered so I wouldn’t be tied to my desk or lug a laptop. Fits nicely in my small backpack and high quality resolution. Perfect for common everyday uses and even streams by zoom meetings without interruptions

Absolutely recommend this computer.  We purchased for my 9 year old son.  It was easy to install and the battery has a good lifespan.  Love the calculator on the mouse pad feature.  Great computer for at home learning.  You can’t beat the cost.  I’m not a gamer or tech person so for the standard computer user it works great!

Computer is just over one yr. I had protection on it first yr. NO alert the yr was up and so when I Turned on computer BOOM I Got hacked and Money out of pocket to fix... Now After getting yr Mcafee and running fine Today I get a NOT CONNECTED TO INTERNET Notice.  Mind you I Know There is connection as Others are online in house .. So More money out of pocket to fix another problem
My phone is much louder than this. If someone is talking, you can’t hear what you’re watching or listening to. Other than the low volume issue, it’s a great little laptop

Everything seems to be going really well:-) The setup was amazing. There’s a lady voice called Cortana directing you through the entire setup process. It sounds something like Alexa. A kid could do it. Booted up pretty fast and I’m able to work on my word and pdf docs. It’s small and compact. More convenient to carry. Will update if I come across any issues. Love it so far:-)

I use this laptop to check emails and surf the web.The screen quality is very good.I does not have a touch screen.Althoug the quality is very good If you are going to play second life  you won't have enough space.

This thing should be selling for no more than $50, not no $220 and that's being generous!! Couldn't navigate Cortana though voice or keyboard, the left top side of the number pad started coming up, not worth it. I had it less than 24 before I sent it back!!

Considering the price especially, this is a freaking steal. However, if you’re spending $200 and expecting the quality of a $1000 laptop— you’re setting your own self up for disappointment. This is a wonderful choice if you’re on a budget or just need one for the basics. It’s stores things for a few of my games, college programs and work programs. It’s fast, and well worth over the asking price imo. This is actually my new fav brand too!

Battery is great, but hard drive is small and not sufficient for using photoshop cc which need minimum 10G and preferably 20G free, Adobe won't let you move application or even scratch file to external or flash drive. Could've used a backlit keyboard too. live and learn. I did use it to develop website and was useful to see how colors would look on less high resolution computers

It was VERY slow when I bought but I read some reviews that said the system needs to be updated and that what I did. Works like a charm now. Love it. It is small so I can carry it in my purse or just hold it. Very lightweight. It is really worth for the price.

Bought this for one of my staff who does only email, Microsoft Office, et al. Has Windows 10 Pro installed, along with Office 365. This little computer hums. Sure the screen is only 12" - but we have it hooked to a 24" monitor. My 79 year-old staffer is a happy camper.

I've only had this laptop for about a month but its a lot better than the HP stream laptop that I got before that died after 8 months. Will definitely recommend this laptop. I wouldn't use this laptop for gaming.
This is nice computer that we mainly will use for travel.  Others we have are too large to carry and go but this one works great and goes without worry on trips.  Would be fine for home usage also.
Battery life is a plus.  The antiglare screen makes it subpar for movies.  The ASUS L203MA-DS04 VivoBook is great for movies, which I also have, but battery life became poor.  I would purchase again.

This is my first review I will on a product. I like the fact it is small which is easy to move around with however it sucks when using with zoom and the keyboard for the numbers always turns on by self. It’s very sensitive.
I had to return because I bought as refurbished and they didn’t wipe the computer so I couldn’t login. It still had the original user’s password. The Amazon rep dropped me to a Asus rep
I updated my internet and this thing runs like a beast. I use it for simple projects, video chat, Word, email and YouTube. For $200 this laptop is a steal and I do not miss a more expensive one.

I ordered a different computer by mistake first.  I had to return.  Then I got this one from Dell and live is now worth living.  It works smoothly.  The color and resolution are good.  Just what I needed.
Over all I'm happy. It serves its purpose well enough. Be sure to fully update, turn off s mode if you want to download non-microsoft applications, reboot a few times. Should run fine

Who puts the power button on the keyboard next to the delete button, one of the most commonly used buttons for people who type all the time as their job? I've turned this thing off in the middle of my JOB like 4 times today. Jesu Cristo

I knew it was going to be small but this laptop is tiny.. I guess I expected as much seeing how little it cost. Other than the size. It gets the job done, Google loads fast, I mostly use it for word and typing.

I needed a small laptop for general purposes when away from my pc. This more than met the bill. When I turned it on it went thru' a few gyrations required by ASUS. Once I set up the WIFI it immediately synced with my pc and transferred most, but not all, I had on the pc. I did forget it comes with the "S" version of Win 10, so I had to get out of that with minimal hassle. In short, as I said in m headline, it's exactly what I hoped for.
I confess I was hesitant about buying this laptop as a replacement for my old travel laptop of many years.  Yes, I read most of the reviews, watched the few available videos and, took the plunge.

i'm not a big user on laptops and would very much stick to my iphone but this laptop is easy to use! it's small but easy to transport around and the number pad is useful when it needs to be. you can definitely turn off the original software but beware that you can't get it back!

This is a great computer for a hobbyist or anyone that just needs to get online, use an office suite, or watch videos. I wanted something small and light weight and ASUS nails it with the L210. You can’t beat the price and even with upgrades I did, it still cost less than anything with a similar feature set.

9/10 a great laptop for under $200. Im a college student and needed a cheap smaller laptop for when I travel since my everyday laptop is 18 inches. I couldn't buy a cromebook because its not compatible with everything I use for school. Arrived boxed well, set up was quick and the display is good. I do suggest you buy a headset or microphone because when I use zoom my professor/tutor can't hear me well, but again, this laptop is under $200 so I didn't expect perfection.

It's not touch screen and the charge port doesn't work right ...alos won't stay charged would have taken more money to fix it and I'm not going through all the bull crap to ship it back when  I'm not a shipper all I want is one good product from Amazon ...sad thing is that they recommend it to me ....might as well go to a retail store and check it all yourself
This has been a decent little laptop for me. Starting off in S Mode was a novel experience. At least you can do more with an S Mode Windows 10 than with a Chromebook.

I bought this lappy for my son so he can learn mobile developement, so the way it came was not useful, switched it from S mode to home edition but it took more than 80% of the SSD and installing Java ver 11 Android Studio, then Flutter allong with Dart language in the administration account it was left with very little for the non admin account.

For $200, I didn't expect much. But for a laptop to work slower than a cell phone? That's just unacceptable. When I try to use this laptop, the processor (straight out of the box) keeps running at 100%. I couldn't even open up the task manager. Also, the wireless range of this device is very limiting. I found that this laptop loses connection from my hotel bed whereas my cell phone sustained it flawlessly.

Great little machine for the price. Has space for an NVME SSD drive, which is great, but no expandable ram slots. Make sure if you're booting to Linux Mint or Ubuntu that you disable secure boot or the WiFi will NOT work.

Very convenient, light and portable with good screen quality. Durable battery life when in use but tends to drain when in shut down. I would recommend for school and probably online work as storage is small.

Straight up lies to you this is false advertising it says 64 gig memory but it only has 15.7 available for me out of the box. This is horrible I can't delete anything and it says for some reason it's taking up 56.9 gigs for no reason at all. Is this a joke? I want my money back.

The touchpad is the most difficult thing to use on this device, and I had to get a mouse just to help. I use it mainly for light coding and accessing the internet. My kids have used it for Roblox. It gets the job done, but this will be a temporary device for sure. I already had issues turning it on at one point, but was able to resolve it. Just have realistic expectations from this device.

I have to move between two locations with multiple floors and this laptop is so light and small that you can carry it around very easily. I use a 128Gb micro SD card for additional memory for programs other than the OS. Very quick. I had to switch from S mode to used other apps.

The picture description says BACK-LIT KEYBOARD, but it isn't! Whomever designed the website for ASUS should be fired! I went through a big hassle trying to find an ASUS laptop that actually had the back-lit keyboard that was advertised on several of their models, but didn't have it! I wound up buying an ASUS 14" laptop that actually had the ADVERTISED back-lit keyboard from Office Depot/Office Max. I had them verify it before I bought it.

This is one of the best low-end laptops I have purchased. I needed it for work and school. It runs perfectly, is light-weight, and easily manages the tasks I run on it. The battery life is especially impressive. I often toss it in my backpack and use it throughout the day. I usually do not need to charge it for a couple days under these conditions. I also play older games on it with no problems. I am very pleased with this purchase and would recommend it to anyone looking for a cheap but useful grab and go laptop.
The laptop was decent at first but now the screen freezes and it blacks out. It’s always not responsive when multiple tabs are open and you can’t do much without getting other unnecessary apps.

One of the main reasons I bought this was because I wanted a small laptop with a backlit keyboard.  It literally states 'backlit keyboard' on one of the image screens.  But.. just a lie.  Now I have to decide if it is worth keeping or not; prob going to send it back after I beat the shiite out of it until the last day of the return window.
This website says 64 GB but actually, I got a 57.3 GB laptop with only 25 GB free space left. Can't install my favorite apps cause they eat so much disk space.

I was very excited about getting this little laptop BUT after using it for a couple of days it has been nothing but headache after headache. i’ve had to reset it multiple times and can rarely get it to actually work. I’m definitely not a computer genius or anything but I know enough to troubleshoot and fix errors pretty easily but this laptop takes frustration to a completely different level. I cannot recommend it on any level.

Ordered this laptop for my husband and he was not impressed at all.  Some of the answers claimed that there was a backlighted keyboard but not so.  The computer itself seems ok, small and lightweight but unable to download apps.

Did not like this. S drive blocks you from downloading printer drivers that actually work (like direct from the Canon website). The keypad doesn't seem to work all the time. I was not pleased with this laptop.

I could not be more disappointed with this laptop. Between Windows 11's criminally intrusive updates and the MyAsus service spamming me with unwanted product ads I can barely open any application. The UI is almost totally unresponsive. Hate it. Hate Asus now too. I'll be sure to avoid their products in the future

If you feel that you need the trifling advantage of the "easy access" NumberPad, go ahead and buy this one. If you don't, avoid this one--it's a constant annoyance. Think you can permanently disable the NumberPad? Good luck with that.
Well it really wasn't what I was looking for. It's kinda slow, and I really couldn't get too many good apps on it. And it seems much smaller than what it's size is supposed to be.
Does it have to be returned in its orginal box?? cuz i got excited the first day i got it and threw the box away!! now it doesnt work anymore after six days!!!

I bought this laptop to replace a HP Stream 11.6" that wasn't keeping up with my levels of tolerance for casual web browsing, streaming, and word processing as my daily carry laptop.  This is my third ASUS laptop and, overall, I am pretty happy with it.

I wanted an inexpensive laptop that I could dedicate to crafting projects. Unfortunately,  it is just too slow to use Cricut Design Space or even the simplest photo/graphics editing software. I read the specs, I should have known. I don't know what applications this laptop would be good for, but it is useless for my purposes. I've completely wasted my money.  Don't make the same mistake.

It’s cheap for a reason. If you have any type of expectations it won’t meet them. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money on a computer you won’t wanna throw out the window after 10 min of using it
Why the laptop does good for my needs, it doesn't have a back lit keyboard like it says in the description! Other then that, it works good for doing minor things.

It’s cute, and quiet, but the screen is made in a way that you HAVE to look at it at a certain angle or it feels weird on your eyes and only the center circle is bright while the edges appear dark.  I’ve never hated a laptop screen so much. It’s almost like it has a privacy screen on it.

The laptop is incredibly slow. It takes atleast twenty minute to boot up and load chrome or edge. Setup took atleast two hours by it self. I do not recommend. I can’t return it either because it’s past the return window. It doesn’t sell for much either. Awful product.

I want to like this laptop but I’m struggling. I’ve had my original Asus for 7 years and just needed something new and smaller. So I bought this. But I have some issues. When connected to HDMI for more than an hour, it just shuts itself down. It’s slow to start up and slow to run multiple windows of Google chrome. I want to use this for school work but it doesn’t seem to handle multiple word documents and chrome windows very well. I’m debating returning it.

while this review is otherwise early, i thought it worth noting that the process of upgrading from windows "S" security mode and installing visual studio, and an array of hardware and software development apps has gone smoothly. i was concerned about the processor meeting the minimum requirements since i had little understanding of these new variable ratings - the geekbench rating is about 16 times higher than my old toshiba ;)

Purchased this laptop in March 2021 and it only lasted six months with light use. One day I could no longer connect to the internet. Ran the troubleshooter and it said it could not find a network adapter. Tried everything suggested, but still can't connect to the internet. Total waste of money!

I got this laptop as a simple easy laptop to start animation, but it is incredibly slow and takes like 3 minutes just to start, it has very little storage and it crashed when working on a project and I lost 3 days of work.  I'm going to order a new laptop this week.

Good deal for a computer- but man what a hassle all the PC users have just to turn on a computer. I couldnt use the thing without providing a ridiculous amount of fake personal info and restarting the machine 3X before it was finally set up 45min after I turned it on. Only reason I bought this was to run a specific app in Windows. Glad I don’t have to use these for work.

So far not a good experience. I just got it out the box and sat up and its flashing a white screen then black screen. Not loading anything, now flashing between screens and making clicking noise. I will be sending this back. Not a good buy for me

First of all this item did not arrive in time (so it is still under the return timeframe) and I wish to return it, and also as I have tried repeatedly to access my Microsoft 365 features which are a function included with this purchase and can not do so after trying over 25 times.
Not great if you need to do just about anything. Painfully slow, you cannot add more memory. Just a trash laptop, I don’t know what I was thinking when I bought this.

Numeric pad is so great.  Portability is awesome.  Always me to do basic task.  Screen size is very reasonable vs a cellphone.  Really wish there were colour options and accessories like a shell case.

I love this cheap little laptop. I installed a 256 gb microSD card to use as an additional storage drive. It fits almost flush... you will need to configure it, easy to do, see google . I also got rid of windows 10S, which limits what (non-microsoft) programs you can download....nice try Microsoft.

Brought this for a gift, it arrived just on time (used in like new condition). Opened it up get it setup and it was locked to another Microsoft user. Nothing could be done, now I have no gift and have to wait either 7 days for a replacement or 3-4 for a refund. Waste of time and money. 1/5 stars for Quality control, someone should have caught this issue before it was resold.

L210. Great little machine for what it is. Had it for about a week. Switched to Win Home and turned off/deleted a couple dozen stupid Win10 resource eaters. Turned off "Fast Boot" (always bad to have yesterdays mistakes reloaded, especially stupid idea for any RAM based drive). Only adds a few extra seconds to the boot. Updated to 20H2 with no issues.

I purchased this laptop and it sucks it had issue from day 1, after turning it on it works good for 20 minutes but after this the writing on the screen is distorted to the point that I cannot see anything. The issue is a manufacturing issue and Amazon refused to replace the item and they were no help at all in finding a solution I do not recommend you purchase this item it i a waste of money.
I bought this computer to install a tune on my car it’s excellent for this because it’s very portable the battery lasts a long time and it downloads and uploads quickly

I bought this machine because I was looking for a small, inexpensive machine with good battery life to use for writing and media consumption when travelling, without having to worry much about it being damaged, broken or stolen.

If you know a lot about this product, I am sure you understand when I say "I have no clue what I'm doing". Its ok to play around and learn as you go. The user's guide is worthless, throw it away. I am sure this thing does way more than I have figured out so far, but I would probably buy it again. Tech Support is so, so. Their English is hard to understand. For the price, it's "ok"

Asus computers are not the fanciest, but they are durable and they work.  They get the job done and are great for travel.  For a small travel computer, one that can store some pictures, handle the internet and email, and get the basic job done, Asus is the way to go.

After many years of using actual netbooks, I was in the market for something the same shape and size after they discontinued the term. I wanted something that was somewhat future proof and wouldn't crap out after a few windows updates like all of my previous models.
I got this because  we thought  our other  laptops  was dead. But wasn't  so use this and I love it.  It fast  . I don't  do gaming  so this is good for me.

My first ASUS product, and I must say the build quality is excellent! Feels substantial in your hands, not flimsy or cheap, but still lightweight and solid. Perfect. Fairly snappy and I have no complaints. By the way, thanks to LM's review on June 8, 2021 titled "Excellent machine for price when combined with M.2 SSD". I upgraded mine with a WD Blue SN570 500GB SSD, and man, what a difference!

Es bastante veloz para las especificaciones tecnicas que tiene de serie. La tarjeta de red responde excelente a 5ghz. Apenas es para navegar o office recordando que la pantalla es de 11 pulgadas. Aparte de la ranura de SD se puede colocar un disco nvme y aumentar considerablemente los tiempos de respuesta del almacenamiento (mmc hace bien las cosas de fabrica pero si les sobra un disco nvme vale la pena instalarlo en este PC.

Great small 'on the go' laptop.  I lost my first one, and then I ordered a second one' of this same laptop.  Good battery life and lightweight.  And it also built in blue light blocker' for eye production which i noticed worked well too.

Not sure, because I personally haven't used it yet. A family member whom I trust due to his technology expertise- feels that I won't be happy with it. I mainly ordered a cheap one for use when visiting. He was very disappointed with both the screen n sound quality. We've had an Asus before n feel it was far better overall than this one. I'm also disappointed that Amazon charged me Sales Tax, because in Oregon "we do not pay" sales tax on anything??
I use this for work and to stream videos and it works great for both. Long lasting battery and easy to use. I like it's compact and light. This is an excellent laptop at a great price.

Buen producto, por el precio… si quieres sacarle provecho debes comprar un m2 yq que se nota la diferencia en velocidad y almacenamiento. La calidad de la pantalla va justo igual que la cámara… pero por el precio no se puede exigir más

Slowest computer I've ever used. I was told it could run games, that's a joke. Memory is terrible. Looks good and can do very basic stuff. Constantly needs updates that doesn't seem to do any good. Wouldn't buy it again.

So far like everything. Use it for basics. Surf, email, a few apps, stocks. Screen and cam are decent. Actually like it being in S Mode, keeps me from downloading a bunch of junk, I use an old computer for that. . .

So far a neat little laptop. But there is a lie in the pictures. There is no back lit keyboard. Doing some research on ASUS's website, there would be a Function on F7. The F7 is just a F7 key. I totally missed the back lit keyboard question with a no answer. If at least one person has caught the false advertisement, delete the picture that indicates there is a back kit keyboard.

DO NOT BUY.  I just ordered this about 4 months ago and it completely STOPPED working.  It isn't charging or turning on.  I can't tell if it's the charger or laptop that stopped working because when I plug it in to charge the light for charging doesn't light up.  I contacted Amazon and they told me to contact the manufacturer.  I called them only to be on hold for hours.  It's very frustrating.  I was going to buy a second laptop before this happened but now that won't be happening.  DO NOT BUY.
Absolute the slowest piece of trash computer I have every used. And I have been using/ repairing computers from decades ago, DOS, WIN 3.11, IBM OS 2 WARP, DX 350 Full Tower, A, B drives.

The ASUS Laptop L210 Ultra Thin Laptop, 11.6” HD Display, Intel Celeron N4020 Processor is lightweight and fast, including a fast connection to the existing WiFi connection. However, this model was advertised on Amazon with a keyboard that is supposed to be backlighted. The model I received does not include that feature which is quite disappointing. Items should not include feature documentation for features not included with the item listed.

If you want to do more advanced stuff, it's probably not the best. Default storage size is really low, but the  upside is that it includes an M.2 NVME drive bay so it can easily be expanded for more storage.
Did not work at all. Was frozen. Have to send to company.  Cost was $40.00 to me. Company says turn around is slow because of COVID. Would certainly not recommend.

I brought this laptop for my 11 years old so he can access Google classroom to complete his homework, the laptop works ok for a week then start freezing touch don't work like they suppose to,I understand the laptop is cheap and everything but at least it could have work for a bit more time 🙄

I'm giving this little engine that could five stars. Why? Well, it's two hundred dollars. So I'm reviewing it as a two hundred dollar product. If I was comparing it to a Macbook Air M1, it would probably be three stars. If I was comparing it to a Microsoft Surface, three and a half. But it's a small, budget laptop, and in that category, it's excellent.

I bought this because I got tired of battling with various websites I need that are not properly designed for iOS mobile devices. It is a very basic machine that does basic stuff for a really good price. I added Microsoft Office and Kaspersky anti-virus (which doesn’t use a lot of memory), and I have everything I need.

I bought this laptop to use for leisure travel this next year.  Wanted something bigger and more useful than the tablet I currently have.  While I have just started the setup process, ie loading my apps, files, etc., it is doing exactly what I wanted it to do.  I've switched to Windows Home, installed all my apps and it's currently updating Windows.  It is showing lots of promise!
Although Asus is a good little laptop at a good price, they have ruined the touchpad by adding a 10 key number pad on it. It turns on with just a brush if finger and there is no way to disconnect it.

I dislike that after I did transfer date from a usb after I can not remove complete and also continue to appear fotos on my desktop. Not Good also I did take a selfie or My laptop then I can not change. Not good. Etc Etc.

Needed a windows computer to run trading software. Inexpensive but for doing the basics it's of great value. It's not a high end computer but for internet surfing, watching YouTube videos, and running a very taxing CPU program for trading; it does just fine. I'd recommend over a chromebook also.

It's a minimal computer as the price should state. But it's what I needed. Small, lightweight and in great condition. I had an older model where the internet card died and it is easier to buy an updated model that try use work around.
Lo único que no me gustó es qué el paquete de oficina estaba caducado y me decía que tenía 1 año gratis, después todo está excelente y el tamaño es muy práctico

I bought the 11.6" 64GB HDD model. Don't need much space/speed as I'm just surfing the web and posting on forums etc. No biggie. Nice keyboard. Screen is big enough. Super light. Quiet. Long battery life. All good!

It very tiny which was a surprise. I had to get used to scrolling instead of a mouse because my wireless mouse would not connect to it. The picture quality is great and it connects to internet quickly.  I don't use a computer much but I'm happy with it. It fits my needs.

I purchased this laptop to use as a spare machine in my consulting practice, and also for use with my ham radio hobby. When I saw the specs on this laptop, followed by the price, I couldn't help but order one. My key requirements were size, weight, and a decent screen. This little machine fits all of those requirements in spades.
Never had a chance to try it out because the screen was broken initially. I’m  very upset because I purchased it to travel tomorrow to Hawaii so I’d have a pc.  now I have no laptop. Bummed!!!
Toons a couple weeks to get, the seller took his time mailing it out. Computer is very very small. Works ok that I’ve seen but honestly I think I’m going to send it back.
I bought t high is laptop to write letters and longer articles on. I am very pleased that it has the capacity to stream sports events. It is a great bargain for the price

I really liked this little machine and for the price, in my opinion is a steal.  It is  like 20% faster than my mini PC which sports an Intel Celeron N3450 Quad-core.  Per my tests with the 64GB eMMC included, even Windows 10 (v2004) is snappy.  I also ran Linux on it with no issues, except that the wireless driver needs to be installed manually(tested on Mx Linux for instance).  The sequential reading for the Sandisk eMMC is 316 MB/s and 154 MB/s writing.

I'm happy with the laptop and my son needed it for his college and it's not his first laptop so i did ask him if he was able to use it for whatever he has to do and i was content to hear him say it was.😌😊 His personal laptop stopped working and until his finance is better for him to be able to get a much better and bigger one i got him it.

I ordered this for my daughters birthday. She was super excited when she opened it however that didn't last long. We couldn't even download a search engine. Didn't seem like it was refurbished at all. Now my refund has been issued less a $75.00 restocking fee. I actually was charged a restocking fee for a product that didn't even work. I could understand if it was for some other reason but this is just ridiculous.  Will never order from this seller again.

I only needed the computer for zoom.  Whenever I touched the mic I had to hit it several times to turn on mic to speak.  It was a pain so I returned the computer.  I prefer touch screen & a larger screen.

Its a cheap nonchromebook laptop so you get what you'd expect. An issue though is the touchpad randomly registers a click and hold with the touchpad so a lot of times when you switch tabs it'll separate the current tab and make another open browser. I'm stuck with that issue since i'm using a usb mouse that for this laptop only seems to stutter across the screen and lag

This is a well built solid low end laptop.  You should not expect much power from this system.  However for web browsing, watching streaming services (like Youtube, Hulu, Amazon), and basic office tasks like word processing, Quickbooks, etc this laptop works without issue.

One of the biggest appeals of this laptop for me was the product description promising a YEAR trial of Microsoft Office 365. I buy it, and at startup of the laptop it only offers a month trial. I try calling Asus support to ask about this and cannot reach anyone. Ripoff.

For what this is supposed to be and for roughly $200, it's fantastic. This isn't a high performance gaming laptop (or really any kind of gaming laptop) and it would be difficult to do precise graphic design work. However, for internet access and word processing and all of your everyday computer uses, it's one of the best you can get.

This is the worst laptop I have bought in my life. It comes with low storage from the start which slows the processing down by a huge margin. DO NOT purchase this product since it has no practical applications!

Nice little computer, great for simple tasks. I recently became self-employed in business development. I look at a lot of webpages but don’t run any software really, and still already low on memory and from what I understand, none can be added. Waste of money I think…

The compact size makes it easy to keep up my writing practice. Just grab it and start, no big deal! I only use it for word processing and research so screen quality is fine. The size makes it for me, though.

You might think that only 4 gb for a Windows 10 laptop that cant expand the ram is a bad idea... Well, I've found this small laptop is actually fine, even quick for internet browsing, email, word processing and watching videos.  Sure, the keyboard is smaller, but even with large hands, I had no trouble typing...

Works perfect with Linux Mint Xfce 20.1. Only problem is the WIFI card, it recognizes the driver but can't install cause it's not connected to the internet.... Can't install the driver thus can't connect to the internet thus can't install driver, vicious cycle. With no Ethernet port then you're stuck :( had no option but to open it up and replace the WIFI card with an Intel one from and almost EOL Chromebook. After all that headache it works flawless!

For the price of this an amazing buy you can do alot of things with this alot of cool features i really wish there was a button to disable the keyboard to be able to clean the keys easier but it is an amazing laptop still i highly suggest anyone looking for a cheap laptop whether it is gaming,using the internet browser or just overall file using!!

I ended up returning this, I got it to replace my 4 year old laptop that died on me. When it came in the mail and I set it up, it ran so slowly! My old computer didn't even run that slowly before it died.

Bought this to watch youtube on that wasn't my big gaming computer, it works wonderfully for that. I have not tried to play games on it. but I must warn that the CPU is not very strong and when you first start it up it will be slow while it's trying to update windows. after that, it will be fine. I also recommend uninstalling what little bloatware comes with it.

It arrived right on time. I'd bought one before for my school and it works well. I bought a second one, and it arrived with someone's pin already set it in. I can't tell you how disappointed I am in ASUS, especially when I was planning to buy more of these. Great price, but representing something as new and selling me a used computer is pretty low!

It is a really good laptop if you want the basic stuff, works erfect for my, screen is terrible it just does the job, do not spect high quality screen in here, Good battery life, fast boot, nice design. There is a miatake on the desceiption, KEYBOARD DOES NOT LIGHT UP

Battery life is pretty awesome, I'm horrible about shutting down my pc but with just closing the screen it has a stand by life of days. Light enough to carry in my purse, small enough to be able to every day. This was bought for light use but had been pressed into business use occasionally. The screen is crisp and vibrant. Easy to use and set up. I'm very happy with my purchase.
This ASUS I was never able to use because I did not have the prior user's password.  A  refurbished Computer  is to be restored to original use.  This Was NOT!!!

I ordered this laptop for work purposes, and because I needed a new laptop. It definitely gets the job done. It's a cute little laptop and has been working perfectly so far. It isn't touch screen which is a bummer because, in the reviews, it said it was. Other than that, I like the laptop overall.

How garbage. I wouldn't even buy this for $50.00 if I was able to try it first!! I should have just been patient and bought a better laptop... As far as the actual delivery of the product it was perfect. But this laptop is a pure cash grab with gimmicks.

This worked great for a few days. Then, it just died. Do not buy. I'm telling you: I used it maybe 3 or 4 times, doing nothing more than email, etc. Didn't go to any new sites, or download anything questionable. But it gave me an error message and then just died. No light on the power button. Nothing.

This definitely did not meet my expectation. I ordered it after reading excellent reviews. Unfortunately this pc sucks. It doesn't let me do anything. It takes forever to load and is really slow. Now I can't even return it!! Total waste of money!

I wanted this laptop to do only one thing - act as the control for a label printer, but it couldn't even do that. It took forever to boot, and everyday tasks kept crashing it. Totally useless! I returned it as soon as I could get it to shutdown.

Help from ASUS is impossible, had problems activating Microsoft and they had no idea what they are doing and there phone system was so bad that calls kept dropping took twelve hours being on hold and dropped calls and constantly reidentifying myself

I had this product for a little over two months with no issues, I just went to open it in class and it’s was completely unresponsive with a white screen and no apparent way to fix it. It seemed like a decent lap top but apparently not.

Absolute piece of garbage. Fired it up the first time to use it, did all the of required updates, and its already bogged down and running terribly. The 6 year old laptop I had bought this one to replace due to terrible performance is out-performing this laptop. Complete waste of money.

According to the seller Holiday-express, it is no longer made with an sd card slot as of 2022. Still shows one in the pictures on the listing and asus website July 2022. If you wanted the SD for storage you won’t get it
The seller lies when advertises that it has backlit keyboard. It says it 3 times, at least, in the product site. IT IS A LIE, and i felt ripped off.
I love the smaller size of this and that it has choice of 10-key number pad. The speakers are lousy so just get a bluetooth speaker or ear buds! Great for kids in school!

I found this product very functional and good value for the money once I purchased and inserted a 128 micro SD card. It does not have a touch screen and probably would not be good for gaming as it is not designed for that.
Battery is fully charged before shut down. When turned on next day, it is at 60% charge.  Does not hold a charge at all. Reviews show that this is a common issue.

Its a great casual laptop that is silent and can run what is needed for my college classes.  Does not possess a backlit keyboard which was a little misleading and disappointing, but not really a deal breaker.  For the price I paid ($190 for the n4020 11.6 model) I am very satisfied.
I wish it had more processor capabilities. I got it for checking email and of course now I want to do more browsing and sometimes it is capable and other times not.
Advertises backlit keyboard. Does not have one. I had the first replaced, but same issue. If you want a touch screen, or backlit keyboard forget about this model. False advertising in that respect.

If you loved the portability and battery life with your chromebook but missed some features of Windows, this is perfect.  I took mine out of S mode (prompted to do so when downloading 3rd party software).  It runs spreadsheets, word processors, and anti-virus software with no issues.  Video streaming, web surfing, email, Roblox with kids, no problem.  Goes all day without a charge.  Smaller than an 8x11 sheet of paper. Fires up as fast as a chromebook. Keyboard works great.  In love with this machine!

I purchased this laptop  because we were going to be traveling abroad and I wanted something light. I just began using it somewhat routinely about two weeks ago. Then…the screen went blank. I have checked everything but nothing seems to work. There is a small white light on the side - which makes me think there is power but cannot get it to show anything else. Trying to get in touch with the manufacturer but no response.  POOR QUALITY

The Celeron processor must be from 10 years ago! This is the slowest computer I have seen in many moons!  don't waste the money and get something worth buying..this boat anchor is obsolete already!  Celeron 1  is what it is! says up to 2.8 Mhz? bull!

I really love this laptop! It's decently powerful and very fast. I wanted something light like a Chromebook, but ran a decent os. This one's great! Does all I need and runs left 4 dead pretty good, so it's great for college and work! As for touch screen, it doesn't have one, which is a weird feature to bring up. Battery life is good too, and the screen is very good for the size.

Took out of box started set up and 5 minutes in it froze up so sent it back and Amazon sent a replacement and received in 3 days took it out of box started setup and 5 minutes in froze up again.  Will be returning this one also.  I'd stay away from this one!

Very disappointed.  Product didn't work.  Contacted support and they tried to help but couldn't.  I returned the broken one and I am still waiting for the replacement.  It's been delayed twice.  I am not happy with this 😕😒

I am happy with this laptop because I can work my engineering excel sheets, manage my email, read my ebooks, listen music and watch streaming videos. It is very portable and lightweight. Office 365 licence was free for 1 year. I replace my pc for this laptop.  I dont use it for play games. I upgraded free Win 10 S for Win 10 home and it runs faster. This is a very good laptop with good quality - price relationship.
This laptop has an 11.6 inch screen, which is kind of small, but I absolutely love it. It's light and easy to carry. Absolutely the best laptop I've owned in years.

Product description very much lied about the keyboard being backlit. Pretty pissed about that considering it the reason I chose this laptop over others I was looking at. Otherwise, it works fine for the basic little wprd processor I use it for. Also, not a cool design like any online description of the model. This one is straight flat black. Incredibly plain-looking. And one of my keys is at a wonky angle, but it works. Considering the ither asus products I own, this one falls short, honestly.
It works great for what I need it for- it's hella basic. Not digging the calculator on the touch pad, thought it would be cool but I keep accidentally turning it on and that's kind of annoying.

The sound is horrible lots of static the picture not good all I wanted to do is do zoom an the quilts is horrible people can never hear me. Did not start using my laptop until a month after I received it but it was to late to send called the company they had me to reset it and it’s still no better I am so disappointed with this product

My wife bought this for email and Facebook essentially. I had to uninstall the Windows 10S features because it kept freezing on the screen that said only approved windows 10 S apps would work.This warning came up randomly even though the only apps on the laptop WERE from the Microsoft App store.Finally I said ok no more Windows 10S and dropped it in favor of plain Windows 10. Since that time there has been no problem and no discernible detriment to the function. It is very small so be advised if this is a concern.

I bought this on a whim.  It's basically a Chromebook with an unlocked boot loader.  Identical specs to the Chromebook my kid uses for school.  I am pleasantly surprised by the performance and versatility.  I have it dual booting Windows 10 and Ubuntu Linux.  I opted to take Windows out of S mode.  I also opted to leave Win 10 on the 64GB eMMC drive and install Ubuntu on a Crucial P5 500GB NVME SSD.

I ordered this small laptop for work purposes and general office operations.  So far, it's been well worth the money.  I took it out of Windows S mode.  It struggled (lagged) a bit with Chrome, so I resorted to using the Microsoft Internet browser but it's been fine.  And since I only use it for work (general office stuff), it's done everything that I could have asked....thus far!

The cursor didn't work. When I watched YT videos I moved the cursor over the gear icon to improve the picture quality, not clicking on the icon, just moving the cursor over it. This made the video suddenly jump halfway to the end, then back to the one third mark, then forward to the two thirds mark. It wasn't working properly. The screen brightness control didn't work, either. It was stuck on full brightness, which was irritating.

I bought this for a small portable Pentest system. I installed Kali on the system getting rid of Windows 11. All hardware in the system wifi, network and touch pad work out of the box with Kali. Solid feel for a plastic case. Added a 500G NVMe PCIe M.2 SSD without issue.

I have to honestly question where all the terrific reviews come from. The laptop looks and feels like a toy laptop you would buy for a 7 yro. Cheap materials - the shell made out of flimsy plastic. Very low quality display. The keyboard action was also unimpressive - surprising considering there are so many v. inexpensive high quality keyboards on the market. I would never buy ASUS again.

This laptop has crashed 3 times since I have received it and now it can't find my network. The network I was on. I'm trying to conduct a small business with this. I'm going to go out of business messing with this ish... It says it has a touch screen. I guess I don't have the magic touch because it's not working.
The only thing that really shocked me was it is not as big as other laptops. It is small. People please aware of what actual size laptop you think you are purchasing.

Not terrible for a cheap laptop but I’ve had mine for a year and a couple months and the touch pad already stopped working. This isn’t a laptop I use a ton so I expected it to last a little longer before I started having problems.

Overall nice little laptop with good graphics, nice keypad, and touchpad, but the description says it comes with a backlit keyboard and it does not.  Very difficult to use this laptop without a light due to all black keyboard and limited space for palms.  Battery life is pretty long (11+ hours) and the screen is nice and crisp.  Easy to take out of S Mode if you prefer Chrome or other downloads that are not part of the Microsoft store.  Fast processing for cheaper model.

This little laptop has saved me throughout my semester at college and it is just so handy. It is very snappy and can easily be booted up to Chrome from being powered down in about 20 seconds. The only problem I have with it is the very low 64gb of SD storage. When you first receive it, the system already takes up about 10gb of this so you are only left with around 54gb for everything you’re doing. This isn’t much of a problem if you only use it for web browsing and homework assignments but still.

Daughter uses it to play Club Penguin. Works well for that. Small, light. She has no problem carrying it around or laying in bed with it. She keeps turning on the numeric pad, which messes with the mouse.
I purchased this cheap computer for a computer class this semester and I have mixed feelings. It's small, super cheap and the battery life is very good which I love but I have 2 major complaints.

The laptop is just a described with two exception,  they should remove the part about backlit keyboard cause it don't have and that's false advertising as I was hoping it did. The battery life was around 5hrs with light use. There is also the issue of limited app installation when out of S mode because of the single channel processor. I found that there were slight delays at times in processing with just a web browser open.

Nice buy, especially for the price. I was looking for a relatively cheap laptop to replace my old one that I had had for 6, almost 7 years. It works well and I’ve had no issues so far. I thought the 180 folding feature the screen has was silly at first, but honestly it’s come in handy more times than I thought it would lol I’d recommend for anyone looking for a cheap or size/space friendly laptop. MUCH smaller than my old one though, the keyboard difference took some getting used to. But overall a good purchase!

It's been more than a month since I got mine and about 3 weeks in the touch pad stopped working. Trying getting it fixed by a technician who wants an arm and a leg to fix it. I'm not a fan of using a mouse so disappointment is an understatement at this stage.

The touch pad on this laptop was terrible! Many times it would type a line of letters or characters without my touching the pad. Sometimes ifmy hand got close to the pad it would change screens and I would have an awful time getting back to the screen.  Most of the time I would have to go back to the beginning and start over.  It was also verrry sloooow.  I am very disappointed with the product.

This is a nice little laptop. I didn't realize it was this small when I originally ordered it but I didn't look at the specs either. It was a good deal so I ordered it. The laptop is an 11.6" but to be a small laptop, it's a good one. It has a great battery life too.

buena relacion calidad precio, en general se comporta bien, buena velocidad de respuesta, la utilizo para funciones basicas y trabajo. no le pide nada a un aparato caro. En verdad si la compras no te arrepentiras.

It took about ten minutes to download Google Chrome, and when it did, simply opening a new tab on the app took at least two minutes for it to fully load. I bought this laptop to use for writing and schoolwork, but the speed was just unbearable.

It is a cute little computer, but parts of it did not work after a month or so.  This is the 2nd Asus product I have bought, and it will be my last.  When it would not work for the things my child needed, I thought I may trade it in to get another.  Best Buy did not see it as having any value although we only had it for 4 months.  Crazy! The other ASUS messed up as well in a few months.  Other than for fun, I wouldn't purchase this.

very nice for simple things. every few days it ask for restart.. it does what i need it to. windows is nice.. email set up nice.. Again for simple things emails keep track of writing, maybe if you need a online shopping .. maybe certain things a person might not want to do their phone..

I bought this for use with my Samsung smart TV, not expecting much more than consistent and trouble free Internet access with reasonable speed. The first thing I did was to switch from Windows 10-S to to regular Windows 10 (Home) and uninstall apps that were not relevant to my usage. I also downloaded a few apps. I was surprised to find that it is quite a nice little netbook for routine computer tasks and excellent for travel: very compact, light, pretty decent screen, lovely clean design, excellent keyboard.

Honestly, it works amazing! The only problem I have is the storage and the touchpad really. The people who say that it’s too slow are probably just fake reviews to be honest. It loads pretty slow for the first 2 hours but then after the updates are done, its a pretty fast load-up time. So far, I’ve played Minecraft (with resolution down), and it worked great!

Touch pad and mouse and keyboard all reacts slow to input... sort of like it keeps having to process the input before it can react to it.  I know it is a cheaper computer but it should not be slow to a mouse click.

Was working fine although we didn't really use it that much...then the screen went black & nothing. Plugged it into multiple outlets to see if that was the issue but nada. We bought in May 2021 & it's only October 2021. DON'T BUY!

Computer does not turn on with one push of the on button. Sometimes it takes 20 pushes. This problem occurred after 30 days once the return policy expired . My loss. I am buying another computer.  Stay away from this computer. Don't BUY!!!

There should have been return labels. I didn't even have a phone number or an email address to contact the seller. It worked for a week and then wouldn't even come on after that. I had to buy ANOTHER computer from Walmart. I WANT MY MONEY BACK NOW!!!

This laptop can be a perfect option for everyone who is looking for a powerful laptop but at the same time light weighted to be easy to carry. The laptop has a simple and chic packaging, the sizing is perfect, not so big and not small. It’s very powerful especially compared to some gaming laptops with thousands of dollars price. I absolutely love how thin it is so I can easily carry it everywhere.

I ordered this for selling items online.  I have a couple sites that I sell homemade items on.  This laptop is slow, and doesn't seem to have the capability to handle some things as well as a higher end laptop would.  I ordered this, thinking it was like a normal laptop, but its not. Its much more restricted.  If you are looking for a laptop for a senior citizen or a young teen, this is a good one to get, but if you want to do certain things on it, you might look for something with more capability.

I don't understand as to how in 2022 laptops like this are still being sold. Even for simple web browsing, it's very laggy and freezes often, how are we still using this processor? It's awful and it heats up tremendously while doing simple tasks. I don't see how anyone other than seniors who need a computer for personal needs can use this, while even for them it might be hard because of the lack of power the processor has.

Really good purchase. I was a little unsure at first with it being on Amazon, but this little thing is great. It's good for people who mainly do school and writing like me. Also good for gaming. 10/10!

For light weight yes does it do most school applications yes. Grade 1st, 2nd,3rd,4th 5th yes,,, light business application yes now the mouse pad is disappointing it’s  functioning ok you have to teach your self it’s not functioning as the more expensive lap tops  it’s ok for the beginner

These type of computers don’t make much sense to me, they are literally only meant to have a usable life of about 1 year for the 64gig and about 2 years for the 128gig. The reason this is, is because the storage is soldered to the motherboard. To give you an example, this is like buying a car with a full tank of gas at a low price but the gas tank being sealed to where you couldn’t add no more gas. I’ll explain in more detail why they have a short use life and why this laptop has potential.
it went black. dont turn on. ik its good brand, and easier to sit anywhere. all issues I have had with laptops. save your headaches and buy desktop. I'm going seek refund

I purchased this laptop, then returned it for the same thinking the first was damaged. The second had the same audio issue during teleconference meetings. I called Ausus for tech support and they alluded that every platform I use was the problem versus the laptop. I have a smaller Asus laptop that I'm currently using and have no issues using it on all the platforms, it's just small and inconvenient to work using it all day.

Biggest waste of money ever! Straight out of the box it's SLOW! I uploaded some photos and they won't even load. I can't even open up the Internet without it taking 5 minutes to load with no additional programs downloaded. Don't make my mistake. This thing belongs in the garbage. My first gateway computer in 1995 was faster than this!

I got this laptop to watch Youtube videos. That is all I got it for.  This laptop had an issue playing the videos. The Celeron processor could not handle it.  The video would stop.
