Sometimes the video would stop and the audio would continue.  Overall, just a frustrating experience.  I am returning the laptop. I am getting a laptop with a better, faster processor.

This is a nice basic computer. It's not good for gaming or graphic design, but it would be great for a student who needs basic word processing, Internet, streaming, and maybe some low graphic games. It's got very basic components, but it's nicely built and lightweight.  It has a nice, sharp screen for watching movies or doing homework.  I would recommend it for someone who doesn't have advance computing needs.
I’m not sure if this is for gaming but I use it for school and it works well. Light weight and love the updated features. Had an asus before and this is a great brand.

I bought this to be my "printer and light work" laptop since I can't use my work laptop with non-company printers (I work remotely).  I learned very quickly that 4GB of RAM will NOT get anything done that you need.  I saw it had a USB-C connection, one of the main factors of the purchase, but learned it does not have DP over USB-C capabilities.  I can't hook it up to my work station, nor can do anything with the 4GB of RAM.  So I returned it.
I got this during Prime Days, so it wasn’t very expensive. I wasn’t expecting much, but it has exceeded my expectations. It works great and it does exactly what I need it to do.
I have had this same laptop (although in Windows 10) and I've loved its ease of use.  However, after spilling hot tea on it, it was fried..  So, I a ordered a new one (but with Windows 11).

Only one complaint so far but other than that it's 5 stars across the board. The complaint is I just got it, installed 1 app (steam) and the laptop already sounds like a airplane taking off. It settled down a bit but I can hear air flowing so it's not quiet. I haven't tested it even with game to see if it can run games well enough to play so I think it will serve my purpose to full decent games on low.

It is a decent machine. The only thing that keeps it from being a very good machine is the highly annoying fact that it restarts itself, without any warning, once or twice a day. I can get no help from Acer, or Microsoft about this issue. Acer suggested that it was a Windows issue, but were no help in resolving it. Microsoft simply won't answer my requests for help.

Do not buy this laptop if you want to add two external monitors. This computer does not connect to any docking stations I have (which I use for various other computers. The USB-C port is of no use. This computer has been nothing but a hassle for me. I bought it because of the price, but have had to buy a number of adapters to get it to work with my monitors. I may have to return this laptop.
It has a plug for my external monitor, a plug for ext. speakers, a USB c for my DVD drive, USB for my ext. keyboard & mouse and two other USB plugs and Windows 11.

I've had it for about 2 months & it does the job as far as what a computer should do. The sound is very low, static filled & just overall sound bad. I haven't had the camera freeze I was experiencing in the beginning as often but it still shouldn't happen. The speed & connectivity is good so far. I would've invested a little more into something that sounds much better but at the time I needed the comp I didn't have the extra $.

I used an Acer laptop all during college and for years after.  So when I needed a new computer I instantly wanted to go back to the Acer brand.  From day 1 this laptop was awful quality.  It keeps restarting randomly and I lost important work and got disconnected from several Zoom meetings.
This is the fastest loading computer I've experienced.  It's quiet and the backlit keyboard really helps because my den is rather dark and that's where I use the computer daily.
Everything is good, but the screen is glary and the buyer needs is required to use or create Microsoft office account to login for first-time use. Not a touch screen, just a clear reminder.

First laptop I've ever had with the speakers on the bottom. Yupp, you read that right, the bottom. Makes the sound very dull and muted. Would love a touch screen or atleast the screen to be edge to edge and without the thick black edges. Boo. Key board is great and the computer is lightning fast. Not great for games tho, but school and movies it will do fine with.

This laptop has fantastic reviews. I researched thoroughly before choosing one and was so happy to receive this. The first few days were fine. I use it for my school work and to play The Sims 4. I have an endless amount of CC and Mods and the laptop speed did not slow.

This rating is not based on Acer's quality which I really think is very good.  This computer is almost identical to my other one, differs only in that hard drive is smaller and it has Windows 11 instead of Windows 10.  And therein lies the problem.  This computer's performance is noticeably slower than my almost identical WIndows 10 machine. From what I have read "Windows 11 is optimized for Intel's new processors".  It really shows.  I am considering installing 10 on this one.

I have always had an acer laptop. Upgraded through the years. I bought this laptop in July. I started a small business and started working from home. I’ve had more problems with this thing than I can count! The internet quit connecting. My son installed the new driver in it. Worked one time. We’ve had to install a new driver multiple times to get this laptop to work. I’m now having to purchase a different laptop and hope it doesn’t happen with a new one. Very disappointed and will not purchase an Acer again!

Pésima computadora.  Tengo 2 hijas y para sus clases compré 2 en total.  Nunca he tenido problemas con compras de computadoras hasta ahora.  Soy ingeniero electrónico, así que sé muy bien de lo que estoy hablando y definitivamente las dos computadoras tienen problemas.  Son 2 fallas que detecto:

Bought this computer when my Lenovo Yoga 2 (which was 8 years old) suddenly died on me.  I don't do much heavy lifting with my computer, mostly just Microsoft Office and web browsing so I figured this computer would meet my needs.  Unfortunately, there are a couple of things I can't look past.

Very nice  price quality, it is not sooooo Good, but it works very well for the price i recomendado for my friends .muy buena relación precio calidad,no es la octava maravilla pero por el precio esta bien,la recomiendo ampliamente a mis amigos

I’m not a gamer but this laptop does allow me to work efficiently. I’m a realtor and work mostly from home. I don’t download games or pictures to my laptop.  I deal with several different websites for work. We do a lot of documents and photos with Dropbox. The laptop is small and perfect for travel. I work long hours so it stays charged about 7 hrs. Good enough for my work and $500 worth the price. Would recommend this laptop and purchase again.

You will not go wrong w this device. Add an 8gig ddr4 sodimm 2400mhz yourself to it and youre good to go. Back lid opens easily. And do remove Windows S. It doesnt fly and isnt for gaming but will do everything else quite well.
The screen quality is really good. I don't use my machine for gaming so I won't know. But I like the back light on the keyboard. I haven't used it on battery yet

Not very computer savvy, so I was somewhat hesitant to buy it, but I already owned an Acer desktop and loved it  so I went with Acer again for a laptop. Very easy to set up and use. 15” screen is good too. Overall, very happy!

I've been on hold for an hour and a half from their customer ignore number. these people don't help you, they actually ghost you. there is no support for anything as far as i can tell, since they ignoring me without even knowing my question. i think you better talk in chinese to get help, because there is no american help. i am sending an Acer computer back for the second time in a month because they can't support their feeble product. i cant do this again, i do not want an ascer.

I picked this particular laptop for my new one because it is supposed to have a backlit keyboard. I had an Acer before and it was a good computer. I work at lot at night in poor light so a backlit keyboard would be a  really good feature. But, unfortunately, the back light does not work at all. I looked up instructions and they don't work.

Although I’m more than proficient in computer use I’m not extremely tech savvy when it comes to computer specs, so this review won’t be about those. This review is about my experience with this laptop as an everyday laptop user.

I'm an engineer who has been using company-provided laptops, bought to my spec, for many years.  This time I was spending my own money, to buy one for my daughter for school, so I wanted a solid school-appropriate laptop that wasn't some crippleware nightmare.  This really fits the bill.

We got this for general use (surfing, movies, games, music, etc.) and overall it's a nice laptop and works well for our purposes. Setup took some time with updates and setting up options but it was simple and walked you through it step by step.

I can't believe the quality and performance to price ratio here. These are my go to for cheap laptops for clients who have employees that need to access online applications, email, web and other SaaS instances. They are fast, and have held their speed great. Even with a $99 upgrade to Windows Pro its hard to find a better deal for the quality and hardware.

I don't know who designed to install the speakers underneath the laptop, but that was beyond stupid. The sound quality is horrible, especially if you don't have it sitting on an elevated surface. Other than that I'm happy with it, but if you plan to listen to a lot of music without a headset, look elsewhere.

I have been searching for a good quality laptop, and this is my first foray back into a windows laptop. First off, this thing is big, it had a beautiful 1080 HD screen, back-lit keyboard and just feels like a super solid build.

A laptop that is suited for basic tasks like online browsing, remote meetings, work activities, social networking , watching videos and occasional gaming because of the Ryzen processor with the Radeon graphics card along with the high speed Wi-Fi 6 which provide quick response and fast and reliable internet connectivity. The 8 GB of memory and 256 GB SSD can be expanded and included with the laptop is a kit to add an additional 2 1/2 inch SSD or hard drive.

after a month of using this laptop and was initially satisfied, i received the blue screen of death. ive tried running the recovery and diagnostics to figure out what was the issue. being inclined on computers i tested everything and even tried reinstalling windows. still, i continued to get the BSOD. eventually i found out that either the gpu or psu was going out. i guess you get what you paid for.

My daughter has been very into playing The Sims and that is what we bought this for. It works perfectly. It’s nice and big and we had no problems downloading the game and expansion packs, which I was a little nervous about.
Buena relacion precio calidad, si lo que buscas es un portatil para trabajar con programas multimedia relativamente exigentes y quizas jugar algun que otro juego esta es tu mejor opcion

I give it 5 stars because I can't imagine getting better bang for the buck. This is a $400 laptop that punches like a $1500 laptop, which is what it replaced. I am a dad, not a gamer, so I use it for dad stuff. Office 365, MS Teams, WebEx, Zoom, YouTube, Spotify, relatively low impact stuff.  I don't need a CPU/GPU/RAM that make your toes curl. I need simple, functional and reliable, and that's what I got for *#@$&? $400. Heck yes.

First off, this laptop works great in general. It features a very nice crisp IPS 1080p screen, has a slightly glossy screen, full size keyboard, is lightweight, thin, and fast --- and comes with a backlit keyboard.

I have no idea why they designed this thing with an offset trackpad, but it contributes to multiple clicks because the "left click" area of the pad is now juuuuuust out of reach, to the point I have to be cognizant of where my hand is every god damn time and it just breaks any kind of flow. Regret not returning this during the return window because if randomly freezes and requires too many reboots for a new laptop. I guess you get what you pay for with this one.

The keyboard is easy to see - in daylight. I specifically ordered one with a backlit keyboard thinking they all stay on, like my wife's. This one goes off after 30  seconds, leaving the keyboard dark. For me that is a problem. I'm 73, have very bad vision in one eye and floaters in the other. It breaks up my concentration when I'm writing. The light goes on with a slight touch, but it's distracting.
This is a great laptop for it's price. Needed a laptop for an employee to use on-site and picked this one out. Very fast, light weight, and perfect size for our needs. No complaints here!

I received the laptop 3 weeks ago and have not had any problems.  Being more of a power user, I bought a 16gb stick of Acer DDR4 3200 RAM from Amazon and couldn’t be happier.  The 6 core processor is a screamer!  And I love the metal lid.  It looks awesome.

...but I absolutely DESPISE Windows 11 and this laptop came with it already installed. I waste so much time tracking down documents I've downloaded and nothing about 11 is at all intuitive or logical. I don't appreciate my time when working being wasted on dumb stuff and Windows 11 can pretty much be summed up that way: DUMB STUFF.
I got this computer as a gift. I love the capabilities for the price as i do mostly everyday jobs on the computer. I do not have much in the way of gaming here.

Acer consistently seems to make great everyday laptops which last for a fair amount of time. Ordering this 2019 released laptop in 2022 can be seen as an interesting move, but I was pleasantly surprised and how functional it is for the price. At $499 (at the time of this post), you’re looking at a midrange specs simple pc that handles Windows 11 very quickly.

I just bought this laptop and right out of the box, I got the blue screen of death. It keeps going blue screen error to restart, repeat over and over. Customer support would not help me. They will not allow me to return it nor refund me, told me to contact manufacturer. Manufacturer states they cannot assist with product purchased on Amazon. Now I am out $400 and a laptop. I am BEYOND furious. DO NOT BUY!!!!

I bought this Acer to replace one I have had for over 2 years.  This acer worked for 3 weeks.  While doing a prompted update, my Acer got a blue screen.  I cannot do a factory reset or anything else to correct the error.  Good luck if you purchase this model.

I had to replace my former laptop and went with the Acer Aspire 5. For what I need, it has been an outstanding purchase so far. I have had no problems with the computer. It is very fast. I'm not a game player, but the "old" games I play are easy work for the Acer. in short, I'm happy with it; and, knock on wood, hope it will give me several years of good service. I also like that it is made in Tiawan. I will update if anything goes wrong, but it's a great computer so far.

Had the computer for three weeks, with only a total of 3 applications installed when I received the blue screen of death. Did what I could to fix it, did an entire reset and thought it was good before it died again.

The HDMI port is broken, cannot hold a connection to my monitor, screen keeps blacking out. I'm past the return window so this is worthless now, tried different cords and no solution has been found. Will never trust Acer laptops again.

I want to start off by saying I am by no means extremely knowledgeable about computers. I know how to turn them on, use them, run programs, etc. But that’s about it. I know basics about storage size and speed. But, even that knowledge is minimal. So, this review is purely from a novice everyday computer user, NOT a computer expert or anywhere close. That’s why I am going to provide the specs straight from the computer at the end of my review, so hopefully if someone does know exactly the specs they want, that info will help.

Amazing laptop for being midrange. Honestly the only thing is the build quality needs improvement.  Internal specs are great and doesn't heat up or slow down after constant use. Love windows 11 since it allows you to use Android apps and not just the Microsoft store. Battery life is great.  Don't really have any complaints except build quality but for the price they had to cut a corner somewhere and I would take performance over build quality anyday.
This computer is completely useless!  Waste of money!  To make matters worse, you only have 30 days to return.  It arrived on 7/16 today is 8/17 and I am unable to return!!!

It can connect to my acer desktop so what I had in my desktop I also have the same thing in my laptop. That’s pretty cool. The screen size and weight are good. It is clean silver color. It has lots of different plug holes.

I received this April 21st of this year, On May 30th I went to pick it up and it was so hot you couldn't hold it and it would not power on.  I contacted Amazon and the company.  Once again on June 20th this happened again and it took two days before I could get it to power on.  Once again I filed a complaint with Amazon and the company requesting a new one sent to me.  I have yet received any phone call or notification to resolve this issue.

Size, weight, display and speed are all very good. This was the best laptop I found anywhere for the price. It replaced an old Acer laptop we gave to our grandson to use in school. He's happy, we're happy. Didn't rate for Gaming because we don't use our computers for games. Didn't rate For touch screen because this model doesn't have one. Summary is: good laptop at a fair price.

After having this laptop for about two months, it will no longer contact to the internet. I’ve tried multiple different ways of trying to fix it, but nothing works. (Restarting, troubleshooting, trying different Wi-Fi, etc) I start school in a couple weeks and only have a $400 paper weight.

Tenía miedo al comprar una computadora online, finalmente lo hizo y tengo para decir que estoy encantada con mi pc, es súper rápida, vino rápidamente y con todo nuevo, ni un rasguño. La recomiendo 100% es una pc muy linda, en mi caso solo la uso para cosas básicas así que no tengo idea de cómo es para videos juegos u otras funciones. Espero y le sea de ayuda.

If you have a new college student, and you are on a budget, this is a good entry laptop that will do what they need for college.  Its not powerful enough to do high end graphics or gaming, but you can play some Fortnite on low settings just fine, as well as some basic Photoshop editing.

This Acer laptop is well made mid-tier, power conscious portable focusing more on productivity and less on gaming. There is no discrete graphics, only AMD Radeon graphics for light gaming at low resolutions. This laptop is perfect for mobile users that want a fast processor with plenty of RAM and good battery life without the need for power hungry discrete graphics.

This is a great little laptop for checking emails, surfing the web, and doing basic stuff. It's not great for photo editing, rendering videos, or other processor-intensive tasks, though. If you're looking to do some light gaming (very light) you can easily upgrade the ram and storage (they include a kit to add an SSD to the system, which is awesome). I use it to run my laser cutter and it does fine now that I've bumped the RAM up to 16GB. I don't need any storage on this machine, which is good because it really doesn't come with any.

This is the third Acer we’ve owned and everyone has been total quality. Laptops and tablet have been very fast response and no issues. After my experience with Dell pleased as Acer is a quality manufacturing company.

Biggest case of buyers remorse in my life. Always bought HP with Intel hardware but figured with the reviews for this Acer Aspire 5 with AMD Ryzen 5 and Radeon graphics why not explore unfamiliar territory and see what the hype was about in the reviews. This Acer Aspire 5 for $489 Brand New shipped to the door I was astonished the laptop didn't come with an actual user manual. Was even more pissed that you can not setup and use this without first connecting to a WiFi network.

I got this laptop for a good price and with enough room for updates. My old laptop didnt have enough room and eventually wouldnt update anything because it had 4 Gbs of Ram. I stream on this and am happy with the quality and sound.

I bought this laptop to replace my wife's broken Lenovo. I have to say, as a MacBook user, this is a great value laptop for regular users. She uses this for web browsing, shopping, email and light gaming. This system is responsive, nice screen and thus far no real lagging while doing these tasks. I like the implementation of Windows 11 on this device as well. YMMV.
It set up fine but second day it didn't boot into windows, I went through a reset software procedure and all is well. I like the backlit keyboard and metal top cover, also seems fast.
My HP Pavilion died.  I contacted HP Support, and they told me that I needed to buy a new laptop.  I am so glad that I purchased this Acer laptop!  I love it!

Screen quality and resolution is great. I have owned several laptops before and this sleek beauty is by far becoming one of my favorites. Easy set up and decent battery life, very responsive with no lag. This will be great for 3D designing and printing. Well worth the purchase.

The computer arrived on time. I was very happy and satisfied with the purchase. I bought the computer as a replacement for my son's computer for school. It is great during conference zoom video and computer screensharing is great with clarity.

There is a half inch decrease in width, no decrease in length, but a 1" decrease in keyboard width -- which is all in the number pad, now 2x4" (previously 3x4).  The pad is almost impossible to use without a typo.  The enter button is shrunk so small it's easier to use the one on the main keyboard.  Look at the photo carefully.  I don't game, and I use a mouse, so no comment on that.  Some optical improvement, I suppose.
Seems to work well. Haven’t really done much with it, but has been an improvement over what I had. Would not suggest for gaming. No dvd/cd player, but an external can be purchased for less than $30.

No real complaints, other than the occasional times where the touchpad would be difficult when selecting/clicking on things; it was like it got stuck. Guess in the near future, I’ll have to invest in a separate mouse to use, if it persists.

I'm a longtime Acer user and I bought this Acer laptop because I liked that it had a second hard drive bay and I wanted to install the hard drive from my old Acer laptop in the bay so I could run my Linux OS rather than the windoze virus.
I was in need of a new laptop and after doing a lot of research I decided this would be the best one for me. It's great for basic use or for work. I'm very happy with this laptop.

I just needed this to begin working from home, and for the price it’s great! Very fast and runs my heavier software for work like a breeze. A great option if you just need to do simple tasks- I can’t speak on its gaming ability as I have other systems for that.

I love my new laptop, but it’s got almost 0 space for anything. I tried backing up my phone to it (which btw iTunes SUCKS on Microsoft) and it couldn’t hold. However, I was able to download a series of games, and it does well with split screen and office work. I’m not sure if I have a touch screen. If I do, it doesn’t work.

I'm used to Macs, so there was a bit of a learning curve, but I'm very happy with this machine.  The screen resolution is great and I love the Microsoft Edge browser.  I usually download Firefox to all of my laptops, but I decided to give Edge a try and I'm completely satisfied with it.  The overall look of the Acer is very sleek and modern and looks a lot like my daughter's Macbook Pro Air.

Glad I finally got this laptop been on my radar for a while now. I was instantly interested after learning which processor and version of GPU it had. Additional ram slot and came with the parts to add in the additional hard drive ( I did an ssd for faster speeds.)
I have had about a month now. I was skeptical due to the low price, but computer has been great. I work from home so I use it a lot.
The screen started blacking out within 48 hours. I've already returned it for a refund. I had high hopes for this laptop, but I should have known better. You get what you pay for.

So far I am very impressed with this laptop. I don't put it through a lot of stressful stuff like high quality gaming but the screen is sharp and clear and the laptop is speedy and responsive. As a relatively low cost option for work or school it seems like a great choice.

Backlit keyboard goes out after a few minutes.  Need to find the correct key in the dark to turn on backlit every few minutes....very smart Acer.  Keyboard died after a week. Had to go through all the suggested ways to fix.  Had to mail in for service.

Gets hot immediately. Fan does not change speeds with fn f like ad. Dragging files stops working and locks up the whole computer. I had to reboot many times just to move my files around the first day: nothing else was running. It used all the memory for a minute after I moved a large file and froze if I tried to do anything else….while literally everything was off and the file was fully moved.

Trackpad terrible. I do not get it. Otherwise works well for what it is. Low-end machine but screen is good, ports are good, it's nice and sleek enough for the price. But damn Windows machines have had terrible trackpads for years and STILL they suck. Just do what Apple does with their MacBooks it can't be that hard!

This computer is PERFECT for me!  Thank you for offering it to all of us; The updating process was a breeze, which was not so with other computers in the past.  I even added a 5TB external hard drive to it without any difficulty at all.  YAHOO!!!  😘❤️🌹

I got this pc after doing my research, and it showed me that this pc is the best bang for the buck at $400.  It's remarkably fast and just great for general internet use.  I did not buy it to play games, and I don't use the touch screen.  I highly recommend it for anyone just using a pc for general internet use.  By the way, I love the backlit keyboard.

whoever designed this laptop is an idiot when it came to picking where to put the speakers. they are under the laptop!!!! so they are always muted unless you prop it up with something. so, if you plan on watching anything with sound, you're going to want another source for the sound.

Package arrived in good shape, plugged computer to charge, 2 hours later computer was very very HOT and not responsive, Being returned for replacement.  I now have an Acer desk top computer and like it very much so will try this one again, Hoping for the best.

Booted up fine went through updates and loaded a pdf scanner and loaded documents in short time. My old computer quit in time for tax’s but this is a much better computer and looking forward to years of use.
Not sure about battery life, as I just purchased. Screen resolution seems good. Like that it is thin and lightweight. I am only using for web browsing, so not sure how it would be for gaming.

Fan is the loudest laptop fan I've ever heard. This apperntly is is known and I should have researched more.  I used it 4 times for basic set up and web. Completely shut off for a whole day on me within a week. Amazon support told me to call acer. Problem fixed it self. Now the screen Completely went blank. 36 days after purchase. No games and no extra downloads. I turned it on and payed bills. Don't buy it!

Llevo usando esta laptop aproximadamente 3 meses, cumple todo lo prometido, como trabajos en Word Excel, etc..., le mejore ram y almacenamiento para poder jugar juegos basicos como Fortnite o Minecraft. La recomendaria para trabajos basicos y juego ligero. Hasta ahora no presenta falla.

Product arrived with a defective USB port.  Took a week to get a label to return it and had to provide my own boxes and had to pay to insure it out of my pocket.  Mind you, a brand-new product and I had to provide the box and insurance.  When I had warranty work done on my HP; they shipped me a box with padding in just a couple days and I downloaded a label immediately.  This ACER and support are very disappointing.  I dread to think how long I may have to wait to get it fixed and returned.
With the s mode I was not able to install my printer also Google and Google app store you may want to think this over.serfing is good and is fast.

I love this laptop! It does what I need it to without adding upgrades (though I might do that so it runs more smoothly). Any Acer computer is amazing, I love this brand recommended to me by my brother who's bought from them for 10 years!
Over all I feel it is a great laptop for me.  My only  2 issues with it are cursor lag tracking at times and that it doesnt have a dvd drive.  My previous laptops did.

Crashed after only 6 months. Nothing working to bring it back. Bought this for my son. Laggy for playing Minecraft and Roblox. Ok for Terraria but now it will not boot up at all. Caught in endless repair loop.

I think for 350-400 this laptop is probably one of the best you could find, especially considering it's size. I'm not sure how people are having trouble switching out of S mode, but I did it in literal seconds (for free, no clue how people are getting messages they have to pay) after I was able to access the desktop so that's a complete non-issue. It also looks a bit more expensive than it is which is cool I guess.

Had to get a new one because our other laptop finally died after 7 years. Didn’t want to spend a lot of money and would mostly be using it for just browsing the web, Zoom meetings, watching YouTube videos and mild gaming. So far it runs perfectly and smoothly. Must switch it out of S mode to get Zoom installed…

I purchased this laptop to provide a great value at this price point.  It hasn't disappointed.  Very easy to upgrade the memory by 16GB to a total 20GB.  The 128GB NVMe SSD makes application loading very quick.  With most of my storage in the cloud, this is the perfect laptop for everyday business/personal use.
If you like using Chrome, then avoid Windows 11. It was engineered to force you to adopt Microsoft Edge. This and many other laptops are being built with Windows 11.

This laptop is useless and a waste of money.  It apparently was owned before with setup being impossible.  I’m not the sharpest knife in the drawer anymore, but I can still cut.  After weeks of trying, frustration, I’m giving up!!!!!!

Bought this computer for development work. The main features I cared about were the SSD regardless of its relative low capacity, the 15.6 inch screen at 1080p, backlit keyboard, and ability to upgrade.

I purchased this product in hopes of being able to download and do what is normal on a laptop computer.  This laptop came in S MODE and it was impossible to get out of S MODE.  Asurion, Acer and Microsoft could not help in this matter.  What a disappointment.  DO NOT BUY!
For what I do it’s perfect. Slim ,light and what a screen! I did my share of searching and shopping and you can’t get these features at this price anywhere except ACER

Everything was good about it especially for price but couldn't put a hdd in it to increase  storage because the connector inside was super cheap and broken on arrival so they sent me a replacement and that one had the same issue is your ok with the limited storage it's a fine computer could probably upgrade the ssd on it but was trying to increase storage cheaply with hdd but couldn't because the connectors wouldn't lock in

Ryzen 3 speed is fine for browsing and light duty tasks. so far ok. Quality of screen and build quality is good. Would buy again.  *Upgraders:* only 1 open sodimm slot avail * Comes with HDD tray which is nice.

Just received computer Acer Aspire 5 A515-46-R3UB | 15.6" Full HD IPS Display | AMD Ryzen 3 3350U Quad-Core Mobile Processor | 4GB DDR4 | 128GB NVMe and the mouse pad does not work, unable to set it up, amazon is replacing the computer.

S mode makes it impossible to my email and most apps I have used forever. Disabling it affects security and performance according to Microsoft.  It seems more of a ploy for Microsoft to monopolize on my purchases. Otherwise the laptop is great
We purchased 2 of these. One totally quit working. You can't even open in safe mode. It's useless to us. And now it's too late to send back. So we're paying for nothing....literally.

Great price, great product.  No glitches, no delays.  Screen has clear and clean color.  It moves rapidly from site to site.  I guess my only complaint would be the small keys.  I make a lot of typing errors.  This comp was my choice and I am adapting.  I have experienced no negatives so far at all.  I highly recommend it.

Difficult to open computer, nothing to hold or grip on top portion or lower portion of computer. I have it setting on a folding table and the gripper feet on bottom of computer do not grip the table surface, so computer slides away from you when you try and open it!

The Acer Aspire 15 has been a super great laptop. It's probably one of the best tech purchases I have ever made and I'm an IT guy. I paid about $350 USD for this one and am very happy with the purchase. The last time I was searching for a Laptop I returned 5 laptops before I was satisfied so I'm pretty picky. This was for my wife but I use it at night when I'm not in my office sometimes.

we bought this model instead of the similar model with intel processor after reading the review that although both models have a second ram slot for upgrading ram,  the model with intel process has the 4 gb ram soldered in, while this one with AMD processor has the 4gb ram replacerble. however, when we openned the back, it appears the 4gb RAM is soldered in because we only see one emplty ram slot (and didn't see another RAM that can be replaced.

This is the least expensive computer I've ever owned, and I am very pleased with its performance.  Probably this means that I've been buying more than I really need in a computer.  This bargain computer does email,  word processing, online purchasing, and video streaming very well.  No problems with the trackpad like I had with my most recent computer.  I am glad to have found this!

Has large screen portable, with decent speed, storage and many external ports.  slightly heavy but have note pads if I want to be mobile. I really like having a lot of external ports so I don't have to unplug my mouse  to use other pieces of hardware which really aggravated me with note pads.  Can't hand zoom the screen, but screen is plenty big enough.  Battery life is fairly long, but cord is very long.  Storage is excellent and no problems with speed.  Operates windows 11.  I personally love the machine and glad to be back with a real computer.
I have a few of these for classes. They spend more time under warranty repair than they do in the classroom. Spend a little more for an hp or dell. Lesson learned.

Producto de calidad, es de cuerpo metálico, aunque tiene poca memoria RAM tiene un slot para expandirla, así mismo trae el mecanismo para aumentarle el almacenamiento interno. Para un estudiante está más que suficiente siempre y cuando sea lo básico. Si necesitas instalar programas profesionales no te puede ser suficiente en cuanto a rendimiento. De lo demás, la mejor compra que he hecho.

This laptop comes with a kit to add an additional SSD or HDD, but the connection socket for the cable will not lock on, making installation impossible.  This same issue was present in the first PC I ordered and the replacement I received as well.  Poor quality components make for nonfunctional equipment and unhappy customers.  Advise you stay far away from this one.
Great laptop for the price! Sturdy build, great screen image and size. I did add a 16GB module and an SK Hynix Gold S31 SSD 1TB internal drive. Love the keyboard back lighting and have no complaints.

I won't have thought it possible......for Microsoft to come up with a more user hostile....counter intuitive.....pile of crap that is actually WORSE then windows 10. BUT THEY DID! Windows 11 makes Windows 10 look great by comparison!!
Great laptop! Only downside is there's no indicator from we capslock is on, which can be a pain when it's accidentally toggled when typing in passwords, etc. Other than that, love it!

Only has one ram slot and a soldered on 4gb of ram so can upgrade enough and the hard drive can be added I like the ability to choose your own hard drive size to put in instead of being stuck with a low amount... Less ewaste.  Also speaking of the hard drive I had read a review about the hard drive ribbon cable connector you cannot lift up you have to unscrew the Wi-Fi chip to be able to lift a little tab for the hard drive ribbon cable see picture

Windows in S mode does not support Zoom. You will need to disable S mode for video conferencing. The Ryzen 3 processor cannot support virtual backgrounds so you won’t be able to blur your background for meetings. I would not recommend this laptop for any professional use.

I bought this for my wife, who does e-Bay, Skype calls to family, normal business stuff and no gaming. I was very surprised that it have better performance than I expect for an entry level machine. The screen and keyboard are magnificent.

Great laptop for the price, I don't think you can find a laptop this great at this price point. Appearance looks great, great build quality, keyboard does not at all feel cheap at all and the keyboard backlight is a great touch. Very lightweight. Touch pad is large and responsive. I have not tried the fingerprint scanner yet. Decently fast boot up times given it has an SSD. Battery life is actually pretty great, too. I am happy with the ports, it even has a USB C port. Screen gets very bright.
Horrible Slow out of the box . Simple things like running You tube from Microsoft store won’t work . As many users say Windows 10 S is horribly constricting and most apps do not run well.

Worked great for the first 4 months barely got to this 4th month. The screen started to have issues and now all of a sudden you can't even turn screen on. Won't buy from this seller again. Outside of my return window, naturally.
I do not like this laptop and I want to return it for a refund or another laptop. I had no idea just what S Mode means and I can not work  with it and I can not get S Mode removed!

I rarely do reviews on products I buy. However, this product deserves a recommendation. I bought this machine for my wife, whose old machine had become too slow. While Intel processors are still the top of the line this AMD processor-based PC is a very good machine. For the price, it is a great buy.

I had it less than a month and the touchpad stopped working. Of course the last day for me to return it was April 2nd and the second it went out it was April 5th.  So I had to go and a mouse to troubleshoot. I tried every avenue advised and it still isn't working.

Es increible que el producto haya llegado usado ya que compre una nueva. Nosotros somos de Argentina y aprovechamos el viaje para comprar una notebook y ahora debo devolverla y volver a mi pais sin computadora porque no tengo tiempo!!!!!
I bought this for work and school.  It is great to use. The key board is easy to touch and letters type quick. It is very useful and suit my needs.
This is a great laptop for the price . Fast , ease of you. Just beware that you also have to pay $99 per year for word, excel etc. comes with no software

I really like this laptop it’s not the top of the line but it performs perfectly for me. It’s quiet running it turns on quickly a lightweight machine definitely worth the money I can’t find anything or say anything negative about the purchase of this Acer Laptop.

I have only had this laptop for a few days. Seems to function as designed. Is fast. Screen is bright. Keyboard backlight feature is awesome, especially during the evening hours. Keyboard is standard for a laptop but is easy to use, even when switching from a full size keyboard for a desktop. 2TB USB drive accommodates all necessary files. Easy access to the Internet for cloud drive setup. So far, awesome machine!! Now to go a purchase a carry case!!!

We bought this laptop to replace our old acer. We have tried numerous things to transfer our documents from the old computer.  We now have taken it to a  computer shop and have to pay someone to do it for us. But even he said it was difficult to transfer on this computer.

I bought this 2 wks ago to replace my Dell laptop that crashed. I LOVE this laptop !! It is so easy, fast, sleek, great keyboard for fast typing, great screen quality and more. I am amazed for the price!! Did I mention fast?!

So far no dislikes - it’s large screen is perfect for work and makes working on the go easy breezy. My wife did a great job in picking this computer & thank you to everyone who reviewed before me for inspiring her purchase! Cheesy 🙈 but honest ✌🏼

I really like the load times, screen quality, and basic functions on the keyboard.  It's nice that it comes with windows 11 but it'd be cool if there was an option for 10.  I use this for school, so I have no idea if it's good for gaming or not.  You can have half a million tabs open and the laptop will run just fine, the fans are quiet too.  Overall I'd highly recommend this laptop to anyone

This is the second Acer I owned and while I was happy with my old one, this is much faster.  That’s what I wanted: speed, light weight and bargain priced. I use it for Quicken software- so be aware this laptop comes loaded with Windows 11 which will NOT run Quicken without first disabling the S mode.  That’s what I did and it runs fine but had to add anti-virus software.  Not a big deal.  Just fyi Quicken users!
Just what I've been looking for. I've had a Chromebook which is great but I needed to get something that could run windows based programs but couldn't afford a lot of money. This is perfect!!!

Our old laptop died one afternoon... dead hard drive. I ordered the Acer at 7:00 pm and it was delivered at 5:30 the next morning. About two hours to set it up, transfer files, etc. and it was good to go! The SS Drive makes it quick and responsive, and so far Windows 11 has been well behaved, Nice little machine for the money.

Acer advertises that you can put a hard drive in the laptop.  You can put a hard drive in the laptop.  However, the connector on the mother board will not hold the ribbon cable down to make a good connection, therefore, the hard drive will not get recognized by the system.

This laptop has a really good battery life, it starts up quickly, and it overall is a fast computer. I only needed it for some school work, so for me it works great. It also had a really great price tag which was also a plus.

I am not very happy with this computer.  NOT user friendly-has a mind of it's own.  Sometimes hard to get around.  Not very happy with Microsoft 11.  I liked the last one I had-Acer, but it was 10 and easy to use.  It just died after 1 year.  Thought it was the cord, so bought one.  NOO.  Took it to my computer genius, and could not find a motherboard after months of looking.  Now I have 2 cords and this new one uses a different one!  UGH

i love how light the laptop is and that you can easily upgrade the ram and storage. So don't think you're stuck with 128gb. Windows 11 was included on the laptop so get ready for the next learning curve. I use mine for work and its pretty quick and responsive. I'm very surprised at the price point for what you get. fingerprint scanner is very fast. So as far as budget laptops I have to say I really like this one.

I just "wore out" another stupid charging cord. the thing doesn't stay in. the thin connector, combined with the overly large, L shaped end constantly falls out with the slightest movement. i hate this computer. it was an affordable replacement to my first acer that up and died on me approximately 1 year after purchase. I will never again purchase Acer

Windows S Mode is worthless; you can't install any of your own software, such as software you already own.  You can only install software from the Microsoft Store -- just stupid "apps", not real programs

Item was listed in the 2-1 tablet section but was a full size laptop! Due to disability was too heavy for me plus was too complex for my skill level! Appeared to be a really nice laptop for the right user!
I don't do gaming or have the touch screen, but for what I need it for, it works great.  Very fast and up to date.  The price was right too.  Yes I would recommend

Laptop arrived. Got it set up and works as advertised. It is not a gaming or touch screen just a standard laptop. I wish it came with a Microsoft word program but I will just buy that too. Hopefully it lasts more than two years.
Easy to upgrade computer if you put a few moments in, save hundreds of bucks. I am so glad I did this instead of spending money to do things we all can do. Watch you tube

It took me a while to find a decent computer for my home needs.  I like the lightweight of this computer, the small number keypad to the side and the efficiency of the computer.  I'm not a regular home pc user but when I need to do something, it takes seconds on this computer.  I would highly recommend.  I'm not a gamer nor do I watch movies and stuff, but for surfing the internet, created docs, sheets and printing, I love this pc.

I bought this notebook on the 6th of July. I have been using every day. I never owned a notebook, so wasn't sure what to expect. Do not hesitate to buy this product. I am very impressed w the price tag and performance. The screen quality is excellent. Very sturdy and reliable. Very happy w this purchase.
This laptop is just what I needed. It is fast, light and quiet. I only use for browsing, streaming and a few games but the quality and performance is amazing for the low price.
I live in a mountainous area & my WiFi can be spotty but only had 1 instance where didn't have wifi. Also printer issues but I think that's just me. Happy with purchase
I had a problem with this one changing the program on my other computer, even though I was setting it up as a stand alone.  It was messing up everything. Otherwise it was a nice laptop.
If you have to open this thing multiple times a day, that will likely be one of your only issues. They designed this in a way that makes it pretty hard to open. Otherwise, great laptop.

I mean computer works, it does what it's supposed to do. I installed a Acer 480 SSD to increase it's capacity and 8 GB DDR4 stick.(No ram included) You will notice your fan go crazy fast during the set up process, that's the CPU trying to process everything. Windows updates also make CPU usage high and make fan go crazy fast, sounds like a airplane about to take off!. 🛫😳

So this is a pretty decent budget laptop! Runs pretty fast and gets the job done. My BIGGEST complaints are the wireless card and the ethernet port. They are both pretty bad. The wireless card is weak. The ethernet port is designed with a lip that doesn't securely hold the ethernet piece in and so any movement and you'll be knocked offline.
Made the purchase to have a new computer for our son (10yrs old) for the coming school year. It does everything he needs it to do. I have had an Acer before and was always satisfied with it.
The screen is very good. Keyboard is comfortable. Easy to update a SSD and RAM. Add a16GB RAM, you got 20GB totally. Win is 11 also very good to use. Almost spotless if it is not used for gaming.
As an adult returning to college, this laptop is perfect for me! It's sturdy but not bulky, and the screen is so much easier on my eyes than the tablet I had been using.
Nice screen with a few extras like the finger print scanner and backlit keyboard is great but it runs hot.  Not being able to sit this unit in my lap and work comfortably is a deal breaker.

My new Acer laptop came today and I could not be more pleased. I want to address just a couple of issues that I read in the reviews. First, it is very easy to get out of S mode. I just googled it and it gave me step by step (settings, activation, click the Switch our of S mode which will take you to the microsoft store and just click get/install. No, it does NOT ask you to pay for anything (unless you click the wrong go to the microsoft store).

Let me shake off the review cobwebs for this because i am disappointed.  It's the small stuff that becomes annoying after a while. A good basic laptop but the reasons why i am returning them is as follows.
This laptop is great. Screen quality is awesome and antiglare is great. WiFi speed gave me the full 100mbps of my network speed. Fast to startup. Love the Backlit keys.

I bought this for myself. I love that it has the backlit keyboard. The battery has a long life. It is not touch screen so I’m not sure why the review is asking about that. As for gaming I have no idea! So far I love it and haven’t had any issues. It’s a great laptop for the price.
Me encanta, está súper funcional. Yo le agregué otra ram de 8 para tener 12 porque solo 4 trae, pero lo demás está excelente. La resolución de la pantalla esta perfecta y el sonido también.

I can't believe this touchpad went out. For the price I got it, it's not worth dealing with customer service to get this fixed as I need it for work. Guess I'll just get a mouse. Can easily add in RAM and another 2.5" ssd while swapping out NVMe  if you so desired. Does it's job just C'mon TOUCHPAD!
I bought this laptop just to have something "mobile" when I want to get online or do some "light work" out of the house (I normally use my desktop computer which is a BEAST!)
I got this laptop for light use in the office in our meeting room. Everyone has had no issues using it and it does everything we need for meeting purposes. It's fast and light weight so it's great!
I had problems with this model, it would not fully charge, I sent it back for a replacement and encountered the same problem, so I do not recommend this computer
This laptop comes with a moderately small SSD drive and 4 GB of RAM. The RAM is the minimum requirement for Windows 11 and it shows. Just after boot with no apps running the RAM is at 90% in use.

This is the 4th one of these that I've bought!  With it being all solid state, battery life is excellent.  Startup is very fast.  I've added a second SSD to two of them with no problems.  It even comes with the necessary hardware to add it.  It's not fast enough for intensive gaming but plenty fast for games like Minecraft, which the kids like.  Being solid state also makes it quite rugged.
I don't game, nor do I use it on battery only.  Yes, the weight is decent.  It is quick to turn on and functions well.  I use it with an added keyboard.

Bought this to take notes and do videos for a college course. It's working well, and lasts 2-3 classes (1/week) before I have to plug it in at home to recharge. All my old laptops were very old or cracked screen, so had to buy a new one as it was required for the class. It is doing well with all the documents and videos I have to use.

It's very slim! Lightweight as well and it's my favorite laptop I've ever had. The speed is fast, but I assume because I don't have a bunch of used up storage. The screen is big enough for me, I don't need anything bigger. I use It for applications or if I can't see something good enough on my phone. Affordable price as well.

This laptop is pretty good. Keypad has a weird layout, and the keyboard lacks proper Home, End, PageUp, and PageDown keys. Oddly enough, Shift+Home works if you do LShift+RShift+Home, while LShift+RShift+End does not work and is just treated as End.

This  laptop is a good quality for the price and the picture is good. The sound is not as good as a high end laptop but most people use headphones anyways. I really like that the keys have a grip type coding on them. My work laptop that is four times the price does not have this and I wish it did.
Great computer for what I need, had to take it out of S mode and I'll have to upgrade the ram (easy to do) but overall a great budget computer

Una Laptop con diseño elegante y caracteristicas decentes, ideal para trabajo de oficina como es mi caso, tambien la puedes usar para colegio o universidad, siempre y cuando no sea para juegos o diseño grafico, para esos casos hay mejores laptop pero mucho mas caras.
I tried two different types of DDR4 sticks to expand the memory and both failed. It can't boot after installed it, no any display even the logo... pls help advice.
Una de las razones por las que compre esta laptop(versión i3 de 12 generación) fue por que supuestamente tenia teclado retroiluminado, pro no es así. Por lo demás, muy contento

Great computer for price. Works nicely, can switch apps and surf fast and easy. Good storage, plays basic games and can stream easily. RAM is easily upgradeable, I would suggest upgrading to 8gb or higher RAM.

The laptop has a very bad battery and very noisy ventilation.Even without loads it is noisy.The battery lasts for 2-2.30 hours watching video.On another model with Rysen,it works 5-6 hours and does not make noise.In addition,here the ventilation goes directly into the screen.Absolutely useless.I do not recommend this model
I wanted a new computer with Windows 11 and could not upgrade my old Toshiba. I don't play games or do a lot on the computer so it fits my needs.

This budget laptop features Windows 11, and a nice display. It is a familiar wedge shape, and weight is moderate. The top part is made of aluminum for stiffness, the bottom part is plastic. The nice, bright 1080p display has thin borders on two side to give the laptop a clean, modern look. There are plenty of ports, including USB-A and USB-C, plus HDMI and ethernet. Sound quality is decent for watching streaming videos - good at reproducing voices. The trackpad is a nice size and the keyboard has a good enough feel for typing.

All the useful features are locked out! After I FINALLY got into the BIOS setup (Which took HOURS of messing around and checking for on-line solutions!), I called ACER support.  They informed me the laptop is ONLY to be used AS DELIVERED!  No external DVD boot, or USB boot, which I require for Dual-Boot capabilities, (Windows and Linux) which I have required and had for at least 15 years.  WORTHLESS!

me parece aceptable el producto para su precio está más que bien el problema que tiene es que viene con la BIOS desactualizada y va a tener un error de que no reconoce el cargador no se asusten entren a la página de acer y descarguen la BIOS actualizada  y luego abajo de la laptop trae  un huequito para reiniciar la batería lo unden por 10 segundos y se arregla el problema al parecer viene por defecto de fabrica pero si actualizas la BIOS se soluciona todo

The laptop itself seems to work great.  However while what I ordered was not listed as refurbished,  the power supply included was for a random company, not Acer, and did not actually charge the laptop.  Once I bought a compatible charger, it is working well, but ridiculous that it did not arrive with a valid charger.

I just wanted a small PC to do some simple tasks that need to be run on a PC only. Fits the bills really well. Can’t imagine it had any horse power to do anything heavy graphics duty wise. But that wasn’t the purpose of buying this laptop.

What a piece of crap, wont charge. Acer needs a 10 days to send out new charger, might not fix the problem. NEVER BUYING AN ACER AGAIN. Also window s mode is a bunch of crap. Dont buy this. Amazon this is a problem.
I love this computer, it is light and fast. It comes with a big screen, full size key board with a number pad (which I find so much easier for doing bills, only shopping etc).

this is my second acer. the only problem is i can get my usb printer to talk to the acer with windows 11. there must be a way but i spent 10 hours yesterday trying and  have accepted i'll have to get a new printer.

This laptop is extremely user-friendly and has a smooth layout for productivity.  The desktop wallpapers and the desktop themes are simplistic as well as eye-catching.  All-in-all, with this laptop, everything seems to be more streamlined which helps me focus on my goals and daily tasks.
Added a larger SSD storage and 4GB more RAM. Could not be happier with this laptop for the price. Picture quality is great. Much better than expected for a laptop in this price range.

This laptop is for sure one of the best laptop for everyday use, and works great for almost everyone. The design is chic and simple. It's very light weighted so easy to carry with you anywhere you want or even travel with. The sizing is perfect as it has 15.6" monitor so still pretty big size to be able to do any work with. For the price, it's super powerful and works great even for some graphic and architectural design works and applications. It's slim which is exactly how I like.

After a couple months of use by my teenagers, the laptop seems to be holding up very well. It is responsive enough with Windows 11 for basic schoolwork or web browsing. Like the screen size and resolution. I initially had a concern that the laptop was not charging properly, but using the battery controller reset on the bottom seems to have solved the problem, it has been working well for several months now.

Overall is a good computer and works well, the screen looks great, it feels light and sturdy. The only problem I have is the retro-illuminated keyboard that the description says this computer has. There's no retro-illuminated keyboard on this laptop. I reached to Amazon Customer Service and they said There's nothing they can do (How about changing the product description?? And offer a discount on the price I paid for this?) This has been a really disappointing experience dealing with Amazon Customer service

Normally I don't leave negative reviews but couldn't hold back this time.  Spent the last three hours trying to remove S Mode in order to install Google Chrome with no success.  Also, the charging cord wouldn't charge the battery.  Too bad because this was a stellar deal!

3rd time  buying this  laptop and its  awful keeps  freezing up and it's  not  as fast its suppose to be  not  buying anymore electronics  on amazon anyone was hoping it would be  good ha ha its not !!!!

La computadora por su precio esta bien.  No trae teclado iluminado como decia la descripcion y alguna de las respuestas dadas .  Algo que si mejoraria bastante es que el sonido es muy bajo, definitivamente no es una computadora para ver progamas o demas con mas de dos personas.

On the second day of use it started problematic charging. When charger was plugged in it kept charging for 5 minutes and then automatically stopped charging. It started charging again after unplugging and plugging again, but only for 5 more minutes. The laptop kept doing over and over again, just wont fully charge. Just didn't seem to be a trait of a brand new laptop. Wont recommend this seller.
The product I received worked but the back panel was damaged. The shipping box wasn’t damaged and neither was the product box. There is two big cracks i the back panel and a dent.

The MS software included noted an "S".  This means it will ONLY download and accept Windows/Microsoft products.  I got rid of that (no going back) so I could use Google, Firefox, my security software and other things. Works fine. Paid $300 on Amazon's annual two-day sale.

Laptop lasted maybe 30 minutes before it completely shut down and would not come back on. Not sure what the issue was but was really hoping for a quality long lasting laptop for my family and homeschool and did not get that.

La descripxion del producto esta mal, lo mas importante por lo que elegi esta laptop fue el teclado retroiluminado, favor corregir esto. Tambien al principio me ah dado problemas para cargar la laptop, de un momento ah otro deja de cargar.

I noticed that this laptop had a 10-key panel, and that's why I purchased this. However, I have since discovered that it is a very very condensed version of a 10-key.  It it not a standard ASCII keyboard.  If you do data entry for a living, you will HATE this laptop just based on that feature alone.  Shame on me for not discovering it before I purchased it, and shame on them for not disclosing it in the item description.  I'm gonna add the extended warranty and then take this thing for a swim in the hot tub

You can't beat this machine for the price. Don't expect a miracle, but to get an I series processor in this (prime day sale) price range is pretty good. I did add ram (and downgrade to 10 pro), but even without that it was fine for everyday tasks. The main downside I've experienced is that the touch pad leaves a whole lot to be desired.

This Acer Chromebook is my new business laptop. It is dependable and fast. It has touch screen, amazing battery life, and light weight-perfect for travel. I love the clear and bright display. It can store a lot of files. Great value for money, I highly recommend!

I had this monitor for almost a year and used it about once or twice a week, with my laptop for working on spreadsheets, QuickBooks, and other accounting things. I was very happy with it while it worked. I take very good care of my things and about a year after getting it the display started showing colored lines and distortions.
i like the light weight. it was difficult to navigate through things. I was on zoom and got disconnected as I lost my hi-spied WiFi connection. Some other issues too.

Do not buy this laptop! Multiple issues with it, had to purchase a new power cord, and after letting it rest for a few months (untouched), this is what it looks like now after powering it up. Save your money and time and purchase something more reliable.

Absolute garbage product. Says every wifi requires login on a captive portal even on an open wifi with no captive portal. Because it won't let you connect to any wifi, you can't even get past the initial setup. Bad operating system prevents you from fixing the issue by bypassing the captive portal issue in the firewall. Complete waste of money, buy literally any other laptop that isn't chrome OS.

Well, after two months of light usage, the mouse is stuck and refuses to work. I went online and tried everything they recommended, I even did a hard factory reset and the mousepad is still frozen. I am so unhappy with this product, wish I never purchased it.

Probably my only complaint is the startup setup and the limitations of the Chrome OS relative to Windows systems neither warranting a star off.  Immediately upon receipt you notice the weight of the box it is a little heavier than I was expecting.  It is a very solid build and feels really durable.

I had a smaller version of acer that I loved. I had to get a new one because I couldn't update the old one. My new acer does the same simple things the old one did except the new one is bigger. If you are looking for a laptop with memory, this is not it.

I got this to free up some space on my IPad and phone.  I use it to play games and do lite paperwork.  It’s perfect for that.  There are so many apps in the google play store that can be downloaded on this.  I can save the storage on my other smart devices to use for other things.

I have the smaller Chromebook and have been satisfied with it as I use it daily (now in fact), as it's light and sits beside me at all times. The larger one filled my need to be able to view some files without having to manipulate them on the screen. Fast, efficient and avoiding the "windows" nightmare I used to have. Seems their "auto updates" wiped out 2 hard drives in past, but no such problem after going to chrome.

We got this chromebook for our guest room. We like to have guests over and we like to make sure they have the best experience. So we got this chromebook so they can browse the internet in their downtime. It has been great so far! The guests love it.
Acer Chromebook 512 | Intel Celeron N4020 Processor | 12" HD+ Display | Intel UHD Graphics 600 | 4GB LPDDR4 | 32GB eMMC | Intel 9560 802.11ac Gigabit WiFi 5 | MIL-STD 810G | Chrome OS | CB512-C1KJ

Bought this for my son for virtual school. It seems to work fine for that, but don't expect it to do anything else beyond working inside Chrome. I've installed both Microsoft Office apps as well as the HP Smart printing app and neither work. They either fail to launch or crash. I have to restart the computer numerous times at each setting. So, if you want a laptop that you might use beyond the Chrome browser, I'd avoid a Chromebook.
This is the second one we got.  We had to replace it due to the first touchscreen going out and they were unable to fix it.  Everything else about this is great so far.

My 314 Acer chromebook arrived on my front porch no announcement like ringing my illuminated doorbell, found it by accident while looking for the prognosticated snowfall. Opened it to find no soft sided travel case like the last Acer I bought. This time I opted for the 4 year Asurion plan, didn't get one last time as the last Acer was gotten from the Amazon "Treasure truck."  Just hope this one lasts more than 2 years!

I am very happy with this Chromebook. Being a first-time user, it is a little bit of an adjustment after years of using computers that run the Windows operating system. But, for an internet-only computer, this has everything I need and more. (I don't have/use the touch-screen option. So, I can't speak to that feature.)
Purchased for a specific task, Zoom / Web streaming. It’s only function, run Zoom and take the input from a BlackMagic ATEN switching 4 sources.  Great value for my needs
Once I got used to Google space, it was great. Computer fires right up. Hard drive is solid state so it is quiet and since it uses less power it doesn't get warm, and the battery lasts a long time.

I tried using this product for my schoolwork which was a terrible idea, I wish I did more of my research. The Chromebook is basically just a large phone for playing games you could've played on your phone. just try and open up a PowerPoint file, its just gonna give you a chrome extension that's corrupted. I tried opening a zip file that i downloaded off my school website and it was empty. I then to find out that they were empty because my Chromebook blocks content it doesn't think is secure and doesn't tell you about it. Everywhere

I bought 2 of these Chromebooks.  They were great until they stopped working.  One of them stopped charging about 5 months after I bought it.  Acer honored the warranty, and fixed it.  The 2nd one stopped charging about 6 months after I bought it, and Acer is not going to fix it.  Acer is saying it out of warranty even though I sent them proof of purchase showing that it is not.  These Chromebooks are not worth the hassle.  They do not last.  Very frustrating.  Poor product and poor service.

This Chromebook from Acer surprised me with how well it's made for less than $170, I wasn't expecting it to be this good. It has a few shortcomings but it's hard for me to really complain for the price. Some Chrome OS devices on the market are older and already several years into their supported lifespan, which is usually 5 years. This one is at the very beginning of that window, it will get updates until June 2027. This is not something people think about but it is important for having an up-to-date and secure device.

I am not new to chromebook.  This is for my family use.  The display is very good for the price.  The keyboard, the body finish are all good.  I like Acer chromebook comes with lots of usb ports on both sides.
I am not a tech savvy person, nor do I know enough to quote specs for this machine.  BUT, I do know that it works perfectly and was easy to set up/use for the person that is not tech savvy.
My wife loves it.  I convinced her to get a  chromebook instead a windows laptop.  She likes simplicity and cuteness and it's  super lightweight and thin.  It also has a long battery life.

This is a smaller 12" screen chromebook by Acer.  I have always had great luck with Acer products.  This computer is under $200 which is a great deal for a computer.  I love chromebooks because you can basically log in with your password and have access to all of your saved stuff.

For the price this is a good solid unit for any student who lives in the google sphere for school, or for the grandparent's email and other online needs.  It's a Chromebook so it performs like one, but this one is especially snappier than most and the durability is MIL std, so you can be assured it will take one heck of a beating.  So far, I've dropped it twice with no problems lol.
Considering how inexpensive this Acer Chromebook 512 is I wasn’t expecting anything amazing. But I was actually pretty surprised at what $200 can get you these days in a chrome book!
This is my first netbook.  Must admit, I was a bit skeptical after so many years with computers.  Not really being into more compute power.  This is far more better than expected.

I’ve had my chromebook for years and haven’t had any problems. My laptop is still working as it was when I bought it. I love this laptop so much I’m gonna buy my husband one for Christmas to replace his crappy HP laptop.

This Chromebook is surprisingly very nice! I was a bit skeptical with the low price tag, but it is super easy to set up and connect to Wi-Fi, and it moves at a decent speed. It is for my teenager to do his homework and play games, so it is truly perfect for that. It’s simple, yet great for the price. He is super happy with it!

We have multiple phones and a 17 year old desktop computer, all of which will print to our Canon printer. This laptop does not. This is a brand new laptop and it would not configure to the printer automatically. Anyone can walk into our house and print right from their phone, so this does not make any sense in 2021 why this new laptop will not. I configured it manually like the online instructions say and it still won't print. The computer shows that it was sent and it's in the print cue but nothing....

Happyt with the machine.  Poorly packed though.  They just put the box into a much bigger box and threw in a piece of brown paper.  The computer rattled around badly inside the bigger box.  No damage that I could find.

Of course, I can't review definitively after only having it a couple of days. But I like the look and feel (sturdy and not too heavy). Everything started up and works fine. I think I'm going to like it very well.

Great price on sale. Would be 5 star if it had a card reader slot. The operating system is using 13.5GB of space leaving 18.5GB of useable space. Web camera is pretty bad, only 640x480. Great battery life. Nice size and weight, the 1080p, anti-glare, IPS screen is the best feature. Trackpad is nice and responsive. both USB-A ports seem tight and a bit cheap, but they work and otherwise I'm very happy so far with this Chromebook.

I have a desk top and a larger Chromebook.  This smaller one goes with me everywhere.  It is so lightweight that I can put it in a tote bag and have it on hand when I need it.  It's easy to use and when watching videos, the picture is fantastic.  (My cat loves watching bird videos on it, too.)  I bought this on a whim because of the low price, but would buy it again because it is such a good product.

I bought this chromebook for my husband because we just started homeschooling our middle schooler and we are doing a lot of research as we are about to invest a lot of time and money into a new farming business. It is perfect for using GoogleDocs, researching, watching youtube videos and creating and delivering lessons for our son. Web pages load quickly.

Pleasantly surprised by the display quality.  Resolution is decent and I really like the 1366 x 912 dimension -- I prefer it to 1366 x 768.  Processor is zippy.  I bought this as a Prime Days deal, and for $129 it was unbeatable. Even at the retail price of $199 is would be a good deal.  I definitely recommend this unit.
I cannot turn on my computer. I’ve tried charging it but it won’t charge. I purchased this January 7 2021. I don’t use it often. I’m very disappointed with this product.

Bought this as our "tv" computer (we've never owned an actual tv) when our old Mac broke. It's simple, lightweight, battery lasts forever, and does exactly what I need it to do: connect to the internet and play shows off Netflix or whatever. Decent volume (we don't connect to any speakers) and good picture from all angles.

This was perfect for me I no nothing about computers it was very easy set I was connected to my internet quickly I don’t really do gaming just really  looking around internet nothing to big this is perfect for me and perfect price

This thing died and won't charge after ONE MONTH of very light use.  I maybe used it 5 times. The stupid thing is the battery cost $50....the Chromebook is only $80 right now. So absolutely frustrating. Piece of junk.

The machine was very easy to set up from my existing Google account.  I ported over MS Office 365 and added all my favorite apps in a few minutes.  I am more than happy with my choice.  This Chromebook is fast, has great battery life, and can do everything I need.  The keyboard lacks a "delete" key, which was awkward until I learned the shortcut workaround.  I highly recommend this item.

It's cheap, easy, small, and it does what I need it to do.  You want to browse the web and do word processing?  This is your machine, nothing spectacular, but it doesn't need to be.  This is your 'extra' laptop, the one you set in a room you don't use often or take with you somewhere because it doesn't matter if it breaks or not.  I'd say get it if you find that useful.
Of course, you have a very limited hard drive, but for email and browsing this laptop could not be any easier and it is very affordable.  I bought one for my mother and and identical one for me.

Needed a lightweight laptop for my night shift job and traveling, Acer has always been a great company this chrome-book is worth it  Great price , lightweight, fast and the volume is better than my 800$ laptop lol definitely would recommend!!!!

What I like is the light weight, long battery life . I am still getting used to this machine and it is coming along nicely. As I travel it is also much better for me unlike my PC. Overall I am glad that I made the switch to a Chromebook.
Anyone looking at Chromebooks these days, and trying to choose one, is in for quite the ride.  So many to choose from, and at so many price points and feature sets.

This was purchased during the Amazon early access sale. It's a great basic, no frills Chromebook for the price. My daughter just needed something to apply for jobs and surf the net on. Google apps work great, and so far no issues at all.

I first was going to return because of inadequate storage but after reading about it before even opening the box I knew I needed this computer. I love it does what I needed and more and as always with amazon arrived on time and packaged immaculately. Thanks Amazon L Bullard

I have two older Acer chromebooks similar to this that I've been very satisfied.  Just started using this new one and everything has gone well.  It's really nice and performs well at a very affordable price.

I've had this 314 a few weeks now and find everything about it a joy. I ordered through Amazon US instead of Amazon Canada and got a better price--much better--than getting it in Canada. I did have a US gift card. On the first day, there was a slight screen flickering, and was about to return it but filled out a complaint form and sent it to Chrome--the flickering stopped--and hasn't returned. Just stopped. Feels so good to be free of Microsoft but use it sparingly when others need a doc in Word. None of those irritating Windows 10 updates.
after a year and a half, completely dead. Worked well for awhile, and it was inexpensive but I thought I’d get at least 3 years out of it.  Lesson learned

Update to my review: This wasn't a hardware fail. It was an operator issue. There are settings for the machine that you access by clicking the TIME in the lower right corner. From there, look for mirror mode.
This Acer Chromebook 512 Laptop | Intel Celeron N4020 | 12" HD+ Display | Intel UHD Graphics 600 has completely blown me away with how capable a low-priced Chrome OS laptop can be.
Really can't complain given what it does for the price, but a slightly annoying issue is with the power button.  Sometimes you have to hold it down to get the device to power up.  Otherwise no issues
I returned the first one, the same model, because  the second monitor (HD TV) flickers or blacks out.  It wasn't the faulty C to HDMI connectors I have many of them.

I bought this for my disabled vet spouse for Christmas 2021.  Here we are less than a year later and it's dead.  Won't turn on nothing.  I didn't buy any warranty so it's my fault and I don't expect anything but did expect it to last more than 11 months.  Can't afford another so he'll just have to go without.

I first purchased a Toshiba chromebook in 2015, it is still going strong.  Decided to update and I cannot fault this Acer version in any way.  Display size and resolution is great.  The majority of chromebooks on the market are HD.  But this version is full HD, there is a major difference between the two.  Bonus is that it is complete with both USB A and USB C inputs.

I’ve had this computer for six months, and over the last two months, it sometimes refused to charge when plugged in. I replaced the charger, and walked through the battery reset with tech support (which I am about to do, yet again). My older two children have older Acer laptops that aren’t giving us issues, but I am pretty disappointed in this one.

I had an Acer 15.6, which I liked quite a bit but I've had it several years and it was starting to rundown.  I then purchased an 11.6 (I think) and I found it to be too small.  Returned it and ordered this.  I love it.  More lightweight that 15.6, fast , screen is beautiful (HD), keyboard is fine.  No complaints at all.  Very, very happy.  Ever since I got my first Chromebook I was sold.

While not top of the line, it does the job nicely and provides better value than anything I could find on Amazon in its class. It's worth noting that the first one I received had a dead pixel near the center of the screen, but Amazon was excellent in getting me another one quickly.

Huge disappointment from the very beginning, setup prosses. Simply didn't work. When called tech support, the SIND number couldn't be recognized. Spend about 45 min. waiting to be connected  and it never happened. Just waste of time and money.
What I received was not what was described. What I received was a run of the mill chrome book and not a spin 311. Also does not have a touchscreen.

My god this is the first time having an awful experience buying something here and I hope its the last, this was completely ridiculous and absurd. Simply put, I was sent this Chromebook WITH NO CHROME OS.
