You might as well sent me no screen or no motherboard cause it'd be just as useful, will be returning and purchasing something more fitting for my tastes, a working laptop.

Just purchased in August and have to send it back because it will not power on. Had to purchase another power cord, because the one it came with died. It's fully charged & will not come on. Called the customer support... Did everything they told me to... Now have to send it in so they can tear it apart and erase everything on it and send it back... NOT HAPPY!!!

Our kids have used this product for less than 2 months to do their school work on. Didn't have any issues until it suddenly wouldn't charge at all anymore, or even turn on. Tried out varying charging cables and outlets, with no success.

I would not recommend buying this because after 30 days of using it, it has turned into a tablet forever. It will not go back into its laptop form. I contacted the seller and he is refusing to help me.

At a cost of about 200 bucks the Acer Chromebook is a bargain. Does all the things you’d expect plus it is very light, the touch screen is responsive and the screen resolution is good. Not my primary tool, but very useful, kinda like a utility infielder.

I bought this for a friend, easy set up, just type your Google email and everything is already there, when u login its very fast, i like the touchscreen feature, u can used it as a tablet too, its well build, the size it perfect, not to big not too small,  i was on the whole day and the battery did not die on me, in fact i still have a lot of juice left. the only complaint i have is i regret not buying 2 for that price.

The laptop has heating problem. The switch between tablet mode and laptop is not smooth. The mouse pad is really bad. The laptop freezes just while watching netflix option for the price. Wont recommend to anyone

Money is tight everywhere. I thought I would give this Spin 311 a try for reference of a future purchase, then return it. However, wow. I have been stunned into realizing how slow my previous Chromebooks were. This one is fast, with a nice sharp clean feel to the keys. Bright clear screen. It loaded all my previous items within no time. The wi-fi is even noticeably faster and more efficient than my previous laptops. No. No this one is staying with me. I hope to buy a second one soon. My Wife deserves better as well.

The delivery however sucks. Twice now it has been left in the  sun at 100+ degrees. The product wouldn't turned on one day and the next didn't turn on at all. I asked for someone to knock or if i could pick it up at a ups place when delivering the replacement. i know how the product works because i used a friends.

I did a lot of research as to what to get for my kids to replace their aging and damaged Samsung Tab A's. We decided that it was time to go to a Chromebook so that they could get more repetition with a standard keyboard and GoogleOS. They are still able to download all the PlayStore apps that they had on their tablets, but now with better hardware and longer support.
The ACER Spin 311 is the answer from ACER to the Lenovo C340 11inch which was a great success story. Acer obviously wanted a share of the pie and thus the birth of Spin 311.

Normally my husband (IT guy) writes these reviews, but I wanted to write this one.  We are currently starting the new 2020-2021 school year 100% virtual.  My daughter (5th grade) has used Chromebooks at school for a couple of years now.  My son is younger (2nd grade), and  this is his first experience with them.

I really like the Chromebook concept.  They don't need too much power, rely mostly on the web browser, and aren't super complicated in terms of too many apps or bloatware.  I especially like how small and light this one is.  It makes it perfect for a young person as an airplane movie machine or as their first schoolwork notebook computer.
It does not fold! It opens and closes but doesn't do the same as it shows in the pictures or as it says in the description...it is a regular Acer laptop....

The screen was actually better than I expected, with good touch sensitivity and crispness.  The camera is good quality as well.  Overall build quality appears quite solid, better than I expected.  Look, it's a Chromebook, which are basically commodities at this point, and it does the job we use it for - surfing the web, Zoom calls, YouTube streaming, and an occasional low-memory game.  I will say that it feels better in the hands (heavier, better screen) than our prior Samsung Chromebook, which felt plastic-y and light.
like that it is wireless..so much easier than moving laptop around due to connections.. free to use anywhere in the home...  not stuck to a short wire connect any more. so nice

This is probably the best priced touchscreen Chromebook on the market.  While there are upgrade potentials to more premium models, this one has no glaring deficiencies and works really well for all the standard Chrome OS functions including video.  The touchscreen allows for better Android app manipulation especially in tablet mode.
Stopped working after a 14 months! What a waste of money. When I called the 800 number for help I was told to buy another battery and that should fix my problem.

I loved this laptop, but after about a month of having it, it just completely stopped turning on. I tried recharging it and it still didn’t work. I don’t know what happened to it, but the seller was kind enough to give me my return.
For some odd reason when I'm watching a movie or on an app it'll start skipping or I'll have to force restart. It doesn't work well for the smallest task.

This has survived summer camp and beach vacations on the RV with a 9 year old. I didn't buy any type of case, he just carries it in his backpack. It's very durable and the battery lasts until bedtime, sometimes later. If you're wondering, it's been dropped and wet multiple times but I would not recommend testing it's limits. If your kid is tough on electronics I'd at least get the gorilla glass screen protector.

Bought this primarily for my son to use for school (Zoom calls). Initially we were having trouble on Zoom. Screen sharing wasn't working. Call would drop. Couldn't use the 2nd monitor via Thunderbolt while doing Zoom. Did some testing and discovered the wifi was getting an abismal bandwidth score. I purchased a TP Link USB to Ethernet adapter, doubled the internet bandwidth, and the issues went a way.

Bought this on an amazon prime sale, about 20-30 less than "normal".  Looked up lots of reviews on here and various sites, and decided to go for it.  It's a fairly quick little computer that we use mainly for browsing the web (my kids online learning games, netflix, disney plus, etc.).
Computer worked very well for about a month or so then just wouldn’t do anything, customer service is at best comical. Feel like I wasted my money and would have been better to go to Walmart

used it for about a month before it stopped turning on completely, i lost all my artwork and pictures saved on there. it would crash in the middle if drawings and was altogether glitchy and not worth the money. i wish i just went with a higher end one
Chromebook stopped working in just over one month of use and with very light use. Shut down while in use and will not power back on. Battery still had over 90% life left.

Wanted to love this so much but both the original and replacement had the exact same issue with the screen going dark immediately after turning on. Acer support was a joke... It's just someone with no IT experience reading off a script. Getting a refund when what I really wanted was a computer.
This is by far the best chrome book! It looks brand new and is easy to use! I would recommend this for everyone. I never expected it to be this good.

Working then not. Left in car due to rain inna case. Woke up and at work it fell apart. Screen burned/no response didn't work. Keys dell off like melted into nothing. Most melted off a few warped and a couple intact wth. I want my money back. Doubt they will give me anything or more. I just want a working latop not a crazy job thanks.
I got this laptop two months ago and it has some major crashing issues. It will randomly close an app while I’m on it, or have a loading symbol indefinitely. It also has very little storage capacity.

Perfect work and play laptop for my daughter. With remote learning she needed something compact and sturdy. This laptop holds a charge for a very long time. As with all chromebooks, setup is a breeze. The touch functionality is very responsive and the ability for my daughter to download games from the play store and use this as a tablet is a bonus. Highly recommend. This is my second purchase, my son has one that has been working perfectly fine for some time now. Highly recommend.

This is my first Chromebook. I was not sure what to expect. I love it. It is much better than an android tablet in my opinion. The convertible feature along with a real keyboard is perfect for a lightweight device. The Chromebook itself is speedy. It feels even faster than a brand new android tablet.

I upgraded my tablet to this amazing computer because I didn't want to carry both around when it was no longer necessary. The processor makes this fast and it has impressive storage and graphics. The laptop is also sturdy and well-constructed while being lightweight. I am primarily working from home but when I have meetings, etc it is so nice to have everything right at my fingertips in this one dope computer. The convertible function is well-designed and touch screen is responsive. I love everything about it and it has become my primary mobile workstation!

This is my third Acer Chromebook, the previous two Acer's gave me years of reliable service and never failed to perform when needed. The only reason for upgrading was for additional power and longer battery life, both previous Chromebooks serve as backups if need be.

This is an excellent chromebook. It is fast, the touch screen works perfectly, and it seamlessly switches from laptop to tablet mode when you flip it over. Screen quality is great - videos are crisp and clear. The speakers are terrible - I can barely hear the volume when trying to watch a movie while doing dishes. Headphones pair with no issue.

This was bought as a gift so I can only relay the comments from the older gentleman for whom this was purchased.  The big complaint was the letter on the keyboard were printed in loser case.  He grumbled about touch screen a bit but as he got used to chromebook verses his laptop he has given it some praise.  Can't really give any details as I don't pay much attention to his grumbles.

I loved this little Chromebook, but it was not the product I should have ordered. I couldn't use it for work. My fault of course. The reason I gave it one star is because I had to return it and I haven't received a refund although it says it was received May 10th. What gives?

The laptop is very fragile it fell and was destroyed in a minute I suggest if you’re purchasing make sure and the protective case and screen, also the manufacturers are thieves they’re charging the same amount you paid for the laptop to fix the screen this doesn’t make any sense

Bought this to replace my wife's aging Asus chromebook which was no longer supported by chromeOS updates.  This is almost identical in looks, although larger screen size and much better battery life as well as a faster processor make it a really good upgrade that should last for a good while.  Love the touchscreen and the tablet mode.  The video quality leaves a bit to be desired but for a 200 dollar unit i can't complain.  My wife loves it and that's the best part :)

This chromebook is very much worth the money, I bought it for college and it has been very quick and hasn’t had any performance issues. I highly recommend this laptop to any upcoming college students who need a reliable device for taking notes and doing classwork.

Bought this for my daughter to use at school. She loved it while it worked, but after a year and a month the WiFi hardware died. Acer wanted to charge almost as much as the original purchase price to repair the hardware. No more Acer products for us.
Loved this device when it was working! I purchased in May 2021 and it will not charge January 2022.  Tried two different chargers of which I had the same result.

Got this for elementary school children. I've never owned a chromebook so didn't know what to expect, but so far it has impressed me.  Easy to setup with a google account.  Also like how you can apply parental controls using google family.  As far as the device itself-- love the touchscreen.  My kids don't really use the flipped mode but i like that it is an option.  Very happy with my purchase.  Also, I didn't buy the extended protection but am now thinking I will.

Seemingly very attractive computer however after four months it went dark - it failed at three months and then again at four months - and they do not give your money back or a new one. Do not buy a waste of money and very aggravating. They make you send it back at $25 shipping cost now I’m out for two weeks with no computer.
I’ve been using it all day to make sure everything works properly. Both the display and audio work perfectly and the battery has lasted all day. The touch screen works great.

Locked up while on my banks website. Would not reboot. Tried a few days later after the battery died. Nothing. Shame because I was Chromebook would provide secure banking. Also, a lot of banks do not have apps for Chromebook. And using external storage is made intentionally difficult for no reason.

Bought this for my Daughter on her Birthday in 2020 because she needed a Chromebook for the School Year starting in September... Worked fine then the Charger stopped charging... Bought a replacement Charger Because of course, the return window had expired...

After just 3 months, the Chromebook is became unresponsive. The power LED does not even light up with three different chargers. Acer provides warranty repair only with 5-10 days turn-around and shipping cost is on us. We've enjoyed their products in the past, but this will be the last Acer product we've bought. They clearly don't stand behind their products.

This chromebook has been great so far. It is far more durable than most chromebooks on the market. I love that it is small but is still just as good, if not better than the bigger chromebooks. The touchpad is great and the keys have a nice feel when typing. All around great chromebook so far.

I bought this to use for school, because it can run all the apps I would otherwise be using on my phone. It definitely gets the job done. The ONLY thing I would improve is not specifically related to this laptop, but to the variety of apps that are available for it.

Please be aware that this product is not the Spin model.  I received mine at is the Acer 311 (not the Spin).  I was finally sent a shipping level and returning and promised a full refund.  It was received brand new.  It's simply not the model that is shown.

i bought this is February 2021 for my brother is Florida and im in michigan, hes not tech savy and i just drove down to visit and I can not get this to work. it refuses to do anything but say error i dpon t know why. we have in my home at the moment 4 chromebooks so im quite aware of their capabilities. i need to return it but i cant.  they need to make it right,.

All the Google apps that I always love come standard on every Chromebook, which means I can edit, download, and convert Microsoft Office files in Google Docs, Sheets and Slides.  I am so happy I ordered this laptop.
This was supposed to have an Intel Celeron 4020 popCPU, but instead has a worse Mediatek CPU. I would return it, but it's for a gift and I wouldn't get a replacement in time

You can’t edit Microsoft Office 365 online, super frustrating! You cannot print from this device either!! So frustrating and worst purchase ever!! If you don’t need to edit or print then you might be just fine.

I tried to purchase a Chromebook much like this one from a different seller because it was cheaper. Well, the webcam didn't work so I bought from Acer directly and the laptop is perfect! I use it for school and it gets everything done (except respondus lockdown browser). I recommend it for anyone looking for a reliable lap top. (Ignore the bubbles in my screen protector, I know theyre bad) lol

This is my second Acer Chrome Book but the performance doesn't compare to my first Acer purchased 4 years ago  THe second Acer has difficulty loading apps and must continually be re-booted.  It also loses the wifi connections, sometimes repeatedly in a two or three minute time span.  So sorry I didn't review this product more carefully before purchasing.

This is exactly what you need if you want the flexibility of a 180 hinge so you can move to tablet mode at any time.  Operation is smooth, screen is outstanding.  I tried a 2 n 1 tablet thinking it would work but even with a quad processor it is so slow and the battery lasted 1.45min.  This battery lasts 7-10 hours, full chromebook so very fast, and the 180 hinge makes it perfect.  If you are looking for this type of tablet you cannot go wrong here.  Very happy.

I had bought one for my son and I liked his, so I bought one for myself. The battery life lasts about 2 days with me and everything that I do on it. The screen quality is amazing. It's nice and clear. Plus I can fold it how I need it for the different projects I work on. I just wish mine came with a pen like my son's did.

Bought while taking a few medical courses for online test taking and word processing and it works great for travel. Screen is very clear, bezels are a little too big however it lasts for near 14 hours of class without needing a charge which is impressive. Charges fast off any USBC you have laying around. Speakers aren’t great but wearing headphones is great for watching Netflix/YouTube at night. Overall if you need a small word processor I highly recommend it.

I bought this for my 5 year old kindergartener to use for her Zoom classroom. This Acer Chromebook can NOT handle Zoom. Zoom gets cut off, freezes....etc. extremely frustrating. FYI we have 400 MB/S download speed internet. Also, we don’t have these issues when using Zoom with our MacBooks.
Tore up in 4 days of use will no longer charge at all, even after purchasing new charger it doesn't work got my daughter this for Christmas and she is heart broken over it not working!

This thing was garbage.  Set it up for my son, he used it a day then we got a CgromeOS is damaged message.  Recovered the OS and he used it for school today.  Now the piece of junk won’t charge.  A week out of the return window so now we will have to wait for Acer to fix it.  Skip this one.

My daughter has had this laptop for 3 months and it has already stopped working. I am very disappointed as this was not only a school investment but an investment for her small business, as well. This really sucks.

I picked this one up for the grandson, he's going to a hire grade figured it was time for an up grade. The Chromebook is a nice looking piece of equipment, solidly build, the screen is tough and the touch screen is great.  I set it up to see how it works, absolutely a worthwhile investment.  Looks good, works great, the grandson is happy what more could you ask for.

the listing reads as if it has internal wifi capabilities - NO - just like any modern tablet it will connect to a wifi network but does not help if there is secure network and you do not have password - duh - thought i could add data plan and have hotspot

This is the second chromebook ive bought off Amazon, I love it that much.  Perfect for presenting in meetings or appts for work.  Lightweight so I can throw it in my purse and go.  Definitely recommend

This Chromebook is NOT touch screen and does NOT spin or bend at all. It bends 180° at most, a straight line, and nothing further. I spent to much money for it not to have the basic description of the product!

We needed a cheap laptop just for browser usage. We have an employee that occasionally needs to do light work on a computer and so we got this for those cases. It has worked perfectly for that purpose. It's very nice that it's convertible into basically a tablet. We use it both ways all the time now!

I got this as an inexpensive Touch screen for my mom,  She is able to use it very easily,  we are able to use whats app for facetime and she can do her banking and other minimal internet activities with no issue.  for her use there was no reason to spend a lot more on a surface or Ipad

Even though it takes a stylus to work the touch screen, and though the battery life isn't as advertised (10 hours, maybe it's more like six if you aren't using it heavily, I love this Chromebook.  It does everything I need to do -- with freedom from Microsoft, whose subscription plan felt a bit like a noose to me.  Mostly I surf, do social media, buy online, email, but I can use Google Documents if I need to write something.  Basically I love this product and I liked the price very much!

The first chrome book I was sent had a black bar the would randomly show up & was super slow after 2 days of using it. I asked for a replacement & since getting my replacement, it’s better. A bit slow on the typing here & there but over all great for school work & no black bar randomly showing up.

I'm so happy I made this purchase!  I ordered two Chromebooks prior to ordering the Acer Spin 311 and returned them due to dissatisfied. When I received this one, I was totally satisfied.  I watched two movies that were over a hour and a half each and still had over 95% battery left!  The screen is great and I love the keyboard. It turns into a tablet and stands up perfectly!!  I highly recommend!!

Purchased on June 27, 2020. Stopped powering on in early January 2021. Tried resetting but no luck. Worked reasonably well for six months, but when I contacted the manufacturer they just sent a generic email telling me my only option is for me to pay to ship it (insured) to them with no timeline for repair. Wanted to like this product but don't feel great about buying another Acer now.

Really impressed with Chrome OS and its ease of use - it is like having an Android-powered phone, almost eliminating any type of learning curve. With the required Google account, all items synchronize across the various desktops, Chromebooks, and phones we have in use. Easy to add accessories and plenty powerful for everyday work.
The Chrome book is wonderful for streaming tv. I think it would be a great device fir first-timrts and children to learn on. I bought it so I could stream my favorites when I travel.

Within weeks of the end of the warranty it simply would no longer charge and eventually died. I tried all the tricks and event opened it up and disconnected the battery, but there is simply no life in it. I see from the reviews that others have had similar issues. Just a super cheap unit, not recommended.

I bought this for my husband to use as a small laptop. He doesn't wish to use this as a tablet. Unfortunately the screen will rotate sideways while he's using and it's a struggle to get the screen back to the correct way. I do not recommend this product if you wish to use as a laptop only. I would return, but unfortunately we're outside of our return time. :(

For being such an inexpensive laptop this Acer Chromebook Spin 311 Convertible Laptop is a great choice for a child! I got this for my 9 year old and he has had it for about 9 months now, and he genuinely uses this just as much as his iPad and our desktop computer.

I love this laptop! I needed something light for basic tasks such as work, streaming, and casual games, and it is perfect for those tasks!. I love the fact that ChromeOS syncs with my Google account and all of my stuff is right here.
I love the chrome book because I get to use it as a tablet and the touchscreen works well for me, I can put in my hand bag because it’s not to big and everything works well I love it❤️

used this computer about 5 weeks and stopped working.  Sounds like faulty connection between charger and computer so now I need to pack up this computer, send it back to ACER and wait 5-10 business days for them to repair this.  I am responsible for the cost of sending the machine to the facility.  Wow, thought I would at least get a few years service from a computer before I had a problem

bought at $249.00 Respectable specs for price given current demand. Getting 8+ hours of battery life surfing web and watching YouTube. If you cant tell from pics. micro SD slot reader for media and volume rocker on side. your play store app compatibly will vary. please note that only about 20 GB of that storage is available for apps. if you are new to Chromebooks (or computers in general) this is more of a tablet+ than a full laptop replacement

So far so good. I only use it a couple of hours a day, and I can go the whole week without having to recharge the battery. Screen is good given the price point, touch screen has been solid, and the 360 degree hinge is much nicer than I thought it would be. I find myself using the hinge, and touch screen much more than I thought I would. Screen size is a little small sometimes, but more often than not it isn't an issue.

I got this to use around the house and I just love it. Fast and clear, the touchscreen works very well and the battery life is better than expected. I was also surprised by the sound quality. Good machine!

Great computer for kids and school however after just one year there seems to be a hardware problem and the computer died. Since it was out of warranty after one year, to get it looked at would cost same as if I  purchased it!

Light weight and boots up quickly. Timed it and it took me less than 44 seconds from the point of turning it on, logging in and started to browse the internet compared to nearly 5 minutes for my Dell windows laptop. Happy with this purchase.

The product I ordered is listed on the website as CP311-2H-C679. I received instead the product CP311-3H-K3WL (marked as such on the box and the back of the PC itself). This model K2WL uses a different chipset (MediaTek instead of the Intel Celeron 4020). This impacts negatively the performance of the unit SIGNIFICANTLY. Moreover, it has fewer USB ports than the C679 product.
I was so looking forward to using this Chromebook. I am housebound, and with Covid 19, I am in isolation as well. Not as bad as it may sound, since I live with my son and his family.
Christmas present for my 8 year old. She loves it. I can still remember the look on her face when she found out it was not only touchscreen but could also fold and be used as a tablet!

I wanted to get a new table to play games through google play store.  Much to my surprise this is a computer and tablet all in one.  Set up in minutes and away I was playing my games.  Can't beat the price and/or the product.  I am do please with this purchase!!!!!
This item is just as described. I really like that you can do the keyboard or the touchscreen. It has a great batter life and is easy to carry around.

Had to send it back.  Would not retain a password and then any app added would disappear.  Acer said that the only thing they could do was a factory reset.  We had to change Google password 4 times and it never worked.  We’ve had an Acer tablet before and never had any trouble.  Now it’s messed up things on the regular computer.  Probably have to get someone more computer savy than me.  Ordered an iPad.

I wasn't sure what to expect since this is my first Chromebook outside of what the school provided my child for classwork.  We moved to a new school and had to supply our own.  This cost less than what the old school used and is far more responsive and includes a touch screen (old school's was not touch).  My 14-year-old boy was extremely impressed, as was I.  I don't have any knowledge of the battery life yet (nor complaints from the boy).
I had 2 of these units, the first just stopped working - would not turn on would not show any signs of charging or power at all after using for about 2 weeks.
good for the price .. touchscreen need a slightly harder press than other manufacturers, camera is kind of dark . i love the spin but wondering how long those hinges will last lol

Nothing really to review. It’s been dead or with Acer for “repairs” longer than we’ve actually had it. Right in the middle of remote learning too! Customer service was essentially a human doing a robot’s job, i.e. scripted and mostly useless.

Bought this for my granddaughter but found out she couldn't use it for schoolwork. I kept it, and it's OK for what I use it for. Still haven't explored everything it can do so will update my review later

Love the convenience of the tablet but I have had to purchase two replacement chargers since purchasing the tablet. It does not charge anymore. Chargers work with my other devices but do not charge the tablet anymore.

Bought this for my kindergarteners “covid classes” we have at home  instead of in class lessons! Works great.. we were having issues using a regular computer/ mouse cuz I think he’s used to using a touch screen on his tablet, so we invested! Have no complaints so far and would recommend it to any elementary age child for zoom classes/ online classes that they may need to participate in!

This Acer Chromebook Spin is awesome. I love technology and chrome books are so much fun to play with. This one would be great for work, school, or just browsing/playing games. It easily turns in to tablet and tent mode, making watching movies a breeze. It's made from durable plastic and seems super sturdy. Small and light, this will fit in any backpack, bag, or briefcase.
This device is much quicker to “wake up” than my laptop. It does everything I need a PC to do and it is super convenient that it also functions as a tablet.

Review for: Acer Chromebook Spin 311 Convertible Laptop | Intel Celeron N4000 | 11.6" HD Touch Corning Gorilla Glass Display | 4GB LPDDR4 | 64GB eMMC | Intel 802.11ac Gigabit WiFi 5 | Chrome OS | CP311-2H-C7QD

Light, long battery life, quick boot, excellent alternative for those who feel it's too heavy and short battery life for Laptop, long booting time for windows, but not sufficient if merely bring along with iPad or smart phone.

This works pretty well if you are just going to be web browsing or watching some videos. It's a bit slow in terms of installing/running apps. But I find it's small size, lightweight and good battery life make it very convenient to use when you don't really want to haul around a full size laptop. I might in the future consider spending a little bit more for a faster processor. But that's about the only criticism I have for this.
This laptop is so great! It meets my needs and more! And you can't beat the price for the neat perks it offers! I especially love that it's convertible AND touchscreen! Highly recommend!

This Acer Chromebook (TheSpin 311 Convertible) has a long-lasting battery, which is an absolute necessity for younger kids. However, it comes loaded with junk, some of which isn't usable or is outdated. We've been using it for a few days and, of course, the kids love the touch screen, and taking photos. Although, there's little comparison to a regular PC that my10-year-old grandson is using. And it's different enough to be confusing. It is, after all, a Chromebook.

The item they ship is not what is described or shown.  They are aware of this.  However, they will not notify you they are not shipping what you think you are buying.  This does not have a touch screen and does not fold back as shown.  I would give no stars if possible

This review is for the Acer Chromebook Spin 311 4GB/30GB. it looks pretty.  It's fine for light use like internet browsing or bill paying or shopping.  But at this price point I consider it a fail with only one usb and no micro sd card slot.  Considering that the price should be around $80.  It has bluetooth so would be great to load music on it and play that through bluetooth speakers.  To bad you can't.

So first thing, since I know some people will be wondering: this device CAN NOT be flashed to run Windows or Linux, at least at this time.  It is not possible.  Was one of the main reasons I got it, since I did not know that at the time, but I will make do, ChromeOS is workable nowadays.  If you want a Chromebook to flash to Ubuntu or Windows or something, there are websites that break down which can and which can't.

In less than two months my Acer stopped working, it gradually stopped charging and I  wonder what is wrong. This Acer is heavier than the similar Samsung that I bought thre years ago, but the Samsung chrome has never been troubling. It is the one I reverted to.

Me gusta todo. Su tamaño, el diseño ( la puedo usar como laptop y también como tableta). La quise comprar porque la laptop que tengo en par de horas ya esta la batería descargada y ahora tengo más tiempo de carga y muchas más velocidad para realizar mis tareas. Estoy encantado con la acer. Espero que me dure mucho tiempo. La recomiendo al 100%.

I ordered it for my daughter for her to take online classes from camp and school. We are very happy with this chromebook. it is also touch screen and can be folded like a book so easier for her to use when reading books. We are able to install all needed apps to complete her work.

I would not recommend buying this from Amazon.  We have had this computer for less than a month, it has been dead for 2 days and the battery will not take a charge/power up.  We contacted Acer and we would have to send it back for a "repair" that could take up to 2 weeks.  This is my son's school computer.  Such a hassle and Acer customer service isn't great.

Fantastic all around 2 in 1 laptop!  Smaller screen than my ancient dysfunctional laptop but a far better replacement.  It isn't built for serious gaming though, and the screen could be bigger given the wide margin between the display and the edge of the laptop.  I imagine Acer did that on purpose to make the display more rugged and less prone to damage.  If that's the case, I have zero complaints.

We purchased this for my step-daughter and she loves it. We added YouTubeTV app so she can enjoy streaming TV in her bedroom and it works GREAT!  We're very happy with this Chromebook. It does everything that we need it to do.
battery is great. the chromebook works mostly like a laptop and kinda like an android. screen quality is kinda low but not bad, touch screen is nice and doesnt lag with any touch. love it

So far. So good. Bought it for my 8yo, but end up using it for myself! Love the touch screen features. Zero lag. My only complaint is, the screen saver that came on it seems to be something another user would put? So I’m thinking this might be a used computer?
I love it I've never had a laptop or a tablet this is a two-in-one I've actually been addicted to it since I got it and the deliverer dropped it at my door and sent me a picture saying it was there
I like that this product was easy to sign in for and works without much intervention.  I set up a few apps and am enjoying the exposure to the Android/Google world.
I love this chromebook! I csn use it as a tablet or a laptop! The touch screen is a great feature. I take courses on line with it and do alot of emailing and zoom.

You get what you paid for. I thought I liked it originally, but the more I use it, the more I realize how slow the laptop is compared to my Macbook Air 2015. Granted, the Macbook Air costs 4x more, but I came to a point where the Chromebook just felt unusable and more like a starter laptop for my 9-year old kid.
This is a nice lightweight Chromebook and it works great. I have a very strong internet signal so I am not having some of the problems I read about. Its fast. Set up took 5 minutes.
Figuring out how to use it has been difficult.  Instructions are non existent and my intuitiveness is failing me. I can’t even figure out how to add and app or it’s icon
I haven’t used it for long but when I did it was easy to set up, light weight and I love that it’s touch screen, and can be reversed to a tablet.

I searched forever looking at chrome books for my 11 year old I wasn’t really sure what to buy, I finally decided to go with this one and I am glad that I did ! I didn’t want to spend a fortune but wanted something that was going to last and work well for him! This is so easy to use and he loves it haven’t came across anything we didn’t like yet!
I am used to having bigger screen and was worried if it will not work for me. I got it and made some adjustments and I can see really well on it

This is my second chromebook, both are the Acer brand.  I really enjoy the security, the ease of use, and the touchscreen.  I keep it next to my recliner and grab it several times a day to check the news, do some research, some shopping, or read up on email etc.  So glad I decided to give the chromebook a try.

So I gave the stars simply because the chromebook arrived DOA (dead on arrival) and that ticks me off when I buy high end or high dollar electronics!! Other than that it arrived on time, NIB (new in box) but had to charge before we could play around with it!
I expected to like this just fine but I really like it more than I expected to. And huge kudos to the seller. Shipping was even faster than it was estimated to be.

Love the Chromebook! Touchscreen is great. Only negative is that the speakers are not very loud but you can use Bluetooth to connect another, louder speaker d so it's not a big deal for me. Very affordable!

This is a very nice computer for the price I have had no complaints and it has given me 0 trouble I really like all the functions on this computer it can be turned into a tablet also and it has a touch screen you really can't go wrong with this computer

Just got my computer today and started doing my thing, quickly noticed a small crack at the top which if it’s a brand new computer it really shouldn’t have that, so far no other things have come up but I will be in contact.
This is a fantastic device.  We got it for my son for digital learning.  It’s easy to use, fast, and has great features.  The price is amazing too!  I would highly recommend this chrome book.

This is a replacement of a Chromebook from 2017, my only complaint is printing. This one does not go directly to print I wants you to save and not being savvy with electronics this is unsatisfactory for me. Other than that I love the device

I purchased two of these, one for each of my boys and I'm extremely happy with them. Boys are hard on things and they have held up well. They work extremely well for the remote learning and college classes as well as their high School classes. Very impressed. Think I will buy one for myself now.

Update:  Did a little searching on my own and found Chrome Perks.  100 GB still available, but no longer to people who have taken advantage of it in the past with a previous Chromebook purchase.  Not happy about it, but it appears to be Google's greed that is the problem.  That said I think that the description on Amazon should be amended to not promise 100 gb of cloud storage.  I would be willing to bet most Chromebook buyers have already used the perk in the past.
Love it and I am still getting used to it.  I don't like games etc on the computer I use for books and personal business so I bought  one like this as my old one died.  Works very well.

I love it so far. Use it every single day. I guess I’m just a little confused because here it says the product is the Acer spin chrome book 311-2h-c629 or whatever but I definitely received the 311-3h-k23x
I purchased this about a year ago and I still use it. It works like new, I caught it on sale and the touchscreen is so useful! It came exactly like I had hoped.

My first laptop or tablet I've had.  I had no knowledge of either and this was so easy to get used to.  Called the tech support number who helped me to get going and I'm off to the races.  Love this Chromebook!!  It is so nice and battery holds 10 hours.  Totally satisfied!  Putting the 2 in 1 works amazing

I bought this for my 6 year old for school because they went virtual for 2020-2021 school year. I only had this maybe three months and it completely stopped working. Wouldn’t turn on anymore. So I wasted almost $300. Never will purchase from this company again!!

Exactly what I wanted, a smaller size laptop.  I got a bargain on it and am Really impressed with it. I’m not used to android but I’m getting there.  I mostly watch movies and it never has disappointed. Keeps charge plus charges up rapidly. Overall I love it!!

Love this laptop. I'm getting to know my way around the Chromebook OS and find it pretty easy. Never have a problem with battery. Touch pad and screen are smooth and responsive. The only issue so far is a flickering issue while streaming and opened Amazon app. The Amazon app flickered badly.
Worked great for 6 months, then just stopped working for no apparent reason.  Never dropped it or exposed it to water.  Always kept in a soft carrying case when not in use.
My daughter is very happy with this chromebook. I only purchased a new chromebook for her because her previous one is no longer going to get updates because it's "too old".
Wow the advertisement was all wrong.I just got it in the mail today and there is no touch screen or the 4 different modes you can adjust it to.Very disappointing
My child works in Canvas for her virtual school platform and this works well for her.  It was well worth the money and this is the third Acer Chromebook we have in the family.  We love them all!

This Chromebook is the best purchase I made for myself in the past year. My HP Chromebook gave out on me and doesn't do half the things this one does. It's more sleek and lightweight. Also it's convertible and has good screen quality. Folds like a tablet and easy to connect the WiFi.

I like the fact that it is difficult, not impossible to get malware, and can be easily cleaned if you know where to go. I had a continual popup and discovered that although the operating system didn't have a virus/adware/malware, the browser did. Once I figured this out I cleared browser history and it was gone. I do not really like the Chrome operating system, but I suppose I will get used to it. Really like the near non-existent virus/malware. No need for anti-virus. Everything is run in a sandbox.

This was a gift for my partner. I set it up for him, and added the apps he wanted. This version of the Chromebook was easy to set up. The hardware seems sturdy, it survived a long road trip and a few air travel trips.

I'm 72 and have been agonizing replacing my aging Asus laptop. Back and forth between a Chromebook or a laptop. Read reviews on the differences, threw a dart, and ordered this Chromebook. What a great decision. Opened it up, plugged it in and turned it on. Then answered a few questions and it synched with my Note8. I like to cook and can hardly wait to look up a recipe, tent it, and start creating.  I have very simple computer needs, email, banking, and, looking up recipes. For me this is a 5.

This is listed on the website as CP311-2H-C679, but is really a CP311-3H-K23X (says so on the box).  The difference is 3H-K23X uses a different chipset (MediaTek vs Intel).  While this change saves battery life it also impacts the performance of the unit SIGNIFICANTLY (particularly when used for internet calls, aka zoom calls, as the graphics processor was downgraded in tandem).  This device is only suitable for LIGHT browsing and low-quality video/zoom calls.  It'll probably handle youtube playback if you're not doing anything else.

ACER is A+ 5 Star, touchscreen, has good keybooard, the battery last only for a day; u need to recharge it everyday.  My student graduated using ACER.  /  [On the other hand, the other product Tango has no external keyboard (I bought x2 nothing works and they made it hard to return; and I was unable to; bad customer support); i have to buy an externa keyboard for this Tango from entirely different company.  I am writing now at my Tango [this still works as secondary tablet]; because my son still has his ACER.

Bought this for my grand-daughter after being disappointed with another Chromebook purchase.  She was specific about the features she wanted.  Its being used for several hours at least 5 days per week, and is working satisfactorily since it was received.

Honestly I didn't know it was a tablet with a keyboard. I thought this was a mini laptop. Make sure you know that. The screen doesn't take up the whole screen area and the display is only 720p. You can't run steam, or the epic games launcher. So no CSGO during your lunch break. Apart from those points the screen feels well made and the keyboard and touch pad are ok. Overall its ok.

nice and small, quick enough for small and common tasks like email, texting, browsing and movie/music streaming. screen is clear, great keyboard and sound is good for the price. would buy again for sure

I've had this 1 day. Charged it, powered it up, got a walk-through of the set up. It already knows my Google settings including bookmarks and passwords, and frequently visited websites.  This was a concern because I didn't want to have to start all over. Not to worry! So far....AWESOME!
Excellent product! Perfect size, weight. Sound is amazing for its price and size. I purchased this for my 8th grader for elearning now and high school next year. Highly recommend!!
I use the laptop for school mainly and I have no complaints at all. I take really good care of the laptop and it’s still working the exact same as it did fresh out the box 5 months later.

Not worth the purchase. Chromebook just constantly restarts over and over OR the screen will go black, you only see your cursor, and then when it comes back you are back on the home screen with everything closed. Buyer beware.

I'm not completely ignorant of technology but I am definitely below basic. I usually have my husband or one of my kids set everything up for me. Not this time. I did it myself! Honestly, I cant even really boast about it because it was so easy it really doesn't qualify as any kind of accomplishment!

I love everything about this computer. I love the apps, touch screen, and you can use it as a tablet. I am also pleased that the battery lasts a long time. The keys on the keyboard are soft and I am comfortable when I type. I am very satisfied with this product.
The touch screen is great especially in tablet mode. The size is perfect for my on the go job.  The battery life is great and works all day during work and at home afterwards before needing a charge.

Broke my other chrome book tragically and kinda just picked the first up to date one I saw and I cannot say I’m disappointed. I didn’t even realize it was convertible into a tablet as it was the same exact price as my older one, very pleased with this purchase.

Mostly I love this thing. I've had it for several months now and it's got a lot of good things about it, but from time to time, the screen will just blank out when you change from laptop to tent mode (or vice versa) and I've recently started having issues with the keys on the right side of the keyboard (primarily the Backspace and Enter key) not working at all. I would recommend as a backup, but not your main computer for important tasks.

It's a great little computer. Compact. Battery life is good. No complaints except I've went thru 2 chargers in a month. It seems to burn through them and i don't know why. Its not left plugged in all the time or anything.

I was skeptical of buying a chromebook, so I did some research before buying this one.  I am happy with it, and actually have a higher opinion of them now.  They are perfect for general computing needs, where you don't need a $1000+ laptop.  Long battery life, serves every purpose we need right now.

It looks just like the picture on Amazon. Screen size is very nice. It does everything they advertised and was easy to set up. She is thrilled. I purchased it because it has the same feature the school chrome books have so my granddaughter can log into her school account to do certain work. She loves it. That is all I know about it.
I am very happy with this purchase.  Within 15 minutes, I was able to get up and running.  I had an Acer Chromebook so there was very little learning curve.

Speakers could be larger.  The sound is adequate but using blue tooth speakers or headphones / buds is advised .  Not for gaming the processor is not powerful enough to handle game but for photos, surfing and skype it works fine. I'm happy with mine.

I've only had it for a day but I can already tell it's 100 times better than my previous laptop.  I really love that it synced with my phone and everything was able to move over and is compatible.  I also like that if there's something I can't figure out it's as as as googling it since it's Google based.

I bought this for my child for school. The set up was fast, simple & sweet. The screen is clear and bright. It’s not too small like I thought it would be. I was able to set parental controls with ease. The keyboard is just the right size for her hands and the mouse pad has is smooth no glitching or delayed clicks.
It is a great computer, i can get my school work done on it. The inky problem is somerimes it drops wifi and it doesn't give a notification when the battery is getting love

Speaker is terrible. Bluetooth connects to my ear pods but sound wont play. Tried 2 different wireless ear pods and neither produced sound. Turned the system off/on and got one set to play, tried with the other and no sound, and then the 1st set again wouldn't work. Tried turning chromebook off/on again and still no sound, though bluetooth shows connected. Ear pods work with other devices. Too late for return. Wouldn't be such a disaster if the speaker wasn't the pits. My Galaxy Tab A tablet speaker is far superior.

It’s a good laptop for simple things like videos movies social media basic games it’s basically a big phone. Not all apps are able to run though. Like Ibotta. It’s not compatible. It’s lags if you have a lot going on in the background and if you don’t shut it off when you’re done using it. I noticed that when I just close it it gets slow but good news everything saves when you shut it off. I build websites so it’s great for anyone doing that kind of work.
Got this for my parents and they love it. Simple and comfortable. Touch feature and keyboard is perfect since my mom prefers to type and my dad pokes the screen. Wpukd definitely reccomend it.

This is my 2nd Chromebook and I lobe it. My 1st one still works after 5 years, but I use that one at work a lot. If you are looking for a laptop but don't need a lot of software, this is the kid for you. It boots up and shuts down quickly and is very fast all around. The camera works well too. Love it!

I love this. I use it every day. Gets the job done for zoom meetings and streaming. Highly recommend for those who are into these types of devices, especially college students. The battery life is long and takes fast to charge.
I thought I needed a full size lap top and love, love the smaller size of the chromebook! It is sleek, easy to set up and use. A lot of power. Great purchase.

All around great laptop,  used for web surfing,  watching Netflix,  playing seek and find games like June's Journey.  Set up was easy,  sign into Google and everything like my old Chromebook.  Love touch screen for games.

Do not buy this cheep crappy computer. We purchased it thinking it would be an affordable good Chromebook, but it doesnt connect to any printers, the 10 hour batter life is a total lie, and Amazon doesn't let you return it once you've opened it and tried the computer. DO NOT BUY THIS COMPUTER!!!!!!
Love touch screen! Great that it flips, not that i ever use it like that. Reasonably priced too! Battery doesnt seem to stay fully charged.  Use 1 day and 2 days later after nonuse, its on 25%.

Glitchy. I think I got a lemon. The cursor disappeared almost immediately and I have to power down and restart.  It happens more frequently and I have not even had it a full year.  I loved my old Chromebook but it started to fall apart after 5 years. This one, I'm not that happy with. It charges quickly, has great qualities but I'm not happy with how often I have to power it down. Wouldn't recommend for a serious user.

I am the polar opposite of a techy.  That being said, I absolutely love this versatile chromebook (my first chromebook).  It is fast, lightweight and super easy to use.  The touch screen and versatility seals the deal for me.  So happy with this purchase.
Incredible functionality. Better than I expected. Was delivered same day. I have had for several weeks and I am very pleased with the purchase. I would definitely recommend to others.
Got lots of features for a great price.  I thought it had a lighted keyboard but nope - one thing that's missing.  Love the full keyboard and touch screen.  Light weight, really long battery life
I had this computer before loved it the motherboard crashed..  ordered a new one and love it just the same it isn't something u can game with ...but on thr day to day its perfect.

I get text messages for the Treasure Truck and man am I glad I swooped on this! I was in the market for something I could use for work and personal and this popped up. I'm extremely happy with the size, weight and features. I love that I can use it as a laptop or a tablet!!

The hardware form factor for this convertible is excellent.  Unfortunately, if you are familiar with the Windows OS, you're going to HATE the Chrome operating system and quickly run into its application limitations.  This could be a good choice for students whose school has standardized Chromebooks or someone on a budget that doesn't allow for a Windows convertible like the amazing Lenovo Yoga.  This gift was sold 'As New' shortly after purchase.
Concerned about it getting warm when using. If child watches utube or a movie on it the screen will start to flicker or flench randomly every so often. Not sure if its a bad egg or they all do this?
Love how light the computer is and how you can flip it around and use as a tablet. Easy to cArry around everyday. Perfect for school, fits easily in back pack.

gave to my brother as a gift and he couldn't have said more about how great it was. fast, versatile, visually very clear screen, connects well with the internet... would definitely give again as a gift if needed to.

I bought this for my daughter for Christmas.  She really likes it, and I am happy if she is because I purchased it for her.  Amazon is good about getting packages to you in a timely manner even though I am not a Prime member.  Thanks for allowing me to order online and not have to worry about getting out amongst others especially during this Pandemic!

I absolutely love this laptop! The touch screen is amazing, it is a very nice size. sipped super fast too. it took 4 days to get here. The batter life seems to be good. The bluetooth works great. I totally recommend it!
Why buy a chrome book when it's not even compatible with Google apps. Lol very limited on apps you can install. Screen is nice. Lightweight. Good battery life. Just limited and seems like a let down.

This computer is fine for videos and social media.  I haven't been able to print anything from the computer, though.  I contacted support and they informed me it isn't compatible with all printers but they couldn't tell me which printers are compatible.  I have three different brands of printers that are able to print through wifi or usb but it won't work with any of them.  Huge waste of money!!  I have to use my old computer any time I want to print.  Would not recommend or buy another Acer.
Great Chromebook for my 13 yr old grandson. He was using a school Chromebook and can't believe how much faster and easier to get his pages up and he loves the touchscreen. Great Chromebook!

I bought two of these for my son.  Both needed to be RMAed for repairs. The first one the camera went bad.  They repaired it and then my son dropped it.  I hesitantly got him a replacement.  This one the power/usbc went bad less than a year in to owning it.  A few months later it went bad again, but then was a month after the 1 year manufacture warranty ended.  My son loved his chromebook and is so upset that it is broken again, but I am not going to pay to get it fixed. It's not worth it.

Wow great price and amazing little laptop great for my needs. As long as you know what a chrome book is and does this laptop's simply amazing. Love having this one as a touch screen my old one was not and I feel it needed it.

Update: after using a few months, there is a common ‘glitch’ watching movies/shows. The Chromebook picture will start to jump/wiggle a bit and then get stuck. (Think old school like a record skipping)

This thing rocks. I wanted my daughter to have Chromebook for remote school vs struggling along with the district provided ipad or a big computer. Great solution, I just wish I could find a nice form fitting case., There's a bunch of these random acer models, and this one unfortunately doesn't yet have a great solution. shame because it's awesome.

This device used to be OK. These days, however, the time from opening it up to being able to do anything at all is getting longer and longer. For example, the time from startup to closing a tab (ie not doing anything especially difficult) is somewhere around 2 minutes now. That is, one can do absolutely nothing for 2 minutes after start up. The screen jumps to life within seconds, but one is locked out of doing anything for those 2 minutes. No buttons, no key clicks will be accepted.
While it may not be the most flashy computer for the price and what you get put of it, it may just be the best tool I have had for my college experience and I would highly recommended!

Very hesitant about buying a Chromebook, especially a refurbished one. But this Acer spin 311, is really cool. It can do everything and more that my windows laptop can do and it does much faster. And the refurbished one seems to me to be brand new. I couldn't be happier.

I got this because I wanted a small lightweight computer, mainly for web browsing and video streaming.  This does that well.  My only complaint is sometimes the wifi will drop out when I am connected to my phone.

This is our second acer chrome book and we are very happy.  These were purchased for our children and they are easy for them to use.  They’re tough, durable, and simple to operate.  All at a great price point.  Would highly recommend and would definitely buy again!

Got this for the wife to use.  She's not ream smart so this simple chromebook was exactly the answer.  It does what she needs without paying for features she doesn't.  She has gotten so good at it she is thinking about working in IT now.

I bought this for my kid to use in kindergarten and 1st grade. Unfortunately, it did not handle virtual schooling very well. It freezes up a lot during zoom calls, forcing a reboot. The battery does not last for a half day of zoom calls, with some breaks in between. The screen quality is meh. The storage is not good and he was barely able to fit many apps. I regret the purchase and now wish I hadn't bought it, and had just spent more on a quality Chromebook.

This was my second Chromebook purchase. Very good. Lighter and more nimble than I expected; flips from laptop to tablet really easily but still feels like sturdy construction. Very happy with this machine so far.

The laptop is gorgeous and of good quality material; it's not a flimsy little thing, but a very sturdy and beefy like the more expensive ones. I haven't run it yet, so I don't know about the performance, but from the looks of things, it will probably be just fine.

I just purchased my ACER chromebook in January 2021 (today it is March 23rd 2021) and my "Gorilla Glass" screen is CRACKED! Mind you I've been working on this chromebook all morning and it hasnt left my side so your guess is as good as mine on how this actually happened. The product has not been hit, dropped, damaged, ect.

Trying to configure an account on this by following the guides on line and many of the steps outlined by the guides are not available on this turkey.  Example:  Trying to get Chrome browser to open in the home page and it continuously opens into the Google search page.  Tried everything and just will not change.  Going back to Windows.

Love the computer so far. Screen looks great . My only issue is it has went black a couple times. I use it for work , I am a little rough at times , working mobile , rushing in and out of my vehicle . I've googled how to try and get screen back on . So far so good. It has came back on . The size is perfect for me working on the go .

I purchased 2 of these chrome books for my children to do their online schooling. They have worked flawlessly. The touchscreen is a handy feature, and the kids love that the screen goes all the way back to use it in tablet mode.

I was worried about finding a good quality laptop online but I’m happy with the purchase I made. I needed a laptop for my schooling and this one gets the job done. It’s fast with loading what I need up, the battery life is great, the keyboard works good (im still getting use to the shortcut buttons but you can customize what you want for it in the settings), overall I love it and recommend this 2-in-1 laptop
This computer is good for checking e-mail and shopping.  The processor is not powerful enough to keep up with PCH  games.  The screen freezes up after you add the fourth window.
This computer is everything that I need to get my school work and other needed task complete. It's lightweight and easy to use. Highly recommended for the touch screen capabilities.
so great! Got these for my kids for distance learning and they have been really awesome. They are 4 and 5 and have been able to navigate them really well. I love the Google parental controls.

I am terribly frustrated with this Chromebook. I use Office 365 with my work (bought this for work), and I travel a lot. The size and weight were appealing to me. But this thing locks up all the time with Office products. Word, Excel, OneDrive, and the Outlook apps freeze constantly, won't finish saving, saves but suddenly it isn't available to email... it's debilitating. Any help would be appreciated.

This computer is so good, I bought 2 of them. Very responsive and works great for video calls / Zoom. If you plug into a docking station it's almost like a real computer. For the price, it's very capable and the touch screen works much better than expected.

I absolutely love it! I have had it for about 2 months now and no problems. It is smaller than my other Chromebook so it is easy to carry with me. I love that it folds and turns into a tablet. The battery doesn't last as long as my other but it is still good.

So happy with my purchase. Was hesitant about it at first so I canceled my order the first go around and due to financial reasons but here I am typing on it now leaving this review and I'm happy I stuck with my gut which was saying "get the damnnn thing" hahaha. Love that it's touch screen, my hands just slides over the keyboard. Merry Christmas to me, Happy 2021 to all!! Cheers
I usually am not a fan of chromebooks but this is pretty freaking cool. Battery life is good. The tablet part is not so shabby either. It's a hit in this household.

For what it does it does well.  That being said there are cheaper options that compete with it performance.  But, it looks sleek, the screen is sharp, and you'll look good using it on your college campus.  It's just that I already graduated so looks (of my laptop) aren't a priority.  But, my mom would love it!

I purchased this laptop less than three months ago. It stopped working and after 45 minutes on the phone, they'll send me a return authorization in a couple of days so I can ship it off for them to work on. My last Acer purchase ever -- and I had just bought a new desktop that hasn't come out of its box. It's on its way back too.

I was skeptical at first because the nature of the product seemed to good to be true for the price however I took a risk and it payed off. When I first turned it on I did go to the play store however it kept closing it out. However I just let the laptop run for a little bit without touching it and it ran fine. LOVE IT.

ACer Chromebook stopped working after 2 months. No power and would not turn on. The only way to get it to work is to unplug the internal battery which requires taking out 12 small screws in the back, unplugging the battery and plugging it back in then reinstalling the screws. pretty hard to do in the middle of a high school class.
The purpose has been achieved.  It doesn't have a touch screen and the battery life seems a bit less than my former Samsung.  All aspects are above average. A very good buy.

The first one i received wouldn't power on.  The second one works, however the built in speaker isn't very loud.  To use for any kind of application requiring sound, you need to be right next to it.  Not very useful for video or music apps.

This is very nice however because I don't have internet at my home and have to go to a friend's house to use theirs at the moment I couldn't use this for working on my book I am starting. Because it doesn't come with that option to write pre installed. You have to download stuff on a app store.

Completely pleased with product! Sort of a side note the price was only $5 or 10 less than Walmart. I purchased it on Prime day along with some other items that totaled ~$370 and only saved  $40 ; that's barely sales tax. I guess I need to learn a better Prime day strategy ! ;-{

It's one of the best pick I have had for this money. For a person who just wants to surf internet, watch movies and videos, it's the best product at cheap cost, light weight and easier to carry around, it's a very small screen but if you take into account the size of the phone where we spend most of the time on Instagram and YouTube I wouldn't complain about this size. The only drawback I found was that, it does not have a HDMI port, meaning you cannot connect to any kind of monitor or projecter.

I thought a normal tablet would work for what I like to do that is not using my desktop.  When I ordered this product, I was not sure if I would like it.  However, I love it!  I would buy it again in a heartbeat!

The ACER Chromebook is everything it claimed. I have no problem with the machine itself. HOWEVER, This statement is FALSE = Chromebooks come with built-in storage for offline access to your most important files and an additional 100GB of Google Drive space to ensure that all of your files are backed up automatically.

I like this computer. It is easy to use and has a great battery life. It charges quickly as well. I like how I can position the screen multiple ways and am able to turn it into a tablet. I really feel like I got a great deal for the price.
Got it for a Christmas gift so it is still in the box but it looked good packaged and it even came with a case which is a good bonus.

This is a fantastic computer. My kids love it since they can flip it around and use it like a tablet. I love that it has the keyboard so I can use it for work. I also like that we each have our own log in. My files won't be messed up. It was super easy to set up. Overall, I would buy it again and may end up doing that so we don't have to share.

Never used Chromebook before but it is easy to learn even for those who are technically challenged. Love the versatility even though it's not detachable. It seems Chromebook operating system's usability is according to size, so there may be some disappointment depending on what you would like to accomplish or if you use it like an apple or Windows product. What it offers however can get the job done if you learn Chromebook.

This is an awesome laptop. My wife loves it. My kids love it (9, 6, & 4). I was unaware that ChromeOS was not compatible with iTunes. Thankfully I was still able to reboot our old laptop in order to reset my son’s iPad when he forgot his password. Probably would’ve gone with a windows-based device had I realized that. I guess I should’ve known there was a reason all the schools around here were handing out chrome books to all the kids. Outstanding laptop for the price.

This is a great laptop. The only 2 things I dislike is how the "desktop/home screen" isn't actually the "home screen". You have to go to a seperate screen to access it. The 2nd thing is that I wish there were more than just 2 USB ports.

I purchases this for almost 50%of during Prime Days and that is the ONLY reason I am not completely upset.  Zoom doesn't work because it freezes every 5 minutes.  The TouchPad won't work either.  None of the "tricks" are fixing the issue either.  I haven't had it long enough to not work and I have a work laptop I use 95% of the time.  Still debating whether to send it back. Don't purchase this or you may be frustrated as well.

I use a laptop for simple emails, web searches, social media, various apps, accessing pix and docs on Google drive, etc.  For those purposes this is more than adaquate and for the price - it's a great deal.  I'm very satisfied.
Like Jakey's Mom wrote in their review, we experienced the black screen of doom on two of these devices. One was used for 9 months. The other for 2 days. Will not purchase this again.

The computer looks very good the only problem that I had with it was it goes in and out of touch screen and touch pad, sometimes it will lock on on all the touchscreen and I won’t be able to access the keyboard or the mouse
Overall, it is a very nice, well performing device for doing school work and maintaining email. The camera quality is very low. Not my first choice device when needing to meet remotely.
I can do everything i need to do linked to my home pc and phone. Can access ay file i need and with my NEW 64G flash drive, I can easily transfer files without congestion.

We bought this for my daughter’s school year since they are distance learning. She loves the swivel screen and the touchscreen. Exactly what we needed. Plus it’s nice and light for her to carry around.

This is my second Chromebook and it offers a lot of updates from my first machine.  What burned my biscuits was that it was already two plus years into its short life even though it was right off the shelf!  I can understand a few months but more than 2 years!  This machine should be discounted 25% to make up for the years lost.

I got this is good faith that it would work, yea did, until a month ago. I am so disgusted with it. It is hard to make things move,  The styler or my fingers won't make the screen move or go out of a page, it takes to many times to get it to accept what I want to do, now it is jammed with the Google logo on a white screen, can't get out of it no matter what I do.

Based on the spec, I don't have a high expectation of the performance given Intel Celeron N4000 CPU etc. I simply use it for lots of chrome based web office work. So the battery, screen resolution etc. is good enough. I bought it on sale which is a good deal. Otherwise, I would buy an iPad instead.
Have it delivered to my country in just a couple of days, and got one extremely happy kid learning at school! Touch screen works great, and the convertible spin is awesome!

“I wanted to use it for homework and play a lot of games and my favorite is Roblox but the processor isn’t the best so it just can’t process anything and it’s barely playable. The only games that are playable are to 2D games. But it’s fine for homework.” Written by my 10-yr-old son

When I found Chrome OS to be ill-suited to my needs, I tried to install an alternative OS or boot from a USB stick. After much research, I learned that Acer, together with Google, have prevented the mainboard from loading any OS other than ChomeOS, either from the internal SSD drive or from a USB stick. What's more, in 9 years, this device will be a brick. Even though it might be perfectly functional hardware-wise, Google will just turn it off.
The outside got scratched up super easy, touchscreen works battery runs low quickly but of course my kids are doing lots of work / schoolwork on it. They like the touch screen thou.

This laptop/tablet is a great personal tool and game device. I use it for email, word processing, and spreadsheets. The size is perfect for using in an easy chair. The touch screen is great, and very responsive. I can use the touch screen in lieu of the keyboard, if I wish. The screen is a high quality and very durable. So far the battery life is fantastic.
Love this.  Use it sooo much.  I just wish it could be used as a touch screen without the keys sticking out.  I keep feeling like I am gonna hit something and break it.
Bought for homeschooling and video appointments. Works great for all of it.  Easy for my 5yo to use.  Can download all the apps I need.  And it was also an amazing price.

I bought them for my children since the online class seems to continue this year at our school. Really nice, and they can play with games too. Not to mention, online school, such as Adventure academy works great!

Late posting a review but wanted to share my experience with the product. I purchased the computer in July 2020. Two days after the warranty went out, it wouldn't turn on. I had to contact support. We finally got it working by hitting the refresh and power button. It worked correctly for a month after that. I contacted support again and they told me it probably has a dead battery. The battery didn't last a year.

Updated to 5 stars after a month of use.  Given the price point, this is an excellent laptop for the price and I've enjoyed using it.  ChromeOS has made a lot of improvements and I'm using not only chrome, but Android apps and Linux applications.  Good power, good battery, USB-C ports and power, micro-SD port, great touch screen, etc.  My only dislikes are the lack of a lighted keyboard and wasted screen real-estate of the unusually wide bevels.  That said, I'm making this laptop a hand-me-down and purchasing something with a better screen.

If they'd shipped it when they said they would, I'd've given more stars.  It's a great device.  I bought two. I even paid extra.  My kids went a week in college without receiving it, because they gave false dates/expectations in delivery.

The Acer Chromebook Spin 311 is a huge upgrade from my previous Chromebook and it suits most of my needs. I purchased it because of it's price and convertible design. The limited internal storage space and poor camera are the biggest drawbacks in my opinion. Depending on what you plan to use his for, this might be a great low cost option. There are a lot of other devices out there in this price range though. I think it's important to find out what features matter most to you before you decide.
This is supposed to be my games device, but I don't like the pad screen, it hurts my fingers due to my arthritis. I can't use a mouse on it.

So I bought this to originally hook up to my cricut. Well turns out it's not compatible with the cricut cutter. Not gonna lie, it's a disappointment but so far it seems like a good quality little chromebook. I could still use it to watch Netflix, play games, etc.

I really like this laptop. We use it for online school and it’s really easy to use. My 9 year old has no issues navigating it. I like how it’s lightweight and quick to charge. Overall it’s a great laptop for light work. Wouldn’t recommend it for gaming.

This is a great little Chrome book for distance learning. My son uses it for Zoom classes and that’s what we bought it for. When not on zoom he uses it to complete work. The battery could last longer but it does charge super quickly.
There is a quirk! When being used as a tablet it freezes. I have to fold it back as a laptop periodically for it to resume what I was working on. That's annoying. Other than that, I really like it.

This is my first experience with a Chromebook. I recommend taking the tutorial to get acquainted with keyboard shortcuts (for instance where's the delete key?). Using it mostly for web surfing, streaming and photo compilation. App based interface is similar to your phone, very intuitive. Fast boot-up time. Good battery life. Nice touch screen.
The Acer support does not have the technical expertise to fix the problem with their own product and Google support is worthless because they say it's not their problem and they contact Acer.

Product works well as expected and is pretty snappy for web surfing. The only thing I noticed was the left hinge was not installed straight but at an angle. It doesn't seem to be a problem for opening and flipping the device all the way around though.

Absolutely, this Chromebook offers plenty of bang for your buck considering certain features that it offers, such as transforming into a tablet. Now this is a device for those who want a budget friendly device and more for casual use its not going to win any awards, but it does the job a feature that people will appreciate is the use of type-c charging which can make charging a lot more easier and expandable memory. If you are in the market for an affordable Chromebook , but want decent quality give this one a go it won`t disappoint.

I found this chromebook to be lightweight and very mobile. It was also convertible, which made it more versatile. Visually, it looked elegant, and the keyboard was big and comfortable to use. The touch screen was responsive and I had no issues with it, though I prefer using a mouse so I connected one as well. I found the picture and sound quality to be as expected, and had no problems with the webcam. Overall, this was a decent chromebook.
It allows me to work around the house without having to carry a bulky laptop around I can just flip it into a tablet and go but the keyboard there if I need it .
Bought this for my grandson.  Chromebooks are the way to go.  Very easy to set up.  He is able to quickly access the internet for school projects and games.  Great value!
I hesitated a lot for choosing the Chromebook for my 10 years old boy that needs a computer at school, and some ratings were not good but I honestly feel that perfectly does the job for him.
Does not work. No response from shady seller after 1 week, 3 requests and multiple frustrating chats with Amazon CS. Amazon Customer Service is a joke and this seller is not reputable.

This has worked perfect for our 3rd grader doing online schooling though out the summer. It works great for google classroom, YouTube, Netflix, and general internet browsing. I really have no complaints about it, we have been using it for over a month now. It charges up with any USB-C PD charger.

We purchased this for our daughter for virtual school during COVID-19.  She already has an iPad , but were told by the school iPads were not allowed and they recommend a Chromebook.  We purchased this one based on reviews and limited supply.

My first laptop or tablet I've had.  I had no knowledge of either and this was so easy to get used to.  Called the tech support number who helped me to get going and I'm off to the races.  Love this Chromebook!!  It is so nice and battery holds 10 hours.  Totally satisfied!  Putting the 2 in 1 works amazing
