Wow, this laptop is incredible and the best I've ever owned. The battery life alone is stunning. I can go all day on this thing without a single charge. When it's at 5%, it still lasts a good thirty minutes. The fact that all docs get saved to google drive makes it a great backup in case anything happens, and it makes everything streamlined and decluttered. The touch screen is a bonus, as it the way it can work as a tablet. Also, this thing is *FAST*

It was good to use good quality picture was awesome it charged then a month later it won't charge anymore we couldn't charge it couldn't turn it on I couldn't do nothing with it so it sits on the side of our couch don't know what to do with it would like to get our money back for it cuz we just bought another one from you guys

Much faster and of course newer than my old Acer 15" Chromebook, which was one of the first 15" models they made and the only 15" Chromebook on the market when I bought it. I got this because I wanted something good for couch surfing and my old Chromebook doesn't support Android apps so it was starting to feel very limited in use. I decided on this model after reading a lot of positive reviews, which mainly turned out to be for the last model that uses this devices same name.

Es una tremenda máquina. Corre bien los juegos, el paquete de adobe, entre otros. Considerar que su pantalla es un poco frágil se raya con facilidad. Su configuración para aumentar el espacio interno es ASOMBROSO. Precio justo para una monstruosidad.

I knew it was not touchscreen when I bought it, so I am not sure why it asked me to rate the touchscreen. Picture is great, I added more ram and brought the total up to 64 GB and have had no issues as of yet. I have been gaming for over 30 years and am not ashamed to pull this out at our conventions.

This computer arrived dead and would not charge. All connections were checked.  Tried multiple outlets. Contacted ACER to troubleshoot, we did so with no changes. Had to return the laptop. Ordered a replacement. After a week, the replacement arrived, and the same thing happened again. Do not waste your time with this product. Idk if this is a scam or what, but you will not receive what you’re hoping to. Beware. Just very disappointing for my teen. :(

I normally don't write reviews but I was so impressed I had to. First of all, came 3 days sooner than predicted which is a win of itself. The packaging was pretty well protected and came with a nice little lanyard. The display is sharp and the speed is fast. It didn't break the bank overall a great laptop
I guess this is the best value for your money when it comes down to decent laptop.  I finally upgraded from an old Dell laptop (12 years old) which at the time was top notch.  First the cons:

I've been using this laptop for a little over a week now and it's been solid all across the board. Fans are pretty quiet (Similar to Asus Strix\RoG laptops) The CPU is obnoxiously powerful. I can't say anything about the RAM because I replaced mine to 32GB almost instantly.
Bueno: Buen procesador, acabado ligero, extensible, las teclas se sienten bien al tacto, la pantalla es bonita, bastante potencia y el nitro sense te deja configurar la potencia a usar.
The computer came dead and unable to charge. A complete disappointment. And Amazon did NOT refund the purchase for days after I sent it back. I highly discourage  a big item purchase through Amazon.
I like the laptop for gaming, I am able to stream as well. I will say the HD and Memory size is a bit underwhelming but very easy to upgrade.
The laptop came dead on arrival. No power and the  charging indicator light also would NOT turn on. The charger is working because I tested it on my other laptop. Laptop itself is dead.

I saw some of the reviews on here saying you couldn’t run certain games but I’ve had little to no issues at at. One of the things I noticed when I first launched a game was the lag on the game, but I just needed to do an update on the computer and it stopped lagging. So if you start lagging, make sure your lap top is up to date.
My son ask for this as a gift , we're in different  countries, bought  it and send to him only to know the part font fit . Don't buy 4m this site

I'm very disappointed by acer. When I first got the laptop it was not charging. After leaving it for around 24 hours in charge, it started working. Now it's been around 7 month and the laptop is dead. Can't understand why this happened. Amazon would not help me to get it fixed. I will not buy Acer again.
I bought a model from tem years ago SAme case Chassis, It was horrible gpu burned out easily within 3 months of use, Hate to tell you nerds but ACER makes bad LAptops.

After many reviews I came to the decision to decide on this laptop but after the arrival of this unit, it won't power on and the cable used to charge won't work with the unit and therefore won't charge.  Proper evaluation of the laptop to determine if it functioned correctly would have been a good idea before shipping it.

I love using this laptop that's faster, more powerful and more smooth. It won't cause any freezed. It might be a bit hot when you're playing high quality games, it has two powerful fans that exhaust hot air to keep it runs well. It is a bit noisy, but I'm sure it's really worth it.

I am really impressed with this laptop. With the i7-11800H processor and turbo it is fast. One thing that I read in other reviews is to push the power connector until you hear it snap in place. As I was exploring and learning about the machine, I wanted to look at the BIOS. The PDf manual said to push the F2 key when the logo was displayed. Wrong! press and hold the F2 key and then push the power button. Bonus feature - pressing the F2 key at the logo does a fast boot.

I spent a while deciding on a lower end gaming machine to get after growing weary of PSN offerings over the last few years. Have been a console player on PSN for 27 years and wanted a good machine to start my PC adventures again. For PC Gaming you have to have good gear. And man can this machine deliver! It boots up and shuts down in about 5-7 seconds and flys through games and apps. I'm running Xbox live, Steam, Epic games with no issues.

This lap top is junk do not buy. I’ve had this nitro 5 for 1 year and the mother board is toast. Tried to contact acer and they told me it was out of warranty. This lap top maybe had a weeks worth of use and it’s already junk. Don’t go cheap buy American

After paying a chunk of money for this laptop, you'ld think that it would be well protected for shipping with something more than one sheet of paper.  Look at the size of that shipping box!  Sure hope it works...
*** UPDATE 8/13/2020 -- I updated drivers, and RTX 3050 is now running 58-65 FPS on Ultra, and 93-98 FPS on High settings.  I must have needed an update, this is a legitimate gaming Laptop! ***

I may be biased or underqualified.... as my laptop I am upgrading from is 8 years old and was not a gaming laptop. This thing rocks! Definitely a massive upgrade from my Dell Vostro 3558 with a Intell 5500 UHD graphics card (a pretend graphics card).

TL; DR: The Acer Nitro 5 AN515-55-53E5 Gaming Laptop is an entry-level gaming-capable computer. Its out-of-the-box specs are underwhelming, but some can be upgraded, like RAM and hard drive space. The RTX 3050 is the cheapest house in the fancy neighborhood. It’s a solid starter GPU for current games, but temper your frame rate and detail expectations. The Comet Lake i5 CPU is capable, but can run hot. Get used to the fans. Don’t pay more than MSRP, given you’ll need to fork out some extra money on ram and another SSD to meet basic storage needs.

The laptop had been delivered to and when I tried to turn it on after plugging it up. It didn't show a amber light or when press the power button it was still unresponsive. Crazy thing about this product is that will have a fifty-fifty chance of being delivered dead or working. Not worth the money on playing a game of chance.
I bought two, my kids use them to play games on work well for that they can play any game out to date, the computer is capable they are good laptops do what they are supposed to do

The lap top is working as expected, with 800 USD you were able to get a 3050 GPU, which is good for most light duty game like CS go, DOTA2, etc. Which is good enough for me. Unlike those ultra book, this one has slot RAM and can be upgrade to like 32GB and another stat HDD slot, but they don't include cable and socket. I believe you'd have to do some research how to solid one. It looks like a good deal for light gamer.

This is the best gaming laptop you can buy in its price class. It even outperforms some more expensive options. Big screen (for a laptop), strong CPU and GPU, enough memory, and a 1TB SSD. The only downside (and this is very minor): You quickly run out of battery while gaming. But that's the price you pay for a bigger than average screen, coupled with both a strong CPU and GPU.
Got this machine for my kids for general use and gaming.  There were a few negative Amazon reviews which I wanted to add some perspective to - in case it helps someone.

Normalmente la batería dura unas 5 horas o menos, aunque nada mas vea vídeos, si esta encendida pero en modo de espera si dura 8 horas o mas pero la bateria se gasta también. Pero sigue siendo una buena laptop y cumple su funcion al momento de jugar con altos requisitos.

The computer is excellent. As a gaming laptop, the Acer Nitro 5 offers decent value. A really nice feature is the backlit keyboard and very comfortable to use as well. The display is decent, certainly not the best, but not terrible either.

If you're looking for a affordable gaming laptop, I'm sure this model came up. I mean, it looks cool, pricing appears reasonable, and there's room for upgrades, so what's not to like right? Well if only it was that simple.
THIS PRODUCT IS TERRIBLE 1 hour after getting it as a gift it would not charge whatsoever do not waste your money on this terrible device. (Yes, i pushed it down really hard so it would charge)

It's RAM is kinda bluh but I'm planning on buying myself memory sticks! It's a really good laptop though and I'm enjoying being able to have a gamer laptop for the price of a normal one? It's keyboard doesn't stay lit, but I'm sure that makes it more worth it in the end. Because it prioritized your laptop's energy over all else.

Awesome laptop with an awesome price. I could not give any higher praise. And it is easily upgradeable. The RAM can be upgraded, and I bought the Crucial RAM 8GB DDR4 3200MHz CL22 here on Amazon. Easily installed to give the laptop a total of 16GB but you can upgrade it even higher. Next upgrade will be a 1TB SSD, because the only part that would take away from this amazing laptop is the low amount of storage but their are options to increase that as well. I only got the 256GB SSD.

I purchased this as a Christmas gift but it would not turn on, even after attempting to charge overnight.  I was sent a replacement, which would arrive after Christmas. I was extremely disappointed to say the least. Luckily, the replacement works.

I thought it was dead on arrival, but you have to really pay attention to how you plug it the port in the back. There is an extra pin that clicks when you push a little harder. I learned this after a mild panic attack and much research.

After much digging, I found that the processor (IIRC) supports 128GB of RAM. I'm not sure how much the MoBo supports, however, running the Crucial test, it stated that I could upgrade to 64GB of RAM, so I did.

This gaming system is a great setup when you want to be able to do both gaming and work from the same system. It's got the power to play online games with ease, but also isn't so over the top that it makes it difficult to work on, I'm able to play games in the evening like Fallout very smoothly without freezing or crashing, but also work from it during the day without having a lot of extras going on.

In terms of gaming, this laptop is on the low-end. You’ll want an RTX 3060, or preferably a 3070 for excellent visual quality especially if you plan to use your laptop hooked up to a nice monitor or TV. Personally, I use an ultra-high-end desktop with an RTX 3090 founder’s edition for high-end 4K gaming. Meanwhile this laptop is my go-to for playing my favorite MMOs, even when I’m traveling for work. The high refresh rate is exactly what I need for gaming.

So  far the product  has  worked well however the power adaptor needs to  be inserted  and  pushed all  the way in and flush with the  back of  the  laptop. The images  in the user  manual are not  accurate  and thus can make  the initial  set up  confusing .  Before you return  it please see if your ac adapter is pushed in all the way, May help!

Everything is good whit this laptop, gmes like assassin's creed vanhalla runs at 60fps perfectly, apex legends at 110 fps, but the only thing microphone cames whit an issue, and is an internal issue is not the drivers or settings, is may something on motherboard, is no good it really sucks because you are paying more than 1K$ for this laptop, acer or amazon or the providers must be sure that Everything is in perfect conditions before sent it
So far a month in and this thing just annihilates every game I put infront of it to play. Definitely an incredible machine. Runs games fast with 0 hiccups beautiful graphics quality.

I got the version with the better processor and more ram—this thing will play modern games really well but not maxed out. The only thing that’s really bad with this laptop is the speakers are just terrible, quiet and tinny. A couple times in a brighter room I wish the screen would get a little brighter but overall great value!

The laptop is great, I have the i5-10300H / RTX3050 version and runs pretty good. On Grand Theft Auto 5 I run with mods, (singleplayer) and get about 60-100 fps and that's with some shader mods. I also have tried destiny 2 and runs amazing no lag and runs smooth. ATS (American Truck Simulator) runs great even with Ultra graphical settings.
If the lights don't show, try pushing in adapter all the way in, I got worried until I found it, the adapter needed to go all the way in, it's a bit stiff but yeah works just fine and is amazing

I’m so sad, I got this for Christmas and it doesn’t even turn on. I plugged it in and no lights or anything. I’m just so bummed I got this for Christmas and my heart lit up with joy only to just crumple up when the computer doesn’t even work. Don’t buy this, save yourself from the misery on Christmas morning.

Great laptop for the price. Will run any game you throw at it with no problems. Some extremely demanding games will be limited to high settings instead of ultra because of the 4gb of VRAM. However if you're gaming on the laptop screen it's very hard to perceive any difference between medium/high and ultra settings because of the pixel density of a 1080p 15.6" display.
THIS PRODUCT IS TERRIBLE 1 hour after getting it as a gift it would not charge whatsoever do not waste your money on this terrible device. (Yes, i pushed it down really hard so it would charge)

I'm "late" to the game (pun intended) with my review as there are already a few very complete and competent ones before mine.  I agree with just about everything there, so I'll just add a few of my own thoughts.

Great value for a baseline gaming laptop. Added a 1tb storage M2, and dual rank memory. FPS in Desriny2 went from 60ish to 90ish on average with less dipping. Using Nvidia optimized settings and video to only use the graphics card.I have it sitting on an angled base to raise the screen and for better airflow. Running the cooling in auto. BIOS does not support XMP, and I not sure it is using the dual rank config but it runs as expected. the picture of the box is how it arrived, no padding…really….

So the product came not charged I thought it was broken so I ordered a new one the new one didn’t work either it was because I didn’t plug it in the right way it’s like very confusing to plug it in and kinda complicated cuz you have to turn push turn then push the plug in the computer for it to charge

This laptop is great for gaming if you can upgrade the ram to 16 instead of the factory installed one. It will run great for your standard blizzard rpg games, league of legends and riot based games, and almost all non-cpu intensive games like gta5.
This is a great computer for its value. It gets the job done with the majority of games i play. I just wish that it was shipped it better condition. Computer works great nothing wrong thankfully
Everything it was said to be.  Battery life is a little on the short side even when you're not really doing anything.  But other then that, can't recommend it enough.

So, at first I thought it was dead on arrival.. I tried different outlets and all.. I was even requesting to a refund.. but I know this sounds like a simple fix.. step 1. Relax, Step 2. Put back the power cable and use a bit more force till you hear a click.. trust me.. I thought I was using enough force at first.. it should show the indicator light.. then switch it on.. good luck 🤞🏾
Just opened it and got it setup, but so far I like it. Acer is a good company, especially for the price. I cannot wait to start gaming on here!!
This thing is awesome. The only thing I can say that isn't great is the speaker quality. The speakers suck. But that's a easy fix. So I still gave it 5 stars because I truly love this computer.

Very fast for the money. Upgraded the NVME drive to 2TB and memory to 32GB 9TEAMGROUP T-Force Zeus DDR4 SODIMM 32GB 3200MHz (PC4-25600) 260 Pin CL22 Laptop Memory Module Ram - TTZD432G3200HC22-S0100. Works perfect! Battery life pretty decent at 4-5 hours medium use. Wifi is fast and Screen looks great for everyday surfing and movies.
Like the keypad lighting up in sometimes dark areas of work. Light and easy to carry in one hand while open. Powerful enough for what I use it for which is mainly HVAC controls and literature

I was skeptical on getting the laptop when I saw some negative reviews about it being DOA and not charging. Fortunately, after reading other reviews, I decided to bite. This laptop is definitely worth the money. I use it for school and for gaming. It's the best of both worlds. It runs smoother than my desktop and it plays games beautifully. I have no issues transferring my external hard drive between my laptop and desktop for my steam games which is awesome as well.

Fantastic motion flow during live FPS heavy operation. I was most blown away by the insane Wi-Fi abilities though! The killer Wi-Fi feature is so proficient that it’s consistently getting stronger upload/download speeds than my new M1 Pro chip & Asus zen book.
I love this laptop, it is able to play almost every modern game at fps over 40 and most stay above 60 if their settings are set for boosting fps.
Me encanta no pensé que sería tan hermosa y cómo mueve los juegos y para los que no les carga empujen hasta escuchar un click la Pc trae un seguro
Acer Nitro 5 AN515-57-79TD Gaming Laptop | Intel Core i7-11800H | NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050 Ti Laptop GPU | 15.6" FHD 144Hz IPS Display | 8GB DDR4 | 512GB NVMe SSD | Killer Wi-Fi 6 | Backlit Keyboard

When I plugged it in there was no life no lights whatsoever. Was very disappointed but when I called customer service they said to make sure the charger that is on the laptop end make sure it clicks in properly. And that was it! It started up right away. I thought it was not working my son was very upset. But it was pretty simple issue. So if you have this problem just make sure you hear a click sound when you plug the laptop in charge

The cpu is 2.5ghz, but it has 4.5ghz turbo. So I am happy. It shows 4.2+ghz on task manager and I tested doom and got steady 120+hz. I upgraded with another 8gb ram and 1tb ssd for only about another $100 so for around $900 I am very happy with this purchase!

also the 3050ti died, within a couple days.  also the cpu and gpu (when it was working) was getting super hot due to all the bloatware, these slim laptops weren't meant for power house hardware packed into tiny compartments.

My eldest child had tech requirements for his laptop when entering his freshman year of quality. This particular Acer checked and exceeded every requirement AND I was able to make payments. Not only has it served its purpose academically, but my son has enjoyed the graphics and speed for gaming as well.

Acer has built a really nice entry-level gaming laptop here that's quite capable (scoring over 4900 points in Time Spy)  and relatively nice looking - it has some gamer aesthetic touches like the red vents on the back and the red keyboard lighting but nothing too showy.

My Alien finally died on me and I was at a loss.  After a decent amount of grieving time, I decided it was time to start looking for a new PC.  I am pretty picky about my computers since I do a lot of gaming.  I after reading the reviews on this one, and decided it sounded pretty decent despite a couple of negative reviews about the keyboard.
I purchased this for school work, & to use with my Oculus Quest 2 to play Steam VR & Oculus Rift games. Works like a charm. Great package for the money.

Very happy with the laptop.  Will upgrade the memory but was still a good deal. I am a little apprehensive about the hinges as the look awful flimsy and each hinge is only about 2 inches each.  We will see if it holds up to a preteen gamer…

On August 30, I bought ten of these laptops for my students. One of the students had a bad charger. I contacted Acer support on September 15. It's been nearly a month. No contact from Acer support. I'm on support chat with them now and they said, "I see no records of sending the charger because when you contacted us the first time, the device was out of warranty." Evidently, Acer only offers a 15-day support window. I'm switching to DELL.

It’s a really good laptop. It can run so many games! I play Valorant, Minecraft, OW and more and I haven’t came across any issues while gaming. I also use it for school when I’m not playing anything. I suggest having it plugged in while using it/playing, other than that, everything is gooood, I’m really happy with it! :D

I wanted a gaming laptop but didn't need anything super high-end. I am getting into graphic design and wanted something that would last me a while and have enough under the hood to do what I need. I haven't started with graphic design as of yet (my next moderate purchase is a good graphics tablet) but I have been using it for gaming and literally everything else it is superb.

I got my computer on February 1st. It had a defective screen. I sent it to Acer. It took them two days to get my a shipping label. It took seven days for it to reach them. After they had it for a week, they could not give me an ETA on when repairs would be finished. I finally got it back today, on the 25th, and immediately returned it to Amazon because I had to have a functional computer and couldn't hold onto my loaner without a solid estimate for when I'd get this one back.

My wife and I like to do some casual gaming now and then, and the most intensive games that we've played in the past year are Divinity Original Sin 2, 7 Days to Die, and L4D2.  We general don't need the fastest computers to get decent framerates at 1080p.
Donot waste your money.  It arrived dead and would not turn on.  I bought it for my son’s birthday.  Not only it arroved broken but also was late on delivery!
It is very fast, the screen quality is great as well and I definitely would recommend you purchase this. You can upgrade as well because it came with the attachments for upgrading the RAM

This is amazing quality for the price. I am able to play any game I want at the highest speeds and metrics. I haven't used the touch screen, but anticipate it would work just as well as everything else. Very glad I went with this computer.

If you're looking for something that can play most modern AAA titles at medium or low, this is IT. Slap another 8gb of ram and some storage in this thing (under $140) and its an amazing budget laptop for the price! It also includes a free month of game pass and an upgrade to win 11. It's awesome. I love it!

I needed to replace my previous laptop after 5+ years, but I didn't want to break the bank. After researching different gaming laptops, the Acer Nitro 5 stood out as the best balance between price and performance.

I will say it could be because I use it for CPU intensive activities like music production and gaming but the battery life seems to be pretty short. Other than this I’m completely happy with this purchase.

I am Game Artist. I use 3D modeling and game engine programs like Unity, 3DsMax, Blender, Photoshop, and Unreal. I also play plenty of MMORGs and Steam games in my (very little) free-time. And I really needed a new work/personal gaming laptop as my last Acer Predator was starting to degrade after several years of constant use. So I decided to try the Nitro since I really liked the Predator and have an Acer monitor as well.
This laptop was a wonderful upgrade that I don’t regret one bit! Before this, I was using something way weaker that couldn’t get the job done at all but this laptop is good for games and more!

I really like how easy this laptop is to upgrade. Immediately upon receiving it I added 2 16gb RAM bringing it up to a total of 32RAM. You can add a total of 32 to this one. I plan to also add a PCI-e ssd to it since it’s so easy and has an extra slot. Maybe later on I’ll add the 2.5 ssd!

In the "almost touching four figures" range, there are a lot of surprisingly good gaming laptops coming onto the market from different manufacturers. Assuming each one was available, you'd be spoiled for choice this summer. Decent processors, nice midrange RTX GPU's, and at least a certain degree of expandability should be expected.

The Nitro series from Acer is their budget line of gaming laptops. Tucked away in this line are some hidden gems and very capable laptops able to handle your gaming needs. Is the Acer Nitro 5 up to task? Hopefully this full review will answer all your questions.
Came on time, upgraded the ram to 32gigs, added a 2tb hdd and a 1tb ssd and it runs nice It you buy it you gotta upgrade the ram and storage and it’s pretty good for the price.
My son sent me the page for this, knowing what my desired specs and budget were.  Then I read the reviews and was almost scared away.  He talked me into at least trying it and I am so so glad I did!!

I've only had this for a day now, so I can't speak to longevity. All in all I'm pleased with this laptop. It's lightweight but packs a punch still. Set up and updating was quick and easy. It's a great utilization of space, only a slim border around the screen and keyboard.

So far this laptop seems decent. Manage you’re expectations. You can’t buy a mid-range gaming laptop and expect all the best. I’ve yet to try some of the more demanding games. But for the games I play these days, like Fortnite, Apex, Rust, R6 Siege, Subnautica, and No Man’s Sky, it’s performing pretty well.

Haven't really tested it yet so can't testify to the specs but if you think it's dead on arrival the charger is difficult to plug in. Myself and three others tried to turn the laptop on and couldn't get it to work. I finally pushed the charger in as hard as I could and it clicked in. Started right up. Much more difficult than my other laptops. Thought this info might help someone else :)

So I seen a lot of people complaining about dead on arrival units, the battery ships completely dead. I was confused why it wasn't turning on or charging, a quick search on YouTube. The simple solution is to plug in the charger more til you hear a click. Then you're good to go!! Amazing laptop!

After trouble shooting multiple reasons as to why my first order of this laptop would not charge or turn on, I returned the item, waited a week for the refund, then re-ordered for my son-only to have the SAME issue. Do NOT purchase this Acer laptop. It’s a waste of money and will not charge or turn on. Now I get to repeat the process again. Huge disappointment.
Bloatware on this device.  Was not interested in Norton and when tried to remove could not due to application error.  This is a problem with the Image Acer uses to load these in the factory.

If negative stars were available, this would rate a minus 5. Like many other buyers, this item was a brick: Dead on Arrival. After 3 hours of dealing with ACER Customer service and Amazon's incredibly insane return policy on a high value item, I was finally able to arrange a "normal" return.
The laptop has been performing perfectly so far. The case does seem a little bit on the plastic side. However, if you take even reasonable care I don't see that being an issue.
It’s a good laptop overall but there seems to be problems with it every now and then, for example the laptop freezes up every now and then but not so often
My PC died on my and I decided to splurge and pick up a high end one. I’m glad I picked this one.  None of my games have had any problems.

So on Christmas morning I thought it was DOA. However, you really have to push in the power cord into the back of it computer. There is a noticeable click. If you do not hear the click then it will not charge.
For the price I think it’s a solid deal honestly Added a second ram stick an a 1tb sad and it is solid great for a first time of player

Everything was working perfectly until I started gaming on it. Was playing Apex when it started to blue screen of death on me. All drivers, and updates were installed. Apex was being played on low to medium settings and the laptop would still crash to blue screen. I do not recommend a 3050Ti 4GB. The other components seem to be good but maybe this was a lemon.

I had to return the Acer Nitro to Amazon.  The computer failed to boot properly twice within the first two weeks and both times it said the system needed to be completely reset before using it again.  I have had an Acer Aspire for more than 5 years and it has performed without a problem during that time, so I do not have the patience to keep wiping and resetting a brand new $800 dollar computer.

Laptop comes in the mail. Second day gets error and blue screen. Third day sparks and kills itself. Manages to turn on. The plug in port would beep nonstop and might shut off again as if the battery is nonexistent.

It just started blinking orange and dindt turn on, when connected it won't charge, hopefully i can have a refund of this if not well whatever im sending it to someone to fix it and lose money....good luck

Frames will be locked at 60 automatically, you have to change the settings yourself. The laptop can barely run a small game without issues, I’m kind of disappointed. I use this “gaming laptop” for everything besides gaming now.

Good laptop for playing games at medium settings at a steady 60fps on certain games. 8gb of ram is not enough though. recommend upgrading to 16gb of ram if you plan on playing games. Otherwise no issues when using it for the first time and runs great!

I really liked the look of this computer and gaming was great for a laptop, but there was something wrong with it. As soon as I got it and updated everything, the keyboard started freezing and the only way to type was to turn it off and on with a mouse I had plugged in. At random times if I clicked on a drop down menu to type it would start typing random things or just entering spaces for no reason. Maybe a lemon? Idk.

The power supply has to be plugged in VERY firmly to the back of the laptop... It didn't look like it could go farther in, and the laptop wasn't charging. I pressed again really firmly and heard a click, then it finally started to charge.

Tiene un rendimiento excelente para su precio. Refrigera muy bien lo cual es estupendo ya que vivo en un área calurosa, los videojuegos corren perfectos a más de 170fps con máxima calidad y eso que aún no le hago overclock al chip de video ni al procesador. Lo único que no me gustó es que la bios viene muy, muy restringida.

Had all the features I wanted (3 x USB & ethernet), decent sound and SSD.  My first Gaming computer, have to get used to the keyboard layout, since it's slightly different from a normal keyboard (some keys smaller than normal).
Got this because my old laptop was dying and I am happy I did.  It far exceeded my expectations and I am enjoying playing Lost Ark and WoW on this at max settings.

excelente producto. el  equipo responde de forma excelente a programas de diseño. corre con rapidez los juegos actuales. la entrega fue mas rapido de lo esperado. muy contento con la compra. agradezco al vendedor.

Need to push power cord until click heard! I thought I got a dead laptop until I read a review in Spanish that pointed out that the power cord that plugs in to the back of the laptop needs to go in until an audible click is heard.

Works good bought this for my son but still lags on gaming but not just in online gaming but offline games too i realize lagging online is latency due to wifi signal & usage but that's not the case as i mentioned told my son to test but he never mentioned anything till now so I'm having issues with expensive returns after return window closes & my trust with Amazon is decreasing my husband will have to contact support if anything is wrong cuz they have given me a headache recently.

Got ir under $800 and its a very good laptop. Playing games like witcher 3 flawlessly. The cooling is nice in this laptop, and mi cpu doesn't get pass 55° in cold rooms while playing witcher which is the game im currently playing.

I play rdr2, Fortnite, csgo, halo infinite, etc. just fine at regular settings, haven’t tried to push it too much settings wise but I’m fine with the regular settings on the games and they run good, no lag. The fan can be loud but I wear headphones and after a little bit you barely notice it.

Great laptop for the price and easily upgradable. Bought to play elden ring and some other games with friends instead of console, and elden ring runs great and smooth. Does get a little warm if airflow isn’t clear but that’s to be expected from a gaming laptop.

Always been a fan of Acer and needed something to run some hames on Steam. This runs BeamNG , Teardown, ARBS , pretty well at normal to high graphics. I did have (ok want) to upgrade the SSD and RAM so that typically would add cost. It goes up to 32GB RAM but 16 has been fine. 15.6” screen is great especially in 144hz. Cooling fans all over it to keep it cool.

So I loved this laptop for a whole day. Thought it was great. But suddenly after just 24 hours, it’s broken. It says that my battery is at 100% yet if I unplug it, it automatically shuts off - just goes straight to black. If I wanted a device I had to keep plugged in to use, I’d have bought a desktop instead.
Great product but buy the ram and hard drive upgrades, they're easy to install. I use this with my Oculus Quest 2. Some troubleshooting with Windows 11, but runs great.

This is a great entry gaming laptop for my 12 year old who will be 13 next month. The colors and graphics are great, he loves the lighted keyboard, and this definitely has a bit of weight which contributes to the sturdiness.

This would've been a great buy if it wasn't for the faulty charging cables. I seen others complaining about it and figured maybe they got a bad shipment. However,  I have the same problem. I have to keep replugging it in to get it to work.

It’s honestly not as bad as people say, it handled downloading games in a 90 degree environment without problems as well as a decent performance right out of the box (clocked The Forest at 150fps) fan is a bit noticeable but can be quiet when doing low performance tasks. Weight feels good and the screen is amazing for movies/games
My son got this laptop for Christmas and he loves it.  Great beginner gaming laptop!  It was super easy to setup!  Literally set everything up in less than 30 minutes.  Worth every penny so fart!!

quiero agradecerte hoy recibimos nuestra nueva laptor ...super rápido y muy oportuna ...todo venia muy bien empacado y el producto en optimas condiciones ....que gusto hacer negocios con alguien tan serio y cumplido  mil gracias

I received the laptop and couldn’t figure out why it wasn’t charging.  Read a lot of reviews to see what the problem was and after 20 minutes I just pushed the charger into port harder until it clicked a second time.

I took the i7 with RTx 3050 version, 1TB. I already have MacBook Pro, but I bought this because I just need it for gaming (no HW, projects, or anything) JUST for gaming! I played cities skyline and Counter Strike, and I didn’t face any problem. I really recommend to buy the same version that I have if u want a laptop that can handle strong games (COD, FAR CRY etc). And talking about the RGB keyboard (the version that I have cannot change the color, even if you go to NitroSense App - ONLY RED)
It runs great able to run some big games at a good fps but storage and ram is a bit on the low side other than that if it new to PC and don't know what to get this is ur best choice.

Runs everything at 144+ Fps on external screen. (I'm talking GTA on high settings) I've been in the pro scene of gaming on Xbox and this delivers for comp gameplay. Siege 200+ Fps. Fortnite 300+Fps. GTA 144+ Fps. Warzone 100+ Fps. Valorant 400+Fps. Runs VR great aswell. This is a great pickup for gaming but the storage drive is a little lacking at 256 gigs.
This is a great Laptop as long as it's plugged in. Battery life is supposedly 8 hours, i can barely get this running for 45 minutes without it needing to be charged. Disappointing.
La pantalla no es tan buena porque cuando juegas se ve como una clase de línea rara pero corre muy bien los Juegos solo necesita que le metas más ram y listo

I got my daughter this computer for Christmas and she has absolutely loved it.... until one of the keys broke off. Most of the time she uses an extra keyboard for gaming, she was using the laptop keyboard and the s key broke off!! I can't put it back on very upset about this

The battery life is a joke and the audio system is weak.  The screen is nice and it can handle high-quality graphics/visuals easily. But it's not worth it for a battery that doesn't even last 3 hrs in battery saver mode.

I made sure it had backlight keyboard. Yes, it has one, but shuts off every 30 seconds and NO WAY to keep it on or change that length of time. Stupid feature, so you are always having to hit any key to turn it back on. The most annoying feature ever.at. Worse yet, the keyboard is hard to see in even low light when it isn't lit up. The backlight keyboard, while true, is misleading. Would never have bought this computer if I had known that.

I gave the screen a 4 because I have to figure out how to activate that. I haven't gamed in over 10 years on a laptop and I gotta say I love it. I'm kind of new to gaming and this is prefect for me. However if your having trouble charging angle the charger to point to the right and make sure its pushed all the way in. It gets hot but I bought a cooling fan for this when i made the order so I most def recommended.

Battery life is horrible wouldn’t last 2 hours when I first got it I keep it on charge now, Laptop is extremely fast and has ran everything I’ve thrown at it so far, and the black gets extremely dirty really fast

The quality and feel of this laptop is definitely top notch, also the performance for gaming which is what it was intended for is great. Unfortunately the battery life is just horrible.  I bought it as a Christmas present and I've been told that it has to stay charged to the wall when in use because how has it depletes battery.

Been using this mainly for music production and gotta say very happy with it given what I paid. I use Ableton Live 11 Suite with many plugins like Serum, Omnisphere, Kontakt, etc and performs well. I will occasionally game on it and it looks and runs nice. Been playing Retail WoW and Genshin Impact the most and both run smooth. Can't beat that 144hz!

If you're trying to play minecraft or other small games this is perfect, but AAA titles like Warzone and demanding games alike this isn't your best bet. For reference in warzone with the lowest possible settings you get 50fps on a good day.

Excelente producto para el precio lo único que deberían mejorar un poco es la parte de la refrigeración en el sentido que los espacios por donde circula el aire de afuera hacia adentro deberían ser más grandes

The screen flickers like an old tube TV attempting to get a station. Attempted to deal with Amazons customer service to trouble shoot and was passed to Acer. Worked with them for 3 weeks and even shipped it to Texas with a VIDEO of the issue. Got a letter back to say they couldn't replicate the issue but replaced the screen. Turned it on myself and within 30 seconds of it idling it was back at it. The customer service was absolutely horrid. Never again. Wasted time and energy on a plastic piece of garbage.

The charging indicator didn't light up when plugged in and the device would not turn on. Just put it in the return post. Will update my review when I get my refund. Because of the price, Amazon won't just send a replacement, I have to wait a week after they get it back to get my money back and then make a new purchase. Because I'm not the first to have this exact issue, I'm contemplating looking to buy a different laptop altogether.

Product arrived dead on arrival. Plugged in (firmly after reading other reviews) to charge for the first time and light would not come on to show that it was charging. Attempted to power on laptop and would not turn on either. Offered a refund but price has gone up and would have to pay more. Will not be ordering another after further reading reviews.

This game plays all the steam games I own. Most at max graphics settings. I can even run Cyberpunk 2077 at above the settings that Nvidia GeForce Experience recommends. The SSD is large enough to store over 25 relatively recent games. If you're a retro gamer, I've gotten  MegaRace 1 to run on this guy.
I bought the Acer Nitro 5 with the i5 10300H CPU and the RTX 3050. I upgraded to 16 GB of RAM and added a 1 TB internal SSD and the review is based on the computer after the upgrades.

I am not at all disappointed with this laptop! Screen is beautiful. It is super fast! It does need an upgrade in memory(8GB for $40) and HDD(1TB for $80), but it appears to be pretty easy to access and upgrade. They even give you the cable for the HDD upgrade. Will be testing out a few games, in the next couple days. Did not purchase for high end gaming, so I think I will be pleased, based on how quickly this thing moves for everyday activities!

Computer was completely dead. Would not start up even when attached to power. Trying to get it returned has been a nightmare. The only way Amazon allows you to return the product is to wait for UPS to come and pick it up. Since I have to go to work everyday and I am not about to leave it outside so it can be stolen I am forced to take time off from work in order to get this defective product returned. Lesson learned about buying computers through Amazon

I've needed a laptop for travel for a long time, and overall it's great. Ive been able to keep up with family and gsming friens much better while traveling. Only drawback so far is that pre-installed Windows 11 is driving me nuts, the layout is annoying and it is being much more intrusive with service solicitations than any previous OS ever was.

I have a flight sim and a pc projector which is ceiling mounted like 40' away and has a looooong hdmi cable. After installing windows 11  started having problems booting windows. It's noise on the ports. Unpluged the flight stick and long hdmi cable and it boots fine. It was fine with windows 10 also. It's some setting up the ports with windows 11 and is most aggrevating. The answere is to leave the joy stick and hdmi unpluged unless it's on and using it....

I bought the i7 version of this laptop expecting it to perform, well, not as good as other laptops, due to the lower price. However, I was absolutely blown away by how fast it is, running games or even just using it for work. The image quality is fantastic, you can also easily connect your gamepad and play whatever you want at max. I didn't pay attention to the speaker sound though, since I always use a headset. I loved this laptop! It's really an excellent choice.

If you’re low on money but want a gaming laptop that runs good but, not only gaming, it’s also good at editing. Might want to upgrade RAM and SSD storage to make it run at peak performance but other than that it’s a free low budget laptop.

Got this bad boy for school and casual gaming, screen works just fine and everything boots up just nice. I haven't gone too heavy into triple A titles yet but so far the performance is pretty good and doesn't get loud or hot. Will update in a few weeks or months. In terms of budget, can't be beat for the class of hardware it's got.

Product lasted less than 1 year. I called Acer support service, three times already and a host of worthless  people with fake names were unable to solve the situation or give me instructions to send the laptop for repair or replacement. I guess they are waiting for the expiration date…So disappointed! We are never buying this brand again.

Brand new laptop doesn't power on doesn't charge. Used multiple different outfits and chargers and still doesn’t turn on. I open up the laptop to try and fix the issue there is rust on the screws. It’s so bad four screws won’t even come undone they literally chipped away and broke my screwdriver. Do not buy, this is a scam

I was pleasingly amazed at the quality for price ratio. I added another main drive, and swapped out the ram. I use it exclusively for off-line gaming. I play modern games on the best settings. No problems. I also keep it on the best 5 fan cooling pad I could find. Excellent device.

que bruto pongale 0... recibi la laptop hace un par de dias y me asuste mucho, porque no encendia, ni cargaba ni encendia ninguna luz.. la deje toda la noche conectada pensando que podia haber venido descargada de bateria, pero nada.. al dia siguiente ya estaba a punto de contactar a soporte para enviarla a garantia, y me puse a leer el manual. cuya instruccion decia, al conectar el cargador asegurese de empujarlo hasta escuchar un click...ahi estaba el fallo.  despues de conectarlo correctamente, encendio de una y hasta ahora vade maravillas..

I'm primarily impressed with the speed though I may be biased since I had an outdated computer. The color, the graphics, everything is excellent and I'm just getting started with learning everything on this system.

I can't complain much the quality for the price isn't bad if I had to nitpick I would have 1 issue I live in the us but I got a Eu charger so spent some extra money on that other than that it's a pretty good gaming pc

It did not work on arrival had to clean power terminal. Than 3 months in stopped working completely had to send it back for fix. When it worked a nice laptop. For price though not a great machine should work out of box and for years not a few months.

Envio rapido a Peru, muy buena laptop por el precio pagado, hasta el momento ningun problema funciona perfectamente ,  tambien funciona perfectamente linux junto con windows recomendable laptop la core i7.
Screen quality is good speed is good gaming is great however it does get hot and heats up and if you have to unplug it at a meeting the battery dies in 2 hours so the battery sucks

Bought it couple of days back and the laptop did not boot at all. I almost returned my laptop when I read a comment suggesting to push the pin all the way in at the backside of laptop until an audible click is heard. It worked and rest of the experience was smooth.

Nice reasonably priced gaming laptop. Day after I bought this as a Christmas gift for my daughter, I found one at a local discount freight store for 400, just lucky I guess. If I wouldn’t have found the cheaper one I would’ve been happy with this one. So as far as quality;; this laptop is great !! And even without the freight discount markdowns I would have been ok with it because it’s still a good and economical choice
The USB - C hub is not connected to the video card so you cannot drive a VR headset from this port. The online information leads you to believe that this will work, ACER says it does not.

I'm not a gamer, I'm an amateur photographer who uses photo editing software.  I had seen advice that recommended using a "gamer" pc to run photo editing software.  This laptop rocks, it makes adjustments to photos in seconds as opposed to minutes on an older pc.  I've never had the pc fan come on because of heating, it is very silent.  Highly recommend.

Really good laptop for the price. Runs games at ultra graphics like a gem. The only reason I give it four stars is because they sent me a broken charger and I had to buy a new one. But they did refund me for the charger at least. Also the battery does die pretty quickly. Other than that it’s a great purchase!

Got this a week ago and can I say, I didn't expect the RTX 3050 in here to be this good (It has a low TDP). I suggest getting more storage and ram. It will vastly improve your experience with the machine

I wanted to experience a true fast  gaming PC, but entry level.  This Acer has exceeded my expectations in every facet.  The picture is immaculate, the processor is super fast I have yet to see any slow down.  If there is anything at all to improve on it is the battery life but what do you expect with a fully lit gaming PC. The memory is limited but it works for the way I use it.  I would buy again

I really shopped around for a laptop I could use for video editing and graphic design. The Acer Nitro 5 AN517-54-79L1 had decent reviews and it seemed like the best option in my price range. Well, the first one I ordered had problems so I had to send it back, then the replacement Amazon sent had the exact same problems so I had to send that back too!

Okay so the title of this review maybe misleading, but I noticed this is one of the biggest issue with this machine, it even got me the first time. Had to order a replacement. When that came in same issue no power.

I don’t know what could be possibly wrong with it or if I’m not doing something right . I just opened up this new laptop out of the box and it won’t turn on nor will it charge . Can anyone help me please ?

Great computer for gaming and business. Lightweight and easy to upgrade. A stick of ram and extra storage and can handle any game with ease. Works great for the oculus  quest 2, just need the cable . And you have a whole new library of games and free content not offered in the oculus store. Would highly recommend this laptop.
I’ve had 2-3 of these with varying gpu over the years and have always been satisfied. This one blue screened within 2-3 months after gifting it to a graduate heading to college. Win some lose some

It's a decent gaming laptop if you are playing games that are not taxing. Even for a laptop with a 3050 installed and the fans cranked to max this laptop will feel like it's gonna explode. I had two moments where it would shut off from overheating while I am in a game of league of legends on medium settings. So I had to switch to low settings to even play league without any frame lost.

I bought this PC to game when going on various work trips. The 3060 performs really well. It’s great for entertainment. Only drawback is the size, but not difficult to carry with the right kind of backpack.

Venia todo perfecto en un embalaje que era imposible que viniera algun desperfecto, el portátil cumple con las expectativas con sobresaliente, muy bueno, la unica pega es que hay una pequeña mancha en la pantalla casi indetectable que hace que en ese punto se vea mas clara, quizas ya la pantalla venía así por que no creo que fuera por el empaque, debe ser cosa del proceso de fabricación justo en la que me enviaron por el resto perfecto.
My computer wouldn’t play WoW and I was disappointing a friend because I kept getting disconnected all the time! This think runs it like a dream! I highly recommend! 😍😍😍

When I received my Acer laptop it had what looked like a small ding in the top left corner of the screen-- to my disappointment, this meant there were very large, awful crack streaks & lines going down the side of the panel, rendering this laptop useless. Currently awaiting a refund. When I got it in the mail, the factory seal on the box was already broken, meaning this laptop may have been a refurb or previous return. I'm sure this laptop may otherwise be a great model. Buyers take caution.

Arrived in perfect condition. For medium gaming only.  The RTX 3050 and I5 doesn't keep up with newer titles like the new Hitman series.  256 Gb storage is useless if you want to game.  These days, it should be a crime to ship anything under a TB of storage.  Wish I had paid the extra $300 for the 1TB and RTX 3060.
I love the simplicity of it but I hate the storage capacity. You can upgrade the storage and buy a new ram to get more fps in games. The battery life isnt that great.

Shopped around for months extremely pleased with this laptop. I play WOW and skyrim mostly and have had no issues. Only thing cant quite figure out is why it says my graphics card is out of date under WOW log in. IDK. Seems to run great to me. Thank you.

I bought this for my wife. Once I got the laptop I ordered a 500gb hard drive and 8gb of memory to add to the laptop. Acer included the hard drive cable to install a second hard drive, a very nice touch since the laptop only came with a 250gb drive. Installing them myself saved me some money. She loves the performance of this machine, the 144 hz display and is extremely happy with it.

It is amazing. I played a lot of games in it but the only problem is the rtx 3050 gets so hot and quickly hits 100% usage. Perhaps an extra fan under the laptop will do fine. Beside it getting hot it will work just fine. It makes no problems in games. No black screens no crashes. Windows 11 is an extra plus, and 1 months of game pass is a little favor if you ask me.

I5 10300 H is a great CPU but it runs really hot normally around 95C which worries me because that’s the melting point I would recommend putting on a new layer of thermal paste to help you keep it optimal but it is a good gaming laptop I use it to play VR chat oblivion Destiny 2 and a few other games like the Sims but it it runs well and it also runs well playing fallout new Vegas
Todo bien el equipo de 10....Recomendaria que lo protejan mas con un poco de Poliexpand... decepcionante el servicio e UPS en Peru pero al final llego...no tuve que pagar demas en el envio..

If you are looking to use a laptop for playing any type of game this will do it for you, as long as you have it plugged in. When on battery I can still play some less intense games. I use it to edit videos and use it for work doing inventory control so I can say I need it but when the boss isn’t looking im on steam.
I run x accounts same mmo and all 3 work without a hiccup on high graphics. but i play on low with high draws just to keep it lasting and to get more fps control etc...

At this price, you'll have a hard time finding the same raw power anywhere else. So far, I've played No Man's Sky and Planetside 2 (at default settings) with no framerate issues that I can notice. Minecraft with RTX also works. It has a few framerate hiccups, but I've seen the same from some desktop RTX cards.

this laptop is very fast it has a 10th generation i-5 and nvidia 3050 graphics card it can be used as a gaming laptop it just need to be upgraded in the ram department which I did I added 16gb of ram and I also put in an additional 1tb of ssd drive. it is lightweight and seems to be able to handle anything you throw at it!

I bought this laptop after seeing several negative feedback from people who received the laptop dead because it would not turn on, the same thing happened to me, I connected it and nothing happened, however it is not a defect of the laptop, you have to connect the cable strongly until click and it will turn on, I was about to return it and ask for a refund, but everything is fine.

I bought this 2/2022,  six months later and those bright white lines are appearing. I contacted Acer because, warranty. I’m dismayed that this is apparently a known “extra” included with their products. I’m an more dismayed that they expect me to pay for shipping this to Texas for repair. Why? Because this defect has been shipping from the manufacturer for years. Do Not Recommend. I’ll stick with Apple products as I have done for the past 23 years with zero issues.

I purchased this for my daughter and her SIMS game.  I am highly satisfied with the way this laptop runs this program and would recommend this for anyone that is just starting out with gaming devices due to the fair price and performance, at least with this particular PC game.

Don't waste your money buying this laptop. Bought this computer for my son's birthday a couple months ago. The screen started glitching and turn black. The lcd cable needs to be changed.  Waste of money.

I was looking for a good gaming laptop since I have no enough time or room for a desktop PC and after searching I found this laptop. I am not planning to use it for very powerful games since I already have an XBOX Series S, but it works better than expected. Fast, comfortable to use and it does the job.

I needed a new laptop with the basics but my 14-year-old son wanted something to play games on. this had great reviews as a great value for the money for gaming. It was very easy to set up and Has good screen quality. He was gaming within an hour of turning it on. So far so good!

You must firmly press the adapter to the back. It looks like it's plugged in but it probably isn't. Keep pushing against the back of the laptop until you feel a click. Failure to do so will result in the laptop not powering on.

Highly recommended! Great quality, came fast and well packaged.  Got it for my daughter to start streaming and for games as I do myself. It's a great alternative to a desk top gaming pc. I love it and got it all set up, accounts and all, for her. Most importantly she loves it!

Bought this for my wife to do audio video processing and some light gaming. I upgraded it out of the box to 16gb of ram and added a 1tb nvme m.2 drive. It works perfect and can handle any video editing and even very modern game titles with ease. With right at $1000 invested it was a good deal.
I’m not a gamer but bought this for its fast speed to keep up with my fiber optic internet. Love it and have no complaints. The lighted keyboard is a plus!
anyone has the laptop does not power on just push it firmly and u will have it working, u can change the charger it may help then ask for a refund.
This machine is quite fast for a gaming laptop with a great refresh rate that makes games and action films look spectacular. Overall good price for a great gaming laptop.
Was recommended this gaming laptop months ago, so when it went on sale it was a must purchase for me. So far it’s met every expectation, has run every game in my Steam collection without a problem.

Bought to replace an aging Acer Nitro, this thing rocks, added a second M.2 drive, the 144hz monitor really makes things smooth.  Paid $1029 with Windows 11, 17.3" screen (Black Friday).  I have been pleasantly surprised with the 3050ti.. this is a great gaming laptop, will play any game, most on medium/high graphics settings.. as of this review, one of the best bang for buck deals on Amazon...

Desde un comienzo debo quejarme de la batería, ya que desde el principio no duraba más de 3 horas sin el cargador. No vino con el cargador original y supuestamente tenía los sellos de seguridad intactos. Ahora en cuanto a rendimiento, sí es buena. Solo es cuestión de aumentar la memoria ram y otro par de TB al almacenamiento interno y listo. No vale lo que cuesta. Si pudiera cambiar de computadora, lo haría.

Tiene un estilo muy llamativo estilo carro deportivo, excelente ventilación, cuenta con muy buena velocidad por su procesador y la ssd, en juegos se apaña muy bien si se le ajustan los gráficos ya que no es una súper gráfica pero da buen rendimiento
This laptop is really good I thought it was broken at first but I had to push the charger in all the way and hear a click but this is a good gaming laoptop

Was good but stopped charging after first month. Bought extended warranty but Amazon making me deal with acer directly. Complained about that so Amazon is allowing me to return. The new one has been great

Just like many I had issues with the charging cord….but I kept reading reviews and found someone who said to push until it snaps into the laptop….and it worked! I’ve never had a laptop that plugged in that hard but it is perfect for my gaming son! He loves it.
After a few hours of fiddling with it, this laptop ran a very heavy VR game, IL2, almost as well as my top end gaming desktop with no hardware mods.  Great VR machine at dirt cheap price!

Got this as a christmas gift for my kid and its a good thing I checked it first. I plug it in and notice the charging light doesn’t activate. I try to power it up and it wont turn on. Hoping this gets resolved soon but even if I get a replacement it wont get here in time for the holiday. This review is going to be a 1 star pending a working replacement being sent.
they wanted to be able to play modded minecraft and call of duty but their old one just didnt run them well they absolutely love this one as it meets all their needs

My husband and I got this for his big Christmas present. He loves it and has been on it since before Christmas everyday I asked him how does he like it and he says it runs great for the games he plays. Not sure what games but they cost money lol

I have had the computer for a little over 2 months. I'm a mom so I don't get to use it as often as I would like. However it runs my games smoothly even with mods added. Loads content incredibly fast compared to my 4 year old computer. I believe we'll be purchasing another one shortly for my husband as his computer is nearing the end of its life. I would recommend this computer for sure.

Only hit against this is it doesn't support 3 monitors. If anyone knows a solution to this please let me know. I brought this laptop specifically to review Amazon purchases and my work laptop is infinitely better. But still does it's job and is worth the money.
This laptop did not work out of the box. It had a loose cable on the motherboard that was preventing it from  booting. The webcam has one of the noisiest images I have ever seen.
Le agregué 8GB RAM y 1 TB M.2 y estoy totalmente satisfecho ya que la RTX 3050 no hace cuello de botella con esa configuración. Recomiendo esta LAPTOP pero si agrega más RAM.

We are using this Acer Nitro 5 laptop for streaming church services.  We run the external camera into OBS, where we transcode 1080p to 720p, and live stream to YouTube or Facebook, while simultaneously feeding the OBS virtual camera to Zoom, and recording the service locally in Zoom on the laptop.  There is no noticeable fan noise. The laptop doesn't even break a sweat!

Works great even better than expected however the stoa rage isn’t amazing that is expected with what I ordered and it’s amazingly customizable for storage and ect. The computer does get really hot sometimes when playing but the fans help cool it down well. Amazing computer highly recommended!
Not as good as I had hoped, not that great for music production. I upgraded it with 64gb memory and faster hard drive and still struggles at times when recording. kind of disappointed.

The laptop itself is sturdy but the screen has an odd yellow tint to it that makes everything look a little off, also the audio without headphones is kinda bad mostly since it sounds like the speakers are on the bottom of the laptop but it works well enough, a little pricey for what you get though.

Their are definitely better gaming laptops out there but this one is just okay. I’m kinda stressed out. This is my 2nd time buying a nitro 5 and they just seem like they are prone to breaking. First one just shut off and never turned on after having it for a couple months, my second one the ram, cpu and screen started acting up pretty much just messing up the whole laptop, only with in a couple months again. I enjoyed gaming in it but for the price you can definitely get something better or build something better.

The case is great, super slim and modern. The keyboard is only red, no customization. Keep having an issue with the audio driver. Will randomly stop all audio output and will tell me no audio device installed. Good for games like minecraft and roblox, but seemed to get choppy with Stormworks.
Got it 2 days ago and Im in love. Everything works smoothly, added extra SDD and ram and it can run pretty much any game. Its great for work aswell. Overall great laptop for it's price.

This laptop does the job when it comes to gaming. Playing the latest games I pull 75 fps. The only thing that is crappy is the hard drive space. I went out and got a 2tb external hard drive to put my games on. But other than that it does the job.

The audio from this computer is barely loud enough to hear and that's at its loudest setting.  Otherwise very fast and quiet. Screen quality is good. I don't much care for the keyboard - seems mushy and imprecise.

Just to cut to it, this specific model of the Nitro 5 is incredibly a solid all-around; from the lots of room to expand storage/RAM, great keyboard, good cooling, etc.. The performance is great as well as it can play most modern games at 1080 ultra settings at great FPS.

I liked the price of this gaming laptop. However, sound quality is an issue as is the graphics card. I bought it to be able to play MMORPG and got constant messages to upgrade graphics card. Will be buying seperate computer speakers as the current ones I can hardly hear even at the highest volume setting.

Got this laptop as a gift and its perfect for any gamer. I am not a big gamer but the display when playing League of Legends is amazing. To experience the full capability of the laptop, its best to use when plugged in to the power. A full battery gives about 4 hours if its used for minimal tasks. Overall, its a great gaming laptop, graphics are awesome, I like the keyboard travel. It actually light as compared to other laptops. Would definitely recommend.

The lit keyboard is worth mentioning; it will stay lit for up to 30 seconds then goes dark.  Can't set it to stay on. This is not a laptop to play on in the dark. The MSI Stealth laptops with the rainbow keyboards are far better, all other things being equal.

Hasta el momento todo bien, super eficiente. Estoy probandola aún... Descargue Witcher III y se ve increible. también descargue varios programas de trabajo como Lightroom y Photoshop, y todo bien hasta ahora. Vino todo super bien! lo unico que quizas sea muy poca memoria, pero ella tiene sus slots para integrar nuevas memorias hdd y ssd. En la pagina de Acer te dicen como hacer eso de colocar un nuevo disco. Gracias! Satisfecha de esta compra.

My son could not wait for this computer. He uses it every day and loves it,  Says it is the best and so happy. His friend recommended this to him who know everything about computers- probably can build his own. My son loves  all things technical so I trust him and says - get it ! Never once complained about it!  He would say something the first day- not a peep !

I love the UHD larger 17" screen! I bought this for business, so I knew I  would need a gaming computer because it can handle large file sizes, high-resolution vids that I want to do for business. The large memory for viewing and building complex sites can slow down a computer, but with the high memory and storage and the operating system on an SSD drive, nothing slows down this beast.  My son just bought an ACER; there seems to be a lot of value for the money compared to other brands.

Pues esta bastante bien para el precio que esta es bastante rapida con la memoria SDD y ademas luego de actualizarla se ve todo bastante fluido ahora solo quiero agregarle otros 16 gb  de ram mas para tener  32 de ram .

Second Acer I have owned.  The last was good, but had heat problems, and they seem to have addressed this on their newer models.  Run's great, fast retreaval, great for gaming so far.  I also run a second Acer monitor on it for productivity when working.  Works like a charm.

This computer can handle everything you throw at it, I got the RTX 3050 version for 800+, but I highly recommend that you upgrade the devices RAM, to get the best out of the Graphics Card. I will be doing that very soon, myself. You can also upgrade the SSD with two of them including a hard drive as well, I highly recommend you guys buy this computer it is totally worth it, if you are interested in serious gaming.

I would recommend this labtop for gamers. It has a concurrent FPS of 65 and it has 3-4 hours of gaming life. The backlit keyboard is a constant red color (the color can't be changed. It's always red.) This labtop is very quick at searching things up, and I'd recommend it for anyone who just needs a good labtop that works nicely.

Had the opportunity to grab this Nitro 5 10300H/3050 for $699. The 4GB vram on the RTX3050 is a bummer but it’s a brand new Ampere GPU with plenty of power for max 1080p gaming. The 10th gen i5 CPU is a small beast. A 1080p/144hz screen with nice brightness. With some little tweaks you can undervolt the CPU and overclock the GPU, upgrade the RAM to 16GB at least and you can squeeze a lot of more performance from this budget gaming laptop. Very happy with this purchase.
The brightness is low compared to the other laptops but I think that’s only because of all the good specs the battery can only takes so much but really good for gaming

I would say that there are a lot of problems that I am not sure whether to attribute to the laptop itself or to windows 11 being terrible. Basic functionality like, "If you close your lid, you'll need to restart your computer every time you open it again or it won't play videos," or "The search button doesn't work at all," or "Plug and play usb functionality stops working and you need to unplug and replug things constantly."

I have had this laptop just shy of 2 weeks and have issues already.  I bought it for a specific game, discord. and Google Chrome.  That's it.  My screen turns black and freezes, or replicates and vibrates the images on it.

The laptop was designed so that the keyboard could not be replaced. Was shocked to find this out as that is a common thing to replace with a laptop. So FYI - if you break it, you're looking at buying a new laptop.

I won't comment on this laptop's performance, but the keyboard's faint red letters drove me crazy and you can't program brighter or different color  letters to aid visibility. I returned the unit promptly in August 2022. Have still not been reimbursed. Now I have no laptop, and I'm still out $$$. Not good.

Added a 1 TB SSD and upgraded to 32GB RAM for just under $200. Took a laptop that was listed at 650 and now it has specs that match the $1199 model. Plays all the newest AAA games at very high or ultra settings with 50+fps. Overall I can't think of a better deal on a 30 series gpu laptop available right now.
The unit I got took turning on and off.  The fan was so loud that it’s not worth it.  I went out and bought a MacBook instead.  At least MacBook doesn’t make any noise and it’s just as fast

This is great for light gaming but don't expect high fps.  I saw someone complaining about it not having enough storage.  This laptop comes with a extra m.2 slot and a 2.5" SSD slot.  It's easy to upgrade storage and ram

Had purchased this same PC with Windows 11. It was a train wreck from the first power up. Almost everything I did (attempt to install any game, load any game, uninstall, etc) resulted in at best the game crashing to desktop or at worst BSOD. This happened constantly, the computer became unusable. Promptly returned and ordered the same laptop except with Windows 10. It is WORLDS better. For me, W11 was a total disaster; most modern games just don't play nice with it.

Laptop doesn’t hold more than 2 MMO games. Decent graphics and nice looking laptop for price. The reason I gave it 3 stars instead of 5 is it doesn’t hold many DL games AND we bought 2 of these and one of them got a white screen of death after 4 days, had to plug it into our PC monitor just to see anything and to be able to clear everything off it to send it back and request a new one. So that really sucked.

This is a great computer. I'm not necessarily a huge gamer but do partake at times but my kids are always playing something, setting up Steam was quick and it had no problems whatsoever running multiple advanced games with great graphics. It was easy to setup initially and lightning fast, well worth the $$$ I paid and I have no doubt this will give me many years of service like my last Acer laptop (still going strong nearly 10 years later).

Best PC I’ve ever owned, runs everything perfectly, but don’t plan on using it for long if you’re not around an outlet. Out of the box, it took about 1 hour of WoW to go from 100% to dead. This is a great bang for your buck and I love how it’s been preforming for me, but it’s basically gotta live it’s whole life connected to the wall.
I had this laptop for 3 months then it died on me I can’t reinstall windows I took it to geek squad and they said there’s no way to fix it.

Am writing this review from the actual laptop. So far, it's going well .... When this laptop arrived, it came with a protective box over the actual laptop box, that protective box was flawless BUT the laptop box was opened. The seal was propped up and the sack the laptop came in was upside down. I bought this laptop new. A sticker on the laptop has a little minor peal on it. I was hoping to keep it on for aesthetic reasons, but I might peal it off in the near future now.

Sleek little laptop. Issues. The integrated graphics is the default so you must mess with power settings and  drivers and the Nvidia control panel 3d settings to actually get the graphics card to work with games. Plenty of resources online. Must get drivers from Acer support not nvidia

Laptop did not turn on or recognize power source when plugged in. Looks like a nice expensive paperweight.  The laptop was received in a large cardboard Box commaxe come up about twice the size of the product Box. Possibly damaged during delivery because there was plenty of space to bounce around. After looking at reviews it seems that this power issue is a common issue for this laptop.
I bought a brand new laptop with a faulty ac adapter. Amazon customer service was useless so was acer tech support so now i have to send this thing back.

Received a dead laptop (wouldn't turn on even with charger), asked for a replacement and received another dead laptop, opted for the full refund instead a replacement... will not buy an Acer laptop ever again. Had to go down to the local computer store (shout out to MicroCenter) and got one that actually works.
After opening the box, it did not turn on. I thought the battery was low, so I connected it to the charger, but the led did not turn on. After a whole night connected, it did not turn on.

That labtop worked great. But Windows11 and the Microphone have become a nightmare. Honestly regret buying this because of windows 11. installing and uninstalling drivers to try and make something happen. Bluetooth and Standard Microphone port are shot.

Went to plug it in & set it up on arrival & immediately it would not turn on. Battery light wouldn’t come on when it was plugged in so I called Acer tech support & now have to send the laptop in to get repaired. Took an hour to take out of the box, figure out it was busted, & repackage everything. Now I have to wait for a shipping label, drop it off and wait 7-10 business days for a new laptop to be fixed. Not great quality control.

Would be possible to have so bad luck in life, I have ordered the computer so excited about it and then when it arrives the computer doesn't work, it didn't turn on and charged.  The real thing is that I've never expected that it could happen. Why does the company make sure of the correct functioning of their devices?

The laptop is great except the item description is wrong. It incorrectly states that the USB-C port can be used as a display port. It cannot be. The item model AN517-54-79L1 does not have a USB-C port with display capabilities. If you are interested in having a laptop with two separate monitors, this is not the laptop for you. ACER does have laptops where the description is true, but this is not one of them. I am returning because of this.

Booted exactly long enough to register it. Never even had the power light come on again. It wasn't the power cord that was my first thought, I already had an I5 version of the Acer Nitro 5 and that one would boot with either cord but this bargain delight wouldn't even light up with either one. Unhappy to the point of disgust, had plans to install an 8 terabyte 2.5 drive as well as my Samsung 970 Pro 2 terabyte in the two open slots. Would be hard-pressed to be less satisfied with a purchase.

I'm sure it's a fine computer, but beware if you have to return it.  The vendor will charge you a 15% restocking fee even if it's returned before 30 days.  They will also keep an additional $17 of your funds with no explanation.

I order laptop from my daughters account, after plugin no lights no charging, I run small computer repair business, I know little bit about computers, I used my testing power supply and other option to reset machine from keyboard but nothing works, no replacement options from Amazon other than return so I did return, I am not able to reorder the product due to 01 per customer.
The thunderbolt port on this does not support displays, there is no way for me to extend the range of monitors outside of the single HDMI output. It should be clarified in their description.
Would not turn on. I plugged in and no charging lights either. Tried multiple plugs on house and push power button many times as well my daughter was so disappointed was her Christmas gift.

I've just received this one. But the charging indicator didn't light up even I plugged in. Also, the laptop would not turn on. Very disappointed.. I will reorder one more time and see what happened to the next one.

I thought wow what a steal for the price, a 1TB SSD, a 17 inch screen? Received the Laptop in 2 days, unboxed it and admired the look, plugged it in and nothing. Plugged it in again and….. nothing. Called Amazon and was told I would need to call the manufacturer. I had to state to the person that I was not going to do that and that I wanted to return it. The representative then said I would receive a gift card and again I had to say no and that I wanted a full refund.

This laptop says it's for gaming but you can't even run dual monitors. It has one. ONE! HDMI out port and the USB-C port isn't lighting so you can't run a monitor on it. Even after buying a USB 3.0 doc for it with an additional HDMI port on it you still can't run a second monitor.
