WOW Never expected this from Amazon in a brand new item unbeliable it didnt even blink the screen,  I read the menus thinking that it was me the problem, but not this computer did anything. I need this to be fix, I read the comments from other customers and it has happed before, need a refund or and funtional item I can use.

Bought 2 units, first did not work out of the box, Charging  / AC light was not lit, was unable to get power to the unit. Unit 2 worked for 3 hours, however when we tried to reconnect to the power cable to charge the laptop there was no power indicator.
For this exact computer I'd pay very nearly double in my country, so the value is very good, obviously it's not the beefiest computer out there, but I don't really need it to be.

Ever since my son got this for his birthday, he has yet to emerge from his room.  I walked into his room the other day, not knowing he was there, opened the shades and got hissed at by what I can only assume was my son.  I did not recognize him through all the soda cans and candy wrappers.

The description for this laptop is incorrect. In the list of available ports it is state that there is one "USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C (DisplayPort)" which would mean that the USB-C port supports video out through an adapter or hub, but that is not the case. The USB-C on this laptop is only a standard USB 3.2 Gen 2 port that DOES NOT support the displayport alt function.

I am a 66yr old man with Red/Green colour blindness. The keyboard was so hard to read (even on full brightness) that I sent it back on that alone. If you are a young dude or someone with good eyesight it won't be a problem to you. I also learned that some Nitro's have a menu where you can change the keyboard colour, not my one. I learnt: 'Turn the lights off and see what colour the keys are, if White you have RGB if Red, they stay Red.

The laptop wouldn’t power on.  Another detail of warning, all the emails indicated that a signature would be required  for delivery, but it was just left on the floor in the common area of the apartment building, indicating that I was shipped without the signature request.

I just opened the box and wanted to set it up but guess what! Doesn't turn on, doesn't charge, doesn't do anything. I tried numerous outlets thinking that was the problem but nope. Just a very expensive brick. Terrible quality control.

Muy buena pc, se puede actualizar fácilmente para más potencia. No se calienta demasiado, las bocinas están bien (aunque uso audífonos casi siempre) y fácilmente puede reemplazar una pc de escritorio por su precio.

I was so disappointed, lab top would not power on.  Tried several know good plugs, charging light would not come on. This is a total waste of time. Do not waste your money. Do not fall for the reviews or the hype. Not worth it.

My first ACER lasted a little over a year before it died.  I saved up and purchased this ACER and it is pretty much DOA.  The manufacturer wanted me to ship for up to 10 business days. Don't have time for that so returned through Amazon.  Done with this brand.

Please don't be like me, looking at all the bad reviews and thinking that is a problem with that specific laptop or a problem on their end. It's not. It stutters about every 15 seconds going from around 250 frames in a game to 7. This doesn't just freeze your game it also stutters your audio as well. Im going to resend this and replace it if that one has the same problem I will update with this review to state so if it is fixed I will also update this review.

Just purchased this for my daughter. She's been waiting a week. Unfortunately, it doesn't work right out of the box. The unit won't receive power at all. It's been on charge for over an hour. The battery indictor light doesn't come on. My oldest has a similar laptop so I swapped the chargers and they both work fine. Laptop was a total dud. Complete waste. I'll be updating this if they make it a pain to return. Taking my money elsewhere.

Espectacular maquina, muy facil el aumentar la ram y añadir el disco duro, viene con un M.2, por lo que solo queda una ranura M.2 y la de disco duro libre, extremadamente facil de instalar ambas opciones, los juegos corren genial, la gran mayoria van de los 70 hacia arriba, unico problemilla que es obvio, la letra Ñ es complicada de encontrar jajaj, pero todo lo demas, increible.

I ordered this as a birthday gift  and was pleased that it arrived in a timely  manner. Unfortunately my happiness soon turned to disappointment after noticing the void tape had been cut. After plugging it in and giving it fifteen hours of charge time then attempting to turn it on nothing no power it was defective someone  had clearly tampered with it.

I saved up for this laptop for a long time, and I received it broken, it will not charge no matter what I try. I've read other comments like this and I'm extremely disappointed in the similar reviews. I've returned it and I'm waiting for a refund.

I ordered this gaming laptop so that my son (9) and I could play online games together. This was a Christmas gift. It DOES NOT WORK. It will not turn on, charged or uncharged, while plugged into any of three different outlets, all of which work for other devices. Basically, I was sent a $1000 non-functional device. This is unacceptable at best and my son is DEVASTATED. I cannot begin to express how upset I am with this.

Entrega muy rápida con los cuidados necesarios para la compra. Llegó en perfecto estado y el equipo a pesar de ser en su estructura de plástico pero elegante, lo mejor es la pantalla y su interior porque el desempeño en juegos una maravilla!!!.

I anticipate your questions - was the AC adapter plugged in correctly, was the outlet working? I checked both several times, all fine, just no response from the battery charge light, no lights whatsoever, no charge, no start.
Bought this piece of crap on april 20th and it wouldn't turn on. Sent it back on the 25th and 25 business days later still haven't received my laptop back.
The unit arrived dead.  Plugged in the AC adapter firmly, checked cords, (we had a second AC adapter of the same specs).  Power lights never lit up and the unit would not turn on.

We received this laptop yesterday. Plugged it in for almost 8 hours to charge. No lights came on showing it was charging. Pushed the power button. Nothing. No pull tabs, or on off switch. This is a $700+ paperweight.  Now just waiting for UPS to pick it up so we can get a refund. I do not recommend buying this.

I have very light computer use. Most people I know told me not to bother buying a gaming computer because I don't play a lot.  Still this computer is toast not even 8 months after purchase. Save your money.

My daughter order this gaming laptop on Thanks giving, I was happy but my happiness goes in drain, after plugin no lights laptop never work DOA (dead on arrival). I have told I cant reorder it because deal is 01 per customer nor I will get replacement, no other options except return.

This laptop initially worked well, but after a week the video began crashing. Even during the BIOS splash I'd see video glitches and artifacts; something in the hardware was clearly broken. I returned this unit and did not order another.  I guess I'm lucky because it failed early, and failed in such a way that I didn't have to bother troubling shooting OS and driver issues.

I'm an architecture student and I bought this laptop as I needed an affordable but powerful laptop to run some of the architectural software (Revit, Inventor, etc) while on the go. The dedicated 3050 comes in handy when rendering finished models and the CPU is beefy enough to handle all the processing requirements these programs take.

Bought this computer and was sent one that was dead on arrival. Filed a complaint and requested a new one, same thing dead on arrival. Terrible quality control, would love to write an actual review for the product but it's been over a month and I still have yet to get sent a laptop that turns on.

I love everything about this computer except the backlit keyboard does not stay lit very long at all and I have not found a way to change how long it stays on. I don't know why it can't just stay on all the time.

Imagine my 10-year old son’s disappointment when he saved up $1200 to buy a gaming laptop and it finally arrived- excitement high- only to find the piece of $hiY didn’t even turn on. Very very disappointing and just sad for my son. Thanks, Acer. Buy elsewhere if you’re a consumer reading this.

Seemed like a solid laptop, but had to return because any zooming on the track pad caused like an open windows waterfall effect, duping each window a dozen times. Tried to get product support, no luck. wanted to exchange because I got it on an amazing sale, no luck.

Only bought this for the portability that supposedly comes with owning a laptop. However the battery life is awful and it consistently drops connection on Wi-Fi every 10-15 minutes. If I wanted to be plugged into a router and a wall I would just use a desktop.
Just received this and I’ve followed the steps of start up and either the cord or the power bar is faulty or the laptop is but I have not been able to even turn the thing on!!

It came with a completely dead battery, return is currently pending. I was really excited for my laptop upgrade. I probably could have swapped the battery myself but I didn't want to void warranty and discover any other issues so I sent it in.

DoA ! 1 Star for now . Purchased as a Christmas gift for my child and when she opened it and we got it plugged in . It will not power on or charge . It shows no indication of charging (the light is on not when plugged in. Tried troubleshooting but none of the suggested methods I found work .  I Would not recommend this product
I did not like anything about it since what happened. But I'm not going to lie, my son did like it cause of course he was playing games on it. What kid wouldn't like that.

I received the laptop, plugged in the power supply, but nothing would light up or power on. After troubleshooting with Acer tech support, they wanted me to send the laptop in for repair. I decided that a brand new laptop shouldn't need repaired and opted to  return for a full refund instead.

I got this because Acer told me this was compatible with Oculus 2.  When I received it, it was not compatible. When I contacted Acer support.  Support told me I needed to purchase a model with 32MB memory.  Sales tells you one thing, support tells you another.  I got the better model at $1400.  That one did not work either.

I bought this item last september. It was not working upon arrival. I then contacted amazon customer service and they sent me a few suggestions which did not work. I was then sent some contact information for acer warranty service and i have been unable to get into contact with them. Now for the past 6 months I have been stuck with a laptop that is broken.
Several keys on the keyboard have fallen off and even after trying to reconnect them they come loose.  Got tired of them not staying put and started using a wireless keyboard.

Screen flickers when playing mildly graphics-intensive games. These games (Total War Warhammer II and others) worked just fine on my 2016 laptop and the screen did not flicker. The screen then continues to flicker in other screens outside of the game. It is nauseating, and would be dangerous for people who are susceptible to seizures. The fans are very loud as well.

Immediately spent 4 hours trying to figure out why this laptop would NOT recognize the Nvidia 3050ti installed in it. Called Acer tech support which was completely clueless. At that point packed that expensive piece of crap up and sent it back. Will not buy another Acer product.
Bought two of these one right after the other because the first one would not come on. Same thing with the second one. Beginning to believe these are pirated versions

I got the laptop, plugged it and allowed it to charge for 20 minutes or more, pressed power button and it was dead. No lights or anything coming from it, I read reviews and majority of the negative ones were for the same issue, a dead computer. I still gave it a chance and I also received a dead computer. Went to best buy in person and got me a different one and was able to use it the same day.

The battery life on this thing is terrible you always have to plug it even when you shut the laptop off and not alot of games will work on this laptop best to get a desktop this laptop need charging even when shutdown

Do not waste your money. I mean IF you can get the computer to stay on or hold a charge, it is beautiful, and great for gaming. But right now it has the purpose of being nothing more than a $900 paper weight for me.

Purchased mid 2021, computer worked amazing well for 8ish months  but now all the sudden the computer can't utilize the GPU (3050) and the motherboard will not launch BIOS... if anyone has any idea what is causing this it would he greatly appreciated.

Plugged in power supply to a known functioning AC outlet.  No indicator lights on the laptop.  Nothing happened when the power button was pushed.  Can't recommend based upon this one experience.  Hopefully, we can get another one that actually works.

Main issue is screen display all the way turned down while playing a card game, I’m lucky if the battery even lasts two hours! Disappointed about battery life mainly! Sucks having it plugged in all the time!
I was given a defective laptop. Wouldn’t even cut on. I wanted to get a replacement but they wouldn’t let me. So I decided to do a return and by an HP instead. Need better quality control.

I have always wanted this laptop but unfortunately it didn’t turn on once I plug in the charger. I thought maybe I let it charge for a while, so I let it charge overnight. Turns out it still didn’t turn on so I returned it the next day.
I definitely recommend if you are looking for something portable and small. The screen was smaller than I thought but if that’s not a dealbreaker to you I highly recommend!!!

This laptop arrived dead. Multiple reviews have stated their laptop arrived dead as well. Don’t waste your time with this. I tried charging through 3 different outlets and still nothing. Returning and refunding. Tech support was very helpful in making my return and refund. Again- do not waste your time with this Acer Nitro 5 laptop. It should be taken off the Amazon site as a whole.

So the product wouldn’t even turn on. Definitely read other people’s reviews as it is in fact just showing up broken and unable to work. Got it fresh out of the package tried to plug it in and it just didn’t work. Wouldn’t even light up.

I purchased this as a gift for my nephew and we did not open it until Christmas. The screen ended up being cracked and there customer care was well below satisfactory. They would not even work with me on an exchange or refund of any kind even after I sent pictures. I now have a 900 dollar laptop that does not work and a child without his Christmas present. Would never purchase from this company again. I recommend you Work on your customer satisfaction and service.

As many others have stated, this product arrived dead. I will not deal with Acer and risk more terrible quality control. You can see it’s plugged into to laptop and wall and doesn’t receive power. Who’s to say if it’s the cord, or the laptop itself. It’s a problem that’s been reported enough to not still be sold to consumers.
Ordered 2 of these for my boys for Christmas just to open them up and find that both were dead and no matter what I did, they would not charge. Save your money.

Did not manage to use it really. Mainly have it stored on the shelf and use about 10 times. Last week start to look for ssd to increase storage, and screen died, completely. Honestly it's very disappointing. So far it's my worst purchase.
Everything was ready to roll out of the box, very easy setup and zero issues; minimal packaging and fluff.  The kid was playing Minecraft with RTX shaders on it within 30 minutes of unboxing.

It's fast, amazing screen quality, just great for AutoCAD, which is what we wanted it for. For gaming, it's superb. One downside....the volume is loooooowww, very very low, an external speaker is a must.

Just like the sticker states "VOID." Thats exactly what I did, and I'm returning it. The low rating is because I was expecting a brand new item, and I received this. Total waste of time seriously what are the workers thinking when shipping out open items ! So frustrating!!!
Will not turn on, dude from acer said I need to send it in for repairs... I told him to pound sand and I'm not repairing a "new product" I'm getting my money back and going with a different company

The computer wouldn't charge straight out of the box. I plugged it into every available outlet, all of which work. I made sure every connection point was snug, and that the charger was fully into the laptop, and still no charge.

I expect a laptop at this price would be ready to use when I received it. But no it's the begining of a nightmare. First I got a laptop with a broken keyboard. After some trouble shooting I have no choice but to ship it back.

Had this laptop for less then 6 months trated it with the upmost care, used essentially as a desktop. It was only moved 3 times from its initial setup, and now it is a brick. It will not charge and will not turn on regardless of being plugged in.

Jack of all trades laptop that does everything pretty well. Ill go over some of the important categories in detail. I did end up returning this laptop for reasons Ill mention but it is a good device overall.

I bought this laptop with the intention of using it for school and for some light gaming. I wanted something thin, small, light, with good battery life.  I didn't expect to pay such a low price for an item matching my requirements. This is a great laptop but it's got things that one should know about before buying.
I was searching for a new laptop for weeks. When I saw the acer swift x and all the details I understood it is gonna be my laptop right a way.

I got this laptop for Christmas as a gift from my parents since I will be going off to college soon for engineering. I needed a mid-range laptop that had good battery life, solid and light build quality since I will be on the go, a strong CPU and GPU since I will be doing CAD and maybe even some light gaming, and of course a good price. This is a tall order for any laptop but I am impressed with this thin and light.

This Acer Swift X has the specs -- AMD Ryzen 7 5800U, NVIDIA RTX 3050Ti graphics card, 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD, Wi-Fi 6, and it's thin, lightweight and pretty sleek looking. It can play games or crush productivity work, has a really crisp full HD display (though it only gets up to 300 nits brightness), and has a decent port selection - two USB-A, USB-C, HDMI, headphone, & power.

Acer Swift X SFX14-41G-R1S6 Creator Laptop | 14" Full HD 100% sRGB | AMD Ryzen 7 5800U | NVIDIA RTX 3050Ti Laptop GPU | 16GB LPDDR4X | 512GB NVMe SSD | Wi-Fi 6 | Backlit Keyboard | Windows 10 Home (ASIN: B093TK1PXF)

This laptop seemed fine for a while but then the left-side USB port stopped working. I spent many frustrating hours trying to install an Entrust data card until realizing it was the port. I found Acer's support website difficult to navigate. Finally got through and returned the unit. I clearly explained to the chat agent the issue. And I clearly wrote down the issue on slip of paper and included with the unit. Unit comes back from some facility in Texas - NOT fixed! Same exact problem.
I've learned to trust Acer brand. My Acer PC is still working great and the Acer laptop that I've replaced with the Acer Swift, still works fine. It's just way out of date.
I had gotten this laptop for college and a bit of side gaming. It works like a charm! I knew the specs were pretty good and I didn't really expect it to be this good. Overall good laptop

I did not receive a unit with Win10 on it, despite it stating Win10 in the specs. Ignoring that, it has a solid build and solid performance. I do hate the nuisances of Win11, it's like a reskinned Win10, but with extra steps. I'm keeping it for now as I need the laptop, but will remain slightly disappointed. I was hoping to skip this OS until the next one (Win12?), but I'll give it a shot a little longer.
Aside from a ton of bloatware and missing drivers which I fixed with AVG, the laptop felt great. Very light, as they claim. Battery life is pretty average, maybe above than average.

This is by far one of the best Windows laptops I have ever owned. It came with minimal bloatware (much of which I cleaned up upon receiving the laptop) and the memory and processor performance of my personal laptop keep up with high loads: multiple virtual machines running, WSL running Linux, Firefox, VSCode, Spotify, Teams and Outlook run almost constantly on my laptop with no gaps in work or delays from loading.
I went for this laptop because I didn't want to have to move to Windows 11.  The listing needs to be updated as this machine does not have Windows 10 Home as advertised.
An absolute beast of a laptop in a little package. My only gripe is that it's advertised to come with Windows 10, but it instead came with Windows 11. That should be updated!

Bought this as an early birthday present for my wife. Runs as good if not better than her gaming tower but she can take it in the living room. Runs great after i did a fresh windows install. Almost tempted to buy one for myself. Battery life when gaming isn’t amazing, but what laptop is? Its great for its size.

I'm on my third laptop and each time the wifi card disappears after 2-3 months. This time I'm outside the return period so I'm unable to exchange with Amazon and will have to deal directly with Acer. Don't buy this.
There are essentially two laptops available that serve the niche the Acer Swift X exists in; the other is the ASUS ROG Flow X13. That notebook is $300 more expensive...on sale.

Battery life was a major feature I was excited about, disappointing. And when charging, literally half the computer gets too hot to touch. Battery life is about an hour n a half when playing a game. Windows 11 is buggy and mediocre at best

Laptop is really looking elegant and its lightweight.  Its perfect for both office type of work to high demanding apps like adobe. I also played on it several modern games and they worked like charm! However this laptop has been purchased only for work stuff so its really doing the job great!

All is good w/exception of being advertised at Windows 10 operating system.... it's Windows 11.  Not happy yet will live w/it mainly because I had techs transfer files and they told me it was Windows 11.  Sure it could b returned but it would b my cost to offload files.  It's quick.  Lightweight.

Por el precio que pagué es  una maquina espectacular para creadores. El diseño es limpio y bonito, la pantalla se ve preciosa, es liviana y le dura bastante la bateria 10/10. Mi trabajo de como creadora de contenidos para redes sociales

I got this for personal and light work use. I do some freelance work and this performs well and manages many tabs open and can process through downloads without slowing. Haven’t had any issues with graphics. Keyboard lights up and feels smooth under the finger tips. I like the color BUT I do have some

Overall, it has good performance and a good battery life. I am happy with the screen. The only drawback I can think of is that the fans can be occasionally noisy but I think the pros (price/performance) outweigh a little bit of noise. It does everything that I need it to and the keyboard/trackpad are pretty good.
Muy buena compra, no pesa mucho, es minimalista, muy rapida, elegante la batería dura mucho. Lo único que no me parece es que solo tiene 2 puertos USB, y no tiene puerto Ethernet.

Considering the internal specs of this model, it's a good deal, especially if you get it on sale. The 3050Ti GPU in this unit has a TGP of just 40W, which is on the low end, but given the compact chassis, it's hardly surprising. Nonetheless, this machine is more than capable of doing some gaming, but you won't be running Cyberpunk 2077 on Ultra settings with raytracing, obviously. Haha.

The combination between the fast Ryzen 7 CPU and the RTX 3050Ti GPU make the computer's performance amazing. Additionally the 16 GB RAM and 512 GB SSD makes it a perfect combination. The reason I'm giving this 4 stars is because I had some minor problems with the WiFi card and some problems with Windows 11. It has amazing battery life and it provides a great gaming experience for what it's worth.

Laptop arrived with issues. Frequently reboots itself and goes into recovery mode. A clean reinstall of Windows did not fix the problem. Memory tests fine as does the SSD. There is an error when I try to return it for replacement which I assume is stock related. I will be returning this for a refund and getting something else.

The laptop has a ryzen 7 processor and a 3050 Ti for the price you honestly couldn't get a product that offers more than the acer swift x. I cannot recommend this product because the moment I turned it on the fan just started kicking in and would never stop. I tried pressing Fn+F to put the laptop on quiet mode and the fan will slow down for 2 seconds before sounding loud again. I honestly can't use the laptop to study because the fan noise is too distracting especially when you connected it to an external monitor.

I used the computer for two months and the battery life was great. I can take it for class at noon and keep using it for programming and taking notes till 6pm with still around 30% power left. It can only work for two hours when playing pc games, but I play them at home and can charge whenever I like. And it’s light. I can hardly feel it when I take it in my backpack.

Has some good specs and good performance, but as others have mentioned the fan is way too loud. Like this is a serious faulty issue. The noise sounds like they're grinding metal inside the laptop. Returning immediately and likely getting a Dell XPS.

This is a review of Acer Swift X SFX14-41G-R1S6 Creator Laptop | 14" Full HD 100% sRGB | AMD Ryzen 7 5800U | NVIDIA RTX 3050Ti Laptop GPU | 16GB LPDDR4X | 512GB NVMe SSD | Wi-Fi 6 | Backlit Keyboard | Windows 10 Home.

Very excellent for what I have it for. I like to be able to play AAA games on moderate settings, and the 3050ti delivers. But I also write and read a lot, and some programming, so the long battery life is very useful.
I bought this computer by the advices of some friends and I don't regret it, is really fast, the battery might be kind of weird sometimes, but overall it does the job, would recommend.

The laptop works great with an awesome battery life. My budget was around $1,300 and this laptop with an RTX 3050ti and a 8 core processor. I’m a student and I needed a lightweight laptop and I knew that this was my choice. The laptop have a responsive keyboard and a sturdy chasis. The camera is not that great but it works so I don't mind.

The laptop comes with all the hardware I needed at a reasonable price point. It's not too heavy and has a solid build quality. The keyboard is responsive, however the PgUp and PgDn keys are close to the left and right arrow keys.

The laptop arrived non-functional. I couldn't figure out the issues for the life of me, but it had an earlier release of Win 11, so I wiped that for Win 10 and once it was all updated it was smooth sailing on Sea of Thieves and nice shots on Rocket League. I've got Davinci and Reaper installed and they all work excellently too, and the extra NVMe slot was perfect to add some storage for audio/video/games.

This laptop has worked great for me for school work. I have run into no problems or bottlenecks even when I try and do some gaming on it. Overall I would recommend this to anyone that wants a great quality thin and light that has some serious horsepower under the hood for all of your gaming or creation needs.
This laptop is fast, lightweight, and has great battery life. The only problem was that the charger components did not fit together. However, acer can replace it. Overall a great purchase.

This laptop is perfect for students. It's only 3lbs very light weight but contain 3050ti which is great. Ryzen 7 and what not. It has sRGB which produces accurate colours. It's perfect for editing also. Battery backup is pretty good. It looks dope in goldan colour. Do buy it.

This laptop is perfect at nothing, but great at everything. It can run intensive games well, it can be used for typing well, and pretty much anything else a laptop should do, this is good at doing. Overall, it's one of the best laptops for students, especially if you want a super subtly secret gaming laptop that looks like a typical laptop.

the laptop feels solid, it's thin & light + so powerful, it has great CPU with 8 cores and 16 threads + decent GPU 3050 ti . it means that i can edit my 4k videos with no problem. the keyboard is good, the screen is not glossy which is nice, sound quality is average. overall I'm very happy with this laptop.

I was looking for an upgrade to my old laptop and I didn't want to pay an exorbitant price for an ultrabook. After a thorough internet (and Youtube) search, I found the Acer Swift X. I just think this laptop is amazing. You get a pretty light, compact, well built and with great specs laptop, for a reasonable price.

I was looking for a 14 inch laptop for my programming classes that wouldn’t break the budget. I found this laptop and decided to buy it. It’s good for multitasking and programming. You can also play games in 1080p. I did decide to add a WD Black SSD to store my games. I think this laptop is a great deal without spending a lot of money.

I love this laptop.  3.06 lbs and it can run triple-a games (with lower settings).  You don't even need to carry around the charger.  It supports USB-C power delivery up to 100w (i tested it with a watt meter) so you can have one charger for all of your devices saving even more weight.

Although the computer satisfies my needs, it is certainly without its flaws. The speakers are terrible - downward-facing, with no depth. I had a audio popping issue due to power distribution which I eventually fixed by adjusting the power plan. The charging cable is also a bit flimsy and stresses me out quite a bit.

I got this for one purpose and one purpose alone: gaming. I use my Mac for mostly everything else (web surfing, light coding, work stuff, etc.), but obviously the Mac can't fill the gaming itch that PC's have enjoyed for decades. Admittedly, I don't game too much on PC because I usually play on my Switch and PS5, but there have been a ton of Steam gems I've wanted to try out over the years that I never got the chance to.

My new Acer Swift X SFX14-41G-R1S6 Creator Laptop did not work. The screen was black and did not work. I returned the computer to amazon and got a refund. I chose to buy a different laptop as a replacement.

My only complaints are the lack of an SD card slot, and non upgradable ram. Build quality is a lot better than others are making it out to be. Speakers are OK, a little bit on the quiet side but still usable. Battery life is awesome, averaging 8-9 hours of light to moderate use. Get this if you want something independent from a wall outlet but still very capable. Sure, there are more powerful laptops out there for the price at the sacrifice of weight and battery life. Then again, this is an Ultrabook, not a gaming laptop.

The Acer Swift X is well priced laptop with plenty of power that could be dialed down to last a whole day. The laptop might looks simple and bland, with the silver aluminum chassis, but the Ryzen 7 5800U APU and NVIDIA RTX 3050Ti packs a punch.
Better than I thought it would be. It is super light which is what I wanted. The quality is fine for me. I would buy it again if I needed to

I liked the size and weight of the laptop plus the specs are very capable. Most games will play just fine and the battery life is pretty good if you plan to use it away from home. My main con is the screen, I thought it could have been better.  It seemed like the contrast was low and the black levels were higher than I'd like. The brightness and colors were decent enough. I would've also liked to see an SD card slot.
The RAM is soldered in with now expansion sockets! Really Acer? So buy as much RAM as you can get because you're not adding any! It does have two M.2 SSD slots, so that's nice.

Just got this laptop, and it works like a charm. I love the matte screen, which means there is little light reflection off the screen, and I can afford to lower the screen brightness and save battery. Really helps me as I'm a college student. Not only is it able to process all of my school work, but I am also able to play some games that I couldn't with my old laptop!

I am a computer science student + work with adobe programs and this laptop really does not struggle with anything. I can carry it around college and not feel like a brick in my back and has a beautiful design!

This is the best laptop you can buy for the price point especially if you aren’t into bulky gaming laptops but still want to game amongst other things. It has great battery life, good for gaming but the camera and microphone is lacking. I also had a wifi driver issue but that resolved itself and I never saw that issue again. Other than those things extremely happy with my purchase, this will last me years.

It's 2022 but somehow finding a quality laptop with an excellent backlit keyboard is still difficult. This feature was one of the reasons I purchased this laptop, but if I could do it over again I'd look elsewhere.
Only owned for a short while but the laptop runs very well. The build quality is nice and screen looks great as well. Definitely a good bang for your buck with the specs

Been using this for a week now and it's been doing me wonders. Great for low-end gaming and great for school and normal life activities. The only problem is that the charger is a bit finicky and the fan is a bit loud when gaming but other than that its a 10 outta 10 from me!

Built quality was better than I expected. Screen is great. Performance has been really good. Very portable. Extra SSD slot is a big plus and is easy to access. Overall great product for the price, I have been more than pleased and I highly recommend.

The using experience is terrible. The network card is very bad. Just after three months, the device cannot to the WiFi.I call on Acer to get a support, every time they let me to reset the internet. But It cannot work. Just waste my time. And after do that a coup times, the device shows a blue screen and cannot to open. For the repairing, I need to ship it to Acer. A very terrible experience.
Bit of a nerd alert here - I'm fairly techy and so this review might get a bit in the weeds, but read on if you're interested in a true breakdown of what this thing can do.

I called Acer support immediately after noticing it would not turn on. They guided me through a few steps, but none that fixed my problem. The support told me that they had received a similar report for this item the 24th of September. For the exact same unit. The same product had been returned and sold again without fixing the problem.

I've been looking forward to getting an upgraded computer. We found this one after looking for awhile. This product seems to meet all my needs. Gaming, Great Graphics, Portable/ Light weight and reliable battery life.

Worked fine for like a month. Now it blue screens daily and I have to reinstall windows every day. I need this laptop to tour with and theres no way I’ll be using it now. Horrible experience. Looked online and many people have the same issue. Going to try and get the money back because I don't want to have this happen in the middle of a live show on stage.
I really like how long the battery last, it last me all day if I don’t charge it while I work and it’s also great for the times I want to just chill and game

La recibí hace una semana es una bestia, el rendimiento es impresionante un poco más pequeña de lo que esperaba, el teclado no es el más comodo las teclas son un poco pequeñas pero es algo de costumbre.
It’s too expensive for what you get, a small laptop tgat is kind of slow if you run more than a couple programs. It shouldn’t cost $1200, it should be more on $800 price range. Disappointed.

I do a lot of video editing and though I love everything Apple creates, I’m not a huge fan of their laptops or desktops.  I grew up using windows and adobe products and I know that macs are supposed to be great for editing videos, but the cost and learning of a new software keep me from making the switch.  This laptop has handled every 4K video I’ve thrown at it and it is super portable which is great as I mostly shoot drone footage.  All around a great laptop.
Love the speed and sleekness of the machine. After 4 months, the wireless adapter went caput. Completely unrecognizable in the laptop and thus no WiFi. Apparently, it's a more than common issue.

The performance on this laptop is excellent with it's RTX 3050ti GPU. I am not a heavy gamer, so it is more than enogh to handle my games such as LOL and AOE4. Not to mention this laptop is only about 3lbs with incredible long lasting battery.

I own an acer swift 1 and needed a laptop with more ram and disk space and acer X gave me that plus all the bells and whistles.  Its really loaded easy to setup.  Color is off the charts good and very fast.  I highly recommend.  I received the laptop in 3 days well packaged.

It’s a great laptop with plenty of power to run most popular applications. Battery life is good especially when plugged on to the monitor - I get about 7-8 hours. The only bad aspect is that laptop doesn’t go to sleep.

This laptop has internals of a laptop 300 euros more expensive than it and performs admirably in both office and gaming tasks. It is stylish and feels premium. It has a great keyboard and a decent trackpad. It can easily get 60 faps or more on most games if playing on 1080p High.

I originally bought a MSI 15M 3060 MAX-Q w/ 11th gen Intel. I’m an casual gamer and that laptop ran VERY HOT, I couldn’t even use it as a “Laptop” without 3rd degree burns. Now this laptop, wow, it runs very cool under load. If you’re looking for something besides a space ship with huge fan vents, this is it.

I was looking for a laptop good for gaming and work, and this laptop accomplishes a lot of my needs. For all the  great specs that this laptops gives, its truly a jack of all trades laptop. Great battery life, and fast charging. Really light weight laptop, and quite portable. The keyboard and trackpad are not the best, but very reliable and solid. Not much to complain about this laptop.

This is a fantastic little powerhouse. For an (oh-so-close to 3lb) ultra portable, this little machine packs a punch. It's not a gaming laptop, but can keep up in a pinch, and way outperforms similarly prices rival models. It's exactly what I need in a mix of portability and power.

We were looking for a great laptop at this pricepoint (around $1k) that would fit our needs in photo and video editing as well as have some room for other things. Needless to say, this laptop has fulfilled these needs and exceeded all expectations!

I Just got the laptop a few days ago, and I already really like it. I really like the fingerprint sensor and I like how fast and responsive it is. I am using it for college and it is going to be perfect. I have already recommended this laptop to my friends.
Decent for the price. It is a very light laptop but has enough power to do some gaming. The screen is good, bright enough for most applications. Would have been nice if it came with Windows 10 Pro.

I have only used this laptop for 4 weeks and the trashy WiFi card already fails on a regular basis. It has been an issue off and on since I got the laptop. Sometimes I have to reset Windows, sometimes I have to manually reset it by going to hardware devices, disabling it and re-enabling it. Sometimes none of these solutions work so I have to hard reset the laptop by holding down the power button for 30s ("shutdown" through the Windows tab doesn't cut it).

I wouldn't game on it. I would do ok for things that are not gpu intensive. They underclocked the GPU so you don't get the full power out of it but I caught it on sale and it was the cheapest laptop that fit my specs. Works great, great battery life and fantastic to work from home. Only downside are the small compress chiclet keys, but its a laptop.

Let me say this has great performance. It handled everything i threw at it, playing mid to high gaming with rtx and dsll enabled was cool - while even doing some media consumption and work on the side.

It's a great laptop for its price. There were issues with the stock Mediatek WiFi adapter. I replaced it with an Intel AX200 adapter and the issues are gone. Build quality is acceptable for its price and specs. It's a great laptop overall. Delivery is really fast, I got it to my hands within a week even if I live outside us. Also, I didn't have to deal with customs. My order was shipped by Amazon via UPS.

It's what you'd expect. Solid performance from the new, updated CPU/GPUs. I was looking for a more minimal looking laptop with these specs at this price point, and this sort of fit. The chassis is a little outdated in terms of it's design and the trackpad feels a little clunky, but overall a solid laptop.

What's a laptop with a dead WiFi card ? An expensive paper weight. And it doesn't help when the manufacturer's website cannot identify their own product with the S/N or SNID. Acer is now on my business no-buy list. Decent NVIDIA/AMD power horse for architectural software, but when it fails and can't repair WiFi connectivity, it's just a kid's gaming trinket.

I bought this Swift X just over one month ago.I immediately upgraded the O/S nvme to 2tb,& added an additional 2tb nvme. I installed steam, Amd Tuning utility, & a custom version of windows 10. Total ram on idle was 1.2g.

The WiFi module died within the day of delivery. When it was still detected, it wouldn't reliably connect to the internet in both Windows and from a Linux live USB. The overall build quality is quite poor for a $1000+ laptop. The charging plug is laughably fragile and will only connect at certain angles and with a constant push inwards.

A great replacement for my previous laptop. Longer battery life, better graphics, better performance, quieter (even when playing high fps games), and overall just what I was looking for for its Black Friday cost. Highly recommend for just about everything except if you want to play games at the highest graphics and/or games known to require a lot out of your computer.

Great price (especially recently discount). It’s quick and easy to set up, lightweight, only 3.06 lbs. Fingerprint scanner is fast. This laptop only has two USB ports, may need to get a USB dock for additional USB ports. Overall I would highly recommend this laptop.

I bought this computer to use in college, I use some kinda heavy software like sketchup, autocad, photoshop and illustrator. And for these, the computer seems to be doing very well. I really like de design, cause products with similar specs are usually aimed for gamers and the style is usually very agressive an rough. I like that this one is extremely elegant. The sound has some issues, as I have read across other reviews, but I do not need this aspect to be perfect anyway.

This review is primarily for people who prefer GNU/Linux computer operating systems and are familiar with the process of installing such a system on a computer which comes with Microsoft Windows pre-installed.

I have been looking at several laptops before buying this model. Many pages recommend it, also If you look over the reviews for this model and the 512GB there are many reviews that have been done as a free product. This is ok -marketing' but let's go to my experience.

I bought a pc because I needed to run windows for my engineering classes. I'm not knowledgeable about windows at all, but this computer has amazing performance all packed in for a great price. I wish that the display was 4k, and that the body was a little more premium, but for the price you cannot beat the top-of the line specs!

Product:Acer Swift X SFX14-41G-R1S6 Creator Laptop | 14" Full HD 100% sRGB | AMD Ryzen 7 5800U | NVIDIA RTX 3050Ti Laptop GPU | 16GB LPDDR4X | 512GB NVMe SSD | Wi-Fi 6 | Backlit Keyboard | Windows 10 Home

This is a very light laptop, with many high-end features. Thanks to the AMD Ryzen CPU, the battery life is awesome even with 8cores and 16threads. It is also very fast owing to the SSD, 16GB RAM, and the Ryzen CPU. There is even an NVidia graphics accelerator for playing games or video editing.. if you can part with some of the battery life.

I found this computer and comparing prices this have a really good hardware, no after I received y ran the PS2 emulator an run very well, I downloaded other videogames and run excelent, all the cover is of metal, and can virtualice the operating systems very quick and easy wit VBox or other virtual hypervisor, it is really fast when executing software, the  RAM can't be expanded but the hard drive yes, so I expanded the other slot to a 1 TB with a gaming SSD NVME, that's how I have now a complete laptop

This computer has a lot of potential but the build quality isn't there. It it feels like it should be a $300 laptop in build quality alone. The trackpad on my unit wasn't even level in the computer. I don't have much confidence in Acer's build quality anymore. I think the specs of the computer are pretty good value, but I did hear the fan run quite a bit. The battery life seemed to be okay. I ended up returning this thing going with an Asus ROG Flow X13 which worked much better for me!
You really can't beat the price for the quality and power of this laptop. If you do a lot of heavy gaming, the graphics card is OK but not great. But really for anything else this is the one to buy.
The build quality of this Acer Swift is excellent and on pair with every other high-end laptop I have owned. The screen is clear and crisp with no dead pixels.

I got this for work since I'm constantly having to move around. This works great. The only thing that I should have gotten was one with a touch screen. But I don't really need that. I haven't tried to game on it so I don't know what games it will play. But it is fast when moving between programs and having multiple windows open.

The laptop arrived protected. Upon inspection I didn't liked the choice of colors too much, but its performance is unbearable at this price. The screen could go dimmer when turning the brightness down, but I'm none of those people that tend to use the least amount of backlight on my laptops, so take it with a pinch of salt.

A year after I bought this product it stopped working due to water damage that was there before I bought it and because I bought it renewed the apple store couldn’t do anything to fix it unless I pay like $900. Don’t waste your money

I was so excited to get this air because I previously owned the MacBook Air 2015 model. I received this product today and noticed a broken key, the "1" is jammed and only works when a lot of pressure is applied. disappointing because everything else works great and runs much faster than my old 2015.

This was an open-box purchase. The end of the micro-usb cable broke off in the first week. Then the power plug itself failed after three weeks. Have had to purchase replacements. Otherwise, the laptop seems to be working fine (fingers-crossed).
I am currently using it and love it!  I am so glad I bought it as it does just what I need it to do!  I would buy another one just to have an extra - though I don't really need one :-)

When I received my computer is was absolutely stunning. Perfect everything- but then I discovered the tab key did not operate properly. Then one day it just wouldn’t turn on. It finally did, but I did not think that I should have to deal with that even with a refurbished item. Had to return, to big of a purchase for it not to work properly

I am a big review person  let me tell you this thing is amazing and it like practically brand new for refurbished not one scratch on it I was very impressed  And it came the day it said I will definitely buy from that seller again

A little disappointed in the packaging. Came in original MacBook Air box but the box was quite weathered. Made for an anticlimactic presentation and honestly made me concerned that the product would also be subpar. However, the computer seemed to be unblemished and function normally. Did have to reset it recently for acting up. The mouse was not appearing no matter how much you moved on the trackpad. But resetting it resolved the issue.

I bought two of them, in Gold (sold by BREED), and in Grey (sold by KANGA). The gold/Breed one presented as completely new and was probably renewed by Apple (5 STARS!). The Grey/Kanga was... far from great. Packed poorly, not really properly cleaned, and came with an aftermarket charger - not the Apple one (2 STARS). For some reason I could not write two reviews. The Air itself is a great machine with a gorgeous screen - go for the i5 - the i3 is too weak.
this is NOT the latest model and does not have the M1 chip which is newest and this is a 2018 model. Why is the "latest model" in the desc? That is very misleading + it is a 2018 w 2020 price.

I'm beyond happy with my purchase!! My MacBook basically looks brand new and everything works very well. no issues at all. Item was delivered within 3 days of my purchase, very fast and safe delivery.

I bought this thing for my daughter. I tried to convince her to let me buy a similarly priced Lenovo that was 4 times as powerful but she would have none of it. Her friends all use Macs and this one in particular is gold and matches her iPhone. You couldn't have given it to me. FYI, the daughter in question just graduated from medical school. SMH.
Super malo,estaba en muy mal estado, por fuera como por dentro,y encima me toco pagar para devolverlo, su cargador no era el del PC,eso es una falta de respeto para uno como consumidor. 😡

I’m not gonna lie. Initially there was an issue with the shipment of my MacBook Air. I frustratingly reached out to customer service thinking it would take days to receive a response (or no response at all). Surprisingly they replied in under 24 hours and handled my concerns with such care & professionalism! Not to mention my MacBook Air came in AMAZING condition. I have no issues and will definitely make another purchase with them soon after the holidays!

I got this MacBook and it has so many issues with it. I cannot use it at all. Even after being on Apple technical support for hours. $1000 down the drain. Husband gave it to me as an anniversary gift a month after getting it. Now can’t return it.
bought a few days ago.  delivery was yesterday.  I turned it on, installed all the programs, did a little work.  And this morning it does not turn on anymore.  what to do?
I am very much in love with my computer, I was really scared to order the computer online but I am so pleased to say that it is real and I am in love.

Got mine, tried to charge it, never charged or turned on.  It came with a SHARKK charger and it was not working, I went to Bestbuy and bought an apple charger for MacBooks.  Let it charge for over an hour and still would not turn on.  I am not satisfied and I will be returning the laptop and purchasing a new one from Apple.  I should have known better.

The product came dirty and it was damage after one day of use it would freeze constantly and from time to time glitch. The color was nice but the product was not in well conditions. And not all money was refund it was a company's fault not my fault

The laptop is beautiful!! This is the first Mac I’ve ever had and I am in LOVE!! The display is amazing, crystal clear and there is no blemishes or anything wrong with the laptop. It looks brand new and works perfectly. Thank you!!
Absolutely love the sleek look of this MacBook! It was super easy to type on and lightweight, so that I could take my work on the go/ fit it in a small carry on! Recommend, recommend, recommend!!!!
you can get it with windows11 for 30% less just look around on the net free shipping to i payed more for 10 and got stuck with 11 not happy at all O and it in S mode !

It is a good laptop for light tasks: office, web surfing, watching videos. Not for more. No coollers = no noise. CPU is weak and after first loading you need few hours to update the system. After this it works good. Laptop has NVMe M2 port inside for adding additional ssd disk. You can not upgrade anything else.

I needed a Windows 10 computer for work.  I thought this would be perfect.  It arrived with Windows 11 running in S mode.  The listing mentioned it would weighed 1 pound which I knew wasn't correct.  Had to return due to the OS issue.

This laptop is not bad, but it is not very efficient for anything other than checking emails and online schooling. You cannot download games to it as it does not have enough ram, but if you are just doing basic things online then you should be fine. The laptop started having issues after we downloaded Chrome, now it's very slow. If you're just going to use the Explorer Web browser, you should be fine.

nice inexpensive computer, great except there is a built in calculator in the mouse pad that keeps turning on that makes it impossible to use the touch pad for scrolling etc. I delete the driver and windows reloads it as soon as I shut the computer.
I’m sorry but it didn’t turn or charge no matter what I did, it was honestly a waste of my time and money. (I don’t mean to sound rude though.)

This has got to be the best computer deal I have purchased!!!!  The 14inch screen is great and the size and weight of the computer is amazing. Super fast response, graphics are great and is easily storable!!!  Great buy for the money. I will be buying two more for my kids!!

For the money this is a great buy. Don't expect too much. I made the mistake of upgrading to Win11 and lost about 5GB of built-in hard disk space (so now I'm down to 25GB). That's not a prob for me since I never keep anything critical on my built-in HD anyway - nor should you :) BTW I always use an external keyboard + mouse (consider a USB hub that will cost you all of $10  I DO appreciate the 2 built-in USB ports.

I didn't even receive the right laptop with the right specs. After setting up the laptop it immediately started beeping really loud and then blew into recovery mode due to not having a hard drive>??? I'm not that tech inclined but I know enough to know what specs a computer does an doesn't have and
I can't rate the computer because you did not include a power source or tell me I needed one, so-o-o-o-o now I wait a few more days to see if it actually works.

Don't buy it! Dell won't fix it!  Used at home and less than 60 days the hinge came lose and the screen came apart.  I have to leave it open or it will get worse. After hours on the phone, Dell said the warranty does not cover this issue.  I can see other reviews with the same breakdown. Dell and Amazon are big companies and should try to make it right for consumers. It appears to be a manufacturing fault and should be recalled.  I will never buy another Dell product.

I could barely set the thing up. It timed out on every screen, every internet search, even with full-strength wifi - and with me sitting right next to the router! I had such high hopes, and I'm entirely disappointed. I got a new computer BECAUSE my old one was slowing down, not to get an even slower one.

This laptop is slower then my old laptop I was replacing that’s 5 years old so I expected much more…  I expected it would be able to play a game on fb.. it’s not like I am playing COD it’s FarmVille for gosh sakes!!
I'm very happy with this machine it works great, I wished it had touch screen but for the money I can live without it. The clarity is wonderful and so easy to setup.  Life is good for a senior😊😊

the internal battery lasted 2-4 days and wont recharge. its not dell, its the battery. i will never buy a laptop unless i can order a replacement  battery. in of story  . p s  i bought a IBM a year ago, the touch screen is junk,  dots that wont stop.

It's a good solid laptop! I needed an extra for work and then my primary broke so now this one is the one. In fact it is the one I am typing this review on, lol. The 10-key is great also. The picture quality is good for the price.
Buyer beware - I bought this laptop specifically because it is advertised as running Windows 10 as that is what I needed to run a specific software program. It comes preinstalled with Windows 11.

I needed a new laptop for a class, after owning my old laptop FOR YEARS. Dell Inspiron has a Beautiful 15+" display & was exactly what I needed: Spill proof keyboard, fast processor, great basic storage & functionality (I'm not an IT pro). Definitely recommend it.

I've always LOVED Dell Desktop computers. I've had several throughout many years. But I'd never heard anything about Dell laptops. Knowing that Dell makes the best desktops (in my opinion!), I decided to try the laptop. I couldn't believe how fast I fell in love with this laptop. I've had it for over a month now, using it for several hours each day & I have only found 2 problems with it:

I do not like the laptop. It is the worse I have ever had. It shuts down and will not come back on unless you are typing. Then you have to keep rebooting. Warning- I would not buy again. Don't waste your money.

This is the perfect computer for someone needing a home computer or work and school computer.  It's lightweight, fast, and can do multiple tasks.  What I like best is how fast it starts up.  Zero loading time when you turn it on and I like how easy it transitions between apps.  I don't do gaming but I do stream and it is smooth and loads fast. I've had several other brands and so many were disappointing.  This one is a keeper.
& wanted two good search engines, but Was frustrated by all the roadblocks thrown in by the hype telling me how good MICROSOFT EDGE was. i just could not load GOOGLE. I finally returned the Laptop.

As expected. It is fantastic! Light weight and well made. It performs smooth and quietly. We just needed a laptop for day to day office work and we had a small budget. The price was unbelievable and the performance has my two tombs up. The delivery was made way ahead of time, the package was well wrapped and padded. Wow! Thank you.
ing. This one is perfect for that. It's not touch screen which I didn't want any ports. I found set up to be really easy and  don't mind any of those

I'm about to finish law school and I've had this laptop throughout my tenure. Being in law school and addicted to old 90's video games at the same time, I've spent more hours than I can count on this thing. I also stream movies/shows to my TV through the HDMI, and rock dual screens with a portable second screen. I usually have at least 10 tabs open for research, a few word documents open, run a really expensive adobe program, and play music at the same time and this thing can handle it.

I bought the 2012 iteration of this models series and stopped using it on 2018. I stopped using it because it started getting heavy and slow. If I actually made an effort I would have probably been able to tweak it so it would go faster. The touchscreen feature is really nifty (especially in 2012/13) but this makes the screen heavier and dirtier. I believe for what its worth you get a lot for your money. Even being a budget friendly laptop I was able to game on it and use it as my daily driver.
The computer didn’t work when it arrived, after much hassle with Dell we returned it for a new hard drive - the ‘fixed’ one doesn’t work at all, not even the keyboard!! Worst product ever.

Returned as soon as I finally got to open the computer and look at the specs.  Processor was slower (1.1 GHz vs 1.4 GHz\1.6GHz) than advertised and the hard drive was smaller (128 GB vs 500 GB) than advertised.  There is conflicting specifications when this computer is compared with similar ones.  I'm going to stick with purchasing directly from the manufacturer.  I would have been hugely disappointed if I had paid the original purchase price of $1,000.

Dell won't give a service warrantee but charges a higher price because of the length time since the vendor bought this..  The vendor did not mention this.  I recommend buying Dell computers directly from Dell.
If you are just going to use it for emails and social media this is perfect for that.  If you are looking for speed for gaming etc. this is probably not the one for you.

I use this for personal and business computing at home - currently independent contractor.  Screen size is good - can use stand-alone (when I travel) but add larger screen at home for second screen.  Keyboard is also fine for travel, which again I supplement at home with separate key board.  Could have used more ports but extension ports seem work fine.  I am not a Google fan so the Microsoft suite (Excel, Word, Outlook, etc.) work fine for me - although Edge I am not crazy about.  Google and other aps work fine.

I haven’t bought a Dell in well over a decade because I’ve never had a good experience with them. Thought I’d give them a second chance 2022. It’s an impossibly slow laptop, to the point that I was almost nostalgic for dial-up internet. Not happy about having to pay to return this junk but it would have been an expensive paperweight if I kept it. Lesson learned - no more Dells.
Do not buy dell laptops , the hinges come loose and then the hinge catches the frame around the screen and screen, then dell won’t pay for repair, say it’s not covered, only had laptop 2 months

Nothing wrong w/the laptop except for the way it was advertised.  I specifically ignored laptops that had Windows 10S.  This one was advertised as Windows "Home" - which it is, but running in S mode.  S mode is a real pain and getting out of S mode once it's on there isn't straightforward either.
we were looking for a lap top, to take with us when we travel, this computer is great!, light weight, large screen, and simple to use.  I always loved Dell, and, this fits all of our needs!

I did not discover until I got through setup that this machine has Windows 11 Home installed, not Windows 10 as advertised. That matters because Windows 11 may not work with some of my legacy apps on a hardware platform as limited as this. There was NO indication on the box or the machine itself as to which version was installed. It even arrived without ANY paperwork inside the box, not even a rudimentary setup guide.
I needed a new laptop for work since l am working from home..l like a lot it’s fast and light weight the set up was very easy..and the price was not bad either..

Never loads when i actually need it to. It is so glitchy I have constantly missed zoom calls. The price is alright it worked for the first couple of months but after that it did not. Not worth my money or my time

Ordered this as a gift for my mother for Christmas and upon powered up it said hard drive not installed. It took me a month, several phone calls, several emails, plenty of fights between Amazon and Dell neither wanted to help fix this!!!

I did not realize that there was no CD-ROM drive nor that the keyboard did not light up for easy to see keys. I don't see too well and that would have helped me out alot. And I guess I assumed that all laptops would have some sort of CD drive. Pay closer attention to things that you might take for granted.

20 days after we received this laptop, the hinges holding the screen onto the body of the computer broke. We were not using the laptop on a daily basis and we were not abusing the laptop in any way; so this is obviously a defect with the manufacturer. The seller, GamerLand Express, has a high rating based on the website, so hopefully they are not at fault for the problem.

I was so glad that I purchased this new laptop from Amazon. The price was affordable and works great. The anti-virus was a feature that was at a very great price. It is still working great after about almost a year!

I am very happy with the laptop. Since all of the wireless mouse, that I have gotten, were not a success, it was great to find that, all I need use is a finger. Plus, it does have USB 2.0 (socket) that allows me to my corded mouse, and my printer.

I’m always hesitant with purchasing electronics on any marketplace (I.e Amazon ) but everything is perfect and exactly what I’ve been looking for. It’s worth the money you’ll spend on it for sure! If you’re anything like me I know you have to scroll through a few more reviews to be convinced but trust me when I tell you if ANYTHING and I mean ANYTHING was wrong from the time I purchased to the time I received my laptop I would say it. It also came super quick.
I bought this computer for my dad.  He uses it mostly for paying bills and searching the internet.  It's perfect for that.  It also has a camera.  I think I'm going to get myself one too.

It is unbelievably slow. The computer itself looks nice but the reaction is way too slow. My son would rather use his old broken Accer laptop instead. I don’t know what I can do. It is totally idle and waste. Is it possible to sell it back to the seller with a discount?
No touch screen, that’s ok, you will have warning come up after starting due to the power charger pack. It needs a larger power pack charger. The one I have is to weak.

Within less than 6 months the computer wouldn't charge unless the charger was wiggled in just the right way. I contacted Dell and they told me it wasn't covered because it fell under "normal wear and tear". There is nothing normal about a device not charging properly after less than 6 months of light use.

Still can not plug in earphones and get them to work. Very slow. Purchased for my wife, she is not happy with it. Not happy with them trying to force Mcafee down our throat. Also tried to use recommended Edge as a browser. Tried it and it kept popping up porn advertisements and trying to force Mcafee on us again, even after I had deleted it. Switched to Firefox. This may be one of the worst purchases I have ever made.
Dell Inspiron 3583 15” Laptop Intel Celeron – 128GB SSD – 4GB DDR4 – 1.6GHz - Intel UHD Graphics 610 - Windows 10 Home in S Mode - Inspiron 15 3000 Series -
I had issued with the microphone at first but was able to run some diagnostic tests and it has been restored to whole. Overall, a good product for the price.

When I received the laptop it powered up got it all set up and it was running fine. Today two or three weeks later it would not power up. I had a Tech look at it and he determined that the laptop was dead and useless. Unfortunately my return window has passed so I'm out a little over $300 for a laptop that doesn't work

I ordered this laptop in June for a new job I started. I was to be working hybrid, home on Tues/Thurs and in the Office MWF. My old laptop was a janky Lenovo from college that just needed to go, so I did some digging and found this laptop. The reviews were solid, and the price wasn't steep at all so I went for the purchase.
Got this just for my zoom meetings. The screen is cheap and blurry, but this stays put at my webcam table so I dont hv to move my better computer.
Going over the specs I came to realize it wasn’t going to have that much more storage than I already had in my older laptop. So I returned this item.

I bought the laptop for my job, and I waste my money, is really slow and the most significant is the space that I show in the picture, when I push 2 times for open any document doesn't work, I think 2star is a good review for this product

I ordered this laptop to replace an older HP that has a failing hinge where the screen connects to the base.  I specifically wanted a computer with Windows 10 Home without the WIndows 10-S version because I prefer certain third party applications.  Well the description says Windows 10 Home but it is the -S version.  Not a big deal but misleading and I had to connect to the Microsoft store to get the version I wanted.

Experienced a a Microsoft Scam one day after delivery.  Related to "When I purchased the computer it was to have Security Hardware on it.  Did not per the scammer.  Needed to send $99.95 to get the refund from Microsoft.  Hah!"  Not sure why this would happen immediately after delivered.  I was not on new computer.  So scammer did not know

I ordered 2 laptops for my sons. Within a month, one had a hinge failure, the second machine now has a hinge failure after 4 months. The first machine was repaired, but took about 6 weeks to receive back. It's inexcusable, considering this is a basic part that should be perfected by this point in Dell's manufacturing.

Just got the laptop a month ago. I really love it. Very convenient to use. We even installed Wi-Fi and A Virtual Private Network with it. Now, I don't have to worry about using too much data on my smartphone or waiting to use my desktop PC when I get back home to New York.
Used it for two weeks ran great now everytime I attempt to use it it says “hard drive not found” in the middle of me attempting to get something done. Waste of money.

First off, I got an HP laptop which I was I was fine with but wasn’t expecting. Opened the box and it had a thank you card from Walmart-interesting. Was using it once while doing school work, it went into sleep mode and never turned back on. Very very frustrated and disappointed.

I have just had the computer for  2 weeks and it will not turn on !! When i called dell they said i need to call amazon . I am very frustrated! This seems ti be a problem with this type of computer if you google it

The "Watchdog violation" has been seen on Window's stop code extraction. Did just a Windows update (Win11) procedure. The only third-party software installed to the moment is the Googe Drive. Yet don't know the root of problem. The hard fault happened on Wi-Fi connection changing from established 5G to 2.5G within same router area.

this is the worse computer I've ever had...I the middle of setting up it froze and it been 5 hours and I can't shut it down...and cant get up hpI've callHP and he was it still can;yt get it started...terrible product

Bought/Set this up for a family member who just needed a very basic laptop. Laptop works fine but was disappointed that it doesn't actually come with Windows 11 already loaded. It boots and gets you connected to the Internet and THEN it downloads and installs Windows 11.

I bought this for my Nephew. He likes it a lot, but he is a writer and he had to install and pay for a word program. I don't know why laptops don't offer something simple for writing purposes. Other than that, he is pleased with the laptop.

This computer has me waiting 30 minutes just to search up something, the color is very trashy gray and dull, it is also false advertisement of 256 gbs of storage. This is the worst laptop I have ever owned.
This computer seems to work fine. I thought from the photos it had an SD card reader, but it just has a slot for one so I have to use a separate card reader.
HP has a home run with the average, non gaming user. Just wanted a quick boot up and won’t  burn my legs laptop at a reasonable price.  Rips through all my programs with ease. I am very satisfied.

For what it is, it's pretty good, a ryzen 5 with an SSD and a fhd screen for 400 is honestly impressive. I hate the fact that windows 11 was installed by default, so I moved to Fedora Linux as soon as I was to. I haven't tried any gaming, but I can confidently say it won't run much. Definitely a better choice than a chromebook.

La panatalle trajo un detalle. Un punto claro que se nota cuando el fondo es oscuro. La bateria no dura mas de cuatro horas y tiene un problema que, creo es de configuracion, que no me deja colocar el acento. Le hago los ajuses en idioma, la reinicio y todo bien. Al pasar dos minutos, vuelve con el mismo problema. Me siento decepcionada. No se como hacer para solicitar un cambio, pues la compre desde Venezuela.
The only problem I have is that the processing is not as good with windows 11, the rest of the PC is fine it's light it's ryzen 5. I do realize that I needed a graphic card though

After seeing so many rough reviews I was a bit skeptical myself, but no worries this laptop is lovely! I'm months in and currently typing up this review on it. The keyboard is fantastic and satisfying. The mousepad is super responsive and has even a left and right side that have different features. Although the screen is not my favorite it still works well. This computer performs magically, but I do recommend installing extra ram onto this to rock its full potential. Overall beastly computer, take my word for it!

The AMD Ryzen 5 chip gives this laptop great performance and battery life. Both the CPU and especially the built-in GPU perform very well. Also, it really doesn't get hot nor draw much battery during operation. A very good performing inexpensive laptop overall.

I did not get a 8gb. It was 4gb, blue, and extremely slow. The entire laptop felt like a child's toy. The screen was impossible to see. The quality overall was horrendous. I love HP, but was beyond disappointed with this product.

As you can see in the image, the screen presents this problem and it is more visible when the background is white or light, I have not used a lot this laptop and it started to present this problem for some reason.

Best priced laptop. AMAZING battery life and quick charge. You get everything you want in a simple but powerful computer without having to pay for the "premium" of a top brand name, or the "premium" of an Intel Chip. Thing works just fine -- one glitch is I have to often restart my laptop (takes like 30 seconds max) to initially connect to my WiFi ... maybe an easy fix?

This is a great computer for the value and I am happy with the purchase but, when the computer arrived, it was missing the 3 prong connector jack for the plug to outlet. Please take note as I had to wait another two days and purchase this part.

This laptop did surprise me. The Ryzen 5 mobile CPU is rather good and the 8GB of RAM that it comes with is more than sufficient if you only plan on doing simple tasks - office work, watching videos on video websites, etc.

I never really take my laptop anywhere so I never really rely on it for on the go, I’ve bought this so I can run emulators on my laptop and the limit of this pc seems to be The ps3 emulator, so everything before it should run fine. That’s for people that care about that but overall a solid Investment for me

It's a basic laptop that you can use for work. Comes with Windows 11 and you then buy Office. It's really lightweight - almost exactly as light as the MacBook Air. So if you don't want to spend a lot on a laptop and you only use it for basic stuff like Office, YouTube and web surfing and you are not too finicky about specs then it's a great choice. The AMD Ryzen is pretty fast - kinda faster than Intel IMO.
I do shirt design and am a college student so I definitely use my computer a lot, this computer functions well and is pretty fast. The battery last me maybe 6 hours and is very lightweight.

Bought this one for our son thats attending ASU for engineering. Added another 8G memory stick and this thing is a very capable workhorse. I need one for work travel and look forward to using it daily. Don't hesitate on hitting the button. You will not be disappointed.

I loved everything about this laptop.  It was great until I went to turn it on the other day and though the light indicating it was starting up went on, it quickly went off and it has not worked since.  Since it is a laptop, I was advised it would be cheaper to buy a new one rather than fix this one.  Very disappointed!
I ended up returning it because it doesn’t have an ethernet port.  I didn’t know that not all computers have one.  It seemed like it would be a great computer for a casual user.

Excelente equipo! Prácticamente todo lo que ofrecen sin embargo no tiene el teclado Retro-iluminado como dice en las características para su venta. (Deberían cuidar ese detalle) , de resto, es muy rápida, la pantalla me encanta, excelente calidad y la batería tiene una gran duracion
Good specs for this mid-level laptop.  Perfect for my kid heading off to college.  It has all that is needed except maybe an additional upgrade in RAM needed in the next year or two.

Really good specs for a laptop. I did purchase another stick of 8 gb ram, not too bad to install, just be patient when removing bottom panel. Cinebench score of 5299, which for a mobile processor is not bad. Plan on using with an external monitor, external keyboard, external mouse for CPA/business/tax work. Cheaper than buying a small form factor desktop.

I like how lightweight it is, the ram is upgradeable & so is the SSD drive! I have always been partial to HP; my last 4 computers have been HP's. I find them to be reliable and I am hoping this one is too. It drains the battery faster than I would like, but it could be my settings, I will keep you all posted. Thank you, Amazon!!!

I got this simply to acquaint myself with Windows 11 as my desktop could not be upgraded.  So far for the budget price it was a good choice, so I'm not surprised the keyboard has a flimsy feel.  It does what I need it to do as a backup device and to get familiar with Windows 11.  My opinion on Win 11 is still out.

As for as a laptop, that is all it is. The headphone jack stopped working after 3 months. The battery is meh, it drains pretty quickly if the laptop is off or in sleep. It takes forever to turn on, I legitimately thought it was broken when I first received it because of that. It also takes forever to come out of sleep. The review mentioned a touch screen, I don't think it has one. If it does, mine does not work.
Ok so overall this laptop is a decent, practical, all-around laptop. Not great, but good enough. If you’re a deal hunter and are good at what you do, I guarantee you can find better.

Tenia duda del procesador AMD, acoostumbrado a Intel por mucho tiempo pero es super rapida, la bateria dura bastantes horas. No es tactil pero los colores de la pantalla son geniales. Viene con Windows 11
This laptop is really good and fast. I just upgraded the ram 8gb to 16gb crucial ram and also 1tb sss crucial. Now this thing is butter. Good to buy

I’m glad I tried this laptop. It gave me an appreciation for my 5-year-old model that has more speed and memory. I returned it knowing that I should buy at least an equivalent replacement. I’m not a gamer and

We needed a computer that was light and portable for school. This ticked all the boxes for what we were looking for, and we bought it and a additional stick of ram. It works well, performance is plenty.
Speedy and powerful, I can finally play Genshin Impact. Great battery life and fast to update with a lot of storage. The internet reception isn't very good on it though.
Add another compatible 8GB 3200 RAM (about $40) and upgrade to a fast 1TB-2TB NVMe SSD ($60-$200). I play Fallout4 with a mix of med to mostly high settings with no lag.
