The laptop is fine  but I'm deducting a star because the keyboard is not backlit.  I own three very similar HP latptops purchased through Costco over the past two years.  The Costco laptops were Intel powered i3 and i5 machines with the same 250 nits 14" FHD screens, SSDs and backlit keyboards.  This unit is very similar however it is AMD powered and the keyboard is not backlit.  I tried my best to ensure that it was however I could not confirm on the web.  So let me be the first to confirm it is not.

Everything came fine, box was sealed and undamaged but when it was opened I notice this huge scratches at the back. Somewhat displeased because I know this is a new system but now it feels like a used device

I like the size and weight and was really surprised how easy it was to set up and transfer from my other computer. My biggest disappointment is no touchscreen. I'd be lying if I said I don't miss my touchscreen because I do but that was my mistake, I thought it was a touchscreen, it is not. It's a little bit slow on the startup but functions well so far in everything I use it for. So far so good.
I'm a Gmail guy I have a Gmail account I don't want to change.....good luck getting past all the Microsoft monopoly malware to install chrome as a browser...super slow also

I got this for school as an online college student and I love it!... So far. I've only had it a few days but it works great! It runs fast, I love that the keys are big and don't on them. It's lightweight and the screen is a good size. All and all I'm very pleased.

When the computer isn't plugged in, the laptop won't turn on. If you fully charge it, then put it to sleep..When you open it the next day the battery will be dead and it won't turn on. What good is a laptop if it always has to be plugged in? Useless. Trying to figure out how to contact HP about the one year warranty. It's ridiculous how hard they make it.

Flimsy and breaks from falling less than 2 ft on a carpeted floor :-(  HP will not honor any repair on accidental damage.  My laptop was less than a month old when it happened. I sent it to them and HP quoted $619 to repair my $500 laptop.  I will never buy HP again.

Produst was as expected but I ordered 2 laptops and only one came with shipment. Had to find out why and apparently warehouse only had one but there was no communication so 1 daughter happy and other disappointed as we had to order a different one from another seller.

I needed a smaller computer. My desktop took up too much space on my desk while working from home. This laptop has been great. I can put it away when not being used and put it in my bag and take it with me when traveling for work. I would buy it again.

Bought this for simple audio recording and it is amazing for that. It is very snappy out of the box, but I did upgrade it with another 8 gig stick of ram for future proofing. I would wholly suggest it for any type of workstation duties.

Its good for basic gaming but anything like vr or final fantasy will not be playable unless you take out the entire motherboard and get a new one so you might as well get a better more expensive laptop because thats gonna cost about the same

I wanted to give this Laptop 5 starts but the battery life is no good. In just 20 mins I lose 10% battery power even when it runs on balanced. Overall a great and powerful little computer. Lightweight and excellent screen quality. Do I recommend buying? Yes.

So far I have had no problems. The speed is good. I have a second memory card that I haven't installed yet, but will soon. As fast as it is now, I can only imagine how much better it will be. Will give another update later.
Got this for my daughter after all of the chromebooks in the house died. It's the perfect size/weight, and has enough spec to run all of her games and schoolwork. She loves it!

I like this laptop, but it is hard to see the letters on the keys. You can barely see them standing straight overtop the keyboard.  I wish I had returned it, but I've already downloaded personal stuff on it.

This is feedback from my Daughter who I had it sent to as a gift. HP is typically good equipment. The components and spec in the AD appear to be a solid unit for it's intended purpose. I'll send an update upon hearing further information.

So far no issues and it functions as it should. Bought this for my daughter for online school and she loves it. Wish it had a backlight for the keyboard but otherwise I have no issue with it. Great speed and easy to navigate.

The product page for the HP 15-dy5024nr is unremarkable, in that it does not really let you know what product line this HP laptop is part of.  It's also tough to know exactly what the specs of this laptop are, without getting one.

I will give it some more time I guess but am really considering sending this back.  I can't believe how crappy the screen quality is.  My 5+ year old fire tablet has better video quality than this thing.  The last laptop I bought was in 2010... is it a requirement now that you need to spend $1000+ for anything decent?
So much faster than any laptop I have had! I had to get one with lots of RAM and SSD. This would have been a bargain at twice the price!

Awkward to use. crosshair attaches to anything it gets close to. I don't want a computer deciding what I am doing. Highlights text at most inopportune times, not at my direction. Frustrating to use. Ikons too small.

Got this for my college Freshman daughter, she absolutely loves it!! So light to carry around campus, fast connections, and the battery lasts all (class) day. Not to mention all the non class things she does( Facebook, reading, streaming, ETC)

Not good. The keys were loose and the plastic holding the keys in place was warped and very flimsy.  The overall feel of the computer is very cheap for the price tag.  I couldn't say much about the battery or specs because to be honest, I opened it up and noticed straight out the box it was such low quality. I Just sent it back for a refund.

Who ever thought of silver keys with light gray numbers and letters should lose their job. Barely visible even if your are directly looking at them. Almost makes me feel like returning it just for that reason. Other than that it's a decent computer.

A big thanks to Techno Panda on YouTube for the review and recommendation. I added another 8 GB RAM as soon as I got this new PC and it works really well. Restarts quickly. Chrome browser opens quickly. Can handle demanding tasks like Adobe Photoshop and Premiere Pro CC with little or no delay.

The computer touchpad is terrible. very sensitive and it goes all over the place. The audio jack already stopped working. Always have issuing with WI-FI connections. None of my other computers have that concern. The quality is not worth it.

I purchased this laptop on Jun 13th and it was delivered on Jun 15th, which is the day warranty should start. HP sent a mail asking for feedback mail, in which it recognizes the purchase date to be around Jun 15th. However, when we check the warranty date, it starts on Nov 25th, 2021 (and ends warranty support Dec 29th, 2022)

Purchased this laptop in November 2021.  It is still under warranty but the HP website lists repair sites of UbreakIfit it. None of these sites would repair connectivity issues under the warranty.  Spent three hours online with HP support tech and still unable to access the internet.  We've always been satisfied with HP devices - no longer! The Amazon support CS did NOT offer to help provide a three way call to HP to fix the issue just gave us the HP 800 number. Sorry we purchased this laptop thru Amazon.

I never write reviews. Ever. But I am so disappointed after having this laptop for 4 months, the wifi stopped working. Nothing even shows up for connections. The touchpad/mouse is also not great to use, it is very touchy and ends up doing really strange things.

I only used it a couple of days when I got up one morning and it wouldn't pick up any wifi networks.  I tried to find out why, but there was nothing showing as to why it wouldn't find any networks.  So I had to once again break out my old, outdated laptop.

I am waiting to see if Amazon / HP will honor the warranty.  My laptop developed vertical lines less than 3 months after i bought it.  Based on a test it was determinized that it was a hardware issue.  The laptop was not subject to abuse.  I am a 62 year old granny that keeps my laptop in my home.  I do not carry my laptop around.

I thought we were getting a nice, basic, laptop for my senior mother. It was nice for a few weeks then started having issues and eventually the option for wifi completely disappeared. After 10+ hours troubleshooting with windows and it’s still not fixed and conveniently out of the return period. I don’t recommend this device. It is flimsy- which is a little expected considering price. Also not a touch screen. Overall I would not recommend this laptop.

Just about 7 weeks after its April 29th delivery, this computer booted up to a different interface and we could not get the system back to its normal function despite the many options shown on the screen including selecting the option to do a fresh install of windows, system restore, etc. I am now left with a fancy shell of an inoperable device.

Thought this to be an ok mid- priced unit. Liked it at first. Then it kept dropping off line. The dreaded blue screen shot of rebooting. This happened about every 5-10 minutes.  Two other computers in my house do not do that. Internet is fine. Sent it back as defective. They deducted $91.47 as a restocking fee. FOUND THAT TO BE EXCESSIVE. Do not buy this unit. Purchased a new one at Best Buy and it works perfectly.

I’ve had this laptop for less than 24 hours and there is no Wi-Fi capacity only VPN or Ethernet! In 2022 that is totally unacceptable! Don’t waste your time or your money. I spent over an hour on the phone with HP only to have the representative hang up on me when she wasn’t able to identify the issue. Thankfully Amazon will refund my money but in the meantime I will have to go buy a working PC that actually has Wi-Fi capability.

This laptop is probably just fine for someone else, but I returned it for a full refund due to the lack of facial recognition software and a keyboard without backlighting.  Facial recognition is a great way to unlock a laptop, and can also be used in place of a password for many websites.  My condo is usually dimly lit and a keyboard that lights up makes a huge difference.  It was a mistake to order this laptop.
If you hold it by the base near the touch pad the space bar will press without clicking it which can be annoying especially watching videos. Other than that it's pretty good

The computer was good looking and pretty responsive.  The screen had a sharp image. But that's as far as I got.  I had the computer running a total of about 1 1/2 hours when it put up a blue screen and froze! Will I get another HP? I'd like to think this is "one-in-a-million" but I do get dubious.

I'm a casual home user.  This unit is awful.  I don't know the verbiage, but I've had nothing but problems since my purchase 2+ months ago.  I still have my old HP PC which still works, it's at least 10 yrs old.  I'm done w HP.

Purchased brand new. Inexplicably turns off by itself while on a full charge and plugged in. There's also a fun bug in Windows 11 that turns off the wifi by itself and won't let you turn it back unless you do a full power-down (I've run all Windows updates). Restarting the computer doesn't fix the issue. Pretty bummed out that I've only had this a few months and it's a complete lemon. Not sure I've had such a frustrating experience with a piece of technology before.

Wifi function routinely disappears. The fix is spending hours on the phone with hp while they completely wipe the laptop and reinstall everything.  Really handy.  👌  AND since there's no ethernet port, it's basically the most worthless laptop available.

Barely two weeks after having received the laptop, the wifi drivers are barely working. The laptop consistently acts as though wifi does not exist and I am constantly forced to restart the laptop just to get it to recognize local wifi connections.

I bought this laptop a week ago was excited to try it out. Set it up and then one day later it wouldn't identify the WiFi. I tried network reset , reset adapter but nothing worked.  Had to send it back. Don't buy this one. There is some problem with the WiFi adapter.

This product met my expectations. I use it to run software for my Laser Engraver.  i bought an external Docking device that allows me to have more USB ports, and an Ethernet port as well as a few more.

This was a great computer until it started losing internet every time I booted it up. I have to call HP support every day and have them troubleshoot things to get it working. I’ve begged for them to replace it but they always think they can fix it. I’m so annoyed and just want to throw this thing out the window

The computer does not recognize Wi-Fi so you can’t go online at all. Hp had me reset some things that were supposed to fix the problem but ever time I try to get online this happens again. Obviously the computer is defective. Trying to reach someone at HP but no luck. Don’t waste your money!  This is a scam and I will be reporting this!!!

Do not buy!  Within a month of purchasing, the wireless adapter just suddenly stopped working and disappeared.  Upon further reading of the reviews of this computer, apparently this is a common problem. So save yourself the frustration and avoid buying this. I'm giving Amazon high marks for giving me the option to return it for a full refund without hassle.

Item is listed as new and shipped from Amazon. The unit I received came with the standard laptop box packed in a much larger box with NO additional packing to protect it. It had a "second life" used/refurbished sticker affixed to it. I looked up the serial number on HP's website and sure enough a warranty had already been registered for it 3 months ago.

Ever since I received this, it has been ridden with bugs. At least twice per week I have to reinstall the BIOS because it has lost connection with its network adaptor and has no ability to connect to the internet without an ethernet cable (for which it has no port). If I were not in Kenya, I would return this machine. Very frustrating to have to start my workday with a 20-minute BIOS reinstall.

This laptop is very responsive, very fast. i have read other ratings saying that it is flimsy, I find it sturdy. The only problem with it is the keyboard, without full light over it you can barely read it and it is not backlit, the letters are etched over silver keys, very hard to read them. I had to buy a desk top lamp to use the laptop. Other wise, a very good laptop.

This laptop worked for just under a month, and then the wireless card gave out. All of my devices, including my 4 year old HP Envy laptop are connecting just fine to my network. I've restarted, run diagnostics, and still nothing. It continues to say there are no networks available, which means that the wireless card isn't working, at all. It's not even finding other local networks let alone mine. Since this thing doesn't have an Ethernet cable port, it's useless now since I can't connect to the internet with it. Returned.

WiFi adapter is dead. Return window went out just over a month ago. Literally had this stupid thing for 5 months and now it’s useless. Only used for writing papers in word and uploading for school assignments. Avoid HP like the plague.

Never had so many issues with a laptop before. Contacted HP numerous times and instead of acknowledging the laptop has an issue, they kept trying to restart it, reflash the OS, etc. with weeks of back and forth as it would work for a few days before disappearing again. worst part is after all of this time and no lasting solution, the return option on Amazon is gone, and HP is saying thats how we have to get it replaced. I would have expected better from HP... Do not recommend at all.

I got this as one of the Treasure Truck deals and was excited to use it. I've had it for 7 days and didn't even use it every day. I opened it tonight and there was no internet connection! Upon investigation there was no wifi device detected. I'm so upset. I opened reviews here and saw a long review that covered this same problem in detail. I immediately initiated the return and requested a refund. It worked fine until I did the Windows update and then the wifi disappeared like it never existed. >:-(

I thought it was a good deal for the amount of horse power this computer has, so I bought two of them. within the first few weeks both laptops’ network cards failed, and they're unable to connect to wifi. So we've had to use usb wifi dongles. Would not recommend this product.

WIFI adapter stopped working just over 3 months of having this laptop. HP said since this is software issue, (and software warranty is just 3 months and hardware warranty is 1 year), I can pay ~$50 for them to help me fix this issue (for the first month).

I have bought this laptop for my business associate. As he was traveling he didn't have a chance to set it up. we were trying to do now but neither wifi nor bluetooth are responding. Amazon told me 30 days passed and dismissed me. Truly bad experience.

Bought in January for a work from home job that I needed a decent laptop for.  Works well with Teams, video quality is ok, but I'm not using it for gaming.  Only 1 HMDI port- which is kind of annoying when you'd like to connect it to multiple monitors. Another annoyance is that it will sometimes disconnect from home WiFi- which is inconvenient (to put it mildly) when you need to be online for work. Other than that it's an inexpensive machine that for the most part does what it's supposed to.

After initial setup, the machine stopped being able to connect to the internet. Wifi wasn’t even an option anywhere to be found in settings or anywhere. I got a replacement and the same thing happened to the replacement. Nothing was clicked, the awful driver was no where to be found. I do not recommend.

I bought this for my wife, who teaches English at a small university in Zimbabwe. She LOVES it!! She doesn't game with it, so doesn't need a super-fast computer. She loves the solid feel and the quick reactions. So far it does everything she needs to do with it.
Technically the laptop itself meets my needs, but the resident programming sucks. I do not like nor use McAfee, and having their annoying popups every few seconds makes me hate it.

Have to reboot because the shift key doesn’t work, have to reset your modem every time you turn it on to get wifi. Eventually it stopped connecting to wifi all together 1 one passed the return date. Piece of junk

Slowest computer I have ever had. Only purchased to use adobe and editing software as I have a chromebook that does everything else but does not support adobe software. I have had HP in the past and hoped for a better experience since the last time I purchased an HP was in 2011 for college, however…. All other features are fine. Just, very slow loading 😵‍💫

i love the SSD and the I5.  not too crazy about windows 11.  Their passion for one drive and how they removed functionality from standard utilities like photos.exe.  But, I love the computer, especially the boot time (<10 seconds)

I bought this computer at the end of April and have used it maybe 10 times and I ALWAYS have an issue with being able to log in, keeps kicking me out, now the battery won't charge and won't work unless it's plugged in. To make matters worse I tried to install the updates to see if that would help the battery and now it won't let me sign in at all. Keeps looping back to the sign on screen. Don't waste your money!

The laptop has been doing this the second week I got it. It loses the capability to connect to Wi-Fi and then tells you to connect to Ethernet. Which I can’t because it doesn’t have an Ethernet port. So every time we have to reset the laptop to factory settings in order for it to work

The laptop is a standard laptop, no extras which is what I needed. Two weeks into owning the laptop, the WiFi completely disappeared off it and all the computer was detecting was a LAN. I factory reset the computer and all was fine for two more weeks, when I woke up and did it again. Had to send back the computer for a full refund, luckily I was still in the window for returning it.

My only complaint with this 15.6 inch HP laptop is that the letters and numbers on the keyboard are very difficult to read. I had to buy a keyboard cover with black letters and numbers so I could read the keys.
This laptop has everything I need without paying a high price.  Nice to look at, super thin and light weight, and was easy to set up, and it came with Windows 11!

Worked fine for few months and then started loosing internet connection requiring to connect repeatedly.. but now, it won’t connect to internet at all. Tried to get support on chat but wasn’t helpful .. tried resetting etc including factory reset and nothing works.

Not too happy with the device.  Overall performs weaker than my last computer at the same price point (also HP) with less features (touch screen, can turn into a tablet by folding).  I would personally return this if I didnt get it online and had to deal with shipping back and forth.

The laptop has to be shut off and restarted.  NO USING the RESTART function either.  I have to shut it down, wait a bit, then start it for the WIFI to reappear.  All work is lost!  And, you can not add anything to the task bar!  All the sites I frequently use, can not be dragged & added.  WTH?  I have had this laptop less then 24 hours and I absolutely HATE IT!
The shift key for @ sign for email comes out as ".  The shift " comes out as @. Update.  Apparently I set the language as English UK instead of English USA.  Working fine now.

So my first one broke. HP replaced it. Second one broke. My insurance replaced it. Third one is now broken. Do not buy this laptop. Same problem every time. The touch screen and volume stop working then the screen just goes black. THREE TIMES IN A ROW!!

I like HP products and this computer is not an exception.  My earlier, older, slower, and heavier laptop died between Zoom meetings.  So it was research time and get an order placed, was I ever surprised when two days later I had a new laptop and was set up and handling everything like before.  Working great with Chrome where many of my files were stored.

After 2, 3 days trading with amazon.com, it's symbol showed up on the 1st app web page.  I realized that this is built with an advanced AI system.  Amazon has been collecting data concerning my buying habit for many years, and it suggesting this and that beforehand.  But it will never be like human, because human mind is many hued animal.

Would have given 5 stars but it keeps disconnecting and losing the wireless adapter.  The first time it completely disappeared from the system and I had to reload it from the HP site.  It was a pain to get it reloaded and connected!  The second time, it disconnected from the wireless adapter but it was still on the system.  I restarted and it reconnected. It's a significant inconvenience to not have wireless capabilities on a laptop!

The screen is bright and easy to view, however, the keypad is difficult to view unless you have light right on top of the computer.  The keys are labeled in silver with the overall keyboard also in silver.  I had to call in a professional I.T. person to set-up the computer.  Windows 11 created major problems for him and took him hours of research to solve the problems (especially with the HP printer) and he has been working with computers for over 20 years!

This is my first laptop and my first PC in at least a decade so there's a learning process. I'm using it to start working at home. My only issue is I wish the keyboard had a backlight and I wish the letters, etc were darker or thicker etched on the keys.
I needed a cheap laptop to install Kali on. This fits the bill but I had to fight with it to turn off bitlocker, disable the TPM and jettison Windows 11.

Would have given 5 stars but it keeps disconnecting and losing the wireless adapter.  The first time it completely disappeared from the system and I had to reload it from the HP site.  It was a pain to get it reloaded and connected!  The second time, it disconnected from the wireless adapter but it was still on the system.  I restarted and it reconnected. It's a significant inconvenience to not have wireless capabilities on a laptop!

I did not like to be followed up with warnings that the drivers were dying so Microsoft had to update the computer which really ended up being scammers trying to wipe out our account.  The computer works perfectly.

I want to start by saying that I love the big screen and Microsoft office runs well on the computer, but for the life of me I cannot figure out why it is so fickle when it comes to wifi connectivity. Sometimes it connects to wifi with no problems, but other times it won't even register that there is wifi available let alone connect to it. It is incredibly frustrating and you probably need a computer that connects to the internet so I would not recommend this computer.

I got this laptop from the treasure truck. I have been wanting a new laptop so it was perfect timing. This laptop was really easy to get set up. I haven't had a bigger laptop in a long time but as a college student it's much better to have large screen and keyboard to do work. It's not a touch screen, which I really like. I might use it for video games at some point but that's not my main priority with this laptop.

I bought this laptop for university school and let me tell you...it could take jamming! Battery life is long lasting i must add and the graphics quality is exceptional. I have absolutely no issues with this laptop. In fact, i will be buying one for my son for his birthday! Definitely recommend.
Bought it as a surprise for my grandaughter and she loves it.. She has always liked mine and has wanted one like it.. One of the best laptops I have ever owned..
I like the laptop it's fast it boots quickly, but as you can see from the photo it's almost impossible to read the keys which makes it almost unusable for me.

I thought I got a great deal as I purchased this through treasure truck. But like many of the other reviews stated, there is constantly issues with the WiFi. Every time I close the lid and the computer goes to sleep, the next time I boot it up, WiFi cannot be located. Long story short…..I returned the damn thing.
I only use this laptop for school work. I bought a laptop last year that failed me after only a year of working. Will update if this computer does the same

I am still experimenting with this little girl, but I am very pleased. I do not game, so didn't enter a comment. Very smooth operation, speedy - I've not used this version of Windows, so taking my time to test drive newer applications. BUT, very pleased. Would recommend.

Nice lightweight laptop with good speed and easy to use BUT big issue here is I Lost my WiFi connectivity after using it for only 2 months and had to purchase a TP a link to plug in to the USB port In order to get WiFi connectivity back - occasionally the connectivity will come back only to disappear again randomly so I have to keep the TP link plugged in all the time…. This is a huge problem for me as I needed this to work remotely when travelled and have to use WiFi- this needs to be addressed

Wife uses this for work and has done well so far waited a little bit before review to see how it would be and has been great! Battery has been solid screen great and easy to use easy set up light weight and durable to an extent feels a little flimsy but it’s a slim laptop shipping was fast great product so far !!!

I love the size. It has everything I wanted except a touch screen which isn't important now that my granddaughter is older. The speed is great and it has a 10 key which I hadn't noticed until I received it.

It's very good, the laptop works well, and it kept well, the only problem was the time taken to arrive, more than a month,  the problem not from the seller but the company that you send the order in my country. thanks amazon!

All around its a good laptop. Its fast and reliable. However... there is nearly zero gaming potential. This thing only has 0.13 go of vram so anything other than minecraft and games of similar simplicity are a no go. Though it can do Xbox gamepass no problem.  With all that said everything else is great.👍

This is my 3rd HP laptop and my first windows 11 pc. I bought it to replace a 5 year old Windows 10 HP Stream that I have kept up to date. I will be using this mostly for web browsing and streaming video  and can truly say I'm amazed by just how much faster this is. Video and sound quality is excellent and web pages load instantly. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a new laptop for personal use.

I bought this for school to make digital art and animation. It works well for those purposes, but I've honestly spent most of my time with the laptop playing video games. Pretty much everything from like PS3/360 era and before can run at high settings fairly stably. I don't think it can even launch most newer triple A games, so I haven't even tried.
Can't speak to battery life - haven't tried using it for long period on battery.  Great for casual internet and streaming use.  Bought mainly as it came pre--loaded with Windows 11.

Bought this over a year ago and love it. Just bought a second one for my father and he’s happy too. Great price great machine and it’s lightning fast. I use it mostly for work so Microsoft a office products. Some tv streaming.
My laptop arrived quickly and in great condition!  I mostly use it for work, but have used it for some older games and it works well.  I do not think it is powerful enough for true gamers.
Excellent performance.  My only gripe is that the keys are hard to read for old folks like me.  That said, I bought it for my children to use, so might not be a problem.

I don't do a lot of gaming, but it's great for Microsoft 365, email and shopping.  The only issue I have is how light the words on the keyboard are.  Until I learned where the 'end' key was, for instance, I struggled to see it.  Still it's a great lightweight unit and I am very happy with it.

I was honestly scared to buy this pc just because of so many bad reviews. But I’m glad that I did because my pc arrived early, and in good quality, I’m in love. And yes it’s for gaming also because I played on it, and it performed well. If you’re thinking about getting this DO IT!!!!! Don’t listen to these people (most of them are trolls trying to make you not buy it)

This is a great improvement over my ancient Dell D800. Because it runs Microsoft Windows as the operating system, the laptop requires about three minutes to start all of the basic services and processes before one can reasonably use it.

For what I need, this is perfect. I have Zoom meetings on it and the screen quality is great. Watching a video the resolution is 1080hd.  The camera quality is 720hd. Far and beyond better than my old laptop that died after many years of use.  Since it does not have a built-in CD/DVD player, it is very light weight. I just purchased an external drive which is quite inexpensive.  Glad I bought this.

I've been with PCs since IBM first unveiled it in Chicago at the SHARE conference.  This is the fastest one I've ever owned.  I bought it to replace an old Toshiba used for music and audio books.  This notebook is too great to use for just that.  Can't say enough good things about it.

I stopped buying HP in 2008 after purchasing one of their top-of-the-line laptops and having nothing but trouble with it from day one.  With that I had to struggle with support several times over the course of the next three months before they agreed to take it back and replace it -- when the replacement arrived, I sold it on ebay and decided not to buy HP anymore.

This isn't compatible with the pricey HP Thunderbolt G2 dock.  Not sure why a chromebook is but HP to HP won't.  Also I bought this Amazon used and the warranty was activated and only had 4 months left.  Product itself seems nice though.

This laptop was purchased to replace one purchased in 2013.  I was not unhappy with my 8+ year old machine, but disk access had slowed down with fragmentation, and the battery needed replacement.  The attraction of SSD and price made a device change the only rational choice.

it came with a user and a password and when i connected it to wifi it was locked by the user. After some struggle now the laptop is usable, support from amazon was great compared to hp where there was no support.
Only 2 weeks into using it and all is good so far. I’ve had HP laptops in the past and have had good experiences. I think this will also be a good purchase.

I'm still learning how to use the features.  As far as I know it does not have a touch screen.  It has issues connecting to the internet/wi-fi after updating.  It does not have a place to connect an ethernet cable which I should have checked before buying. It allows me to do what I need to do so far.

I've only had this laptop a couple of days, but I really like it. I replaced an Acer and the construction of this unit if far superior. The Acer had only two small hinges for the screen about an inch wide. This HP has a continues hinge almost the entire length of the case. The hinge mounts broke off the Acer causing me to buy a completely new laptop. Just keep this in mind when purchasing a laptop.

I want to say is this is not a touch screen, which is so disappointing i absolutely cannot get used the touch pad. I have tried to no avail. I didn't realize it was touch pad or i would kept looking  its terrible .missed my return window Although everything else is good ,just really not able to use it
everything worked just great. was delivered to my us imaginary address, then forwarded by our logistics company outside the us, arrived safe and sound. works so far so good-knock knock.

Only reason I ordered this one above other similar ones was because of the 1080p screen. I had no idea 1080p quality could be so lacking. IF you can handle a blurry/fuzzy display, this one is for you.

We purchased this for my dad for Christmas. It is his first ever laptop. It's great for browsing the internet and playing solitaire on. He absolutely loves it! I would highly recommend this laptop for a first timer that just wants to browse the internet or read online books. it's not built for gaming at all.
Look at the photo. The lettering on the silver keyboard is so faint that you can't see the keys from many angles and in less than direct light! Who thought up this disaster?

Constant reboots itself which is probably a couple fan or overheated cpu. Contacted extra warranty I purchased and told to go to place I purchased. Did that and was told to contact HP. Guess shame on me for buying from Amazon to begin with.

The review says to rate the touch screen, but there is not a touch screen.  I purchased 2 adapters - one for the Ethernet connection and one for the mouse.  Would have liked another USB port.  The keyboard has a good feel, but the shiny silver with the thin letters, is annoying for me.  Installation was fine once I got past all the questions that were asked.  Speed is very good.  Have installed several HP computers in the past.  Don't place this at the top.

All our programs are cloud hosted so we didn't need anything super powerful. This laptop is actually overkill for accessing our web based program and Microsoft 365 but we bought these for longevity over any i3. The i3 models just don't last as long and tend to get slow much sooner than this i5 model. Dozens purchased, no issues so far.

I was expecting something more mettalic heavy, but feels like a Asus talking about the body. Otherwise performance is good. Feels smooth and responsive. I've got the issue with the WiFi driver and Windows 11 but fixed looking and searching on the web. HP support didn't help me at all.

I had a heck of a time when using this because of the wifi dropping out or not initializing.  I believe that the "bloatware" was interfering with it.  I say this because I updated windows  several times to no avail.  It does work fine now. The swiching of the wifi driver to disable letting windows decide when to optimize battery usage DID NOT SOLVE THE PROBLEM.  The battery does charge quickly but it does not last super long (may explain in part the quick charging).  I am now completely satisfied.

The computer looks and feels sleek. It’s a powerful unit. But it doesn’t matter at all when windows 11 has a fault that will endlessly disconnect the wireless network adapter inside the laptop itself. If you can afford something newer, or ever run windows 10 for the time being, I recommend that highly. I’m so pissed at this laptop, I’ve probably reset the network settings and restarted it 10,000 times in 3 months.

I have an HP at work - like everything about it. When it was time to replace my old computer I chose an HP for home use. Very happy with it so far.  I'm not a gamer. I use it for e-mail, internet , and tax preparation.
Nice laptop, works as expected. It forgets the internet easily, if you leave your location and come back- so keep your eye out for that. Other than that there is not much to complain about.

Sometimes when I write on social media, E-mails ect, if I use certain keys the curser jumps back causing me to have to reset it. Could be my fault. Otherwise I like it. My previous computer was very slow so I am impressed with the speed. I am happy with my purchase and I feel it was worth the money.

Was not happy with the quality of screen, viewing was not crisp and clear. I thought I could live without a back-lit keyboard, but it is impossible to see the keys clearly because the characters, letters, numbers are very thin and almost the same color as the keys....especially if you don't have 20/20 vision. I found this computer, for the money, only average compared to what I have owned before.

I thought I was purchasing a new gaming laptop.  I'm pretty sure it was refurbished and it is definitely NOT for gaming! It has many glitches, sometimes drops internet and now the camera refuses to work even though it is downloaded.  It is now more like  a beautiful paperweight than a working computer.

I actually swapped the laptop from Costco for this one. The screen is huge! The processing apeed is okay too. It's just that i'm not used to the positions of the keys on thr keyboard. The letters shift to the left because of the additional numbers on the right side. Other than that, it is very good quality laptop and I'm satisfied qith it.
Got this for my 17 year old son for school.  It works great, fast, picture is SUPER clear, speakers were awesome.  It was an excellent price for everything that comes in this laptop.

La marca hace muy buenos productos, funciona excelente, pero por la cantidad que termine pagando hubiera preferido comprar una de 15.6 Pugadas, ya que se me cobro dos veces la importación. una la cobra AMAZON al momento de la compra y tambien le pagas lo de la importación al servicio de paquetería FEDEX México al momento de la entrega.

Bought this HP laptop as NEW not a refurbished or used one. Was very excited to use it considering it has 4.5 stars. Very disappointed. I have an 6 year old laptop that will run faster than this thing. It can’t even find any Wi-Fi networks and to finally get connected to one it takes a very long time to do so. The discovery mode for searching for any devices is absolutely terrible. This thing sucks

I bought this for my private practice and it works great. Does not have a bunch of bell and whistles but it meets my needs since this is what I leave at the office. Analogue:  Better than a flip phone or Google phone but it's not a new  iPhone. I am very happy with it. It runs faster than I expected, which was my biggest concern.

I am more than pleased with how easy it was transferring my files/photos, etc from my old laptop to this one. Being a senior, I am limited at times dealing with "technology" and since I keep all my records in a "vault"  recovery of those files was critical for retaining my medical, financial, photo's, etc it was important not to lose them. My old laptop had zero memory available, but I was able to "link" the use of both laptops and transfer my files with little effort at all.  Very happy with this purchase

crappy tin keypad, locks up alot. It's 1 of those laptops that you took the battery out to restart, only now you push every key with your palm to get it responding, has to be much better one for half the money out their

Overall a decent laptop for work mainly using web browser to complete my task. The battery never really held a charger longer than an hour and after three months it didn't hold a charge longer than 10 minutes. After five months the laptop won't work unless plugged in.

Laptop quality is pretty good. The IPS panel pairs well with windows 11. I would recommend going for the 16gb version as with all laptops. 8gb of memory is not enough for most takes in 2022. As I have pointed that out. This computer comes from HP with an insane amount of bloatware built in. The system will consume about 4gbs of memory just being turned on, and with the bios locked down. The average user will not be able to wipe the drive and freshly install windows.

Very fast and powerful machine but onboard wifi failed after only two weeks of operation. Very disappointing. Getting mentally prepared for the warranty repair hassles.  Update: decided buying a wifi dongle was a better option then wiping data, being without it for two weeks and having to set it up again.

This HP laptop is a great choice for everyday use. The build quality is great with no issues. The screen is crisp and sharp with no dead spots. The keyboard feels good to use even after long sessions.
its light weight, and the keys are large and easy to press, comes with windows installed and its a fast booter and runs smooth, perfect and will do the job
The wifi settings disappeared and i thought i was crazy until i had my coworker look and she notice the wifi setting wasnt there either. This laptop was defective. I returned it the very next day.

Laptop did a system update that deleted the wifi drive. Tried many options, but cannot restore wifi. Tried to restore to factory settings, but now windows won’t even open. Did a google search an learned this is a popular problem many had with their laptops as well.

Product failed. Hardware not working. Needed it to be ready to start grad school for my daughter this week. Would not recommend. Very disappointed. Now I have to return and buy another laptop for her first week of school.
Computer has disconnected from the internet twice and says there is no connections available. The only way I have found to remedy this is to factory reset the laptop and start over.
The product didn't work right from the beginning.  It would kick off in the middle of an application and it would shut down wifi. Also, it was difficult to turn and off.
This HP 15-inch Laptop is very bad product. It has wifi adapter compatibility problems. The wifi asapter is incompatible with windows 11 operating system & does not connect to the internet.

Quality was weak, flexible in areas it shouldn’t be. Mine had sound issues where if the laptop was tipped sound would go out and sound bad. Also if you pushed in the middle of the keyboard or by the speakers it would go out as well. Returned for refund.

Picked this up for my 85 year old dad.  Very fast machine, nice and light.  Trackpad clicking isnt as smooth as more expensive machines and keyboard feel is just ok.  Would totally get again if on sale.

If you read the negative reviews, you will see that this computer has problems. The Wi-Fi keeps dropping and you have to dig deep into the computer to restore it to only have it occur a day later. Also, the screen size is small and if you are older, it will be hard to read unless you bump the document size up. You should also know that if you do have the Wi-Fi problem with the computer and return it within the timeframe that Amazon sets, the seller will charge you a 20% restocking fee.

This laptop repeatedly went offline and would ask to be connected to a ethernet cord. It did not have an ethernet outlet. I called HP several times and was told to expect this with Windows 11? I had to return the laptop because it was affecting my ability to work
Bought in late Nov.  Set up for wifi to download updates.  Left it alone.  Picked it up the other day to do some additional work and it doesn’t even recognize that it has a Wifi card.

As soon as I plugged in this "new" laptop it popped up with the name Andres Garcia and asked for a PIN. There were also a bunch of old saved wifi addresses. This was definitely not a new, or even a professionally refurbished laptop. This was almost certainly stolen and resold. DO NOT BUY

I purchased this as a gift for my wife. The description stated it was a touch screen, it's NOT. Beware before purchasing. That was a major selling point for me,  & I was disappointed with that. Cross reference info, model #'s, etc with other places before buying here.
So far I love the laptop. It's bigger than I thought so I will definitely need a larger table for it. It's easy to use and connect. One of my favorite purchases.
HP never disappoints! This is a nice large laptop, good for home and school use, would like if it had a backlit keyboard but for the price, I can live with it.

Okay, so normally not a big believer in brand new, basic laptops. Like cars, I would prefer to buy a higher spec laptop that is a few years old for the same amount of money. However, when this came up on Prime Day as a flash sale for Prime members, I threw caution to the wind and recklessly spent my hard earned money on something that inflation had not yet seem to hit!
Disgusting that this computer sold on prime day was sold as new and had another person as administrator from the UK with all his info . Had to hire someone to work to get him off😡😡😡

Poor contrast with keyboard keys. Poor design by HP, I would say! Lots of people do not have excellent vision! White on black would have been much better, as shown on my hand held calculator. Getting accustomed to Windows 11 is another story, for a later time! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For $299 a great buy. Even has Solid State drive. I rarely ever use my computer anymore. I forgot to update to win11 so instead of buying it, just buy new. My old Lenovo (2016) was very slow. I swear they program it to slow down after 5 years.

Works fine but the casing is defective and already falling apart. Now the laptop cannot be closed. HP technical support offered to have it shipped back for repairs and said they would return it within 7 to 9 business days. Who can be without their laptop for 2 weeks?  My son can’t because he’s taking online colleges classes.  Beware of Amazon Lightning deals. You get what you pay for.

First, it's an HP.  I have come to trust HP for reliability and price.  It's a little slow for me because it only has 4GB of RAM, which I knew when I bought it so I'm not faulting them.  It has a SSD, which is only what I buy now.  Boot time is faster and things run faster for me with a SSD.  Screen is excellent in size and display.
Its bulky and slow.  I am not a fan of windows 11.  There seems to be a lot of clicking with very little action.  This is a throw back.  I just need a machine to fill in.  I guess it will do that.

I mainly use this computer for working at home and some internet browsing.  It is much faster than the laptop with an i5 processor and twice the ram than it replaced.  For general tasks that aren't too demanding it is a good affordable option.
Seems to work fine.  I like the big screen and the ample SSD storage.  Wish the keyboard was lit, otherwise, it's perfect. Thank you for a quality product and fast shipping.

I like the size and the picture but windows 11 is hard to use big learning curve wish it was more like xp just basic is all i need just trying to put a app on the desk top screen is hard no drag and place

The laptop itself is fine. I bought it because I couldn't update my old laptop from Windows 7 to Windows 11. If I had known then what I know now I would've taken my chances on keeping Windows 7. Windows 11 is such an intrusive, cluttered, jump through the hoops mess that I hardly use the new laptop.
I got this for using with my sewing machine. I’ve always used a mac but my sewing machine is only PC compatible. Im in a learning curve now. The PC. Is what I need
Impossible to see the keyboard symbols. Dark grey on a light grey background.  Hard to open. Need to pry open with two hands. But overall a good value and machine.

It was time for me to replace my old laptop that I had for years. It’s easy to overuse them and wear them out. I found that it’s also cheaper to just replace it. I always prefer Dell and HP products. This is my 3rd HP and I love it!

I have a Surface Pro as my workhorse, it's hard to beat for speed and screen resolution. I didn't need that for a second machine. This is the machine I use for browsing, social media, crafting (knitting/crochet patterns), writing, and watching videos. The larger screen works well for these tasks, and I can even have 2 items on the screen. It is rather large, so it is not easily transportable. I plan to primarily use it on a small desk in my home.

The first thing I noticed when it was delivered is that the laptop is HUGE! I was disappointed because I thought it was a touch screen and I thought it would have lighted keys but it didn't have either! It has a great looking screen display but the speakers are weak and the battery doesn't last long at all. I wouldn't recommend this computer.
I was so excited when this laptop arrived today - it was delivered undamaged, it was updated already with Windows 11 & it was so easy to set up!  Thank you!!!

I’m going to need help with using the laptop. The new generation is good at figuring it out. I’m old school and don’t even know where to start. I’m going to need help I’m 68 and the new technology is not working out for me.
I did notike the fact that right in the middle of reading the news, a porn sight popped up and my computer was locked down so I am returning it asap!

I loved my previous Chromebook!  This thing always signs me out and then tells me my passwords are not valid.  Then it continues anyway and DELETES all of my files!!  It locks you out and even though you are putting in the correct password it tells you it isn't. You Go through all the hoops to reset password and it doesn't do that.  It either locks you out or deletes your stuff with no way in.  I am ready to throw this piece of crap out in the driveway and run it over!!

This product stays charged, but at random times, the screen will go blank and shuts down and will not turn back on.  This has been a problem to use because just when you need it, it might be inoperable.  I would be hesitant to order this Chromebook

I got this Chromebook in Amazon Day @ a great price, in fact I am writing this review with it! i am IN LOVE wit this thing!!! the one I was looking for!!!! forget about Ipads or Tablets, this thing is AMAZING if you are in the market for a great laptop get this you will LOVE IT! 5  Big Stars from me!

Like a previous comment it would not cut on once plugged in there was nothing wrong with the charger cord because it charged my other HP just right. The laptop itself would not cut on or accept  the charger

It’s painfully slow at loading things and it’s pretty much still at factory - nothing is on the computer yet. I have xfinity and really good internet strength so I know it’s not my internet as my other devices work great.

The edge of this laptop is sharp, and leaves either my palm or wrist with painful deep grooves. I can find no after market accessories to fix this. I can find lots of other complaints about the sharp edge on line though. My Acer Chromebook has just a slightly rounded edge and does not cause this problem.
It works, for the most part.  I had the problem of it going black if I didn't use it for 20+ minutes.  I would have to wait for it to decide to work again.  When it is working, it is great.
Listen to the reviews… computer does not work. Tried purchasing a new charger just in case it was the charger but still does not work. Returning for refund. Save your time and money..

I have purchased other laptops that cost more but for my needs they were not better just had more features I didn't need.This laptop for the price fits my needs at an excellent price.  Very satisfied.

I always thought a Chromebook was just a different platform based on Android but for laptops. No. It is worse. There's no way to open a PDF except in a tiny window with an app designed for phones. Half of the apps I use on my phone won't work in Chromebook but there's no comparable app available. It is horrible.
Awesome to finally get my own laptop. HP is a a great addition to any office for work or home. All my office machines are HP. Great product for a great price.
This computer is a great value. It is good for whatever your application. Whether you're a gamer, streaming enthusiast, movie junkie, designer, or accountant, this is the affordable option for you.

I was looking for a new laptop for my husband and a Chromebook was recommend by one of our daughters and a grandson.  My husband absolutely loves it!  Great quality and price, fast and easy operating with easy set up.  Very pleased with this purchase.

Not even a month and it died on me in the middle of working on an application.  It was fully charged. Still have time to return it but all of my documents are saved. Id, birth,etc... and once they open it they will have access to my email and everything.  Next time I will get a real laptop from a store with warranty.  I will have to just miss out on that 150.00
Many nice features and the battery last 14 hours. It doesn't have a touchscreen nor enough memory for big games like World of Warcraft but suits my purpose for school and business.
Hmm comeing from being a MacOS & Windows User the chromOS side of things are blan…still does what a laptop does just this one hits different…i still recommend this laptop for any type of user😌

Nice for what it cost. I particularly like the keyboard. The screen was the weak point. I felt like I was looking at 20 year old laptop. Unacceptable by todays standards. Charge $50 more and equip it better! I gave to a friend in need. For free it was awesome to him.
Product looked like a refurbished version and the charging port was broken. Returned the item but haven't got my money back and the item was received over a week ago. Do not purchase this product.

Worst thing I ever did.  Nothing now works on my regular desk windows 10 computer. It's all screwed up. I can't even get 9nto my email on my regular computer anymore . Chromebook has destroyed everything. I hate this laptop.
Screen quality is good and also the touch works well. So far, so good. I've been using it every day for work. All I need now, is the HP pen.
I like the screen and the weight. They keyboard is fragile, the space bar sticks. But by far the worst feature is the left mouse click which takes 3-5 tries to get a single click.

I'm so pleasantly surprised. This pavilion doesn't even remotely seem used. It looks and performs as if its brand new. I am SO happy with my purchase and glad I went for it. I have an HP from 2015, i3 processor, and it's starting to show it's age. I love HP and this doesn't disappoint. The swivel touch screen is sleek, thin, and easy to use. It's extremely fast. 10 out of 10 would buy from this seller again. :)
I ordered the white but got the blue one instead. Looks like a kids toy, cheap. Make sure you have the time and resources to return the order if it s not what you asked for.
When laptop is asleep, majority of the time it will not awaken by key press, lid opening, nor power button. You must force a shutdown which you will lose data you are working on.
This was perfect for my 90 year old mother-in-law to use to review her emails and look up various web sites.  Easy for her to use.  Light weight and easy  to carry, if needed.

This laptop seems so outdated and tiny! When I say tiny, my toddler thought it was a toy laptop for her smh lol! How can you sell this for over 200$. I wish these sellers would lose their accounts for selling crap to people spending their hard earned money! Better off going to Best Buy or directly from the HP website! I’m so disappointed as this was a gift for my parents! Do not waste your money! Trust me!

THIS DOES NOT COME WITH 64 GIGABYTES IT COMES WITH 57.4 AND IT FILLS UP YOUR STORAGE WITH APPS THEY GIVE YOU I DOWNLOADED 3 THINGS, THE SIMS CHROME AND ROBLOX AND MY STORAGE WAS FULL I ALSO DELETED MOST OF THE APPS THEY GAVE ME AND IT DIDNT HELP THE STORAGE AT ALL, NOT TO MENTION ITS SLOW AS HELL

The laptop is Thin and looks like it would be a good processor. We are trying to recover our bookkeeping software online. And the older HP is full. I thought it would have been a quick solution. I was wrong. So I will return. We have moved up to all Apple products. However, we needed the disk drive to transfer the original laptop info to the new laptop to get it online for our clients.

do not buy, i had to return the first one bc the CTRL key was totally broken, then the replacement they sent the screen was darker on one side.  after 2 tries im done.  The computer is not worth $249.  Maybe if it was cheaper i would have tried a third time, but even then it only has 4GB and the screen is pretty small.  there are much better HP computers out there for the same price.  Dont buy it. keep looking.

I've had several technology fails this year, including my gaming laptop and my Linux laptop breaking down. My budget is not what it was when I bought the gaming laptop, and the other one was a hand-me-down from a relative. So, I needed a cheap laptop to do basic typing and web browsing on until I can afford something to game on. Finding a non-Chromebook under $300 is tough these days, so I took a chance on this model.
It is very nice looking, light and small. I bought this for my wife to use in college and she really likes it. It is a bit slower than I would have liked, but for the price and use, it's good.
Garbage I missed my return window by A-day I want to return this so bad.  Every time I turn it on it takes forever and freezes half the time. I used it like 2x.  Not worth it

Bought this for me wife. I don't know if she's logged in on it yet. I use it on the couch, at church in the choir and for taking notes at meetings. Didn't review bang for the buck as I bought it with points

There’s nothing fancy about this thing. I bought it to supplement my Mac products for work compatibility when needed. I don’t really use it to run apps or thirsty programming. It does Microsoft office, saves files, talks to the cloud, and connects to the web with wifi. It does everything I need and nothing I don’t. For the price, I’m happy, and if it’s stolen or breaks, I won’t lose sleep.

First off, don't buy this. I bought this for a job search. It's full of nonsense Microsoft sign ins and bloatware. You have to sign in and deal with extra stuff to use it. Completely user unfriendly and ridiculous and a pain to use.  Totally and completely not worth it. I regret buying this. Do not buy this. Learn from my mistakes and read the other negative reviews.
This is the worst computer I have ever used. It gets stuck all the time and the screen hardly works sometimes. Normally I don’t leave a review but this computer was a disappointment.
Small and compact. Perfect for when I need to work from home. Just what I was looking for and needed. Great price for a laptop. Arrived on the day I ordered.
It works great but the scree. Is so small it makes it hard to work on. You'll probably need a docking station or additional screen for it. However, it does tell you the size when you're purchasing

Buy something, any something else because this laptop is crap!!! It didn't give me the option to give it a ZERO otherwise i definitely would  have!!! You get what you pay for and this was a waste of money 100%!!!!!!

What I like about it is because it’s got iTunes, Disney+ and other cool features on it. What I dislike about it is because my mom named my C Drive incorrectly by spelling my name in a short way and with a lowercase letter at the start of it instead of doing it properly the correct way. It was another one of my birthday presents that I’ve bought for myself!

I liked this laptop because I was looking for something small but powerful to travel with. It is perfect and I like Windows11. The plus for me is it had an hdmi slot sling with a usb slot. Prefect for me. You have easily get it out of S mode to install the other programs you use.

I love how this laptop works, great running, adequate storage even for gaming and runs quick and easy with great battery life. The only problem I see is the screen is made out of a cheaper material and gets dirty easily even as a touchscreen. At some angles the screen looks darkened and seems to be higher gamma rate I believe

I love this little laptop so much! Bought it last minute when I found out my chromebook wouldn't work with my new school's online software. Wonderful decision I'm so glad I bought it! Holds a charge very well and is the perfect size

Super lightweight. The matte screen is ideal for viewing in bright light. In spite of the haters, this device is quick enough for complex PowerPoint with embedded video. The microSD slot is a real plus. I've added 128 Gbytes and can store everything I need. Full size HDMI port works great for presentations; too many tiny computers require an adapter. It's true I've only had it for a day but this is a dandy solution for travel and I'm a Mac guy. I already had a bluetooth mouse and I recommend such for efficiency; I don't like touchpads.

This is a terrific little laptop. I have owned several HPs over the past decade or so. This is lean, it has terrific visual capabilities (screen), and I can use all my Microsoft programs on it. Easy access to HP support (easier to use than ever), is greatly appreciated.

I am actually satisfied. I got it within 8 hours of purchasing and opened it the morning it arrived. It's my first laptop and I'm impressed with the buttons, the screen and the overall price for the item.

When it works it is great but it sometimes doesn’t want to power up or when it goes dead it does not want to come back up until fully charged which takes hours. It is hit or miss on when it decides to work

Its ok to use for simple things like browsing the internet but if you to play any games its not great. Its have barely and storage and when i tried deleting anything i could it didnt change much. Its runs fast for a small and cheap laptop though ill give that but its only good for internet usage briefly

Laptop is ok but I cannot get it to work with my Tripp Lite U442-DOCK7D-B docking station.  Ethernet, mouse, and keyboard work fine through the docking station but the laptop will not recognize my HDMI or DataPort connected monitors.  The docking station works fine for multiple displays with my HP Elite Book.  Very disappointing for a newer technology laptop.
The screen quality is fair. Battery does not hold a charge for a long period of time. Very slow to boot up .’just not happy with the product. Returned to Amazon

I got this for personal use as I have a more expensive laptop for work. It does well for basic streaming, shopping, and word documents. It doesnt have the best webcam quality for zoom meetings but it works good enough

The laptop was a bit smaller than I expected but I wasn't too worried about having a small laptop, it looked cute. The only problem is it can't load games very well. My little sister wanted to play Roblox on it but nothing would load into the game. I'd say the laptop is only good if you plan to do web browsing.

Good little netbook, kind of slow. Screen is good. Heavier than expected but still very compact and lightweight. Decent battery life. I am satisfied BUT that's probably because I got mine in the Amazon Warehouse for under $80 it was a super deal, if I had paid the retail asking price I'd have probably returned it. Good for checking email and lightweight tasks on the go, would not recommend as a primary laptop for anyone.

Bought this strictly for my cameo 4 and thought it was bigger due to the pictures that were shown. It’s a nice little computer and does the job but it’s hard to see exactly what I’m doing unless I’m right at the screen and with my glasses on. The volume on it sucks too. Turn it all the way up and can still barely hear it. Haven’t tried n e gaming on it so only gave that a 1 star since I had to give something.

I was overall impressed by the quality of this laptop. The gaming performance was admirable for the specs, and it felt like a good build. However there are several obvious and some not so obvious tradeoffs.

This laptop is elevated by its rubber feet 2 cm off the ground.  This really allows more airflow to leave the laptop, which being an AMD system, gets hotter and uses active cooling more aggressively with performance.  While this is a laptop that should not be used for long periods of time without an A/C connection, one can actually game at full performance for 4 hours consistently with both fans going at maximum.  Thermal throttling takes quite a while (I could only get the 3050 Ti card to throttle after 1.5 hours of Doom Eternal at maximum settings).

One of the best laptops at this price. 16 GB memory, a powerful CPU, and an okayish GPU with CUDA support. The only downside for me now is that the touchpad is not very good. I need a mouse to use this one.

I spent several days migrating my apps and data from a dying Dell laptop (SSD failing) using a USB mouse (because it is easier to deal with for complex screen picks than a touchpad).  It was only then that I found that the touchpad was non-functional. Even when booted into BIOS the  touchpad diagnostics would not function. Thanks HP (NOT) for selling me a lemon. Works well otherwise.

This button-down dark gray HP laptop will spend the majority of its time doing algorithm driven stock index futures trading. For that task, it really has the Right Stuff; wired gigabit ethernet port, world beater office task performance, a bright, crisp 1K display, and the ability to drive a 4K external monitor to its full potential. Sometimes I'll bring this machine with me and the fact that its appearance has about a zero "Star Wars coefficient" is totally a plus. I like the keyboard, its nice white backlighting, and overall style and build of this machine.

Bought this for work to replace my MacBook and I love it. I have a custom built PC, so I don’t use it for gaming. But the Ryzen handles my workload and 10 hour work days like a beast. The only downside is the battery life isn’t the best as compared to competitors. The track pads feels cheap (just use a mouse) and the screen does wobble when hit. Still would recommend over most MacBooks.
Perfect for gaming and the battery life has been great so far. This boots up and runs super fast. No lag for me when playing Xbox games. Definitely recommend this a PC if you love gaming.
A lot of gaming laptops are very flashy, with RGB lights or other gimmicks. This looks like a chunky but non-nonsense laptop but is also a decent entry-to-mid-level gaming machine.

Shifting from a gaming Asus ROG laptop to this has been surprisingly wonderful/all around positive experience.  Only upgrades I did were the installation of a 2TB nvme Samsung 970, and doubled the ram.  However I did these upgrades well after already performing the tasks below.  However the ram and storage has made editing 4k recordings with no delays.  I also was able to get those components on a very good sale which justified the impulse as it was a nice to have not a need to have upgrade.

I switched over to this HP Victus gaming laptop around two months ago. Based on the build quality (it's sleek and feels great to type on even though no mechanical keyboard), its performance when gaming (mostly MMOs or FPS games), and how it handles multitasking (I run a BlueIris VMS server on it most of the day with about 7 PoE cameras recording through it), I can comfortably recommend it.

The size was right for my lap. I was disappointed while gaming I couldn't press "Start" button to Google a question but needed to sign out of the game, then look up my question. The cords were constantly getting loose.

I'm not going to waste any time going through things like performance benchmarks here. I figure if you're looking for a gaming laptop, you've probably already researched that stuff. If you haven't, go ahead and do that now, I'll wait. Seriously, you should do that. It's important stuff. I'll be here when you get back. *Whistles a jaunty tune*

The Victus line of laptops from HP is supposed to be for budget-conscience gamers who want a laptop that has decently powerful internals but forego some of the unnecessary things like RGB lighting and an elaborately designed case. I think that it mostly delivers on that idea, but this is still an $1100 machine and other brands like Lenovo are capable of delivering the same specs with a good screen and a little RGB (at least on the keyboard).

It is nice gaming laptop with nice configuration . Ryzen 7 5800H + 16GB RAM dual channel and NVIDIA 3050Ti is enough to play really good games . Value for this configuration I would say is exceptional.

Upon receiving the laptop I booted it up and within 2 minutes it froze. Thinking it was a fluke I rebooted the machine and it froze up again. I've managed to reinstall windows, update drivers and nothing. This thing freezes within 2 to 5 minutes of startup if you're lucky. sometimes i can't even get past the login screen. HP has offered little to no help for a machine that is essentially bricked out of the box.
This laptop is very sleek and elegant looking, as opposed to a lot of other gaming laptops which are too flashy to be used for work.  I appreciate that a lot.

I just received it today and for someone who is hardcore “build your own” when it comes to computers I was extremely surprised with how powerful this laptop is right out of the box! The bloatware is nonexistent and as soon as you boot it up you’re met with a silky smooth windows 11. For anyone looking to play intense games like rust you will be amazed at how well it renders and plays!! Definitely on par with big desktop computers but with portability!! 10/10

This laptop works but cannot handle photoshop and multiple monitors and the biggest issue PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU READ THIS: the 16GB of RAM cannot be upgraded. You are stuck with limited capacity because the motherboard cannot be upgraded past 16GB ram according to the HP documentation. It works and runs fine but if you want to do multitasking or streaming or real gaming this IS NOT THE LAPTOP for any of that. It should not be called a gaming laptop.

The Victus lineup consists of HP’s entry level gaming laptops.  There are currently two Victus models: the Victus 16 (released May 2021) and the Victus 15 (released June 2022).  The 15 and 16 in the model’s name is the screen size, in inches (rounded).
It was so fast it made my head spin, great with gaming.I just love it 😊 The only thing I wish it had was the fingerprint sign in but overall very happy.

Like the laptop but the trackpad came out to be defective and Amazon is not ready to replace this item for the lower price which I had bought during the Prime Deal. Hence giving it a 2 star for the worst customer service until now from Amazon

I thought I would have to get an additional 8 GB of RAM but since I've received my Laptop and used it for the past week I realize I don't really need it.  I'm not a gamer or big on using apps that need a lot of RAM so I'm very happy with the performance so far.

I've had many Lenovo products over the year and have always been happy. Actually my current laptop is a Lenovo convertible and I love it, has no issues what so ever. This unit is very nice, well made with a great fit and finish. It is also quite thing and light weight. Comes with a charging box and plug. So far it seems to charge quite fast. It was dead when I took it out, but after a short time it said it was at 84%, surprisingly fast.

This IdeaPad 3i is very well made and runs far better than I expected. The screen is clear and sharp with no bad spots of dead pixels. As expected, there is some bleed out with solid blacks but that is a common thing with all screens like this one.

The IdeaPad 3i fits neatly in a category of computer I call the "homework laptop." It's an inexpensive, reliable machine that's well-suited for kids to use to get their homework done and watch YouTube, but it's not designed for people doing heavy multimedia work of gaming.

Really well built, great screen too.  Not exactly a powerhouse but pretty good for general use.  Pretty decent for a little portable workstation to take between the house, the kitchen, the garage, chilling in the yard, etc.
Even when running the most basic of tasks Windows processes plus Lenovo apps are going to be consuming a lot of CPU and memory. The machine is powerful but the software installed is wasteful.
Excellent value for money laptop. It is an excellent device for productivity and entertainment of streaming services. If you are looking for a gaming laptop, you should look at other options.

Got this for my daughter who is a junior in college this fall. She had been using an iPad to do school work, but that does have some limitations. She is transferring to an out-of-state college and will have more demands from her class work than the iPad can hold up to.
This machine does exactly what I need it to do  - web browsing, simple word processing and email and video - both video chats on zoom and Teams and watching videos online and downloaded videos.

I wanted a backup Chromebook for convenience. This Lenovo Flex 5i caught my eye. Very good reviews and  good value,  now that the price has come down some. I am happy with this purchase and the Seller, for the shipping and receiving was also quicker than expected . Thank you

This is the perfect Chromebook for a college student. It is lightweight, with a lighted keyboard to use during the dark. I got this to replace the other Chromebook I have used for five years and it is magnificent. It is not as light weight as described but the heaviness does add to its durability. So far, 10/10. I would reccomend it.
UPDATE: I took the panel off the bottom to have a look, and the 64gb storage is indeed a normal 42mm long m.2 ssd.  So it is removable and replaceable.

Size of screen is good for young students. Memory and storage also good for elementary grades. As this is the same brand that the student’s school is using, that makes it familiar  when doing homework .
Quick and responsive Chromebook, replaced a $150 Acer 11" Chromebook that was about 6 years old and now out of updates, OMG what a night and day difference, glad i made the purchase.
I have not purchased a computer for myself in many many years, as I was always provided one from work. When I retired, I needed my own.  I could not be any happier with my new chromebook!

Make sure you sign in with a gmail account to use all of the devices features like the google play store. Only gripe I have is a low battery life. Other than that this is the perfect tool since all of my school courses use google as their main communication and office/suite programs. Also the perfect device to use leisurely watching Netflix, Hulu, Prime Video, you name it. Plan to upgrade to an even better version one day!

The first time I ordered this was from a different buyer.  What I received was a version with a celeron processer and 4 g of ram- not what I ordered.  I returned it and bought this one which is as I ordered it and now after some effort works as specified.  Now the problem:  Initially it wouldn't boot up.  With the given accurate directions, I downloaded the appropriate ChromeOS image, flashed it to a usb drive and installed it over the defective one.  Now it works fine!  Hopeful for the future!

The laptop itself is perfect. I just didn’t think it was ever going to get delivered after being delayed for 2 weeks. Moving forward, I bought this for my son on prime day. It’s was super affordable and I still can’t believe the price was only $300. I will say I did see that the prices increased by a $110 that same day. They must have sold pretty damn good during the sale. Overall, my son loves it and he was so damn excited to finally get it in his hands. Again great buy.

Great laptop, has more than enough power to do everything web related and can play streaming services with out issues. So nice I just think can fold like a tablet or can go intent mode which makes viewing streaming services easy

This thing is sweet. For my job as a traveling salesman this thing is perfect with battery, functionality, and weight.  Super dependable compared to my laptop ssd which would die in an hr.  This thing goes Iike 10 hrs and is never an issue.  Super reliable

Do not purchase the combination package with the pen... The pen is not compatible with this laptop. You will need a Lenovo USI pen. (Not sure why they are selling it together.) The computer itself is exactly what I wanted though.

He loves the new computer the touch screen works great and computer is super light and convenient. Don’t bother buying touchscreen pen that goes with it. Ours never worked upon arrival and looks like most people have mentioned that. But the computer itself for the lost cost is awesome!
I got this Chromebook on a Lightning Deal and it is an incredibly good device for the price.  Good processor, 8Gig RAM.  Works great!  Plus, will get updated through 2029.  Easy and reliable.

It’s a chromebook not a laptop or tablet. They have no memory, but this has more. It’s best for classrooms or houses with wi-fi. My kid’s school requires them, but their “deal” on older models was about the same as this one which is twice as good.

This computer has changed my life, I was trying to write on my phone using the swipe keyboard and it was obnoxious.  Now I can much more easily express my thoughts and ideas, without all the typos, sore fingers and frustration.

Got this for my wife.  We are both very happy with it so far.  Nice screen,  metal chassis with ventilation slots.  Nice speakers,  spritely performance. Light up keyboard is nice.  Only complaint is that the cursor arrow is difficult to spot.  (Need to try some different background images.)  Highly and happily recommended.
Got the Chromebook and it was surprisingly fast and just works. Easy set up and great video streaming, better camera than my work laptop and easy to use and maintain.

Man, I really like this Chromebook. I've had this model for a couple years, gave one as a gift and the recipient loves it. It looks like Lenovo might be moving on from this model, that's too bad. It's a great buy if you get it on sale. A decent one at full price, especially if you get 8gb/128gb. Remember it's just a Chromebook, so there are a few limitations.
